text: So far so good! Today was my 2nd time visiting after my husband and I purchased a membership Monday. The staff is friendly and the gym seems clean. I went in at 9:45 am and the place was pretty open. They serve coffee in the morning which is a nice perk (it actually tastes great!)

Overall, I like the options that LA offers. All the classes, racquetball.. etc. It's great in that regard. The downfall is this place is dirty and the machines are not well maintained. You can smell the dirty carpet and whatever funk they have growing in the corners as soon as you walk in. They really need a cleaning company to come in there, shampoo the carpets and sanitize that place. Also, some of your elliptical look like they're on their last leg! Rusty and literally falling apart. Come on guys. This is a great gym. Clean and maintain it!!
Great Family Business!  Always nice...sometimes a little pricey but great place to go on a rainy day and they are always some types of specials!  My kids love it!

Amazing place. Business is run with customer in mind - I once got sick and had to cancel less than 24-hours, they honored that given my condition. They could have been difficult about it, but this place actually cares about customers as individuals, and not a source of profit. Very clean, amazing instructors.

Cons: 

Very strict policies. Read the fine print. 

One day I had completed a workout and got into the locker room only to find that they had plumbers just started working on both showers after a class in November. They could have had them work on only one shower at a time or wait until after everyone had left the locker room. 

Almost impossible to understand the instructions over the loud music. If you are new or don't attend regularly, you may be completely lost. 

Pros: very clean studio and great workout. Easy attached parking. 

NOTE: BB studios must be independently owned. Pricing is different depending on location and you can't share passes between studios.

I really love CPY.  I"ve practiced Bikram for years before I switched over here. I do Hot Power Fushion (closest thing to Bikram), C2 and now power sculpt.  I must say, first time I tried power sculpt I thought I was going to die.. Had to build up my strength for sure to ease into this class but now it's my favorite.  It's definitely most intense of them all and least like yoga so if you want more traditional yoga try the hot power fusion or C2. I love the music, the facility is beautiful and I like this studio because it's not as crowded as the downtown one and parking is much better.

I recommend this place if you have preteens up to 15-16 years of age for basketball and something to do with friends on a rainy day or when it's cooler outside and they are "bored" lol
My boys enjoy taking the basketball and reaching out to a few friends to arrange a meet up there. 
I recommend calling ahead to be sure they don't have some tournament type of thing going on or have the place on reserve for some event. You can feel safe dropping the kids off for a couple hours while you get other things done,  providing they are an appropriate age of course.

Ok, so as far as the classes, the cleanliness, the amenities - five star. 

However, they get 2 stars from me for everything else. I clicked on a link for a promotion on FB - 30 day challenge! How exciting! I needed the accountability and support. I spoke with Mandi, who encouraged me, offered me a first class free, and really kept on me about getting me in and started. All good. I paid the $149. First red flag, she had always wrote me back promptly (text message), but when I saw on my account that there was an auto monthly renewal- I wrote back and heard nothing for over a day. I went in for my next ride, and spoke to someone else about this being a one month promotion. 

There is NO benefit to the one month challenge that I paid $149 for only to see the price go down to $99 within a few days. I asked for the remainder to be credited to another month and was told no. Not only told no, but that girl never spoke to me again - even in passing. There are no extra perks- I was told there was a Nutrionist coming to speak - she came, but just set up a table and advertised her products. Nothing extra for the challengers - I never met another challenger. I wasn't encouraged to keep coming and I actually stopped. It's just a marketing ploy - I was bamboozled. I wouldn't encourage anyone curious to try the challenge - you can just pay the $99/month and follow their social media for all the happenings. I don't blame Mandi at all - I'm sure the promotion came from corporate- just sharing my experience.
I just joined today. Chris was super nice and showed me around. I am very impressed with how nice and clean it is, and the price is great!

Tough to get equipment, especially the free motion, around 5:30 during the weekday. Cardio is readily available as long as you do not want the one working rower!  There us a membership fee in addition to the monthly rate. My experience is these membership fee went out of favor in this industry in the 90's. I have not paid a membership fee at Quadrum, Anytime Fitness nor Planet Fitness and LA is part of my health insurance discount plan. Go figure. I do like that classes are included and not an extra. This makes the membership fee a little more palatable. Still have to check out the classes. Personal trainers are good, supportive, knowledgeable and challenging. The personal training rate is higher than I've paid at Retro fitness in NJ or Anytime Fitness in Florida. Those rates were $35/30 mins with discount to $25-30 with more sessions purchased. At LA, it starts at $40/30 mins and goes up from there. Unlike the newer LA Fitnesses in the area this one does not have a pool or courts.   It is close to home with ample parking, including a parking garage. Gym is located on second floor. Elevators are available. They have also renewed motivation in my daughter and I see that as a real plus. There is also childcare available.

I love working out at this gym!

 I've have had wonderful experiences with my trainers at City Fitness, Rittenhouse. I've been a member of the gym for over 2 years and I've had a personal trainer for about 8 or 9 months. They've changed the way I work out completely. The program is called "Thrive", and I've done just that. I'm able to work out on my own and am confident knowing what muscle groups to focus on and which set comes first to get the most out of my workouts. I train with Allissa H., and she's wonderful. I'll tell her exactly what I need and she tailors my workouts to fit those needs (she's rather easy on the eyes and that helps too). I work very well with a schedule, and sometimes I need to cancel due to other priorities. Allissa has never treated me as if I was a floating client and she always fits me into her schedule. She has never cancelled on me and she is always on time. You do workouts in a small group, with your trainer walking you through each set of workouts. There is a definite method to the madness. Stretching and warm up are followed by power, and then two sets of strength training. The trainers are all very friendly. They always smile and say hello when I pass them; as if we were friends or I was previously a client. Alas, it's always a great experience here. This is why I probably go every day.

It's definitely not as bad as people on here seem to say. It has a pretty decent cardio area, they have free weights. Too many Smith machines and not enough squat racks, in my opinion. But I don't ever really have a problem getting a rack.

Every LA fitness tends to hide the locker room, this one is no exception. The showers could use an overhaul. I'm never sure if the soap on the wall has been tampered with because the caps are always off.

Otherwise, it's a decent gym and it's not Planet Fitness. I like going here for the price. If you're too dainty to handle some other people sweating, you should probably stick to TV yoga anyway.

This gym has gone WAY downhill. The locker rooms, especially, are absolutely FILTHY. The photos above are a true but small representation of the deplorable conditions of the showers, toilets, and stalls. I will be buying out my contract. I went through FVH because they let me use my credit card for monthly dues where other locations will not. Because I live in between FVH and Edwardsville, I figured I'd use both locations. No way.  Going back to Gold's. I belonged go FVH when they first opened. Now, you're lucky to find staff at the front desk and if you do, they're munching on their fast food or chatting up their friends. They probably should be cleaning this disgusting excuse for a gym. What's worse is that a letter to corporate results in a basic form letter response. I'll happily pay more and go to a gym where I won't contract a mega virus from stepping in the doors. Despicable.

Natali is a terrific trainer. She takes the time to learn what is best for her clients, and helps you reach your own personal goals. And never fear, even if you don't know exactly what you want as your goals, she'll take you through various programs until you find the perfect fit to achieve results. I love the personal touch of a unique program built for me, including the meal plans. One of the great things about Natali, I feel she truly has a personal investment in her clients, she wants you to succeed. The 1-on-1 training sessions are great, fun and private so you can focus on learning form and techniques without all the extra distractions of public gym.

Towel service is promised, but not reliable. The mold on the swimming pool coping........the grimey body oils in the hot tub....how'd they get that 110 VAC outlet 5 feet from the hot tub past electrical code?.....bathrooms and lockers not so clean.....areas for stretch and calisthenics roped off for 'private lesson' use only....huge staff turnover....no backstroke flags for the pool.....poor design as there is no way to move from the parking garage to the gym during monsoon season without getting drenched.  And there's always an excuse why a lower advertised rate does not apply to your particular membership.

UPDATE: Review #2

I can now leg press 500lbs. 

My 12 weeks with Natali have ended. I am going to try things on my own for the next 12 weeks, and then hopefully start again (I am more than willing but she is becoming even busier with clients!)

I have lost some pounds and definitely some inches. I have had some physical and emotional setbacks, so I may have been able to do better, but Natali never once even hinted that she was unhappy with me. She understands that her clients are doing the best they can for that given moment. She is ONLY full on encouragement, positivity and she is darn funny. 

I also improved beyond the numbers:

1. I am a lot stronger physically. 

2. I am no longer even remotely intimidated by the gym. I'm right next to all the other serious lifters and they are awesome, inclusive people. No one cares about my work out if I am doing my own thing and not impeding someone else. I have the right to be in the gym just like everyone else.

3. I WANT to go to the gym. I WANT to lift heavy (and I mean heavy). I have always loved it but Natali helped me cultivate it more by challenging me. 

4. Meal planning gets the job done.

5. I am a beast in the gym. Natali knew it when she met me and she kept challenging me until I figured it out myself. And when I did it changed me.

6. YOU are the deciding factor. Do the work and get the results. Figure out who you are. Natali has your back.

I can now leg press 500lbs. With ease. I know I said it before but I went from lifting 175 to 500 in 12 weeks. 

I cannot wait to try it alone for 12 weeks and go back to the teacher after doing my homework.

The staff was very friendly and helpful with everything! This is probably the best Planet Fitness around! The ones in Nashville, Hendersonville, and Hermitage cannot compete! Not all Planet Fitness places are the same. This one even has wifi!
Great Crunch location, has its flaws but beats any competitor gym within a 25 mile circumference

Edge fitness what can i say.... well we went here a year ago before it was even built to find out information and to see what the gym had to offer but at that time we didnt sign up because by looking at pictures we couldnt decide if we wanted to join. So we waited until they finally opened up to do a 3 day trial. But honestly a 3 day trial is nothing they should offer a month free to try it out so u have enough time to try out not only the equipment but the classes as well. we tried 3 days it wasnt enough to decide on commiting for a entire year. i dont like contracts and feel others dont wanna be stuck for a year in a contract because if after a few months if your not happy your gonna be stuck i think they should do away with contracts more people would sign up if it was like that.

The gym is beautiful inside they have a theater room with bikes and treadmills that is a great edition that other gyms dont offer. Also they have a protein shake bar which is awesome. they offer many flavors to choose from. i did not sign up for the gym but you should give it a try maybe it will fit you. I would like them to offer a free month trial and no contract that would fit my lifestyle better but until then i will continue Planet fitness

I am OBSESSED with OTF after being a member for 1 year. I took the initial free class after a coworker recommended it and I've been hooked since. I came to OTF when I was in the most out of shape/heaviest state I've ever been in. When I joined, I hated the way my body looked and how out of shape I felt. OTF staff are all friendly, welcoming and encouraging for the members to achieve healthy goals. In the past, I was nervous about attending studio classes and felt very self-conscious, but at OTF, the coaches and other people taking the class are very friendly and encouraging. High-fives and words of encouragement from coaches and other people taking the class happen every single time I attend. There is never a class that I have not felt motivated to push myself to achieve a good workout. So far, I've taken classes with Angel, Ben, Julian, Brooklyn, Jen, and Sarah. Angel (I believe) is the lead coach is she is beyond friendly, kind and welcoming. All of the coaches have the most amazing and inspiring energy and really make you feel like you can push yourself during the class. OTF has turned me into someone who enjoys running and I thought that would NEVER happen. I even run on my days I'm not at OTF because I enjoy it so much! The music they play is awesome and a good mix of old school rock and contemporary jams. OTF helped me loose 20lbs, get back in great shape and love my body again. Getting the confidence back to be comfortable in my own skin and feel strong is the most amazing feeling of accomplishment. I'm a member for life and constantly recommend this place to anyone who will listen. If you're debating trying a class, go for it! You won't be disappointed and you'll leave feeling amazing.

They are open 24/7, have friendly staff, machines for target areas like abs, thighs, arms, chest, and shoulders and all kinds of cardio options (treadmill, bike, elliptical). Tv's in front of you, and a lively atmosphere.

The best part is that it's only $10! And if you want all the perks like being able to bring a guest, get a tan, have a massage, it's $20 per month. Not bad at all!  I find it very motivating to see so many people working out and trying to get fit or lose weight. And for you tan junkies, $20 a month for unlimited tanning sessions!! You now that's a great deal!

This place is really awesome!

My only complaint about this gym is the location... It's too far from me :(. It's like 10 miles from vanderbilt, which is just far enough to be far but I guess thats not really an issue with this gym! (2 new locations in the area- Charlotte Pike in Nashville and another in Madison). All 3 locations are under one owner.  This ownership only takes payment through automatic withdrawal from a checking account but many Planet Fitness gyms throughout the country give the option of automatic payment through credit cards.

Open 24hrs...not the most hard core gym ever but definitely the most hard core in Tucson....All the free weights you need..dumbbells go up to 150lbs..you can grunt and deadlift/Squat till you drop...gets packed at usual busy hours...At times you'll find that clips and pins are missing, which is why I pack my own..Some bitch about the staff and grittiness of the place but the only things that matter to me are the weights, the music in my ears and the empty gym you can find in the wee hours of the day/night.

We've been members of the Y for several years now and primarily visit this branch. In my experience, the group ex classes (which are my favorite way to work out) are superior to other Y branches. The instructors are qualitfied, spirited and FUN! They have a great mix of classes, from dance-focused to strength and toning. 

The facility has highs and lows. 

The highs: 
-clean
-well stocked with towels
-REALLY like that it's on one floor
-classes are offered ALL the time
-awesome childwatch
-equipment is updated often and it very high quality
-generally nice staff
-indoor pool, which is great for the kiddos in the winter
-you can visit any Indy Y with your membership

The lows:
-terrible locker rooms, feels like a high school gym locker room. eek!
-no sauna
-a small play area structure (when compared to other branches)
-children's classes (gymnastics, music, etc) OFTEN get cancelled due to enrollment--i think the ratio has to be 6 enrolled for 1 teacher, which i find to be very high. 
-Lifeguards: some are very tuned-in when watching the kid's pool, but others are clearly there for social hour, lots of talking in groups with backs turned to the pool and wearing shoes (SHOES!) when in the guard chair. I mean, yes, please swiftly swim to my drowning child in high tops!

All in all, it's a good facility that offers a lot of options for working out or playing with the family. Compared to other cities, the Indy Y's are about as low cost as you can get--membership fees fluctuate depending on the city in which they are located. It's good bang for your buck.

I recently changed gyms AGAIN... But I love this location. I have not had any issues.

Cleanliness. This space is ALWAYS clean, which is very important to me. I always see someone cleaning up and most people actually follow the instructions and wipe down the equipment when they are finish, which I 100% appreciate. 

Staff. The staff is friendly and just cool. No issues, they always answer my questions and they are very helpful.

Equipment. There is ample equipment at this location. Cardio section has elliptical, treadmills, stair masters, bikes, and a few variations of those things.  There are also sections dedicated, to weightlifting, abs, thighs, 30 minute workouts and more.

Spa. So for black card members, there is a spa area where you can get hydro-massages, chair massages, tanning, and a body enhancement machine. I love the hydro-massages; it is definitely a treat after working out.

Locker Room. Lockers, Full shower and Dressing Rooms. Actually pretty nice showers might I add. 

Parking. There is ample parking in the lot, so there really shouldn't be any trouble.

I normally go to the gym at 6am-8am  or 4:30pm - 6:00 pm range and there is never a crowd issue. Not sure about the other times.

I left this gym several months ago after being a member for 3 years.  While the facility itself is nice, clean, large, etc. if you are going for the fitness classes you will be disappointed.  Class would be cancelled at the last minute, instructors would quit and not be replaced, substitute instructors would teach a totally different class than what is on the schedule, etc.  When members complained to management we were told we could always go to another LA Fitness and did not seem interested in fixing the problem. If you are going there just to work out, you can go to Planet Fitness or Gold's Gym for much less.  $35/month is too much money to pay when you're not getting what you are promised.
Beautiful new gym the equipment is state of the art. In an ideal location near the Mall and Costco and Wegmans

I've always drove past this gym off the freeway as I'm on my way to Reno but since i had extra time and wasn't rush to go anywhere, i said what the hey, lets check it out.  From the outside, it looks like a small facility but after walking in, the facility was a pretty big especially with the high ceilings.  The equipment and machines are very spread out and walk room is spacious. The gym is 2 stories with the treadmills are all up there.  the reason for the 3 stars is all the equipment is all old and needs a big renovation.  Even the bathrooms are very old which only has 2 toilets. But then again, this club is only an Active so what do you expect, its the entry level of 24hr fitness.

So, this gem is hidden away in a shopping center off of Lebanon Pike. 

If you go on their website, you can sign up for a 7-day free trial, which is what I did. They gave me a tour of the facility, and the next few days were mine to enjoy!

This gym has your basic workout equipment(treadmills, bikes,dumbells, etc). But they also have a swimming pool, hot tub, sauna, huge studio where they offer classes, and a track!

The facility is clean. It was never super crowded when I went...which I LOVED. The staff and people who worked out there were super friendly .

If you live in Hermitage and need a gym, I would highly recommend you check out Hermitage Fitness Center!!

I stopped in this LA fitness in a Tuesday morning around 10AM as it was the closest one between I could go to in between classes. I was shocked by the amount of people there in the late morning on a Tuesday and I'm now convinced that no one in St Pete works, but that's beside the point.

The gym was decent. Fairly clean bathrooms, and I liked the stall area they have outside the shower for extra privacy while changing, however the gym area itself felt  very confusing. The machines seemed to have no particular order or organization to them, meaning you had to scurry around the whole gym in order to find machines that all worked a certain muscle. The gym floor itself felt cramped and overcrowded, with many machines  much too close together to achieve a comfortable workout. 

The have such a cool  location and an interesting info set up, but the disorganization makes it hard to have an enjoyable workout at this location.

I sure wish I had any other option for swimming, because this place really sucks.  From the filthy locker rooms full of hair and water damage, to the loud 90's faux punk music blaring in the locker room to the shitty pool that is out of service constantly because they have no one on staff capable of maintaining it.  The good is that it opens very early, the pool is 25 yards and is kept to a temperature that makes swimming laps at least possible. I also like the crowd of women who come early (I'm told the place is essentially a whorehouse if you go in the evening.) The bad is just about everything else.  I really wonder what their insurer would do if they knew that this joint allows people to swim in the pool completely unsupervised with no lifeguard on staff at all every single morning from 5 am to whenever a lifeguard gets there sometime later in the day after 7 or 8 or so.  Also, on numerous occasions I've gotten there and no one has showed up to open the place.  Once on a weekend there was a crowd of about 50 people in the parking lot waiting for someone to show up; I finally gave up after about 45 minutes of waiting that day.  It's really unbelievable.  The place is so poorly run and so shoddy it kills me to pay them every month, but sadly there is nowhere else to swim.  As soon as the new YMCA opens, I am OUT of that hell hole.

I purposely avoided joining City Fitness prior to their opening and immediately after because I knew there would likely be some hurdles to overcome. Judging by the early reviews, I was right in my decision. But now that they are in their third month, things seem to be flowing smoothly. I've been a member for two weeks now and I'm very happy with my decision to make the switch from my old gym to this one. 

For starters, the facility is brand new. That means everything is clean, machines are new, nice locker rooms, etc. The two-story layout is interesting and the hallway downstairs is a little tight but after a few trips to the locker rooms after using the back staircase, I feel like I know where everything is located. 

Everyone on the staff is super friendly. That's important. You don't want to join a gym and feel awkward. I've been greeted with friendly hellos or goodbyes every time I've gone so far. The towel service is great, and there are always plenty of fluffy hand towels available.  

I purchased the highest tier membership, which includes all classes and access to the We Fit classes. This membership was only five dollars more than my previous gym, and now I'm getting access to the circuit training classes I used to seek outside of my old gym (an extra expense I'll no longer have to worry about). I took advantage of my free personal training session and liked it enough that I have signed up to train with David once a week. Since I'm currently training for Broad Street, I'll probably stick to the treadmills and my PT for the next couple months, but I look forward to trying the classes and We Fit after the run. 

Bottom line, I'm really happy City Fitness finally made it to the neighborhood!

My husband and I went through a short but intense cycling phase and didn't enjoy our experience at Soho. Firstly, they separated our bikes after they told us we'd be riding together. That didn't start our experience well at all. Then we went to the extremely small locker area with one flimsy bench for everyone cycling (i.e., dozens of people) to use. It was so cramped and obviously didn't smell pleasant with so many bodies crushed together changing shoes.

The classroom is large, but there are one or two load-bearing poles that make some bikes less desirable than others. The floor is so slippery with the cycling shoes on. I almost witnessed a pregnant woman slip and fall face-first. Thankfully, she caught herself on another bike. 

There were technical issues throughout the class, with music not playing for various reasons. The instructor had to go to the back several times, which killed the energy every time.

We had been to CycleBar a lot before trying Soho, so we naturally compared everything (as is the nature of Yelp) and concluded that Soho didn't have any positives over CycleBar, which has a large locker area with multiple restrooms, carpet throughout the studio to negate slipping, stadium seating in the studio (so you're not staring at someone's butt crack the whole time), snacks, cold and tepid water dispensers, zero technical malfunctions in the many times we've gone, much more parking, and the list goes on.

After the Soho class ended, we headed to the locker area and discovered children playing with tablets and toys on the one available bench. Again, we maneuvered through dozens of people to get our stuff together and return our shoes. Just not a comfortable experience. A staff member asked us how class went. When I said it had been "okay," he didn't inquire further, which indicated to me that nobody there really cares to improve the customer experience.

I'm giving two stars instead of one, because the instructor and workout were fine. It was a decent workout, and we left sweaty. It was the first and last time we'll go to Soho. I definitely recommend CycleBar instead.

this place champions mediocrity, you are not even allowed to dead lift, which is the best exercise for back strengthening, if you want to stay average, hangout in here, the whole paradigm is a disgrace

My girlfriend signed up for LA fitness with my Debit card, without my knowledge, over the internet. Then we broke up. I reported to LA fitness that This is not me using the membership and I wanted it cancelled. They demanded the person who OPENED the account go down and talk to manager directly otherwise they will continue billing and send me to collections. I spoke with corporate, who was NOT helpful and sent me back to the manager. This is a giant scam, DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION AS IT IS NOT SAFE AND VERY WELL MAY BE STOLEN OR HACKED. THEY WILL NEVER STOP BILLING YOU.To this day they owe me over 100 dollars, its been an ENTIRE year

STAY AWAY! I visited this gym due to a friend that recently signed up for a membership. I was interested in joining because of the promise of more classes and personal training sessions that would be offered. While at the location though, you feel bullied to sign up as a member (and pushed to sign up others in your family). Once I got home I did regret signing up due to the price per month. The contract gives you 5 business days to cancel, I canceled in 3 days. It has been OVER a month and I have called numerous times for the refund of my down payment and all you can get a hold of is the receptionist. The management is awful and is always "unavailable".

I would HIGHLY recommend to stay away from this gym. There are many other gyms in the area that offer such classes and are a quarter of the price.

My usual CF gym is in NOLIB (on Spring garden). I went to this one because I just learned about the Saturday Boot Camp - an INTENSE, HIIT workout very similar to the Throve program. 

In general CF does a nice job of giving you everything you'd want in a gym. Clean, big space, lots of weight & machines. 

This Saturday was my first time trying the boot camp out and it was literally the hardest workout I've ever done - I have done thrive and F45. I enjoyed the ass kicking and plan on making this a Saturday routine!

Only other complaint is similar to what others have said, their Thrive program is absolutely ridiculously expensive. Great workout but soooo pricey.

This one really disappointed me. I just moved to 15th and Reed st and was looking for a gym with a personal trainer.
First I call their location on Wharton St which is a couple blocks from my house. The first thing I say is "hey I was looking to speak to someone about memberships" the person responds and says "can you call back in like 15 minutes? Everyone's very busy right now". I responded nicely no problem.
It was apparent they're location was busy if they asked me to call back, so then I thought hey let's just call and see if someone at the South St location can help me out because I work on south st a block away and it's a good chance I'll be going to both locations if possible. I call up and a very nice girl answers the phone and I asked the same question as I did the first location, she asked if I could hold briefly, which I did. She returns and says "hey everyone's with someone right now can we have someone call you back" I responded "It seems like you guys are a little too busy for a someone who wants to be a new customer huh" she responded telling me how they were slightly short staffed for it being a Tuesday night which I understood and was fine with, she than went totally out of her way to explain a few things about the membership and how it works and settled me for sure. She told me she would have Harrison they're lead guy give me a call back in 10 minutes which I was cool with because I didn't have plans for a couple hours. The time went by much past 10 minutes and I get a call from Harrison at 9 pm when I was already out with a couple of friends that I wanted to actually join a gym with. I gave a call back the following day and asked for Harrison, was put on hold and than told he was unavailable and he would call me back very shortly when he's done. I understand work is stressful and people get busy but for 2 of their places to be too busy to talk to a new member immediately makes no sense to me when it comes to a business aspect or a customer service aspect. I unfortunately don't know if I would sign up with city fitness at this point. I am going to check out other places in the area and go from there.

I can understand the hype about Solidcore. But for those who are looking for a pilates place that you can learn the more technical stuff and to correct your form, this is not it. I went to Solidcore twice with their new member deal (2 classes for $42) but I found the experience both quite similar. The class is not interactive as in that the instructor is not doing the moves together with you. The instructor instead is yelling at you the instructions while the music is blasting, making it super difficult to understand. This is frustrating because the instructions themselves are quite complex as it's not a simple "squat 10 times" but "put your foot on this platform and place your hands here and do this." For someone who has no experience with a reformer (the Pilates machine), it's quite hard to keep pace. Once you understand what to do, yes the moves are hard. But I don't mind that as I know that solidcore is known for their hard workouts. However, I wish it was easier to follow so that I could get to the hard workouts faster instead of wasting time trying to understand what is going on.

I will say, the few days after solidcore, I was very sore. I appreciate the philosophy of solidcore about engaging in small repetitive movements to engage the core and other body parts. I wish I could have liked solidcore because it really is a good workout, but I found myself struggling and lost on the instructions 25% of the time. The instructors were very high energy and optimistic.

Love this place!!! Great music and energy. I used to spin everyday then life got in the way and I stopped going for about 3 years. Tuesday was my first class at Soho and I was able to jump back in to the spin world as if I had never left.

I absolutely LOVE body cycle. The studio is clean and well kept without being too stuffy or frilly. The instructors are super knowledgeable and clearly spend a lot curating the workouts and playlists. Russell and Sho are fantastic and so passionate about the studio and clients. They also do a great job establishing relationships with local vendors like Sip N Glo. Classes are well priced, especially for Philly and there are lots of pre/post work classes as well as options for an afternoon sweat sesh. I highly recommend giving it a try!

The first time I came here, I was a guest attending a Zumba class. I fell in love with Zumba, and just kept on coming back. 

In fact, all the group classes (kickboxing, step, P90X, yoga) are pretty good, but I'm pretty much a member of the gym for Zumba. The regular weekday Zumba instructors, Loretta and Tommy are the best! And Mary Kay's class on Sunday is also a lot of fun. There's a class on Saturdays, but it's at 8AM, and that's just a bit too early on a Saturday. There are a ton regulars, but everyone is in the class is super friendly, which is nice if you're new to Zumba. I would not hesitate to bring newbies to the classes. 

The gym facilities are nice, and there's plenty of treadmills, ellipticals, and bikes, but I'm not a frequent user of the equipment. Also, there are personal trainers and massage therapists, but I have not taken advantages of these added services. 

The staff at the front desk are really friendly, as well as most members of the gym. This is a place where you go to workout and have a little fun doing it, but it's not a scene. Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good gym in the Carillon area, or a fabulous Zumba class with great instructors and participants. I actually drive 15-20 minutes to attend classes at this facility. Now that is commitment!

This place always get's so crowded. I had to cancel my membership because they don't have enough weight benches. You literally wait all day long to get a turn doing bench presses because other men seem to constantly hover around them like flies. Not to mention naked men in the locker rooms who just walk around talking to people nonchalantly. Oh and years ago I was robbed at gunpoint outside here over my stupid hat.

I have been working with Malcolm Pinder, Personal Trainer at Self-Embodiment, Philadelphia, PA for about 3 months now. I really wanted to lose weight and eat better. My eating habits worsened once I began my new job and I wanted to get back to eating healthier.
The only reservation I had is that Malcolm would be an intense trainer and force me to do exercises I was not comfortable with. Malcolm went over each exercise with me and ensured my form was good. Whenever I had questions about an exercise Malcolm went over them with me and ensure I mastered the exercises before the next time I went to the gym.

I really like the online app and that I am able to track my workouts, cardio, and weight. It's great that I am able to see the difference since the time I started working with Malcolm until now. Malcolm is also always available when I have questions and he gives me honest feedback.

Three other benefits are: being able to talk to Malcolm through the app, Malcolm helped me work on my nutrition as well, and Malcolm also spoke to me about the importance of my water intake. I would recommend Malcolm to everyone I know! He wants to see you succeed and lose weight. He is also very personable and down to earth. I was not expecting that in a trainer. I'm glad I had the opportunity to work with Malcolm so far I have lost about 13lbs and counting. Malcolm helped me to push myself harder and to not be afraid of pushing my boundaries and eating healthy.

This place is great, I'm so glad a friend got me into it. I first was reluctant as it seemed very intense and I wasn't sure if I would get used to the stamina needed, but it ended up to be a smooth build up for conditioning. You can go at your own pace as your cardio improves. Then it becomes fun to be on the top of the boards and beat your personal bests as well. The staff is great, they get to know you like a friend when you walk in. The instructors are great as well. I love that I never get bored with the classes as they are always changing them up. Since I've started I've lost a good amount of weight and my cardio abilities are vastly improved, it's really helped me condition for big hikes I've gotten into. It is a little bit pricy if you go frequently but in my mind totally worth the cost for what you get and your health. Would def reccomend trying it out!

I got a flyer in the mail that advertised $20/month membership, so I gave it try.  I am glad that I did.  I joined in May 2012 and now it is October, so I have had 5 months to form an opinion on this location.

When I first signed up there was a heavy sale, I mean really heavy, on the personal training sessions.  I said "no" at the time.  Then I was in there casually working out and one of the trainers, Nate, came up to me and asked me if he could show me some things.  No ask for money to pay for it, just an offer to show me some things.

From there he talked about some options, because I asked, not because he pushed, about personal training.  I signed up that day.  It was his non-pushy approach in the sale that he got one.

Since then, I have been working with Rocky.  He is awesome.  Hands down one awesome trainer.  He listens to my needs and respects my goals (I wanted to just get fit and not huge; I just want to be around when my kids are older).  I am not fat by any means, but I needed a push to get my fitness back to a good point.  

I have weekly 30 minute sessions with Rocky and am glad for the weekly push to get up and get moving.  Being a web designer/nonprofit professional by trade it doesn't give me much time to get active, except the weekends.

Now about the gym itself.  I am giving 5 stars because of the features of the gym.  There are classes happening all the time and they have an app for the iPhone (I don't know about Droid) displaying all of their class schedules.  There is a saline pool to do laps, a room off to the side only for women (so they don't have to feel like they are being watched by everyone in the gym). There are more than enough cardio machines and most of the weight machines are always available.  They have lots of televisions to watch while doing cardio and a side spin classroom and aerobic room for classes.

What is great about this location is also their willingness to watch your kids at no extra cost.  You have to stay on premisses,  but they will keep your kids up to two hours while you work out at no extra cost.  

I am thoroughly impressed by this gym.

Very friendly staff and every machine you could possibly need. Easy to use set up as all of the machines you need for every specific area are around each other. Lots of options for free weights and large stretching area. Also a large pool and hot tub, complete with steam room. Nice to have a ladies only area as well.

So I couldn't find the yoga studio on yelp which is Blue Lotus Good Heart and I just want to say its incredible! Love the owners and love their studio! Looking forward to getting in tune with my yoga self!

Aside from parking challenges facility was ok. But when my wife cancelled, they told her my membership was cancelled and i didn't find out until a trainer telemarketed me, then did not get response from manager for a week; deceptive practices, unresponsive management.

Dear old city sweat fitness, i realize that this review only furthers your decline on yelp but, in my opinion is necessary. This may potentially get removed because i will outright admit i have yet to actually use your facility. However, i do see the validity in wanting to review your business practices, though i haven't come inside. STOP putting solicitation fliers on everyones vehicles! At a minimum, it is one of the single most obnoxious and, honestly, desperate moves a local business can do.

 If you were having a charity event or community event you were trying to make the neighborhood aware in a short period of time, i can at least semi-understand that. You want to spam everyone? Pay for it and do it via snail-mail like all the other businesses in the area. Do NOT litter on peoples vehicles, especially those of whom are your neighbors. Not only is it obnoxious, irritating, and burdening on the owner of the vehicle (thanks, now i have to shove trash in my car because i'm not an asshole who litters, just you), it is also illegal without a commercial solicitation permit from the city which i hope you have, since i filed complaints with both the BBB and the DA's office.

Not understanding the negative review. I've met everyone who is staffed here and they couldn't be any more polite and accommodating. This gym is so clean with state of the art equipment. It's always a pleasure being greeted by happy employees.

Whatever. They pretend they like you and make you feel,like they will be supportive and help you learn more about fitness.

Reality, once you sign up, you will be lucky if they even remember you.
Of course that is if you kiss their you know what every time YOU see the (the owners) unless you are another business owner who they can get something for free.

This is meant for only a certain type of customer like their website mentions "upper middle class" or the north east yuppies that hang out at no other places but the ones on beach drive. 

No thanks.

You get an amazing workout! As long as you follow the instructors and put the work in you are guaranteed to sweat! I've been to Soul Cycle in NYC and this is better. The music is just right and you don't need ear plugs. Every time I'm there the place is always super clean and doesn't smell stinky! I didn't give it 5 stars because it's more expensive than you typical gym membership.
Great gym, nice and clean and not too crowded.  Great staff as well.  Consistent staff also makes it nice, they know you by name.

Love this place. From when i first joined a little over a year ago, i cant say enough good things about this place. It also keeps getting better all the time!!
We (my wife and I) went to the same gym for about 14 years when we lived in NJ. It was hard to find a place we would be so happy with again. But when I first moved back to the city, i checked out a few gyms, but City Fitness felt right from the minute i walked in. Steph explained everything and showed me all around the place and (still makes sire all is great for us). I joined immediately and brought my wife in a few days later. I am there 6 days a week and couldn't be  happier. Love all the classes and the instructors are great. Analis, Carrie, Jackie, Katie, Chris, Chuck, Kelly, Dayna, Jacquie, Ted, Rachel and Christian are ALL awesome.  Very friendly people there from the girls behind the check in counter, the others in membership (who all know our names!!) to just about everyone there. Carl does an amazing job!!! Did i say i love this place???

Someone once told boxing is a good way to relieve stress and get a great workout in the process.  After becoming a weekly attendee at Sweat I can vouch for that sentiment.  I originally signed up for semi-private lessons with Steve, but since no one else typically shows up during my time slot, I essentially have been getting private lessons.  Each time I go we work on form, technique, etc.  Additionally, Steve throws in some core and leg exercises so I get a full workout to compliment my boxing lesson.  Steve is a great guy to train with and he'll consistently push you.  The name of the place is well suited because that's exactly what's going to happen to you if you come.  Not the biggest gym, but it gets the job done and that's all that matters.  If you don't mind taking a hit to your wallet in exchange for hitting the bags I recommend checking this place out.

There is plenty of criticism in the reviews of other yelpers, so I will keep this short and sweet.  This was a great gym when it was Gold's, but it has rapidly gone downhill since changing ownership.  Though there has been some turnover since then, a lot of the Gold's staff stayed on through the transition.  I have never had a problem with customer service here.  In fact, when I canceled my membership (of several years), the  young man who assisted me concurred with my observations and frustrations.  The problem with this gym boils down to greedy leadership (at the corporate level) more interested in short-term bottom line profits than it is interested in the quality of its product.  It appears that "more=better" in the minds of Fitness Connection executives.  It could not be more apparent that the modus operandi of this corporation is to just keep signing more members until they surpass maximum occupancy.  Any decent gym adds more classes when they become really popular.  The class schedule here hasn't changed since it was Gold's back in the day!  The classes and instructors are still great, the problem is overcrowding and management's lack of interest in expanding their offerings.  Why pay another freelance fitness instructor, when you can cram your members in like sardines?  I am absolutely SHOCKED that equipment is constantly broken and that the facility and equipment simply are not cleaned.  Ever.  It is such a shame...What a waste of wonderful resources.  On a positive note, contrary to what I have read from other yelpers, canceling my membership was easy peasy.

This place is NO JOKE!!! You can feel the magic as soon as you walk in. Shaun and Molly have impressive passion, talent, and knowledge. Whether you come for a workout, a houseplant, or some kava and a chat, you will be in good hands and receive personalized service. I've walked out of each visit with questions answered and a new perspective. Go check it out!!

I haven't had any issues with fitness connection. Their staff has always been friendly to me and they have never taken "extra unaccounted for" money out of my account. However, my friend who signed up because I raved about how amazing fitness connection was, has dealt with rude staff and had unauthorized withdrawals from her banking account on countless occasions ranging from $10-$100. When she has tried to rectify this or at least understand the reason for the withdrawl, attempting to give them the benefit of the doubt, they give her the run around and get extremely curt with her transferring her back and forth between departments and providing her with "help desk" numbers that do not help, or even answer half the time. My only complaint is that some of the machines are often out of order. I love the classes, I wish they would add more that aren't so early in the morning, given the fact that my work out partner and I both work nights and it is often difficult to pull ourselves out of bed at 8 am. I know they have 430 classes but we are already headed to work at that time. I think anywhere from 11 am - 1pm would be perfect! Just a suggestion though. Again, the staff has been awesome to me, I  wish I could give one more star, but it's unfortunate that 2 of my friends had similar experiences here.

I use this gym when I'm back in the area for vacation. Sure it is a nice and clean location but I'm glad to have been using a different location for the majority of my time elsewhere. I frequent the stairmaster everyday so I do notice that 1 or 2 of the machines tend to have issues; the machines have a little jump so it is feels uncomfortable/unsecure when that happens. The equipment is definitely updated and I appreciate that. 

It is always crowded but that's something the staff can't really control. This is smaller than my usual gym, especially considering mine was 3 stories. They make the most out of the space that is given. Not that I use it but the raquetball courts have not been open for over a year. Unfortunately I don't see anyone working on them so I assume it won't be open anytime soon. 

The only times I interact with the staff is to scan my card and so far they've been nice and attentive.

I am not athletic, nor a member (my boyfriend is) so this review is primarily regarding "events"...i had both Mothers day and Easter brunch here and CHRIST ON A CRUTCH it was good! i mean every-single-thing good! I mean let out audible sounds from pleasure good! a week later and I'm still thinking about how good, good! I can't wait until the next event i will most certainly be in attendance.

I've been a member at this Oro Valley location for about seven weeks, and for the most part I've been very happy here. The gym is great: large, clean, friendly, and a wide range of ages and physical fitness. You can read the other reviews for that info. My review is going to explain why I'm not giving it five stars.

The main reason I chose this above other gyms was their childcare. The only way I was going to be able to workout was if I had someplace for my child to go. I thought the LAFitness Kids' Klub would be a great solution. Unfortunately, it's not. The large TV is on the whole time, and often very loud. They don't even play nature or science stuff on there; it's all Disney movies. I'd expected that a fitness club would understand the importance of having kids do active things and move their bodies. There is some play equipment there, but my son tells me that he was told not to climb on it because he would get hurt. Most of the time when I walk in there all or most of the kids are sitting in chairs up close to the TV, even the very youngest of them. The vibe in there is also quite negative; the workers seem depressed.

It makes me feel awful that here I am, trying to have a healthy lifestyle, but while I'm working out, my son is sitting there like a zombie. I try to rush through my workout to get him out of there as soon as possible, but it still makes me feel guilty. I'm really not sure how long I'm going to keep this up.

This is the best gym in the area, by far.  I'll start with weights; Lifetime offers 5+ squat racks, dumbbells ranging from 5-120+ lbs, multiple cable machines, and several of the best machines from TechnoGym.  Next to the weights and machines, you'll find an area where you can stretch, workout, box, etc.  

Looking for cardio machines? At Lifetime, you have a vast selection of treadmills, ellipticals, stationary bikes, and stair masters.  They all have TVs with multiple channels attached to them and are generally always clean.  

Lifetime also offers a variety of classes included with your membership such as cycling, H.I.I.T., Zumba, etc.  You also have access to both indoor and outdoor pools.  The outdoor pool makes you feel like you're at a resort with multiple day beds, couches, water slides and more.

Overall, Lifetime is well worth the money if you're looking for a gym that is clean, fun, and has everything you'll need.

These people are trash 
My underage cousin went to the gym today and they kicked him out and told him to say yes sir yes mam like they are something to him 
Threatening to call the police on him. Then my older cousin (his brother) called the gym and asked them why they kicked him out and the chick who answered the phone told him that " im not from your culture , you wont talk to me like you talk to your wives  , understood?!" We pay  for a membership to not to be talked to like that. What they need is a good lawsuit for being racist and inappropriate to an underage.

I joined this gym to prove a point! I'm a lunk. I am. I'm an undercover lunk. I've been building muscles for three years. I used to power lift until I pulled my back out, now I just lift heavy weights and have a great time. And eat. I eat a lot. 

The gym owner at my old gym upset me with his misogynistic comments and consistent inability to take constructive feedback. I went there for 17 months. I made some fantastic progress, and I'm a natural- regular gym rat if you will. I love being in the gym.

Anyhow, yes. I'm a lunk. PF gets such a bad name from my big male counterparts. Let's face it. I'll never use a 110 lb dumbbell. I'm off of the oly bars for a bit, due to injury- so we are going light weight more reps. Guess what? Still a lunk. This. Gym. Has. Everything. Except a squat rack. Dumbbells, loaded barbells, machines, lots of cables, benches, etc. 

The staff here is super friendly. They were patient during registration. They answer all of my questions, including my "do you guys really have Pizza?" Question.  They answered with a "you don't like Pizza?!?!" Omg of course I do. Who doesn't like pizza?! I just hope it's not from Papa Johns. 

Me teenager has been with me free with my black card twice now. I love that it gives us this time together, and that he's completely comfortable working out here. I don't think it would be the case at my old gym. 

Here's to many many workouts together PF. To the naysayers, I say that you can get a good workout in anywhere. I will revisit the squat rack issue at a later time.

I was in Reno for a couple months, and this place was a fine gym for the price.

I wish I'd read the other reviews about how it's impossible to cancel a membership.  Despite the fact that I told the sales staff I'd be leaving, I'm only now finding out that there's a special website to cancel, that you need a secret code, and that you'll have to pay at least 30 days extra once you do.  In my case 2 months extra.

Other posters have said that even after cancelling they continue to get charged.

That level of customer abuse shouldn't be allowed.  Heck, maybe it's not - I'm also reporting this to the Better Business Bureau.

Went here only a few times. Wasn't going enough so I decided to cancel it well they wouldn't let me cancel without a written notice as to why. Didn't get to them in time and now I have a credit agency calling me. Avoid this place.

I only give this gym a 1 star due to their General Manager.
I will say that their equipment is bomb and that gets a 5 star from me.
Management had informed me on my last visit their that I could come back in and use my pass. I'm from Vegas and I travel to Tucson once or twice a month. I was going to join La Fitness but not after management not keeping their word & pushing a membership on me instead. I hold membership to several gyms so that's not my issue. 
The issue is someone word not being kept and since the gentleman that spoke these words is now in a management position. I find it hard to believe and trust future dealings with him & the club.
Business is business. But I believe in keeping your word as well.

I love the idea of the Y and this is the only branch I've been to so I can only comment on this facility but as much as I want to love it, it definitely needs improvement. The cleanliness gets 2 stars at best. The floors in the yoga room, group fitness & the basement level room are filthy. My guess is they are almost never cleaned. It's difficult to do Barre because certain exercises require a sliding motion & you're sticking to the floor. The noise level in the yoga room is almost hilarious. During the rest period at the end of class you can hear every conversation from the locker rooms, toilets flushing, the bathing suit dryer spinning, the doors slamming, kids whining & screaming, you name it. The yoga room is too small & awkward with the amount of people they allow in. The last three classes were so tight we couldn't do several of the poses the instructor wanted to do because there wasn't enough room. People show up for yoga late, even 10 minutes into class & are allowed in a packed class where they force everyone to squeeze in even tighter disrupting the others practice to the point it's un-enjoyable. The instructor put up a sign yesterday at the beginning of class that said it was at capacity & three more people came in after several minutes completely ignoring the posted sign on the door. At that point the instructor should have asked them to not come in but I realize that might be awkward for them to have to do. 
The parking lot is not planned well & most spaces are too narrow for most cars/SUVs to fit into forcing people to use two spaces. I was unable to get into my car one day & had to climb in from the passenger side when someone squeezed in too close & I injured myself climbing into the driver seat. I told the staff later & they had no response or follow up. Having said all this the staff is very friendly mostly & several of the longtime employees are really welcoming to everyone. The instructors are the best part of this Y in my opinion.

I love this gym for its versatility. They have equipment for everyone. A HUGE downside is how crowded it is. There doesn't seem to be a day of the week where you can comfortably do your workout. It's a shame because I'm on the verge of leaving since it's not enjoyable.

This was an amazing experience, perhaps the best spa I've visited in Philly. Very tranquil. Crystal was my massage therapist and gave me an amazing massage. I highly recommend her. I had a wonderful facial with Shaakina. They use Naturopathica products which a very pure. Will definitely be back. Bonus: you can use the pool, workout area, sauna and jacuzzi with your service!

This isn't your typical run-of-the-mill giant box LA Fitness. It's definitely an older location. The gym itself isn't horrible though. The machines and weights definitely have some years on them but they are usable. 

The gym itself is pretty clean, cleaner than some of the newer LA Fitnesses actually. There's also a relatively comprehensive cardio suite upstairs. Note, however, that this location lacks both a pool and a basketball court so if you're looking for more functional fitness options, you're better off heading to the LA Fitness on 22nd Avenue near Tyrone Mall.

Staff is pretty aloof but I've never had any issues. Parking is plentiful in their private lot. I think the biggest pro of this location is its actual location! I would say this is the most comprehensive gym on this side of St. Petersburg.
Love the ymca!   Great place to work out and enjoy community!   Express church is there doing a worship service once a month as well!  Extremely friendly staff!

If you are looking for a combination strength and cardio work out, this is a great place. That being said, here goes the rest of the review.
I took the free introductory kickboxing class and I came away disappointed, because there is ZERO proper technique taught here. Proper stance and foot work? NO! Proper body mechanics and punching / kicking technique? NO 
They don't even permit sparring here!
There is no doubt in my mind that you can or will loose weight and burn calories here but without proper technique someone is eventually going to get hurt flailing around at the abundance of heavy bags. Personally I wouldn't waste my time here, so my search for a proper gym continues

My friend just joins the gym after FREE 2 weeks trial pass. He goes there every day to get back in shape and loose weights. This is a great way to start working out @the gym if you are not sure about it. You can get the pass from its web site. Check it out!

I really liked the location of this gym. It's in a nice looking town center that seems to have a lot of activity going on in it. I would feel safe working out here at night. Based on the other reviews I was expecting this place to be microscopic, but that was not the case at all. This is a decent sized Anytime Fitness that is nowhere near the smallest sized one I have been to. The front of the gym has a collection of the standard machines that you see at almost every location. In the middle is the cardio equipment. I did find it odd that for a gym of this size there are only four treadmills. If you wanted to use one during prime time that could definitely be a problem. There's another room in the back that houses the free weights. There is a squat rack, a smith machine, and a benching station. There is a station for doing seated barbell shoulder presses, which is rare at Anytime Fitness locations. The dumbbells go up to 120 pounds instead of the standard 100 pounds. The fixed weight barbells go up to 110 pounds.

There is a small room that can be used for classes. I was going to comment that it was nice that there were 3 to 4 spinning cycles in there, until I read the sign that was attached to each of them. The signs stated that the cycles were the personal property of one of the trainers and that they should not be used. Honestly this rubbed me the wrong way. We've all seen signs saying that you shouldn't use equipment that is broken. But to have fully functioning equipment in the gym that I'm not allowed to use? I've never seen that in any of the 20+ locations that I've visited. If I'm paying my monthly dues I should have full access to all of the equipment in the gym period. The locations I've been to in Riverview have lots of cycles available for everyone to use.

I did see several machines that had cracks and splits in the padding on them. The good news is that there are signs throughout the gym stating that a renovation is about to happen (that will not close the gym). Hopefully they will take care of that during the renovation.

Dirty machines. Small pool. Some of the employees are rude and need to be checked up on!!! If you are going to have mediocre equipment when it comes to cleanliness, you need to make up for it in good service, which this gym is SERIOUSLY lacking. Some of these people need a serious attitude check.

The men's locker room smells horrible. Not sure if it's the way the bathroom stalls is set up right in front of the entrance. 

The way the mirror are lined up, you want see your perfect reflection if you stand right between where two mirrors are placed together. 

Some pads on the equipment are worn off.

Good: i really like how some of machines are better than other PF. It's a big up. Staff is nice.

This was my go-to gym for about two years. The gym has just about every piece of equipment you might think you need. There are 3 separate rows of cardio equipment so you never have to wait for a machine and even if you did, there's the indoor track to get some laps in while you wait. There's a basketball court and indoor lap pools as well as the nicest gym locker rooms I have ever seen. But the reason I kept coming back (even though the cost is sort of unreal) is for the personal training. I trained with Gavin for over a year (until health stuff got in the way) and he got me into incredible shape. We were training on all of he equipment and even using stairs and going outside, the works! He knew exactly what my goals were and he encouraged me every step of the way. I trained for a Spartan Race with him and I got so strong with his help. If it wasn't for the cost, I would still be there training with him. Highly recommend if you can afford it!

Planet Fitness is no-frills fitness at its finest: they've got treadmills and barbells, and little else. It's a great place to bang out a workout, and it costs less than any other gym I've belonged to. I've always found the place to be clean, with well-maintained locker rooms and stations to wipe down the equiment. I'd recommend this gym to people who have self-directed fitness plans, and don't need the guidance of classes or the comfort of a smoothie bar.

I thought I had the lice situation under control, but wanted to call for a check to make sure. Boy was I wrong. Not only were both my kids full of lice and nits, me and my mom had it too. Maureen was amazing! She came to our house, and treated my two kids, me and my mom. She was wonderful with the kids, great rapport and the kids didn't cry but were engaged in conversation with Maureen throughout. She teaches the treatment to get rid of the lice and nits so you can do it yourself if necessary (hope it's never necessary again!). Very reasonably priced compared to other lice removal services. Great customer service, received a call back later in the evening on a holiday. Definitely recommend this company!

I took a class this past Saturday and was very impressed with Ricks teaching. He's an intense no nonsense guy that engaged us as a class. He is knowledgeable and taught me things I hadn't known.  And I've owned fire arms my whole life.  I'm.  looking forward to my next class and extend my training   And I'm getting my wife a certificate for the beginner class and CCW class after that with Heather

I found out about TFW Tucson through my husband, who has had phenomenal results using the program. After a botched knee surgery back in 2011, I've had pain and joint slippage almost non-stop. I started with personal training sessions, which were designed to strengthen my knees and low back. In the two months since I started, my knee is stable and practically pain free. My low back pain has also resolved. Furthermore, I feel my confidence in my ability to be active has been restored. After trying some of the TFW workouts in my personal sessions, I am now joining the TFW program full time. 

The gym itself is clean and full of real gym equipment. Everyone I've met there has been friendly and helpful. I love this gym, and am thrilled to now be a part of the TFW Tucson family!
This place sucks. The owner is an unprofessional jerk. The facility isn't clean, the staff is rude, and the place is filthy.

In this city filled with yoga studios, running clubs, spinning, and other types of fitness places, I was really looking forward to the opening of CKO Center City! I love the energy of this place! The workout is a sweat fest, and it works out your whole body, both physically and mentally. You soon find muscles in all the right places, and during class your brain keeps telling you that you're not dying, so keep moving! Plus, the thought of going beast mode on a heavy punching bag does more for me than any workout that I've tried. It really is my new obsession. You learn and burn! Learn new combos, and burn off a gazillion (ok, I'm exaggerating, but it seems close to that number) calories at each class.  

The place has been open a little more than two months, and I've been to enough classes where I've experienced each instructor. All of them are OUTSTANDING and MOTIVATING, and each of them are different. Regardless, every hour you spend at CKO is worth it. I love that you go at your own pace and skill level, so don't feel that you need to kick higher or throw 10 more punches than the person next to you. You compete against yourself to do better, and at the end of class, you leave stronger and confident that the next one will be better than the last. You'll be planking longer, running faster, and throwing more powerful kicks and punches. 

For those that are new, I highly recommend going to your first class 15-20 min early and coming with an open mind. You'll learn the basic punches and kicks with one of the instructors, and then you're all set to join the class for a fun workout! All the classes have the same format: warm up, lots of exercises on your core, work some combos on the bag, maybe 1-2 freestyle sessions, and then a cool down (you'll love the moment when they say starfish!). 

I love coming to my new "therapy sessions" because it relieves stress, and after a rough day at work, it's awesome to get angry and destroy the bag. 

And maybe, just maybe, I'll learn to love burpees.

I signed up online, and downloaded the LA fitness app, so all I need to do is have the barcode on my phone app scanned to enter.    I have not been here in 5 years, and thankfully they have done some remodeling.   Lots of diversity in the gym patrons, and there is something for everyone here.   I am going to check out some of the classes that come with the membership, in addition to weights, the pool, and cardio machines.  This gym will work just great for me as a supplement to outdoor biking and swimming.

Use to love this gym but it's gone downhill 
The equipment is always broken, it's hot as hell with the amount of money they bring in they could turn on the air. Weighs are all over the floor constantly looking for things. This is pure social hour and it messes with your time there. The older men are extremely friendly. Was a member of golds for nearly 10 years happy to say I've moved on to cleaner gyms

Was in Tampa for four days and the gym at my hotel was joke. So i had to find the closest alternative and this location fit the bill.
Its an LA Fitness signature location.. so all services are billed as slightly "better".

As a nationwide la fit member by first visit was free and any other visits to this location would be around $5 per visit... which isnt a big deal.

The club is 2 levels with plenty of new well maintained machines and equipment. there were plenty of free weights as well.. and 2 personal training areas. Locker room also clean.

my only con would be that there is limited space to do floor work.. other than that I was happy to workout here during my Tampa stay.

I've been coming here for a while now. My friend asked me to come with her and I was pleasantly surprised. It's 5 minutes from my house which I loved especially waking up before everyone to go to class. It is also right next to my job too. There are so many pluses about this place. 

1. It's black owned 
2. It's real strength and conditioning by people who are educated and know what they are doing
3. Great workout with results 
4. Convenient times 
5. Great community 

I personally go at 5am and its a big facility. The workouts are challenging and I definitely get stronger. Because I have a background in fitness it's refreshing to see a facility that actually teaches workouts correctly and corrects form. It's the push I need sometimes because I get bored thinking of workouts on my own at my gym and don't go as hard as a should. 

They have lifting days M/W/F and conditioning T/Th with a Saturday bootcamp. I usually go for Wednesday full body day and sometimes Friday for leg day.
The gym is great because of Ashley and Chris.  Kenneth is the only one who's abit unprofessional.  The machines the gym doesn't have is glute pushback and the Adductor/Abductor Inner thigh machines.

Good local gym that recently reorganized their space to make it more efficient. Normal machines and stations that you would find at any gym but has a real local feel as it seems like everyone knows everyone. It gets crowded during the after work hours but it's 24hrs so you can come a little later if you choose to do so. The locker rooms are a little dated but they are clean. I believe it's still $29.99 a month for most guests but they often have specials.

They definitely need more staff at the ticket windows by the pool. The last three days I've gone (while capacity was still open--another issue), there's been a line wrapping around the corner because there weren't enough people to get customers inside in a timely fashion. 

The lack of pool chairs is a bit silly. I understand taking early precautions in a pandemic, but I think the chairs are safe.

I've been going to Sweat for about almost 2 years and have always had a good experience but needed to write a glowing review of the staff. I have always found the staff and other gym members polite and respectful. I have never felt uncomfortable. Today I witness the beginnings of a gym member (one I had never seen before) intruding on another member's workout. Nothing crazy but she was clearly annoyed and uncomfortable. Two men on staff immediately stepped in and separated the two and handled the situation calmly and professionally. I really appreciate that they are dedicated to a respectful atmosphere where everyone, especially women, can enjoy their workouts in peace.

Natali is an amazing trainer. She has been my coach for the past two years and she is an expert in her field. She knows exactly what each of her clients needs are and she gives the tools to achieve your goals. She gives great customized plans for just you and she gives you her full attention. Her workouts are awesome. I love that she pushes you to be better and do more. If you are looking to compete or just needing to shed a few pounds Natali is your girl.

As far as gyms go, this is a typical LA fitness.  Lots of equipment, very clean, and lots of people, especially at night after work.  I thought the gym had a nice mix of members.  I see seniors in there for the water aerobics, as well as the all women classes of aerobics.  Of course you have your meat heads, but everyone I find is polite at this gym and concious of their space.  I did see a member in there the other night with one of those really low cut tank tops.  He looked ridiculous, and I was embarrased for him.  The child care room looks very safe and fun.

Couple of oddities, there is no towel service available, even for an extra charge.  The drop in fee is quite high, $15 I think.  But the membership rates seem to be fairly priced.  They do have spinning classes, but the room isn't well ventilated.  The smell coming from that room was quite impressive.

To preface this review let it be know that I'm not very athletic. My high school PE coach once told me he thought badminton might be my sport. That being said, my roommate and a few friends talk up crossfit all the time so I figured I should see what the hype was about.

My initial fitness level was probably average, high school sports days are way behind me, and regardless-- benchwarmer status. In Nashville I tried out some pure barre here and there, running, different spin classes, etc. but I hadn't committed to anything. I decided to give the Crossfit Forte intro class a try (first one is free) and here they teach you some of the basic moves and the accompanying form. Katelyn was the teacher and she was awesome. She was encouraging, and really really helpful to someone whose only athletic ability apparently reaches its limit with badminton.

After the 101 intro class you can sign up to join the regular classes, its $139/ month for 3 days per week, and $169/ month for unlimited. In comparison to spin studios, barre studios, and other workout places around Nashville this is really a steal.

I was sooo nervous for the first day of regular classes and for a quick minute I considered turning my car around and heading home and giving up on this new fitness venture. Luckily, I bit the bullet and went inside. Evan was the coach on the first day and he, just like Katelyn, was great. He made sure to introduce the new people to the class, explained each move as we went, and helped with modifications. Since the first day, the coaches have been nothing less than encouraging and supportive.

The rest of the reviews really touch on how great this crossfit gym is. There have been a few events planned since I started and the community feel is no joke. People of all fitness levels workout at CrossFit Forte; the gym is fun and everyone is committed, helpful, and friendly.

I am really happy with my decision to try out crossfit and join CrossFit Forte. It has only been a few weeks but I already feel somewhat athletic (say whaaat?!).

I tried out this location using a guest pass during a really busy week (during which I didn't have time to drive to my normal gym - the West Chester YMCA).  This place definitely has perks that the Y doesn't - an insanely huge and nice locker room, a juice bar (though, I'm still not sure what "magic milk" is), a tiered spin studio (loved the look of that and wish I could have tried a spin class), etc.  But overall, this place just wasn't for me.  I didn't like the layout of the cardio machines and prefer other machines to the Lifestyle brand that LA Fitness carries.  The group exercise schedule wasn't as thorough as I hoped and the (one) pool was small.  I also missed the smaller, more intimate feeling that I enjoy at the Y.  This place just confirmed for me that large chain-style gyms aren't for me.

RowZone is what all exercise classes in Philadelphia should strive to be. It's challenging, it's well-designed, it's encouraging and it's fun. I have tried RowZone via class pass twice, and even in my short tenure as a customer, I have realized that the members of this gym are a community. Through the sweat and loud music, you hear members supporting one another and coaches cheering you to push just a little harder. 

What I like most about this gym, is it's a low key, no frills environment. Many of the classes I have done through class pass (while challenging and enjoyable) have been in super glamorous gyms, with loud music and DJs, dark lighting, etc.  I don't need to pay for the frills, just deliver a workout that's going to kick my butt. RowZone is exactly that, the room is lined with erg machines and there is an assortment of free weights available for exercises you do off the machine. There are lockers for your belongings and a fridge to keep your water cold for after the workout. 

Rowing is a great full body workout, and the class is designed to get you on and off the erg. There are a few circuits for each class, some are AMRAPs, some are focused on the distance rowing. In addition to rowing, you work in some strength training using both dumbbells and body weight. It's high intensity with low impact. 

I have told a few people about this gym so far, and what a great feeling it is when you complete the workout! I'm hoping to bring my parents next time because I think they would really like the intensity without the impact on their joints!

I belonged to a Lifetime Athletic outside of Chicago and the Tampa club doesn't compare to the one back in IL. The IL club was two stories higher, thousands of square feet larger, had WAY more equipment (especially cardio), had indoor and outdoor, huge swimming pools  and was $50 a month CHEAPER.
