Makes absolutely no sense to me. Summary:

PROS
1. Obviously very, very clean and well-maintained

2. Nice locker rooms, free towels, eucalyptus steam room, nice showers (although there are only 6 or 7), free quality shampoo, conditioner, body wash.  Deodorant, hair spray, mouthwash. 

3. State-of-the-art cardio equipment (although there are no cross ramp ellipticals, which I love)

4. Brand new machines (cardio and weight)

5. Very nice and helpful staff

6. No crowds whatsoever. I was there today, Monday at 530pm and I saw maybe 15 other people. Granted, they just opened two days prior but still, very weird. But at the same time, it was nice not having to wait on any machines or for a shower. 

7. Whirlpools in the locker rooms

8. Has a child care center for the latchkey kids



CONS
1. Way overpriced. Not worth the $140 per month fee plus initiation fee.  I'd be ok paying $80 per month. 

2. Very, very small. Even seemed smaller than some good clubs I've been to. Also very weird because it looks huge from the outside. 

3. No swimming pool. Lifetime is known for their amazing pools but not even a kiddie pool in this one (although they have the aforementioned whirlpools in the locker rooms)

4. Not a big variety of cardio equipment or weight machines. 

5. Not 24 hours like most Lifetimes


That's pretty much it. Like I said, very very nice club, but not worth the price. More pros than cons but the cons are pretty steep.  And I have a feeling if they don't lower that monthly fee, they won't be in business very long.

I love Todd and the whole team and the Bryn Mawr location is all spiffed up! This is a great gym with state of the art training and a terrific atmosphere. It's clean and smells clean and is my favorite place to work out! All ages and all levels individually tailored personal training with just the right trainer matched up to you for your unique needs. Love it here!

Amazing place , to have a kids birthday party, or just as a gym to many things to do here, 
A little pricey but you do get a lot for your money 
If you're just looking for a gym to workout in they have it all, most likely you would end up using 5% of this place, have to say I don't think you'll ever find a place like this anywhere around here
I have always loved PSC. The staff is nice and so is the gym itself and the equipment. The pool is aways a huge plus. I highly suggest PSC.

This gym is amazing. I have been to a few lifetime locations and this one was by far the cleanest, well managed and friendliest location ive been to. I didnt go at a peak time or anything, usually on a saturday or sunday and usually it was empty which was amazing. Its much smaller than normal lifetime's but I didnt seem to mind I almost liked it more because I didnt have to trek halfway across the gym to get to a bench or use euqipment when I needed more than one machine at once. Amazing experience and customer service.

This place rocks! In the past two months I've had the pleasure to train with each unique trainer..& let me tell you they all have that certain vibe and kick a*s mentality you are looking for to push your self to the next level! Whatever you're looking for~physical,mental, or emotional change~OT can take you their. The atmosphere is warm & inviting to new comers & first timers & once you start going on the reg you become family! I highly recommend this place for a new chapter on better yourself! You can find a better upgraded version of you! I'm living proof;)

Every class is worth every penny! I used to come regularly to this cycling studio prior to moving out of state 6 years ago, and to my surprise the studio was still open and thriving! I recently went to a class since moving back to the Tampa area and was happily reminded of why I love the studio. The instructors are motivating and energizing, and  overall the atmosphere is awesome.

If you are looking for a solid gym, this is for you.   

I was in the market for a new gym after graduating from the UA. I am a very critical consumer and I did my homework before visiting this gym. I have to say that many of the reviews here paint a poor picture, so I thought I'd share my experience as you shop for the best gym for you.   

Note: I visited most of the commercial gyms in Tucson prior to signing up, and I enjoyed a 3-day trial run over most of the one-day passes. It ensured the best fit for me.   

Pros: Big open space (Chuze and Planet feel so small in their strip mall style), lots of different machines, pool, courts, Large variety of free classes. No contract.   

Cons: Busy at 4:30-6pm, only open until 8pm on weekends, no towel service for the pool  I would like to mention two key inquiries in my consideration of this facility. 

If you note other reviews, people say they feel uncomfortable because of the "bros" and "meatheads." I was reasonably concerned about this. I have found quite the opposite. There is the full range of people here. I personally think the old ladies are adorable. Everyone is kind and respectful. Even though, I lift 20lbs next to someone lifting 100lbs. There has never been any hostility.   

Another consideration was the busy hours. Simple reality. It is busy. I like to go at 8pm. A lot less people. (and yes there are 8pm classes).   You will read about the sales people in the comments. This is a business folks. Yes, they are trying to make a sale. Look online before you go in. See if there are coupons and deals. Know the price you can get. Be a smart consumer. I notice that only people that complain seem to post.   

Hope this helps you. Picking a gym can be a very stressful experience! But this place helps me destress every day.

Lilly Steele Fitness is above and beyond amazing! I have been looking for something for the last few years that would be: fun, engaging, challenging, a comfortable environment and a good workout. Impossible, right? One workout cannot be all those things?! Enter Lilly Steele Fitness! I was completely hooked after one Aerial Yoga class. Every class is fun, engaging, challenging and a good workout. The environment could not be more comfortable. With a max class size of 4, you get one on one guidance and every person I've been in class with has been super friendly. Lilly is delightful! She is encouraging and motivating. She encourages you to keep going, shows you the right way to do each move and I don't think I've seen her without a smile. 

The classes I take on Tuesday and Wednesday are the highlight of my week.  

I must include that I've had amazing improvement in some areas of tension and pain in my neck, shoulders and hips that I've been dealing with for years. I've spent literally thousands of dollars with various doctors in over the past two years. After less than two months of classes twice a week, pain is almost completely gone.  Best thing ever!

I highly recommend! 6 Stars! 5 isn't enough. :-)

I have always struggled with my weight and thought I had tried it all but I hadn't. Psychosomatic fitness changed my life!!! The trainers are amazing, friendly and supportive!!! The workouts are fun but kick your butt!!! I am so glad I decided to go to this Psychosomatic Fitness! #fitfam

I have been a member at this gym for a long time. I initially began my membership when it was golds gym, which I loved a lot. I don't mind spending the extra $10-$15 a month for a clean gym with updated/functioning equipment. When fitness connection took over, I renewed my membership, and got a much better deal $10 a month. 
However, I was wrong about being happy with the $10 a month membership fee. It seems as if the WHOLE world goes to fitness connection; too many young high school students that don't take their work-out serious; and their equipment is super worn out and outdated. They have not changed their equipment, at least not since I've been a member (4+years). 
If you plan on going to the gym after 5pm, forget about funding a functioning cardio machine or having space to do weights. I went a few times to do cardio around 9-10pm & it was still super crowded at that time. 
As far as cleanliness goes, the main floor is very clean. There's always someone cleaning the equipment and floors. However, the men's locker room is not the same story. The men's locker room is filthy. There's always wrappers & used paper towels on the floor. The sink counters haven't been cleaned in who knows how long. Some lockers don't function. The carpet is very worn out. 
Overall, I do not recommend this gym. I enjoyed the quality of my workouts much better when it was Gold's Gym. $10 a month, yeah, but you get what you pay for. 
Hope this review helps & is seen by the Fitness Connection management.

I'm downgrading a star for a few reasons, the biggest one being that I saw a man bun wearing cross-shitter in the gym this morning. Dont you idiots have your own garages or something to work out in? By the way, those arent pull ups you're doing - they're fucking hanging convulsions. 

There needs to be some new equipment added in this place. I can point out at least 6-8 pieces of equipment that are literally never used. Swap out some of this stuff please. A chest press for upper and lower pecs would be fantastic instead of the shoulder shredders that are currently in there.

This is one of the best gyms I've ever joined. They thought of everything a person going to the gym could ever want. Plus they have awesome classes and soo many of them. From the cycling studio, to the upstairs track, great fitness classes, and little details like cupholders on all the machines, and a filtered waterbottle refill station, it's wonderful. There's also pools and a sauna which I don't use because I'm not a swimmer. Nice, clean, big! Would recommend!

Been a member here for over 3 years. Although the right about the equipment not working most times, rude staff, etc. The monthly price made it tolerable. But lately been have unusual charges taken out from my account (4 in one month)and when contacting customer service I was told I can go online and cancel if I like.

Wow. Stopped in completely ready to sign up for the Black Card membership. Spoke to the woman at the front desk who was the fastest, softest voiced person I've spoken to in along time. I had to keep saying excuse me, because it was almost impossible to understand what she was saying. It was as if there was a race to answer my question so she could get rid of me. I heard a lot of what she couldn't do, and no real offers to help me get signed up so I could take an orientation class tomorrow.  It seemed so difficult, which is why I just canceled my membership to Orange Theory Fitness. Working out doesn't have to be complicated. 

I work in sales, and it would have been so easy to close me in this deal.  Glad I don't own this business.

Amazing gym. So glad I decided to try it out for the summer. Amazing instructors, wide variety of class time and a wonderful atmosphere. Instructors are always welcoming and helpful, especially when it comes to offering modified workouts. 

They really push you in the most positive way possible. I found a good gym. 

They make it easy to support a local tucson business.

This is my first impression upon starting a 7-Day Free Trial this morning.

I went it about 7:20AM and waited around forever for someone to come to the unmanned desk. The fella who showed me around was very friendly and totally excited about the gym. Encouraged me to take advantage of all the classes offered, which I may start with AM Boot Camp tomorrow....hello 6:30AM (ugh).

This time of the morning wasn't too crowded -- plenty of available machines and lots of room on the stretch mats. I didn't do any lifting, but it seemed that anyone there had their choice of machines during the hour I was there.

I went back again after work and while it was much more crowded, it wasn't overwhelming. I was able to get a treadmill right away and then a stationary bike. While it's cool that the treadmills have personal TVs, it's a bit much since they're so close to your face. The desk was manned this time around (more people working, so it makes sense) and the staff was again very friendly.

I enjoyed my first day and hope the rest of the trial goes as well. I'm still not clear on where all the classes take place, but I definitely want to get involved in some of them. Good variety: yoga, boot camp, zumba, Indian dancing, spinning, and a lot more.

Came here for a Zumba training a couple weeks ago and was very impressed with the facility and staff. The room where we did the training was very large, clean, and cozy for a group of 60 women! Also, when we needed to use the restroom/locker room I was impressed with how large and cleaning everything was. I don't plan on becoming a member, but I appreciate the cleanliness and friendliness of the center.

I have been to a few gyms other than this 24 Hour Fitness, & I must say, I feel very out of place at this gym. It seems to me that the majority of the men are there just to check the women out. The women (not everyone, granted, but the greater majority) all seem to be Caughlin Club types, you know, with the make-up & hair that nobody would have if they were to actually work out. The equipment is nice, the customer service varies, depending on who you get at the front desk. Lastly, the locker rooms are absolutely disgusting - be sure to bring flip-flops!
I love Tue. and Thu. Zumba by Dee. She's nice and fun teacher. Bodycombat on Wed. is good also. I love this gym. My son love their daycare and he never say no to come to the gym with me.

I really like it here. I never have to wait on equipment! There is no judgement so no one cares if I roll out of bed and hit the gym. I see that almost everyone sprays down the equipment after they use it. No one really hangs out on equipment just talking, obstructing you from using it. Staff is always professional and courteous. The only complaints that I have is the paper towel holder near the ellipticals is usually out and ladies who wear way too much perfume make me want to gag. It seriously makes me have a hard time breathing when they get on equipment right beside me. It smells like gardenia and old wooden musty closets. I wish they would put up signs asking people to refrain from having perfume or cologne on until after their showers .

I feel kind of weird giving a gym a 5-star review, but I really have no complaints with this location, so we're going for it! 

I've been a member for a little over a year (can't say I attended regularly during that whole time, though :x ) This location was my first experience with a Planet Fitness, and I'd have to say I'm impressed! For all I've heard about them, especially for their membership pricing, I figured it'd be cheap and rundown and bare-minimum ammenities. This is not the case! 

The place is huge- there are always enough of the machines, even when it's busy. Sometimes you have to wait for weights when it's busy, but everyone is always pretty courteous about not hogging for too long. 

Staff has always been nothing but helpful and welcoming. Always being sure to welcome you in and send you off with well wishes. 

They do offer free group and one-on-one workouts with their trainer M-F. I haven't done these yet, but I've seen them in progress and they seem beneficial to those new to the space or unsure of how to get jump-started in their workout journey. 

If you're in their upper-tier membership, you can use their red-light machines, tanning booths and massage chairs. I haven't worked up the nerve to use these yet, but I always longingly look at the massage chairs on my way out.

I've been a member here for a little over a year. First the good.

This facility is beautiful. The architectural design is pleasant and well planned inside and out. The fitness center, which is the reason I joined, has high quality equipment and a nice selection of classes. Many of the staff and instructors here are friendly and helpful.

That said, there are some things that pull this otherwise nice facility down. Really down! The rules posted -  no cell phones in the gym, re-stack and don't drop weights, wipe down the equipment, etc... - are never enforced. People routinely use an exercise machine as a lounge chair to chat on the phone, text, talk to a gym buddy, or for some purpose other than exercise and are never spoken to by staff. Weights drop constantly and unnecessarily and I have never seen staff address this with an offender. Maintenance on the machines, like the bikes in the spin room, is wanting and mentioning this to staff seems ineffective. Several bikes have been in need of repair for some time.

Then there is the behavior of some, and I emphasize SOME, of the gym-goers. While plenty of gym wipes are available, many lack the proper gym etiquette to use them. Profanity and stories about jail are not uncommon. Again, it's frustrating to have to ask a person to get off of a machine they are NOT using so you can use it for its intended purpose. People don't re-stack weights. People DO drop weights. Children often run about unsupervised (although staff does seem to address this when they see it). There is just a relatively high level of inconsideration and little knowledge of etiquette. 

Oh...and the parking lot is too small and people seem to lack sufficient driving skill to take up only one spot.

So, why do I stay here? It's reasonably priced and is overall a nice place. But, with a little effort from the staff to not only post rules but to gently and kindly enforce them, this place could be so much nicer.

Why the hell a gym has key card access and doesn't staff its desk until noon completely boggles mind...translation :  if you are an out-of-towner looking for a guest pass don't show up until noon or else the door is locked and you cannot get in.  Dumb.

Great class, great coach, and great atmosphere. Evan was a great coach and made my wife and I feel very comfortable. Dropped in to the 6am class to avoid the humidity( we are from CA), it didn't help much. The organization of the class was smooth, started on time and ended on time, and most important, it never felt rushed. Starfish planks will hurt me for days.

I had my first trial workout yesterday and immediately signed up for a membership right afterwards.  The trainers were super welcoming, encouraging throughout the workout, and guided me through the rounds.  I met with the owner, Matt, after the workout and went though all of the benefits they offer with membership. He was super friendly and low-pressure.  The workout was intense but the music was loud and got me pumped, and it was over before I knew it.  I highly encourage anyone to do a trial workout

The customer service is horrible.  I have been attempting to sign my daughter up for swimming lessons for three weeks, yet can not get anyone to call me back.  I requested to see the manager on three separate occasions during normal business hours and was told " they are in a meeting".   I left my phone number and requested they call back anytime - big surprise no return call

I would recommend to anyone looking to join a gym to look elsewhere.  


Going from bad to worse... Now they are actually removing benefits ... No longer offer towel service to certain members, although I had it for previous 4 months it seems recent changes no longer provide that "privilege"

Please someone open a high end gym on the man line that understands that when charging a premium requires good customer service

It's nice that this location has a bunch of equipment, but unfortunately the space is too small for everything. Plus the equipment is a bit dated. Everything appeared to be in decent shape but there are some cramped spots, especially if trying to use the squat rack right by the dumbbells. I was able to get a decent workout in while on the road, but there are better Anytime Fitness locations out there.

I jumped around gyms/health clubs quite a bit in the last 12 years since I moved to Philly from NY. I went to Sweat, PSC and finally joined The Sporting Club in April 2015. It's the best gym Philadelphia can offer, for now. Depending on what you want, I love most of the classes I go to. They have a wide selection but I have my favorite classes and instructors that I follow.  I highly recommend: Nathaniel who teaches Hatha is a really fantastic instructor who pays attention to your alignment (Hatha), Miko, Jen & Remi (Hatha and Vinyassa), Jamie is simply the best (hip-hop), Nicole is high energy combo Zumba/hip hop class too. Luis and Laura (Zumba), Emily (Boot camp) and Kristin (Pilates) classes.  They also have Aquafit, TRX, Spinnjng and Barre classes.  Kelli's Barre class is wonderful and Kristin's Pilates mat class will kick your abs! The studios are all hardwood floors and kept clean.  The towels are constantly kept washed, fresh and clean. Clean locker rooms, steam room, dry sauna and jacuzzi are wonderful amenities. The olympic sized pool is great with lukewarm water temp all year round but the cool ambient air can make it feel cold in the winter. The weight room is expansive & updated machines. You get all sorts of people that come to this gym - the lookers, the onlookers and wants to be looked at.  Of course there are the ones that just go & workout and doesn't care (that's me).  They also have a basketball court which draws all kinds of leagues but not necessarily the usual health club  members. They also have squash & racquetball courts.  The front desk people are nice, especially Chuck who greets most people by their first names! A plus for him. The sales staff are helpful...well its sales. Hannah Purbe who is the Group Fitness Director is awesome and responsive to our suggestions, if reasonable.  I also love their indoor running track, so kind to your knees. Its not Equinox (my gym in NYC) but the Sporting Club is as good as its gonna get as far as Philly is concerned. I wish they would replace those stinky carpets along the stairways that somehow soaks up the smelly sweat from people. The management & customer service seem to be more responsive these days and a bit better with communication.  Watch out though if you catch them on a bad day, they might give you the attitude or no response at all.  P.s. I ran into Bradley Cooper in the elevator one afternoon.
If you're looking to join a gym, I'd advise you to stay away from this one.  As soon as you walk in, they team tag you for a membership, for trainers, for supplements. Shakedown.

Love the people here and it's the best workout ever! First 15 minutes are cardio, then you have 8 rounds of boxing broken up by "active rest" which is basically more cardio. Last 15 is ab work, sometimes with a medicine ball. They walk you through all the moves and are so helpful with anything you need or any questions you have. It's so easy to go at your own pace--on some of the cardio, I just stand at my bag and kind of jog in place instead of doing some of the jumping/running that everyone else is doing. I never feel stupid or judged here or like anyone is watching me.

The men's locker room smells horrible. Not sure if it's the way the bathroom stalls is set up right in front of the entrance. 

The way the mirror are lined up, you want see your perfect reflection if you stand right between where two mirrors are placed together. 

Some pads on the equipment are worn off.

Good: i really like how some of machines are better than other PF. It's a big up. Staff is nice.


A few pads has been changed to new ones. & Mens Locker room doesn't smell anymore. Nice.

This one on disc dr is under construction. No ventilation on upstairs level, with only a few cardio machines working. Rest had "no power" at all, no floor exercise area left neither to do weights, abs, etc. poor judgment on management to close 90%of their workout facilities. This place is kinda drive for me as it is. It was a waste of my time since I haven't received any information on when the deadline is for construction. I got email I think about 2 months ago..
I will b cancelling and dojng my workouts from home.

Can't believe I found a gym that compares to 12st street...if it wasn't for the price I would definitely give 5 stars.

This is exactly what you want in a gym, clean, friendly, tons of variety and you actually look forward to going there. My friend gave me a three day trial pass and I completely fell in love. If I wasn't moving from the city I would definitely consider joining. The kettle-bell class was great, followed by a strength/cardio class (with mini trampoline!), followed by the intense TRX class. Also, next day I tried spinning which was good. There is tons of cardio equipment (with actual working TVs and multiple channels) and also tons of weights, indoor track, and pool. I only hope my future gym will be as good otherwise I'll have so suck it up and sign up for this one. I haven't been this excited to go to the gym in forever. This is great for anyone who loves variety  of work outs from boot camp/cross fit type classes, to spinning, yoga and zumba and is bored with their current fitness routine. I could spend all day there and never leave.

The best part? The atmosphere, you forget you are in Philly.

PS. LA Fitness is actually embarrassing at this point, and should really get one star.

Sigh....
$150 admin fee and $40 a month for a tiny gym that is barely ever open? No thanks.

This club is top notch. ALL of the trainers are challenging & great at what they do. They are specific to your needs & will work around any injuries. I love the fact they have an indoor field. Great equipment & they offer HITT clasSes. All the staff make you feel warm & welcome. 

What else is great the have an organic caffe with tons of great options from sandwiches, coffee, smoothies & salads.

Love the atmosphere and energy of the cycle theater. It keeps me motivated by displaying my status and plays music videos from time to time to distract me and keep me from being bored on a stationary bike. 

As a techno geek, the real-time stat board is awesome. Whether I am first or last on the stat board, it does not matter. The board allows me to create a challenge such as holding fifth place position for the last 30 minutes or moving up just one place during a sprint interval.  The technology to record my workouts and review my online dashboard is cool too. 

I love the pricing. No membership. Pay as you go. This is perfect for me since I am not a local but frequent the area because my head office is down the road.

I love it here! Everyone is so friendly and the instructors are motivating and fun! Sometimes classes are a little too crowded for my taste but they are pretty good about adding overflow classes if the class reaches capacity. I love that I can buy passes instead of paying a monthly fee.

The "lunk" definition on the wall at Planet Fitness provides an example of Ricky, who slams his weights, wearing a body building tank top and drinking out of a gallon water jug. The other day I counted at least six tank top guys, high-fiving, dropping weights and grunting. I am happy that my first personal trainer 10 years ago explained to be that the bringing weights back to a quiet rest was part of the exercise. This is not a gymtimidation-free zone.

I was going to be in New Orleans knowing full well I was going to take advantage of all the bountiful food. I didn't want to derail my fitness too much and being that I am a Crossfitter anyway, I decided taking a Crossfit class would probably be a very good idea. I did a little Yelp search for Crossfit gyms only two came up. The closest to the house I was staying at was Crossfit NOLA. I perused the website and it would set me back $20 to attend a class. An average price for most places. I sent out an e-mail explaining I was visiting from out of town and would like to attend a class. I promptly received a welcoming response. 

Cut to Thursday afternoon and I walk into Crossfit NOLA. The previous class was wrapping up so I checked out the space and it is typical of a Crossfit gym: bars, kettlebells, weights at one wall, pull up bars along another. There was a guy at the laptop which I assumed was the trainer and I was correct. He immediately asked if I was the visitor and I told him yes. He welcomed me and had me fill out some paperwork. Soon more people arrived and the class started. 

After busting my ass class came to an end. I had a great workout! Whenever I make it back to New Orleans I will absolutely be stopping by Crossfit NOLA again.
Went in to sign up after accidentally signing up online to the wrong location. The staff was super polite and welcoming. They answered all my questions to the fullest.
my favorite studio in philadelphia! Solidcore is a workout like no other and the instructors are great!

A little small especially if there is a large crowd.  Otherwise, very similar to other jump places in different cities.  Staff was too impressive although it was quick to check in.  One thing that would take this to 4 stars and above is additional jump areas.

I visited here while I was on vacation and it was an OK spot. The staff were super friendly and there were plenty of machines but it was a little small for me. There was a definitely a get in, work out and leave feel to it but it was good for that purpose alone. If I wanted to relax after my work out it seemed a little compact, the massage chairs were placed at the entrance and I don't believe they had a sauna. Overall it was clean and you can't beat customer service!!!

My husband and I are members at a different studio but signing up through the app to join the Tyrone OTF was a breeze.  Staff members were really nice.  We had coach Aimee on 2018 Labor Day and she was awesome.  It was a 3 partner work out (oh no!) which I typically dread, but Melanie joined us and we had SO much fun.  This studio seems to really encourage and cheer on classmates so much more.  I mean, we were high fiving between switches and really motivating one another.  I don't see that as much in my home studio for some reason.  I didn't realize what we were missing until coming to this awesome group.  Thank you, Tyrone OTF for welcoming us and letting us have a great work out while on vacation.  We will be back!!

Nice gym. Very clean equipment  and more than enough machines even on a busy day. Few grunting muscle heads. Varied age groups from teens to 80's. Machines are maintained better than 
L. A Fitness . Nice staff which always are welcoming.

Clean, inexpensive, and convenient.

I didn't work with a trainer so I can not speak to their quality.

Classes, kids club and pool for $10 a month is a great deal. The front desk is not very friendly the only reason I didn't give 5 stars.

I like Kelly and Tara. They are the best coaches. They  seem genuine, remember you and encourage you. The other coaches don't seem to care one way or the other about your progress. Neither does the manager. He always seems dismissive. Oh, except the day you sign the contract. 

The facilities are clean. And if you don't mind the darkness and orange lighting - it feels almost like a night club. The monitors that tell you how you are doing are pretty much the only reason I keep coming back. 

It's like one of those group bootcamp workouts, but it's not crazy like Crossfit. it's different every day, which keeps it somewhat interesting but if you aren't a fan of the treadmill or rowing, this ain't for you. 

Basically you spend 30 min on the tread, or rower/weight room--- and then switch off. They say it's a 500-1000 calorie workout but so far my best ever was 470 calories and 11 minutes in the Orange zone. 

The ppl taking classes aren't that friendly either. They don't even smile at you when you pass. They definitely don't have the kind of camaraderie that you get in a Crossfit box. 

If you miss a class, you get charged $10. Or, if you are on the 8x a month plan, you lose your class. Unless you cancel 12/24 hours in advance. I don't recall which it is. 

For now, I'll keep on going because it's conveniently located. And the only other equally accessible gym is YouFit. But its just ok.

I've been a member for a few years and have never had any issues with the facility.  Great staff, great clientele, and everyone is respectful of each other.  Fairly priced membership with the added benefits aside from just using the gym.  Clean facility, I've always had a great workout every time I go.  I would LOVE a third rower since that's typically the only machine I have to wait for, but I know space is limited.  I have been a member at several previous gyms and this one surpasses the rest by far.  I did see several reviews criticizing the far walk from the parking lot to the gym, but I actually appreciate the longer walk; isn't that why most of us are there, to exercise? Great place!

My daily gym, my home away from home. Pristine facility with everything you could need in the weight room, all types of cardio equipment, spinning room, indoor and outdoor pools & hot tub, basketball courts which often have pickup games, and great locker rooms. Only thing I miss is a sauna but that is a true luxury for such an affordable monthly rate. I have always loved the feel of a family YMCA, can't go wrong and there is always a friendly supportive atmosphere.
Got to get it in. But hard to stay focus,y is a good place to work out they really are there to help you. When I do exercise I feel so much better

I really wanted to give this gym 5 stars but i cant.

The staff is nice enough.
It is the cleanest planet fitness I've been to and I've been to 55.
They have great, new equipment. 
The trainer is a good guy that knows his stuff.
They offer lots of t.v but not one shows national news  (fox, cnn or msnbc).

So the problem?

They refuse to turn down their overhead music. With ear phones on and turned all the way up i still cant hear what im listening to. Ive asked the staff to lower the volume.  Ive tweeted plant fitness asking them to turn it down. No one listens or cares. The music is fine just to damn loud. They dont seem to understand how the acustics work and the impact of their acustics and even when explained to them they dont get it. Ill be deaf in a few more work outs so i guess this noise issue is only going to be short term.

Great gym.
Clean gym.
Nice staff.
Too freaking loud !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've been a member of Crunch for 6 months and so far I've only been to the Hillsborough location, I go 3-5 times a week and am very happy with it. They have lots of membership discounts for various businesses and services and many employers have membership discount deals, so ask when you go to sign up. Gym is usually pretty clean, they run out of cleaner and towels for the machines pretty regularly, and I wish they would go back to the disinfectant wipes they used to provide so you didn't have to spray cleaner. There is often at least one rowing or star master machine that is broken, but they keep fixing them. Minor issues that you would experience at any gym. 

I've been working with a personal trainer 3x a week since December and have lost 50lbs! I highly recommend working with trainer Tyler D. He is super supportive and effective. The sessions are cheaper the more you sign up for and if you pay in advance and the trainers focus on exercise and diet, they put you on a meal plan to track your micros and they check in with you daily to see how you are doing. The environment is very welcoming and the program has been life changing for me!

I just cancelled my membership - horrific customer service and terrible facilities.  I tried to use the baby pool with my little ones and they close the pool for camp 9-3:30 every day in the summer.  And even though I am a paying member and both pools were empty due to lunchtime for campers, they wouldn't let me allow my baby & toddler to use the baby pool for 20 minutes AFTER their front desk clerk told me it was open and I spent 20 minutes getting everyone into swim diapers, required plastic pants and swim trunks.  When I pleaded my case, they said that they couldn't do anything about it.  So I did - I took my money elsewhere.  


They told me it would take 60 days to cancel and I told them that if I got charged for a MINUTE more let alone 60 more days, I would file a complaint with the owner and investigate legal options.  

I am a reasonable person but I am also logical and if a pool is empty and a member is standing there asking for 20 minutes in the BABY POOL you oblige.  No negotiating - you just oblige.

This is by far my favorite gym in the area. Not only does the staff remember my name, but they're always friendly when I visit the gym. I highly recommend the group fitness classes - if you're like me and need structure or a start/end time, that's the way to go. I've tried almost every class they offer and they are all amazing! Any class you can take with Becca D. is worth your time - she is an amazing fitness instructor, and if you love Zumba, she's your girl! Amy is wonderful for yoga, though again - all of the instructors are great. The gym is always clean and well-maintained. The locker rooms are kept clean and they provide a hair dryer, which is so convenient for those of us that need to get ready again after a workout. 

As Tom mentioned in his review, the gym is NEVER overcrowded. I recently attended the 80's Zumba Party and we comfortably had 75 people in class enjoying the party with plenty of room. Even at the busiest times, the gym isn't jam packed.

I've had my daughter try a few different Martial Arts Classes (in San Diego) and was very disappointed.  All they were about was money and locking us into a contract.  We were very disillusioned.  
    We moved back to Sparks and found Evolution and am very glad that we found this place. 1st off, a very reasonable monthly fee and great prices on equipment (if you choose to buy any) and my kid loves it here.  She'd come here 7 days a week if I let her. Everyone is friendly and approachable.  Ray does a tremendous job with the kids (mine is 10) and the assistants are great with the kids as well.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking to put their kids in a quality Dojo.  And with the low monthly fees you can afford to have a couple of kids go here

I travel often for work and having a box that feels like home is a big deal. Was able to make two drop-ins at the Downtown location and could not have been happier. Phil Guillot was a fantastic coach, the format and style were great, and the location and space were phenomenal. Now the expectations for my home box have been raised and I wish I lived closer!

Facilities: 2 stars. The tile around the pool and hot tub was definitely dirty. I saw a lot of hair that REALLY grossed me out. The hot tub itself was kinda clean, but the paint was really chipping off making it look dirtier than it probably was. My massage room was clean and the pool chairs and sauna were nice. The women's locker room needed some work. The shower had excellent water pressure and complimentary shampoo, conditoner and bodywash but again it desperately needed a deep clean. The grout was full of mold, which was pretty gross. Someone needs to get a powerwasher in there STAT. Also, people were drinking complimentary water out of styrofoam cups and leaving them all over the damn place and no one was picking them up. A couple sat in the locker room for at least 3 hours. 

Massage: 4 stars. My masseuse was polite, asked me about my specific needs, and provided a relaxing, 50 minute experience. I wish she worked more on the horrendous knots in my shoulders, but I did not have a deep tissue so I can't blame her for that. 

Other: 3 stars The lotion they used in the massage was unscented. Personally, I like to smell either like a coconut, sugar cookie, or grapefruit after leaving a massage so the fact there was no smell to transport me to a happy place was disappointing. I realize how silly that sounds. Also, there was "relaxing music" but it sounded like Spa playlist from Spotify that didn't have any transition between the songs. It was actually distracting, because there would be classical music then the song would end, a 3 second pause, and then tropical thunder sounds would play, then stop and pause 3 seconds, and then ocean sounds would start. It was just confusing and I could not get into my relaxation zone. 

Overall, an okay place to get a massage, especially on a budget. If you are a germaphobe, stay away, because I am not and I was kinda skeeved out.

I've been coming here since Feb 2016, I joined because of a 6 week challenge offered on FB. After the challenge was over I decided to stay. My personal favorite trainer is Rich, because he takes the time to genuinely get to know people. He is a leader, motivating people to be their best and adapting the workouts to people's needs. As for the center itself, they offer good hours and one on one training which is invaluable to those who don't prefer group workouts. It is a bit pricey, but the variety of exercise and training styles is worth it with the right trainers. The only reason I'm rating 4 stars instead of 5 is because new owners (co-owners?) are coming in and I'm not sold yet.

They recently added some new machines and opened up an area for weights. There's one of everything you might need along with a studio room, which I use to do workouts from apps. It's almost always open (there's a class every now and then). They have one HIIT class M/W at 5. It's usually pretty busy so it's hit or miss on the equipment you get to use. Jordan and Nick are both trainers and are really nice. They always greet me when they're there. It's not perfect but for the size of the gym i think it's pretty good. I only wish it was closer to my home!

So far so good. I came to some yoga classes (so far quality instruction for a gym - cuz ya know the yoga studios are always better ;) with a friend and ended up joining due to tons of free classes and well kept up pool area.  The locker room has been clean on my 1/2 dozen visits so far and I like the ladies only workout area. Other services I have not used yet are kid area and the workout machines in the main area. I got a $20 dollar membership with a low enrollment & bring a friend perk!

First off I'd like to say that the instructors that run the classes are great, they do a great job of motivating the students and its a really great work out. 

The people that run the front office are petty, do not have very good business sense and will rip you off given the opportunity. Be aware that there is a $100 initiation fee that they 'fail' to mention when you are talking to them about the program. It's $115 a month. If you decide to opt out for any period of time, you must call/email the front office to let them know or they WILL continue to bill you.
 I was charged for 4 months after I opted out and noticed the charges on my credit card statement. It is questionable whether or not, according to Platoon that I opted out correctly, but what happened to the customer is king, or the customer is always right. Apparently the person I was dealing with didn't get that memo. I tried to get a refund on the 4 months and they did not want to give it to me. After several emails back and forth, they offered me two, we settled on three. I disputed the charges with my credit card company and the individual in the front office was 'disappointed' (boo-hoo) that I disputed the charges so he billed me again to make a point. REALLY? I'd stay away from these guys unless you over communicate or pay with a check, they seem like real shysters.

I cannot say enough good things about this place! It has changed my life completely!!! My trainer, Elizabeth M. is the absolute best!! I feel so incredibly lucky to have her as my trainer. It's rare to meet someone as perfect at their job as Elizabeth. 

I've been unable to workout consistently for several years due to workout related injuries and had almost given up on being able to exercise again. My studies also keep me super busy and I never thought I had the time to workout. This all changed when I met Elizabeth...within minutes she was able to assess my physical abilities and develop a regimen of exercises that get my heart rate up while strengthening my body. It's been about a month and I already feel stronger, happier, and more agile. I have more energy and am able to study way more effectively. And she's such a blast to work with that the time FLYS by.

I cannot express how wonderful it is to have peace of mind that I will not be injured during workouts. I feel so safe with Elizabeth - she knows my limits, but she also knows how to push me way beyond what I thought I could do, and the results speak for themselves. Her dedication to you as a client extends well beyond the gym. She's  available via text for questions about diet/overall health and she is SUCH a knowledgeable resource. 

The gym itself is fantastic as well. No frills, just great equipment and a huge variety of free-weights, machines, bands, etc. They keep it VERY clean, which I really appreciate. 

If you've ever considered getting a personal trainer, or are like me and always say that you'll get to working out when things settle down in your life and you have more time (which never actually happens)....try Philly Personal Training out. BEST DECISION EVER!!!!

I joined this club in the fall of 2017, and I will say that there is a really good choice of equipment and it's never over crowded........however, the men's locker room is a disgusting filthy cesspool and this club should be embarrassed that they keep it that way. The floors are caked with grime. It's not just the grout color folks, the actual tiles are so dirty that your feet stick to them.  There are big clumps of dust, hair, etc floating in the corners along with used bandages inside the lockers.  The locker interiors are never cleaned (shoe dirt, hair, clothes tags, etc.).  Paper towel holders are frequently empty, toilet paper holders in the stalls are also frequently empty but they at least place a couple of rolls on top of the dispenser, like a gas station. The shower room has the worst smell I have ever smelled. A combination of rancid bleach and mildew. Again they simply don't clean. I see the same empty water bottles in the showers day after day. There are some towel hooks that have been missing for months.  I get it, stuff happens, but maintain the place. Lastly, the HVAC system is not strong enough to keep the dressing area cool enough. It's very warm in there. No fans to circulate the air. 

This gym is way too new to have these kind of problems.  Get all of your shots before going into the locker room.

I love the classes the class instructors and the gym it's self is really nice twenty dollars and I can go to all the classes I want And it has good day care I really wish I had started here a year ago.  But the down side is the employees every one there with the exception of the ladies in they day care and class instructors really acts like a car sales man always  trying to get you to buy things you don't want. My son loves going to the day care and I love the classes so it works for us.

NIFS is $53 a month, but its a really nice place.  I'm a member here and I love how I can ride my bike here from downtown.  I don't like it quite as much as LifeTime, but its still pretty damn nice.  Its very close to my house, as opposed to LT which is 30 minutes away.  It has the old Market Sq Arena floor, complete with Pacers logo, so its a lot of fun to play on that.  The staff is very friendly, the place is extremely clean, equipment is relatively modern (I'd rank it a 8 out of 10, they have everything but a few items are a little dated) and they have towel service, something that LA Fitness didn't have and drove me nuts.  They give you a free parking pass, everyone is knowledgeable.   A lot of hardcore athletes (as opposed to juice heads) workout here so you can usually pick up some challenging exercises if you just people watch.  They have plenty of classes, pretty much something for everyone.   They have 6 running lanes too.  I usually use lane 5, 7 laps around is a mile if that tells you how big the track is.  Overall, I really like the place and would definitely recommend it.

Great box. Loved the overall attitude. Coaches are awesome and very informative about correct form. Always giving feedback on how to improve. The box is well equipped. Will always be back when I'm in town again.

When here last time night with the family, I have a 5 + 7 year old, and we had a BLAST!
Zarin, gave us our tour and we set to climbing. Such a fun activity for everyone, my kids are monkeys. I'll be back soon.

I'm more or less a casual novice exerciser, so I greatly appreciate this small, yet clean, efficient gym. As a night shift RN, timing and convenience is very important to me, and this place fits my lifestyle. I love the variety of exercise machines here from the treadmills to the elliptical, to the ab cruncher and weight training machines. The clientele I see here vary, from casual (like me) to who appear expert. I also love the clean bathrooms and small cubbies to put my things. Definitely feel at home here!

If you decide to join the gym make sure you either speak with a manager or the owners. The employees don't know what their talking about, they don't know what their doing and they never follow through with what they say. The employees are not very helpful and are always either talking with a friend or on their phones.

I've gone to Tufas on 3 occasions when I've been visiting friends in Philly. It's a fantastic bouldering gym with great routes and a beautiful atmosphere. The grade scale is a little unusual, but as long as you don't get bogged down obsessing about the grades, it's a great time!

Verity is a solid, small gym. It has most, if not all, of the essential gym equipment that you need. But the lack of space and multiple sets of dumbbells, benches, squat racks, etc. prevent it from getting the five star reviews. 

The pros of this gym are many. The monthly rate is cheap! And you don't have to be part of a long-term plan. You can just pay month-to-month. There are different membership rates, ranging from ~$15 to ~$30 per month. The cheaper rate restricts your hours, while the higher rates provide you with 24 hour access, guest privileges, and access to the classes. Another pro of this place is the owners / employees. They're all friendly and willing to help. The gym is also extremely clean. From all of the equipment to the locker rooms and workout studio, this place is cleaner than some restaurants in town! The weights are also all rubberized. Some gyms, especially commercial gyms, do not have rubberized weights, so dropping them on the floor causes a lot of noise. Since they are rubberized here, it doesn't cause as much noise and it doesn't feel like you're bothering the other gym patrons. Finally, the keycard is a nice touch and is a reason why they can be open 24 hours a day. 

Although there are many pros, there are also a few cons. The biggest con being this gym is small. The workout studio is fairly small and can only fit a handful of people at a time. There is only one squat rack, one bench for bench pressing, and only one set of dumbbells (that go up to 100lbs?). If you're a serious body builder, this place could work for you, but you might have to wait for weights to free up if the gym is busy. If you're a serious Olympic weightlifter / power lifter / crossfitter, I don't recommend this place. Although the weights are rubberized, there is just no room to "dump" your weights if you happen to fail or succeed in a lift. There are also some equipment and cable attachments that are not available in this gym. But they do listen to patrons, and they are adding more/different pieces of equipment!

They do have cardio equipment (treadmills, ellipticals, stair masters, etc.). I just haven't used them, so I can't give you a fair review. They're clean and brand new though! Same goes for the classes that they offer. I haven't been to any of them, so I can't give you an honest review of them as well. 

Overall, this is a really nice, small gym. This gym is perfect for beginner and intermediate lifters and people who just want a clean, friendly space to workout in. I definitely recommend it if you're on a budget. I will definitely be back.

The best spinning studio in phila for a number of reasons. It's like flywheel without the pretense. Don't get me wrong I love a good flywheel class but body cycle is like it's less culty little sister - and there are no arm workouts which let's be honest makes sense (if you're going to work out arms do it separately not during cardio! though it is a welcome break from interval sprints). Body cycle shares a studio with yoga and barre classes which is nice but it's got its own little area in the back and doesn't feel too crowded. Classes are at convenient times for the most part but there aren't any early afternoon which has been frustrating occasionally. The teachers are phenomenal and I never get bored during class - Robbie is one of my favorites. A notable difference from flywheel is no shoes provided so you either bring your own cycling shoes or wear sneakers and use their shoe cages (which I have found to be almost as good as clipping in though serious cyclers would probably disagree). It's a great workout and you'll leave sweaty but happy.

Cannot get enough. I started working out here because I hated not pushing myself enough at the gym. I wanted someone to help tone my body but have fun with it. Went to a class with a friend as a free trial and signed up as soon as the work out was over. Every day is different and pushes you in a different way. Billy is amazing with always changing it up and challenging you. Lindsey doesn't let you quit and helps my "girlie" areas. With Andrew you know you will get a good work out - and I find him to have good funny commentary.... not to mention he loves hooks! Today I got to work out with Ronez..... just a perfectly amazing class. He changed it up and had a lot of fun and encouragement throughout the class. If you are looking for a change you need to try Title Boxing Club at the Glendale location. The trainers are amazing and I am amped to go every chance I can (no matter how cozy my bed is!) I'm hoping to try some night classes in the near future to see what those trainers have to offer!

Was in yesterday 5 pieces of equipment had out of order signs. Went to use the leg press and it was broken. When I reported it to staff I was told.." yeah we know about it, but we are out of out of order signs."  The cardio theater is a wreck and hasn't worked right in a year and a half. The place is always a bit over crowded. The front desk staff is usually very nice. I have never been in that I wasn't at least greeted with a smile or told "good bye" when I left.  I've only encountered a few of the personal trainers... They don't seem friendly at all and one of them is actually kind of a jerk. If you like a good front desk staff... And that's all that matters for you it's a nice place. But if you actually want to work out I would not suggest it.


Update: went back today and some of the machines were being repaired. For the second time I tried the audio app that is supposed to work with the cardio theater. It completely earns the 1.5 star review. The sound quality is bad and the TVs do not align with the app.  After the review. I was contacted by the front desk manager... like I said before. Top notch front desk staff.

Awesome facility with attached gym and ample parking. Great bouldering area with differentiated levels as well as belay walls, automatic and with partner. They also have a "pit" with taller walls for advanced climbers :) will definitely be making my way back! They also have a smaller facility in Tampa.
Less expensive places abound in the area. Too busy and not a pleasant experience at all. Some of the staff is really great.

Read your membership contract very, very carefully. And I suggest using a prepaid debit card if you are going to allow them to deduct any fees from a bank account. Someday you may want to cancel your membership....Enough said.

This review is for trying to use the gym as a guest for the day. I used to be a member here for several years, and since I was back in town I figured I'd stop by for the day for a 1-day visit. However, when I went to pay I was told the Day Pass price is $50?? As in 5-0, aka more than the cost of most monthly gym memberships for one day of working out. I thought that was a laughably high price, but the membership office confirmed it. 

Truly a terrible business model, since I have no problem spending $100+ on a monthly membership at a nice gym but you'd have to be nuts to drop $50 to go work out for a day. For comparison, Equinox in NYC charged $25 for a one day visit, so yeah.
this gym is packed all the time. the machines & weights are packed in here. my only complaint is the music they have on is usually turned up a little loud for me.

Does your gym send you a birthday card from all the coaches? Do you get a text from the owner wishing you a happy birthday too? Is there a Facebook page for members of the gym to stay in touch, stay accountable, socialize, and also wish you a happy birthday?!

No??

You need a new gym. GeauxFit is that gym!

I completed their 6 week challenge, dropped 14 lbs, lost about 10% body fat and gained 4% muscle mass! I developed strength, confidence, and endurance to survive tough workouts, as well as mental fortitude. The coaches are kind, motivational, and push you to be your best self for YOURSELF and no one else! I can't rave enough about how great this place is and how they actually take a personal interest in you and helping you reach your goals!!!

I want to update my rating. My last experience was awesome. I went to see Danielle Z. for a facial. It was my first professional one. Danielle was great. She step-by-stepped things as she did them educating me about the process. It was really relaxing and just felt nice. I liked the aromatherapy during it as well. It was worth the price and I will be back. She is a great esthetician and knows her stuff. 

Also the receptionist I commented about in my last review, was not there. I had a girl in training named Alex and her helper Christiana. They were great. They took their time to get exactly what I needed scheduled. 

I will be back and hopefully I will be able to give them a 5 star rating. Good receptionists are crucial to a smooth running salon. I hope they know that and are working on it.

I have drank the Solidcore Kool-Aid. I went with the mindset that I would try the first class because I got a deal...half way through my first session, I decided to buy a class pack and I've gone once a week ever since.  I wish I could go more, but it is expensive (the only drawback).  If you got, check out Patrice's class...so hard in a good way!  I have not had one bad instructor, though. Love it!

I really like the Center of Clayton for it's versatility. They have great courts for basketball and volleyball. Their pool is fantastic with 8 lanes in the main area and 2 more lanes in the recreational area, plus a fairly good-sized hot tub.  They also have a fairly good amount of aerobic work out equipment such as treadmills, bikes and others of the sort. Their weight room is really great and has a number of free weights and machines to really throw around some iron.

Here's what I wish they would change.  There is no "cross-fit" type of area to do the very effective and very popular type of training. Body weight stuff is the way to go. Try throwing around your own weight to see how quickly you get into shape. Of course, you can do this on your own, but it's difficult because it requires a fairly significant amount of 'free" space. 

Another thing I don't care for is the additional cost of each and every class. If I want to do a spin class or a kettle bell class the cost is an additional $8-$15 PER CLASS. That doesn't make any sense at all. For this reason alone, I drop it to 3 stars. I used to belong to St. Louis Fitness Club when I lived in the Dogtown area. For $35 per month, for myself and my fiancee, got a great gym, great weights and classes. Tanning was even included if you cared.

I am not a resident of Clayton. Of course, I live as close as a person can without being in their city limits, so I pay $55 per month and then up to $87 for a family pass. Now, don't get me wrong, the whole reason I left St. Louis Fitness Club was to find a great pool where I could swim laps. Yes, I found it, but that's pretty much all I'm getting with regards to working out. As I said, all other classes are at an extra cost. 

I did check out Wellbridge, but at $90+ a month their lap pool just wasn't going to cut it. 

I guess it's what you're looking to do that matters. I suppose for an extra $35 per month I could go back to STL Fitness, but they are not close to each other and that can be a pain when it's tough enough to get out and put in a workout.
Outstanding facility, great trainers and the place is always very clean. The only negative is the awful sewer smell in the men's shower.

Kind of small and equipment is not maintained real well but it's tough to beat for the price. Just be careful of extra charges and additional charges after you cancel your membership. Plan on paying more

I have to agree with everyone else's positive reviews. It took me awhile to get to this place because I have never done a martial art. I didn't know what to wear or if the instructor was going to be like that nut job in the karate kid movies. I showed up. Justin came over and introduced himself. there were 3 other new guys there. Started with skipping rope, pushups, situps. then stretching which I didn't even know which stretches you use for this activity. then he went over the basic punches, kicks. then we worked the bag and shadow boxes. Totally worth it. I just have to bring myself to commit but he was awesome and so was the place. would definitely recommend to anyone.

This review is way over due. I am a former member. 

The facility, (for the most part) was clean, space enough between machines and decent locker rooms. 

My beef is with the management. They are sales people, period.  Once one has signed the contract, management does not care. If one has a concern,
management buries it. Also, the music was way too loud. What's the purpose of having music since most people have their own IPods and etc?  Some people, such as myself, rather have it somewhat quiet. Blasting music disrupts the workout. 

I've been a member of gyms, most of my life. Some were independent and some were other chains like this one and Gold's. Everyone had their own vibe; but, this one had an atmosphere that did not sit well with me.
Just finished MY first class. Yes I am now a white belt....and my two purple belts find it hilarious.

This is a nice gym that is reasonably priced. I love that it is 24 hours and even at 3 AM there has always been someone else there. Around midnight, 20 or so people are, on the mean, there working out. I gave it four stars instead of five because their water fountain in the front has insufficient water pressure. Also, they don't have enough of the flat pull down bars for the huge 16 person machine. It's the machine that you see when you walk in. If you want to work on your triceps or biceps on that machine, there is only one or two short and straight bars that you can use on the machine's 8 different locations that don't have a chair or a bench

I've been going to this gym for two months.  People are pleasant, it is well equipped.  But, can be maintained better.   Tiles falling off the walls in the locker room, toilet areas not cleaned often enough.  Mold in the shower.  Management should manage and make sure that the whole experience, including the locker room is good.

After talking to the GM, who responded immediately, I was assured that my concerns would be immediately addressed.  Great responsiveness by Jessica.

Kind of a dodgy 24 hour fitness if you ask me. Sure, they have the weights and cardio equipment that I need, but the precor trainers are often in poor repair--jerking all over the place--and the treadmills are often in poor repair. If something breaks, its broken for ages and half the time its poorly repaired when it does come back. Not good. And I'm not sure who thought the huge glass windows were a good idea. If you go there when the sun is coming up like I often do you're likely to be blinded while using some of the weight machines. Not good. 

As several folks have pointed out, the locker rooms are pretty vile. I avoid them at all costs. Still, its open 24 hours and its close to home, so given the limited fitness options on the northwest side of town, I keep going.

Great price, which is why a lot of people probably choose retro, however, this one is really small and especially tight in the weight area. I often find myself waiting for equipment, if you squat you'll always have problems getting in the (1) rack available for squats. Bro, please don't curl in that rack. Ugh.

Recently they have banned dead lifts. It's turning into a Planet Fitness, which is cheaper and probably a better choice if you don't need the squats or dead lifts.

Cardio area seems to be OK in terms of amount of equipment, though some is in pretty bad shape. Plastic pieces missing, dirty, etc.

Men's bathroom is in pretty sad shape. The sink area looks terrible.

I most likely will join elsewhere when my contract is up, but the location is great, so that's a bummer.

A smaller gym, nothing like YMCA or the chain gyms. This place focuses on circuit training with weights, medicine balls, and helps with endurance. 

Everybody that belongs here is very down to earth, supportive and encouraging. Devin, who is the trainer gets to know every member and is involved in motivating everyone to get going!

There is even an app to sign up for classes, which is great. Its never more than 10-12 people in class so you dont feel overwhelmed.

DO NOT JOIN THIS GYM EVER! HATE THIS PLACE. Overpriced, crappy smelly equipment, dirty facility, poor staff. Bathrooms are disgusting, don't even think about showering here. This place is always empty and has very dim lighting so it's super depressing to workout here. Got tricked into a year contract... they permanently closed down the 2 gym locations (Depford & Berlin) that were closet to me, now I have to drive 35 mins and they STILL won't let me cancel. The owner doesn't care about anything or anyone, He just wants your money. This is the worst gym in my entire life. I rather workout in a crappy motel gym. CANNOT WAIT UNTIL MY CONTRACT IS OVER. HATE HATE HATE THIS PLACE

I LOVE the spinning classes here! I got a package of 5 classes and probably will get more. Its a small studio on 19th and chestnut (easy to miss they just have a small sign on the door). the classes are from 45-90 minutes long. I have taken classes with Tiffany Wallace and Russell and they were both really good. Russell's class felt like you were in a night club but at 6:30am on a Monday morning. The classes are fun and the instructions really push you. Also, the choice of music is pretty good! I highly reccomend morning spinning classes there because they re not too full and you can always get a bike and get your workout over with for the day!

Also, first class for new customers is free so definitely worth a try!

I'll premise this review by saying I'm not a gym rat, nor am I remotely interested in the fitness lifestyle. The only reason I joined this gym is because 1. I'm not getting any skinnier, younger or stronger 2. It's easy to access for me 3. Affordable.

The complex is clean, amply lit and organized. There are plenty of machines to use and I've felt that there were more than enough units to accompany the number of guests even when it's busy. There's a "ladies only" workout area which I think I'll check out more this week as the main floor CAN be intimidating, but that's mostly because I'm new and don't know what I'm doing. 

The reason for such meager stars falls mostly on the staff. After joining, they ask that you schedule a physical fitness evaluation to see where you are, what your goals are and how to get there. Unfortunately for me, they left out the "how to get the results you're looking for" part. They essentially used that half hour of time to push their physical trainer program which is not included in the $15/month basic membership plan. At one point the trainer Kyle, said "95% of the people here don't know what they're doing here." I thought, oh great, that means you're going to help me not be one of those people. Wrong. I left after my workout session feeling discouraged and without guidance. Instead, I now have to do homework on my own since the only way the trainers are going to walk me through some basic workouts is with more of my hard earned money. 

I would suggest to FRS to add the following question to their physical exam questionnaire; "Have you ever been to a gym/when was the last time you spent time in a gym" to get a better assessment of their members rather than assume just because we don't know what we are doing, we are willing to spend above and beyond our membership plan to achieve our goals.

My son, small for his age of 6, developed an awful habit of dealing with frustration by hitting.  So, naturally, I enrolled him in a class that would make his strikes more deadly! 

Well, no.  Actually, I discovered that other parents found help for their similarly-disposed children via the martial arts.  Many said that the emphasis on discipline and focus was the reason.  Others said it was their child's increased confidence.   Whichever reason, they were saying it worked, so I was intrigued.  But I was also cautious.  I didn't want this to become another "you damn well are going to practice" struggle, ending with an unused violin in the closet.  Or whatever the karate equivalent to that would be.  

I discovered the website for Church's Karate Academy, and the price and length of the trial package was fantastic.  Low output of cash, two months, uniform included.  After that, you enroll at the regular monthly rate, or you walk away.  No strings.  Not bad!  I went to the studio with the intention of enrolling my son.  So glad I did!!  

If you go to the website expecting to find information about the studio, please don't be put off.  The website is flashy, but it's also a bit generic, offering reasons why studying the martial arts is a good choice but no sense of Master Church or his studio.   Frankly, the website feels like more of a sales pitch than much else, but that is not how Master Church himself is.  

The studio works like this.  Karate students are placed in a class group based on their age and expertise.  Master Church holds classes for each of those groups five or six days per week at regularly scheduled times.  You attend two of those classes per week, and he tracks this via an attendance card.  You do not have to commit to particular classes.  For example, if you can normally attend on Mondays and Wednesdays, but something comes up one Wednesday, you can go to the Monday and Friday class for your group instead.  Or, if you split custody, perhaps it's easier for Mom to take Kid on Tues and Wed but Dad to take kid on Wed and Sat.  No problem.  No need to tell Master Church in advance.  Just show up to whichever two classes per week for your group.  So flexible.  

As for Master Church, enough cannot be said about how great of a teacher he is.   It's obvious that he genuinely cares about and believes in them.  In return, they want to do well and can't stand the thought of disappointing him.  He's that kind of teacher.  If you have ever had such a teacher yourself, you know their magic.  He is firm, though, not a push over, and he has their respect for that. I eventually even enrolled a certain violin quitter, and she loves it. 

What's more?  I honestly cannot remember the last time my son hit me, although I'm sure I'm just as frustrating as ever.

Yes, this a great gym. Everything everybody else is saying is absolutely true.

Big differentiators for me:
1) Lots of squat racks.
2) 3 deadlift platforms.
3) My pre-teen son can be a paying member, with full gym privileges. Where else are you going to be able to do that?

Gym is overcrowded. Equipment is nice, but always full and often circled around by people talking instead of actually working out. What do you expect for $9.95 per month? Most members do not wipe equipment down when finished. I moved away from the area and needed to cancel. Even though the contract states to give written notice 10 days prior to the next billing cycle, Crunch Fitness Hillsborough will only accept this notice in person. Imagine moving out of area, and having to come back in person to cancel a $9.95 per month membership? I have been emailing at length with the manager, and he/she still refuses to cancel my membership. I have been a member since the gym opened, I actually transferred from another Crunch when I moved closer to this location shortly before it opened. I typically move every year or two for work, and I have never had more difficulties cancelling any gym membership, cable/internet agreement, electrical, water, other utilities, etc than the Crunch Fitness on Hillsborough.

Not bad, most retro fitnesses aren't as clean as a high end gym. You get what you pay it. It is certainly not an expensive gym membership so I do not know what people are expecting when they sign up for 20 bucks a month.

This reviews the BJJ discipline at this place. This place is the cleanest Brazilian Jiu Jitsu academy in the world! When you walk in the front door you will see exactly what I am talking about. The mat space is also one of the biggest I have ever seen at a BJJ gym. Franjinha and Sean's teaching styles compliment each other so that students get the best of both worlds. What I really like about their styles is that you can train as a hobbyist or you can also train like BJJ is your life. They also have a great kids program. The kids instructors understand what kids need and want. From the moment you walk in this place you will be welcomed here like it is your own. Franjinha (the founder) has always been a true leader and has perpetuated this philosophy to his students. In every class there are extremely talented BJJ players to train with. If you come on the right day, you may get to roll with world renowned athletes like Jeff Glover or Bill Cooper. These guys will leave you wondering what just happened. Keep an eye out for this school, they have been opening up locations in California, Texas, and Sweden and continue to be on the podium stands at the high level international/national tournaments. Go check it out and see for yourself.

I sent them an email per their response and we will see if anyone responds to them waving the fee after misconstruing the like card being free when I never wanted it

Been 36 hours since I sent the email and no response back. Continuing to show poor customer service
Just visiting on a work trip, but this gym was beautiful! Everything was very clean and easy to get around - as well as smaller rooms available with tons of equipment!

Just joined the new Edge Fitness on Bustleton and County Line.  It's brand new so it's super clean, shiny and huge!  
I worked with Alexis -she was great.  Got me set up and in the system and ready to work out with no "used car salesman" pitch.  She is very knowledgeable and knows her stuff - gave me a good deal that meets my needs.
I love the "Edge Theater" which has workout equipment in a movie theater so you can watch a film while you sweat.  
The locker rooms are clean and very nice.
I would recommend Edge for anyone looking for a nice, new gym in the 19006!

I've been a member of Saint Mary's for about six months now, and overall I'm a big fan of its amenities!

Pros:
-Clean and spacious 
-Friendly, helpful staff
-Convenient location and parking
-A lot of variety when it comes to equipment and classes
-The locker room has a steam room, whirlpool, AND a dry sauna (I love how glamorous such amenities make me feel at the end of a long day)
-Their on-site massages are wonderful (Jamie is particularly great!)
-The patrons are generally very respectful

Cons:
-The price is just barely on the reasonable side for me, and even then, I've sometimes debated with myself whether it's worth the cost. Without discounts, the month-to-month price is around $75
-Some of the equipment is getting rather long in the tooth, a problem that I find compounded by the cost of membership
-I'd personally prefer more squat racks (the only one they have now is difficult to adjust)

While Reno's high-quality gym offerings are pretty slim, Saint Mary's is a solid option with a lot to offer. I'd recommend that potential patrons take advantage of membership discounts if they can.

I've been a member of the gym for several years now, and am happy with it, but paying almost $100/mo, I just can't help but expect a bit more in comfort.  The locker rooms could use a redo, although I'm guessing that the economic climate has caused the Sporting Club to cut back a bit on some perks.

Positives: Pool, basketball court, great varied set of classes, huge fitness floor.  Hannah runs a great spin class, but only once a week.

If the Sporting Club wasn't so close to my house I might be looking for a better bang for my buck, but it's still a good place to work out.

You've commented on here, ONLY. I have had NO management contact me, nor have I had any response to the email YOU requested I send. This will absolutely be my last month with PF. Deplorable conditions, utter lack of customer service, and possible lies about contacting paying customers about valid, proven concerns? This has been ongoing for MONTHS. GYM-GOER BEWARE!

i've trained casually at various MMA gyms in the LA area and decided to try out Paragon at the recommendation of a friend. although I had "trained" before, going to a new gym is always nerve-wracking when you are not yet familiar with the setup... where do i put my bag? should I be wearing muay-thai shorts? is anyone wearing a mouth guard? how in shape am i REALLY? will i or will i not be the worst one in the class? suffice it to say, my anxiety was misplaced. the atmosphere at Paragon is so friendly and unpretentious (refreshing, after exposure to some more uppity LA gyms). i took a saturday am all-levels kickboxing class with Tyson, who leads a damn good workout and helps you with technique. it was a perfect mix of cardio and sparring combinations. needless to say i was the-good-kind-of-sore come sunday. 

gym quality is top notch. they had apparently just put in new mats which looked and felt great. the gym is huge so there was plenty of room for solid training, and everything was super clean. 

special hats off to the owner, Sean. he was really welcoming when I first awkwardly stumbled in. you can seriously tell how engaged he is with the gym and its members. he seemed to know everyone by name, regardless of whether they're gunning for their black belt, or just looking for a good weekend workout.

Me and my significant other just joined and right off the bat we loved the atmosphere.  I was happy to see a resource for babies to be cared for while parents work out but also that young adults working out as well.
