In general, I find it frustrating as a parent in many gyms that don't allow a place for teens kids to go to work on their own health and wellness. Fitness 19 is a welcoming place.  The classes are  awesome as well!!! 

We took a Zumba class!! And for 40 mins of pure fun, my man was had a blast!  So fun, so light, not bad for a total 40 min body workout!!! He'll definitely be Spinning and dipping me by the summers end! 
The staff are super helpful and pleasant as well---I will definitely recommend this gym to my friends and family.

This gym has everything you could want but it just feels like something is missing. It might just be too pricey for my taste, but if you can afford a place like this then it may be for you. Just feels like money goes into the wrong things when a lot of equipment could be improved. The pool is a nice amenity as is the sauna/steam room. The classes leave much to be desired.

I'm gonna miss this place.

I've been a member here for about a year and there were plenty of classes to keep me busy and lots of equipment so that I didn't have to wait to do the exercises that I wanted to do.  I'm sad that I'm leaving it because I've recently moved.  It is really nice and yes it is expensive but you got a lot with that membership.

They recently completed a complete overhaul to the men's showers which is cool.  It's not that they were bad before but I can see how they needed the upgrade.

I did spinning classes, boxing, circuit classes, pilates, swimming and general weight training.  I even tried yoga a couple of times which was awesome because it was in a private yoga studio, not a room with the lights dim.  The yoga studio was tranquil and even though I ended up hurting myself, I still enjoyed it.  I just don't think I'm the yoga type.

The website went a bit wonky from time to time when I tried to look at class schedules.  That's a minor complaint in my book.  I was able to take advantage of a special offer when I joined so I beat the initiation fee which is outrageous by the way.  Still, they offer specials and will let you train for a few days to see what you think of it.

I really liked working out here and I hope that a gym near my new place will be even half as good as the bellevue.  If it's convenient and you want to pay for it, you will enjoy it.
Absolutely love it here. I take the Wednesday Zumba Toning class with Tricia and everyone is so friendly, from the other clients to the staff. I have had nothing but positive experiences!
Just transferred my membership to this planet fitness.   Looks like it's comparable to my old PF

This is an awesome workout. I am out of shape so don't think this is a fitness guru's review! I've only had one since they opened but it is great. I like a workout class and some structure but I can commit to a class time. So when I heard about round9 - 30 minutes, full body workout, 9 different stations 3 minutes each - I had to try it. 

To start, you get hand wraps and gloves, a quick how to wrap and you are off. First to stations are strength training...squats with medicine balls, push-ups, etc...then to good stuff....the next 6 stations you jab, cross, kick and speed bag you way thru an intense workout that leave you wondering how long 3 minutes really is. Punching and kicking while trying to stay coordinated is great and it goes by super quick. The staff was super motivational. When Josh, the owner,  saw I was really struggling around round 6, he mixed it up a bit to keep me going (and it worked)! I will admot though - when the buzzer rang at the end of my ninth round I was stoked I was done! That was awesome.

If you want a full body workout, no class time, and like to sweat, this is for you! I made it thru the 9 rounds and I'm ready for my next workout  (once I nap recovering from this one!)

A manager named Von contacted me today to address my issues and told me to come in and talk to him tomorrow when I was in town.
I appreciate him taking the time to contact me and try to make things right.
Thank you!

I train BJJ in Chicago, IL,  was in town visiting family in SB and wanted to continue my training while on vacation. The staff at Paragon was very friendly, welcoming, and informative. I really enjoyed the clean facility and the training. I would highly recommend this location!

So glad I was introduced to CycleBar through Yelp. Such a fun class! This place is like the Ritz of spin places. Their amenities are fantastic! One thing that is different about this place than other spin classes I have attended is the fact that they provide spin shoes for you to wear. This took a bit of time to get used too but after the first time it was great! The instructor for the Yelp class was fantastic and kept us laughing the whole time. The music he picked was fantastic and I actually enjoyed that you could see your ranking in the class. Puts a little fire under your ass. Like most spin classes this is not a cheap form of exercise. They have an intro package of 3 classes for $29 which I picked up that day. I was lucky enough to notice that on St. Patty's day they had a 4 pack of classes for $40. As long as I can find classes around this price range I will be back for more!

Before the remodel this was the best rock climbing gym in the state and according to my brother who's travelled a lot the best in the country. However after the remodel it's even better. Lot more routes including lead routes, good diversity of climbs and hold styles, and awesome new bouldering area that is almost as good as their bouldering specific gym the Bloc. My only complaint is the routes feel spaced a little closer together then before but it's only noticeable when it's super crowded where you end up actually having people climbing on top of you. 

They raised the price which is steep compared to before but it's kind of the standard now for gyms. If you want to save money come on discount Monday nights it's actually really fair especially if you already have gear but just be mindful though it will probably be crowded.

I've only been going for 2 months, but my wife has been going for over a year. She loves it and I finally decided to try it out (after not having worked out for nearly 10 years--no joke). There are great trainers who are so impressive in their athletic abilities that it's easy to be in awe of them--but they are so personable and down to earth that they really make you feel like they want to help you on your fitness journey.

I like the format of the varied classes. You know you're in for a hard workout no matter what you choose. There's good music and before you know it, the hour is done and you've undoubtedly burned a ton of calories, cleansed your body of toxins, and sweated through all over.

I've taken boot camp, spin classes, hiit, tone, strength, tabata, and their afterburn classes. My goal was to be going 2-3 times a week, but I've found myself going 5-6 times because the classes are so addictive, easy to schedule, and fun. 

I definitely recommend it.

Plus side:  A lot of people go here because it's inexpensive.  You can negotiate a monthly price that works for you.  There are classes, but you have to pay more.  Not a huge variety, but something may be at the right time that may work for you.  There are lockers to lock your items up and there's child care.  Nice employees, but there is turnover which is typical.
Negative:  It's not kept very clean which is gross at times.  It's very dusty, especially the walls, exposed pipes/fans on the ceiling.  Mainly the bikes are not working at their best and need maintenance.  There's paper towels and spray that your supposed to clean your machines with, but it would be nice if they went back to towels or employees could step up the cleaning.  Billing as stated in previous reviews can be a problem, but just try to give notice.
best gym in reno, no more words necessary

I think the facility is great, never had an issue with the staff, and the price is good. The people who go there seem terrible and it is always crowded. The only reason I keep the membership is because they have a pool. Otherwise I would have cancelled. I probably would pay 30 more a month for the gym for the facility and if it weeded out some of the people.

TO SUM IT UP: DO NOT JOIN - AWEFUL, HORRIBLE STAFF, Classes change all the time without notice, Calendar is never updated correctly,  ALWAYS uncomfortably hot, basically they lie and scam you to sign up and don't hold the end of their bargain.  

I have been going to the King of Prussia Sweat Fitness for about 3 months now and every time I think it will get better it just gets worse and worse.  At first I thought it was just me and I was expecting too much but as time went on and I spoke with other members, I realized they all felt the same way but they were STUCK with their memberships for a year.  I will start by saying that customer service is horrible at this gym.  The 2 ladies in the front are rude and don't even bother going to them with an issue because they don't have the slightest clue as to how to go about dealing with it.  I don't want to write too much so here are all my issues in a nutshell: 

1.) The Gym is SO HOT that it's very uncomfortable to work out, you start sweating just standing there and they don't allow you to open the doors. 

2.) I do spinning every week and in the past 3 months, I already have seen 3 bikes break, 2 bikes wobble so you have to put a magazine underneath to be able to balance and not fall in the middle of the class.  

3.) They change the schedule of the classes and DO NOT update the calendars, so basically you leave work to go to a class and it was a waste of your time because Denise up front filled out the calendar incorrectly and when you show concern she could care less.

4.) I wanted to use the jump rope yesterday and there were only TWO for the entire gym.  A guy was using one and the other one was BROKEN.  The answer front desk gave me was " I don't know where they are, we had 3 this morning." 

5.) If you have concerns, you have to talk to the girl who washes the towels and is on the phone all day.  Basically you're screwed if you have any issues and you're stuck for a year.  

6.) I've had a friend try a free trial and when he called to cancel after the 21 days, they ended up signing him for a full year and charged his card.  

If they expect us to pay our monthly memberships in full and on time, I expect the same treatment back.  I expect everything that I was promised when they were trying to convince me to sign up.

Best part is, when you tell them your issues, they show no concern or a solution and make sure they tell you if you try to cancel they will continue charging your credit card and will send you to collections.  If you want to be associated with a company that threatens you that they're going to report you to collections instead of trying to work with you to resolve your concerns, then join at your own risk.
Great gym. Super quiet. In 9 months there, I only had to wait for equipment once (including frequent "peak" hours). No pressure to buy personal training packages or anything.

What can i say about this place, has a La fitness sign yet looks like a neighborhood corner gym, too small, no pool, no courts, cycle room tiny, free weights room even tinier, theres always too many people in here, best time around 2pm, half of treadmills broken, water fountains broken too, i dont know why la fitness still on this place they really need a major overhaul.

The Sporting Club at the Bellevue was easily the best gym that I visited in center city while I was deciding where to get my gym membership. The location is a bit quirky, on the 8th floor of a parking structure, but the gym itself is very spacious. 

The membeship staff were very helpful in getting me set up, the shoe-shiner across from the membership office is very nice and good at his job, the gym includes an indoor pool and basketball courts and ellipticals for days... the list goes on!

There are 4 floors for exercising- the first floor is the locker rooms, showers, pool, and cafe/restaurant. The second floor has the boxing ring, squash courts, a basketball court, and aerobics rooms. The third floor is the main fitness gym, with a lot of workout machines, ellipticals, treadmills, rowing machines, and free weights. The top floor is a baby version of a track, where 12 laps around the area equates to 1 mile.

The people here are generally friendly (except when the basketball games get super competitive). I don't feel like I'm being judged while I work out, which is a big plus, and signing up gets you a few discounts and perks for personal trainers, which is nice.

Lastly, the locker room is pretty nice as well. There are hundreds of lockers, and you can pretty much find every essential item that a locker room needs. 

I've been really happy with my decision to join the Sporting Club at the Bellevue, and I'd encourage anybody looking for a gym in center city to strongly consider this gym. The higher price is justified in my opinion, and they often do deals where you get 1 month free when you sign up as well!

Excellent place. I was sort of intimidated by climbing for the first time, but the intro session was very helpful and staff were very friendly. Very fun, great space, and lots of options for all levels (as far as I can tell!).
Obsessed with southRAC! Great community, classes and staff! You must come try this place, you'll feel motivated and have a team there to cheer you on.

I've been a member at SRAC for 3 years. I love this place. It might not be right for everyone, but I'll note down what keeps me a regular and extremely happy member:

-You can virtually always get on whatever equipment you wish to use, even during primetime hours. The parking lot may appear at times to be overrun, but a lot of those people are present for leagues, so don't let it scare you that the rest of the gym is overcrowded and you'll be sitting around, waiting for things to open up.

-I work out all the time during the boot camp classes. Sometimes I even work out in the same space they use downstairs. I've never had any problems. I used to be a trainer for many years and don't feel these guys overstep their bounds at all. I don't think they monopolize the track for long periods of time either.

-The customer service of the owners and staff is fantastic. In 3 years, I've never witnessed any bad behavior on their part personally. Karl and Gabe always know you by name. They talk with members and get to know them. The few complaints or problems I've had (minimal) have been met with quick and friendly response. The only staff member I felt had a problem with good service was their billing/accounting person. I talked to the GM and he took care of it within hours. Fantastic! Their front desk staff is trained to greet you, say goodbye when you leave, smile, and be friendly. Big points in my book. 

-If you are into functional training, this place is full of all the cutting edge equipment and the necessary space to use it. The indoor track rocks too. If you prefer traditional stuff, they have all that as well.

-Their operating hours seem quite reasonable to me. Gyms are not going to stay open til midnight if the traffic they receive doesn't drive it. If you need to work out after 10pm or before 5am, another gym would be a better option for you.

-Most of their long term, regular trainers seem well educated and up-to-date and good at what they do (as I have a degree in the field and worked in the business for a long time, I know how to rate what I see). I've never seen any of the men leer or sexually harass ANYONE (per another review here). I am a young and fairly fit female and have never had ANY such problems.

So I was told I had a certain number of free guest passes with my membership.  Well I just tried to use one and they wanted $15 for my guest.  Apparently the revoked all free guest passes right after I signed up.  

I can't wait to move so I can go to a different gym.  If this place wasn't right out my front door I would go somewhere else.

New owners bring true pride of ownership.  The place is small but had pretty much all you need.  If you are looking for a small, less busy, no screaming muscle monsters, check out this place.  Open 24 hrs.  Price is about $30/ month.  I will never go back to LA Fitness.  


New owner Mike is fantastic.  He just painted the inside and front of the building himself.  The place is meticulous and he is friendly and knowledgeable.  You just can't beat what you get for the money.  Plus, it's open all the time for members.   Now we that is convenient!

As a gym, I give this place 5 stars. It's impeccably clean, beautiful, modern, and gives a lux feel. The bathrooms are spacious and clean, with tons of lockers, and every kind of toiletry available for your disposal. There is a regular sauna and a eucalyptus infused sauna, as well as a hot tub in the bathroom. They have showers, sinks, dressing stations. Outside the bathrooms are a Pilates studio, a cycle studio, 2 fitness studios, a childcare center, a cafe, a business center AND a beauty salon! Creme de la creme of gyms. And the best part- it's not super crowded, even at 6pm! 

Now. Their yoga classes. The studio is gorgeous and gives a serene feel. I took the Monday even hot yoga class and expected to take class with LeSean, who I have heard great things about, but she unfortunately had a sub. I personally hated the class and could not WAIT to leave. The flow was extremely confusing, the teacher did not model any postures, and the weirdest part was that she would teach the flow once, then turn on the music FULL blast while do tried to remember how to do it yourself. And when I say full blast- I mean like night club level. It was weird and ridiculous. 1 star for that experience. I also have taken their "surrender" class and thought it would be more of a restorative practice, but it ended up being yin. The teacher Vivian had a soothing cam voice and was composed during that practice but I honestly didn't love it. This place kind of validated that gym yoga isn't legit (to me).

Philly Dance Fitness has been on my to-do list for a while because if you haven't noticed, I have commitment issues when it comes to gyms/fitness. (Life philosophy: Try ALL the things!)

Went for Zumba with Jamie Wednesday, checked out their new studio, and had a great time! The studio is on the 2nd floor of nest (entrance on 13th street, not locust like the address says). Jamie was awesome and the class was a good workout, but 50 minutes felt so short! Also, the vibe of the class was a little womp womp, not as fun/exciting as other fitness classes I've been to, maybe because it's new and people are still getting to know each other. Hopefully that'll change. Also, right now it's carpeted and looks like a little kids play gym (which it is) but if there's interest, they'll put in hardwood floors and make it more legit.

This is not a pretentious, super intense place. This class is definitely fine for people new to Zumba, but will still be a good workout for others. Having gone to Koresh a few days before, I will say that this place is more fitness than dance. The routines are simple, with more emphasis on workout than performance. As far as difficulty, I'd rank Jamie's class as slightly easier than the cardio classes I've taken at Thrive, but on par with Sweat (actually, Timaree teaches at Sweat and here and I love her!), the Sporting Club at the Bellevue, and 12th street gym (like I said, can't commit).

$10 dropin is SUPER reasonable, and their class cards are only $40 for 5 and $70 for 10 and you can go to all their locations. Definitely great for people who like to mix it up!

$5 off coupon if you sign up for their emails (so, $5 class!) Recommend checking them out! This location will only stay if there's interest.

My trainer, Kara B., was great. She kept me on track, helped me gain muscle, and worked out adaptations to accommodate my past injuries. Very knowledgeable and motivating. I highly recommend her and the other trainers at Platoon.
The facility was always clean and the manager was easy to get a hold of. Great location for people working around Old City/Center City.

Saint Mary's Fitness Center is interestingly located!

So this gym is connect to Saint Mary Hospital. But you can get a membership here even if you do have any association with the hospital via your a client, work at the hospital, or in patient. You can get a membership here. 

Let's talk you through the staff. Staff is great and very accommodating. The entrance by the way is on the first floor. The people are friendly and everyone is pretty happy with the status of the facility. The facility is well kept and the cleaning staff seems to be making rounds during the rush hours. Which is a good sign that this facility is pretty clean and it is. I have mainly used the lap pool and it's pretty clean. So, I am happy with the facility and its staff. They are good at what they do. 

Now for the parking. That can get pretty crazy because they share the parking with Saint Mary Hospital. Which during the regular work day it gets busy and it can be a bit tough to find parking but not impossible. Just keep that in mind when you are looking for parking here. With that said I came here during 4pm-5pm to find parking and I found parking on the second floor just find. 

This place isn't for people on a budget. It is on the higher price range. But for what you get it is pretty good. I will explain this. So they have 3 floors. The first floor has a lap pool, lockers, staff/checkin area and importantly a baby sitting area. For those of you with kids. This is a great day care that is conveniently located in the gym (1st floor). They have a great staff there and they do a great job watching your kids. I would recommend them if your looking to get back into shape and need a baby sitter. No more excuses they have a day care here. So, I stated earlier about the price this day care is worth the extra money in my opinion. I have talked with the day care staff and they are very nice. So some of the rules are 2 hours max for infants and 3 hours max for toddlers. Also if they need you back for anything they have a beeper they give you in case your child really needs you. Also, they don't do diapers changes they will call you back for that. But this place is pretty awesome. I would recommend them. Thank you for reading my review.

I love this place. When I had an apartment in the City, I went there every day I could. The people are friendly and the services are awesome. They even have a shoe shiner for all you business men on the go.

It is several stories high and has a workout oasis inside. The basketball court is huge - a full court. They have every type of exercise class, a pool, racquetball court - everything you can think of. 

It is a top-notch place! If you can afford it - then you just have to try it! at least check it out. You won't be disappointed.

If the local soap-opera stars choose to work out there (and they do!), then you know it has just got to be the best (and it is!)

During spa week this place is a great deal...you can get a nice deep tissue massage (i like to get my knots worked out) for $50 and get free access to the sauna and whirlpool in your designated locker room area...

Service is always good and they're friendly.  Masseuse adjust the pressure well and focus on your problem areas.  If you're truly there for the massage then it's for you.  If you're looking for a super fancy spa?? not it.

I was super surprised at the size of the gym. When we first walked in, we were overwhelmed with the size of the gym. Coming from a smaller gym, we were excited to try out the machines. Tons of cardio machines and tons of weight machines! Can't wait to use all the workouts, I have seen on instagram!  I really like the different and variety of classes they offer and can't wait to try them out.  I also like that they have a sauna room, and nice size hot tub. My biggest gripes  is that the bathroom were not clean and they look like they weren't cleaned in a while. Regardless, I am going again! :)

This is a beautiful gym, it has that wow factor when you walk in.  It has a pool, a steam room, a really great lounge, machines galore, classes, weights, trainers even a nurse on staff in the event you need nutrition advice or CPR after a work out.
     All that said, when I came in and wanted to look around, I got the hard sell from the guy giving me the tour.  Ok, that was to be expected.  I was a member for about a year and a half and the only two reasons I left were because first the traffic made it so annoying that half of the time i did not even want to go.  I worked in Philly and would take 70 East bound, having to make that cross over 70W with no light.... you could age 5 years waiting for a break in the traffic during rush hour.  The other reason was their hours were just not late enough for me.  They close at 11pm on the week days and though that's pretty late, I still need something that is open later - so I went to cancel my membership.  First I called, they said please come in.  I went in, they said you need to speak to the manager he wont be back until Monday, come back Monday.  I came back Monday and the guy gave me the third degree and actually became nasty.  Can I just cancel?  Can you do that for me???  Are you the manager?  Yes???? GREAT!!!  I don't want to be a member here anymore, I don't need the third degree or the drama or the 'tude!  
Sad, this is a really beautiful gym with a TON of good stuff going for it, they could do better with their exit strategy.  People leave, people come back - but only if you show them respect and don't make the experience an unpleasant one.

If you want a spin experience in the tampa Bay Area this is where you go. I come from St Pete and it's well worth it. My fav instructor lately is Phyl. Consistently strong playlist and energy. Love her classes

If you're looking  for a place to get a real workout in and actually feel like you accomplished something, Orange Theory is the place to go! This particular location is amazing. The staff and trainers are all incredibly nice and really care about you accomplishing your goals. I would recommend to anyone and everyone to give it a try and see for yourself why Orange Theory is THE BEST!!!
Great hip hop yoga class. Temperature was high but we didn't go too fast. The music had a great flow - no lyrics so my mind didn't wonder too much! Super clean studio and friendly people! Loved it

My first class was held today by the amazing Jessica and though I was a little concern, being new to spinning, Jessica and the amazing receptionist in the front made me feel at ease.

First walking into the building, you see smiling employees that honestly doesn't feel artificial or commercial, the two that helped me today were/are beyond helpful, explaining the classes to me and the people who go there are beyond helpful, not snobby whatsoever. The whole environment is welcoming!

Jessica is tough and she lets you know that, but she also goes out of her way to assist you when you need help and makes sure your seating is comfortable, giving you tips along the way! If you feel uncomfortable, SPEAK UP.

I'm looking forward to being a regular here and being trained by her.

If you're looking for an oversized hotel fitness center with a full year commitment, then this is the gym for you. Oh, don't expect them to keep advertised office hours. Honestly, they should consider a name change to "Sometimes Fitness".

I used to shy away from activities like rock climbing because it seems daunting, but I finally got into the end of 2020. This is a relatively small gym, I think the smallest of the 3 locations of all Upper Limits. However there is a variety of routes for beginners, regulars and beyond. I started at 5.6 and am slowly but surely making progress. It's challenging to take on a new route and rewarding when you complete a project. There are patrons of all ages here. It's definitely a fun activity that I'll continue to keep up with in 2021.

The gym is taking measures during the pandemic -- Mandatory mask wearing, handwashing before you climb, spraying stuff down after, and limited capacity. I feel pretty safe here. 

**PRO TIP: Check out this brilliant, real-time occupancy tracker while planning your visit, so you know for sure you can get a spot at the gym at any time of any day. https://stlmo.io

I have been using gyms since my high school days in the 60's & 70's. I have used them when I was in the US Army and I did massage for a few years at a Reno Casino Health Club. I have had multiple simultaneous gym memberships most of my life. I look forward to the opening of Crunch on Aug 15, 2019. I was able to easily & quickly sign up today with "Cam" who was polite, courteous and willing to let me take her picture to put on Yelp. Her colleague Sarah had called me the night before and left me a message reminding me to come in to sign up. /// Erin gave me a tour Sunday 8/25/19 and I was able to get a mini workout too. The place is ultra clean and the place is quite nice. They expect to open more locations in this area.

Love this location! I always enjoy coming to the St. Pete vertical ventures over the Tampa one! The staff is great and there are plenty of different walls/climbs for all different kinds of climbers. The walls are marked clearly depending on ones skill level. Never had a bad experience here and will continue to come here

Found this gym while on a business trip thanks to classpass! I did the trampoline class and was immediately hooked!! So much fun, a great way to start the day :) I liked it so much I immediately starting researching to determine if there were similar classes in St. Louis. 

The instructor was great and had a great playlist to match the intensity of the class. 

I can't wait to go back next time I am in the area.
Excellent facility!  Clean, great equipment, and helpful staff.  It's my go to gym while working in Hometown PA.  It's one of the best Lifetime facilities I've visited.

I totally agree with the previous reviewer. The best thing about this place is the location. Everything else is pretty well described by previous reviewer. However, most if not all of the equpment is leftovers from better gyms. The machines at this gym are terrible. They used to have some sensored bench press until a bunch of people got hurt on it. There is barely any treadmills. I actually totally agree with all the employees working out comment. That's so true. Really funny someone called that out lol. I used to be a member, but besides there being open till 5 on sat and 3 on sundays (CAN YOU BE ANY MORE INCONVENIENT?) This place is whack.

I was at this location to see what the population was like and equipment. 

First, nice gym. But the free weight section is underfunded. Less barbells , dumbbells, benches. 

Machine wise , there was lots. 
I was in the morning and I didn't have to wait. 

In the locker room only 6 lockers avail per section. I got the last one. No set asides for handicap. There should be twice that amount. 

Things were very clean. 

I doubt I ll use this location again for what I need. 

It's a ok plan B.

LOVE WATER SURF : A PERFECT 10!! As good as it gets!! Matt Coleman has been coaching my son for about 9 months now. The change I have seen in my son's surfing level as well as self confidence is phenomenal. My son went from riding a 7'2" board to a 5'0" in 9 months. He has been instructed on how to position himself in the line up for maximum wave catching. I can honestly say he is now entering into the intermediate / advanced level after only 9 months of coaching. There is no turning back for him, he is a surfer for life.

Matt Coleman is as much as a mentor to my son as much as a coach. He is truly invested in my son reaching his potential as a person. He has taught my son to reach for his personal best and to stay far away from comparing himself to others. He has also taught him the very valuable trait of staying humble, even when your ripping. At the very heart of Matt's philosophy on teaching surf is to have more fun then anyone else in the line up...thats the key to success.

I would recommend LoveWaterSurf to anyone at any level of surfing. Matt is an incredible role model for teens and young adults.

Body Cycle has such an awesome range of classes... from the 60 minute endurance ride with Triathlon guru Barry (used to be 75 minutes... womp womp) to the upbeat jams with Jessica Sullivan, to the challenging workout with Russell (not to mention he is NOT bad to look at)... there is something for everyone.  I try to make it at least once a week when my schedule lets me... I would go more if I could!  Affordable packages for students, top of the line bikes, and a clean studio puts Body cycle over the top in my book.

Love it!

They are now open!! (November 2013)

Their first day was the day after Thanksgiving, a Friday.  Starting out, it's been pretty lacking of people which is actually great since the parking lot was wide open.  They haven't gotten the body enhancement/ red light therapy to work yet but will sometime this week :)) and they also have tanning beds, massage chairs and hydro massages. And lots of fitness equipment!!! I also discovered the Stretching Cage. so cool!

Pros:
- Open 24/7
- Offer fitness classes (Monday through Friday)
- Have cardio equipment- elliptical, bike, treadmill
- Have a TON of strengthening and toning machines
- Have weights
- Really friendly staff
- Super cheap! (Regular is $10/ month and Black card is $20/ month)
- Its accessible - on Charlotte Pike, 5 minutes from West End Ave, across from Kroger's and Kroger's gas station, and near a bunch of things
- They answer the phone line promptly
- Free purple pens and tootsie rolls!
- Black card member benefits- Tanning beds, Body enhancement vibration therapy, hydromassages, massage chairs, and can bring 1 guest
- Lockers in bathroom areas and there are showers
- No parking issues (yet...)

Cons
- Driveway tricky to get in the first time (at night...)
- Their webpage isn't up to date yet (and their twitter, Facebook isn't setup)
- With starting up- some tanning and vibration machines aren't working yet
- No mirrors in tanning rooms
- Direct withdrawal from debit card only (not credit card or cash)

Don't join if you ever plan on cancelling your membership. They find every excuse not to talk to you. I cancelled on 12/5 (after trying to cancel since early November) and am owed some money that hasn't showed up after more than 30 days. I've tried to get in touch over four times, it's now February, and the money is nowhere to be seen. They're impossible.

On the plus side, this is a big facility with a layout that is well designed.  On the negative side, we walked in this morning with two staff members at the desk who could not be bothered with a hello or good morning.  The equipment is so old that the buttons on the bikes aren't even visible any more.  Only 2 recumbent bikes downstairs and the upstairs bikes are really old and in poor shape.  It's better to get in a workout than not so we will still be grateful that 24 hour has a facility in Northwest RENO but wish they made the investment in some upgraded equipment.  It's pretty out dated.
This gym is great, mainly due to the staff. Warm smiles, kind hearts, and just happy to help ya out. I love how it's tucked away. It's this very special little gem

I love this place. I only wish I could frequent it more often.  In my dreams of being a stay at home mom, I hang out here all the time.

The facility is clean, and up to date.  The indoor pool is like most, but the outdoor pool is filled with fun add-ons like sprayers and buckets, perfect for the kids.  Of course I recommend going early because by the late afternoon it is like warm bath water, hardly a refreshing swim.

I think that the indoor track around the machines is a great idea, and the juice/snack bar is a nice dirversion away from the purpose of being there.  The daycare area is great and staffed with wonderful folks, they even take the kids to an adjacent gym to get some athletic play in, which is perfect because this way we are both ready for a nap after a workout. 

The staff is friendly and kind, and the personal trainers don't make you feel like you are worthless because you have a few (or 100) lbs to loose.  

All in all, one of the best gym experiences I have ever had.

I love the classes here so far! I came in for my first ride free when I hurt my shoulder, and I bought a class package after that. They have student packages which are really reasonable. 

Studio is located above Breakaway Bikes, and it's a really nice space. I like that the bikes have the monitor on them telling you what resistance you are at and how fast you are going. The instructors will often refer to what RPM and resistance number range you should be in. This allows for you to push yourself harder than you would normally, since you can see how much slower (in my case) that you are going compared to the number they are giving you. Also, I definitely use more resistance using these bikes!  Studio uses the black lights and when it's dark outside, it's dark in the studio. Little clip on lights on the bikes let you see the monitors.

They provide towels, coat rack, cubbies, bathroom. They sell water and some other things, but there is also a water cooler for filling up bottles.

So far I have taken from Jessica and Shoshana. I found their classes to be very challenging!

I joined this gym because it was close by, newly opened and seemed to offer nice equipment. But the it was the employees and management that made belonging to this gym an unpleasant experience. The sales staff are fairly clueless, and evidently under a lot of pressure to sell memberships. They haunt you with phone calls after your initial visit. But once you join, the employee problems seem to multiply. 

In other gyms I joined, the trainers are uber-fit gym bunnies who eat, drink, and sleep exercise. At Philly Sports Club, there were trainers who looked more out of shape than me! That would be fine if they were good motivators or coaches. They didn't seem to be, from my experience. The desk staff were fairly hopeless if you had any issues and the manger was never available.

This place is a membership mill. There are better places to spend your money and better environments to keep you motivated in your workouts.

We went there for my daughters birthday and we had 14 people and we asked for a discounted rate because Sky High was going to give us a discount and the employee said naw we don't give discounts and we don't need to we stay busy enough. Seriously that's how you answer a customer. Never take your kids here. Customer service is terrible here.

Axiom fitness is a real breath of fresh air as far as the 24 hour-ish gyms go. Now I have been a member of the Anytime fitness and Planet Fitness, as well as Snap but this one just is a few steps above in quality and atmosphere. 

From the moment I walked in and was greeted by the staff I was impressed. They have membership people and trainers who also give new members evaluations/assessments for free and of course those at the front desk who great you with a smile each visit. The locker room has been a little less than clean on occasion and the counters are always covered with water and there are no towels, paper or otherwise available for wiping down. This could use some improvement. The facilities seem to be clean at all times and if a piece of equipment seems to be broken, it's only for a day or so before it's back in service.

These workouts are hot, like 120-125 degrees hot. The actual workouts themselves are not that hard but they are so hot.

I like the virtual instructor, however I don't like how other clients want to talk to you during the workout bc it's just a dvd...

Also, clients talk really loudly by the benches, it's hard to relax and do yoga or Pilates when all you can hear is about what other people had for brunch.

I do like the idea behind infrared saunas, but having to buy another mat and towel (for $100+) is enough for me to not sign up. You can rent a mat and towel for $5 if you forget it.

Lots of variety for cardio and not so crowded in the machines area. However, in the weight room it's a whole different story. Lots of University kids dominate the place and don't really share. Still I like the vibe and the two stories is cool. 

If you have trouble with the stairs, no worries. They have some cardio downstairs too. You can also hire a trainer for extra OR take a plunge in the Jr. Olympic pool. Oh, and they have a dry sauna. 

There's plenty of classes offered too. Just download their app for the schedule. 

My favorite thing is though is the Rockin' Hoist machines. They have 4 at Ina and none in the Oro Valley or Marana facilitates. So this one -- well -- rocks!

My only issue is that it is a bit dirty in the dressing room/restroom area. Just hasn't met much of a standard.

This gym is WAY too pushy. It's creepy.

I've never gone to the gym, but I signed up for a free trial. I never ended up using the free trial. 

I started getting LOTS of emails from different trainers at the gym. Maybe a month or so later, one of them texted me on my personal phone. Wtf?! So creepy! He was like "hey nicole it's ryley from City Fit." Whose ryley and why is he texting me?!  That's way over boundaries. 

Like I said, I've never gone. Maybe it's a good gym. But I felt they were way too pushy (almost desperate?). The whole thing was weird. 

It has a cult like feel to it. No way will I ever go to this gym.

Update:  I originally attached a screenshot of the text I received from Ryley and recently I received a notification from yelp stating that the picture was being taken down because it was "inappropriate".

LOVE this studio! Came for a drop in class since I was visiting from out of town. The atmosphere was beautiful and the community was very friendly and welcoming. Donna the owner was very nice and greeted me as soon as I came in the door. She was awesome at making very helpful adjustments that helped me "feel" the exercises much better. She does a great job at explaining where you are supposed to feel the movement and what it is working. I also loved her music choice. Was a great mix of styles. I hate going into a studio that just plays dirty rap or electronic dance music 24/7. But that's just me personally. Lol. I would definitely recommend this studio for both first timers and seasoned Lagree veterans.

I am a big fan of spin class workouts. This was my first time doing cycle bar and I loved it!

The staff was very welcoming and showed me how to check in, where to find the clip in shoes, the lockers and got me all set up on my bike. 

Once the ride started the music was awesome and the time passed before I knew it. The instructors are really motivating and reassure you to go at your own pace. Sometimes workout studios can be intimidating but this is a no judgement zone with a "you do you" attitude. 

I really like how they send your stats along with the playlists after class.

This place makes me sad, when you walk in no one greets you, they sit on their phones or talk to each other and ignore every person that walks in the door. One of the front desk employees who is especially rude parks in the handicap spot WHEN HE IS NOT HANDICAPPED nor does he have a sticker to park there. Same guy also made a rude remark about my hair when I walked in one day and decided to say hello to them since they were so absorbed in their own conversation and couldn't do their job properly. I have watched these "personal trainers" walk into the gym with fast food... like you've got to be kidding me  there is only one person who has ever made me feel welcome at this gym and that's one of the actual personal trainers, not the one eating fast food and showing poor form to his client.  
I can't explain how important it is to make your clients feel welcome and comfortable and that is the staffs job. Something needs to change.

I love this place.  I've been a member when they were across the street and known as Love 2 Be Fit.  The new studio space is beautiful, with screens so you can still see the instructor's moves even from the back.  They have a great variety of classes: Zumba, Bombay Jam, Beat HIIT, PiYo, Yoga, Barre classic, Barre Pump, and 305.  Some of these classes are hard to find anywhere else or aren't offered in gyms nearby.  I've taken all of these except Yoga and I really enjoy them all.  It's a great variety of cardio and strength training.  The instructors are fantastic.  Each one is friendly and welcoming.  They make a point of asking if anyone is new and they show modifications.  What I also appreciate is that there are all body types and fitness levels, so it's not intimidating.

I travel a lot & go to many PF clubs, but this one is by far my favorite! 

VERY friendly staff, equipment is always very clean, cleaning supplies always stocked, the atmosphere is well-lit (some clubs are very dingy) and great/diverse music, even bathrooms and locker rooms are clean. 

Truly love this club. Always feel welcomed. Never feel judged. Always happy to go to the gym.

Let me go ahead and preface this: before I walked into CFDH, I had done Crossfit: one time.

I was in town for an extended amount of time and came across CFDH as it was convenient to my hotel. Once I did, I pretty much booked that same hotel so I could have an awesome workout here.

Coach Pepper is encouraging, understanding, and actually *coaches* you on technique and form (and for me -- being so new, this was important). I knew that when on one of my first two days there, my shoulder was bothering me -- he took me off the floor and put me on crossover symmetry right away (v. familiar with) ... that's when I knew that this would be my gym for as long as I was in Tampa.

The athletes here are very friendly and welcoming, and the camaraderie is great. 

I'm not sure what my future CF holds in my hometown of CLT as I'm worried I won't find another place like CFDH. Thank you for everything!

Bringing your kiddos here is one of the best things that you could do for them. Playformance is more than just another kids' gym: Kevin ("Coach Kevin" as he is affectionately referred to) incorporates exercise with character building, nutrition lessons, friendship, and good old-fashioned play. Our kids have attended Playformance's after school programs and summer camps for years, and they LOVE it. My oldest two daughters don't have a sporty bone in their bodies and loathe exercise, but Kevin's gym was the exception - I never dreamed those two would ever be able to climb walls or shimmy several feet up a rope and touch a vaulted ceiling, but the encouragement they received here was highly motivational. Your child's physical development will blossom here, no matter what fitness level they are at. Some kids come here during their "off-season" to cross train and keep fit, while for others, this may be the only form of physical activity they get. All of the coaches at Playformance are wonderful - they truly care about the kids and they clearly have a blast playing with them. 

Kevin runs a variety of programs, including after school, Saturday Parkour, summer and other school break camps, and "parent night out" events (where you can drop you child off for a couple hours and head next door to Borderlands for a beer). He also hosts birthdays and team building parties (for both kids and adults). Kevin has an entrepreneurial spirit, so if you have an idea for some type of fitness and/or play related event, he will try to make it work. 

What child couldn't use a bit more play in their lives?
Great hours (24HRS) Good size gym. Friendly staff. Great assortment of equipment.

If it wasn't for my previous membership at Bally's, I'd never set foot in here!
Weekends are best time to work out when you are busy working at a "real" job during the week -- this place seems to ALWAYS have something major broken on the weekends. This weekend, triple whammy! No televisions to watch while doing cardio, no sauna to warm up the muscles or relax them after the workout, and finally, a cold whirlpool. Really guys!?!? How about also having the cleaning crew work on weekends too? Hanging underwear over the showers that were there YESTERDAY (I was there Friday, Saturday, and Sunday; like I said, I have a real job and can't get there after work). 
Oh, and don't get me started on all the Lunks here with their steroid rages in the locker room! Planet Fitness is looking better and better all the time, next time my membership dues are up for renewal...

I travel to Tucson  regularly have  been to the speedway location several times because it is close to my hotel.  I do day passes.  

The speedway gym  has lots of equipment.  But it is filthy.  The men's locker room  is one of the most disgusting in the country.  And some of the staff are really unfriendly.  I went in on a Sunday at 6:00 AM, and their internet was down.  They turned me away.  Unbelievable!  Most gyms will comp you or make some other accommodation.  They were just rude and wouldn't even try to come up with a win win solution.  

The Golflinks location is so much better. Friendly staff, clean, positive environment.  

If you are thinking of the speedway location as your primary location, I wouldn't do it. LA fitness or Chuze fitness - both of which I have been to are better options.

What a cool gym! Everyone was so kind and welcoming. I met my trainer here and paid $10 for a day pass to workout with her. There are many different rooms with plenty of space to workout and use the machines/equipment. Would DEFINITELY recommend checking this out. Parking lot is small, but there are plenty of places to park and you can get a good warmup to walk in, if you have to park a bit away.

A good to very good gym depending on what you are looking for. It's like a small city in there. Within the gym there's a barber, pole dancing studio, sports massage place, football boot camp, and probably a few other places
I'm missing. 

As a gym this reminded me of an old school body building gym. Lots of equipment, but some was in need of repair. I tried the calf extension and the metal plate I was standing on came off. That was the deciding factor which prevented me from joining. 

I think this is a great gym if you're a bodybuilder and train during off hours. The sign up fee was a bit steep, but one can buy a guest pass for $10.75. Not for me at this time.

This was my 8th summer attending classes at the Monon Center. I love aqua classes and the water park is a great place for them! 
The aqua teachers are top notch and they really care. I attend 2-4 days a week. The walking track is a great easy workout and I love Deep Water classes. I also love Aqua Zumba and a new class to me was Aqua-yo-lates, which is pilates and yogo in the water! I love it and am sad they only have it on Friday mornings. 
I wish they would have more outdoor classes. New this year was a night time outdoor Aqua Zumba and it was great! The water park closes at 7, so I wish they would offer more night and weekend options for people work. My schedule at work changed and I can't get there as often as I would like and that makes me sad. The day classes are very busy and I think outdoor night could be just as busy. 
Communication with the Monon still is just absolutely awful. I prefer to not even bother interacting with the staff as they never actually know what is going on. I think this is a high level training issue and it's just not gotten better. 
This summer when the indoor pool closed for maintenance they decided to not move classes outdoors.  I am not sure why. The park is now closed during the days. Tuesday night I tried to go to class at 6 and followed the email that said classes were being held outdoor. We did have to go inside even though the email said the gates would be open. I asked and they told us classes were outside. But when I asked outside which pool the lifeguard was unsure. 2 people inside told us to go out. 7 of us showed up for class, but another woman doing laps said the teacher told them they canceled them. A super helpful girl came over and said that they showed class was happening and she wasn't sure where the instructor was and she went off to make a phone call. About 20 min later she came back and said they were not having classes. We ended up just jogging in a lane the 6 of us who stayed. 
One woman just joined yesterday and was told class was tonight. She said she specifically told them she joined for nighttime aqua classes. Yet the pool is closed for 2 weeks?!! They told her classes were going to be outside. They always move outside. But not this year, but no one was told I guess. 
Another guy did come out and he apologized again and said he guesses they didn't update the daily notes and schedule. 
I am just not sure how things like that happen. The Monon Center is a multi-million dollar facility and very nice, but very poorly managed.

I have been a member at Ripped since June 2016, averaging 4 classes a week. I love that after all of this time every class is still is a struggle. The instructors are great. Everyone is so personable and their drive and determination to see each person that walks through that door "kick butt" and push their limits is what keeps me coming back for more. I don't have enough good things to say about my Ripped fam, except thank you. You guys rock!

I have been looking for new ways to get into shape. I've done everything from spinning to yoga. I saw a living social for Rowzone and thought I would give it a shot. 

I arrived 15 minutes early to learn the ropes, as instructed, and was able to catch a few minutes of the class before mine. I must saw I was a bit intimidated by the sweat dripping off the people in that class. But the diversity of their fitness levels gave me hope. I am definitely not in the best of shape so seeing people that looked to be at my fitness level was encouraging. 

Jess was the instructor for the day and she gave me a run down of the machine, what the correct form was, and watched me use it a few times to correct any mistakes. Then it was time for class.

We started with a circuit that was easy to follow and Jess kept me encouraged to keep pushing myself. I think that the 1st 15 minutes were the hardest. Gettin the rhythm of the correct form started to get me a bit frustrated, but Jess came over to help me correct my mistakes. 

I was really in the zone at this point and she tells us to hop off the machine. We broke up the middle of the class with some elevated push ups, planks, and supermans. I really was feeling the burn!

The it was time for the last stretch of the class, everyone was pushing them selves, the music had me pumped, we finished the last 2 sets and it was over. It was really the fastest 45 minutes I've ever had working out. Normally I am counting the seconds until I am out of these types of classes.

I was dripping at this point too, but I felt amazing. Everyone of my muscles felt engaged and exhausted. I would highly recommend Rowzone to anyone who is looking for a fast and efficient full body workout. I loved it so much, despite my still sore muscles, I will be going back tonight!
Conveniently located, great encouraging instructors, great facility. I can't say enough great things about this place. I love it!

Does the term, "Greasy sales tactics" resonate with anyone? If so, this is what you can expect when going to LA Fitness. Particularly the one on Ina/Shannon. 

Here's how my experience panned out. I get several  calls from a guy who claims to be the general manager named Clinton J.  I finally call the guy back and tell him I'll sign up that day, but that I'm not going to pay an initiation fee. He replies, "No problem. Come on in. We'll work something out for you." I then replied, "Are you sure you can waive the initiation fee because I'm not going to pay it and I don't want you to waste my time or yours?"  He said he was sure and so I decided to ignore my intuition which said, "They're like used car salesman...they probably won't do what they said."

At any rate, I decided to enter the lion's den. The greeter greets me and is very friendly. I am then taken to a waiting area behind where all the sales vermin reside. As I'm sitting there, I actually heard Clinton tell his sales team and VP who happened to be there. "You all ready to see how this is done?!" Then Clinton comes around the corner and greets me with his VP who says his name is also Clint.  

Long story short, I sit down at Clinton's desk and he says he's going to see what he can do and starts looking at his computer's screen like as if he doesn't already know what deals he can offer. I then tell him I'm only interested in the single club monthly rate with no initiation fee as I'm not going to pay one. He then abruptly gets up, shakes my hand and tells me that plan doesn't exist. 

All this could've been avoided if the dude was just honest. Instead, he wasted my time, his time, his VP's time and all that sales staff who were all listening to how "it's done." Now I'm going to post this review on ever site I can to let people know what to expect at LA Fitness.

By the way, I echo what all the other reviews have said about how it takes LA Fitness forever to stop charging you once you've cancelled. I sent two certified letters to their corporate office and made countless calls before they stopped charging me. Why I thought they would have changed by now is beyond me.
Great environment and very knowledgeable personal training.  I highly recommend Snap Fitnesss-Clayton!!!

The way they went about closing the Hyde Park location was super shady. They announced closing for July 14 and then just locked up and turned off the doors sometime last week. No notice at all. Showed up to work out and...wtf. They have my email - they're great at sending me marketing emails- couldn't just inform us they were closing? They're just such a horrible company on so many levels

I am there most mornings for a swim. The lifeguards are generally attentive, but sometimes get caught up in their own conversations and end up paying less attention than they should.....On more than one occasion the lifeguards didn't show up on time so the pool couldn't open. The maintenance could be improved. The pool was closed a couple of times because of low chlorine levels. Managed haphazardly, but it's the only pool in town so you take what you can get. During the winter months they inflate the "Bubble" which keeps us from the cold, however this year they decided to forego the "bubble" and it worked out fine.
Fantastic fitness, huge! Lots of free weights, machines, cardio, many rooms. Zack gave great deal on membership. Motivating place. Great eyeball liberty too! Go there now!

My husband and I have been here twice-both times when visiting Santa Barbara from Los Angeles.We are experienced Pilates people so were looking for somewhere close to our hotel and came across Simpatico.This is a great place -the owner is very nice and  clearly very experienced so we enjoyed being able to get our Pilates session in when on vacation.The studio is a very short walk (one or 2 blocks)from the  Montecito Inn and walking distance (5-10 minutes) from the Four Seasons,it is a 10 minute drive to the San Ysidro Ranch.Highly reccomend Simpatico and will return when next in Santa Barbara/Montecito
Still enjoying the Zumba at the Racquet Club. Katy, teacher for Silver Sneakers, adapts every class to fit the students.

My daughter worked out at this gymnastics gym while we were on vacation. The owner, coaches and gymnasts all treated her like she was a long time member. We will definitely be back!  Thank you Bronco Elite!!!

So we have several family members that signed up for this place as they noted a $29.99 charge.   They are charging all of us $49 or so.  It's insane.  After conversations, pointing out the contract says 29.99 flat fee, they refuse to explain or provide refunds or work with us.  We have tried all the ways we could to deal with this but now we are forced to involve the Better Business Bureau.

Planet fitness here at Brownsville road is 1 of the best Planet fitness around. It has a lot of equipment to use, not crowded like other PF , very clean, and the staff are all very friendly and welcoming. I try to come here 3-5 times a week but sometimes with working full time it is hard to make it. If you or any one you know is looking for a great gym to join I recommend trying this PF.

The sporting club at the Bellevue is everything I need in a gym! I started off lifting weights and they have 4 Squat & Power racks which is very respectable for a mainstream gym. They have platforms for Olympic power lifts. They have air strike bikes. Anyone that knows anything about bodybuilding and weightlifting should be excited by what I just wrote. Usually there's only one or two squat racks and rarely will you ever see a platform in a mainstream gym.

Their hours are also that of a true athlete's gym. There are some commercial gyms out there like Weston Fitness that will close at 3:30 p.m. on a weekend. The sporting club is open until 11 p.m. on most nights. To go along with the hours is the fact that the pool is open for the same time as the gym. I believe it's a junior olympic size pool and it can fit 8 swimmers.

Aside from swimming and weightlifting I also practice Muay Thai and boxing. Their boxing studio is top notch. Trust me I've worked out all over this city from City Fitness to the now-defunct 12th Street Gym to Temple University's gym. Sporting club has it all. Also they have a great view and a little lounge with Pure Fare food there. 

Ask for employer discounts. I'm an Einstein employee and I get a significant discount. My friend who works at Comcast also gets a significant discount.

Ask them for their free 7-Day trial. Also members are given 4 three day guest passes so maybe you can meet someone and they can let you into the gym to experience all of it.

My cons are that it is an outdated looking gym and I have bad service in there.

Horrible cancelation experience; LA Ftiness of Mt. Laurel does not deserve any stars. Please be aware once you complete the LA Fitness requested form to cancel your gym membership they will call you everyday and send emails atleast twice per week to collect billing. It's unfortunate they spend that much time calling someone that has not used their facility in over 6 months. They should take that same energy for calling to collect to make sure their members utilize a service they pay for.

LA Fitness should do a better job with their level of service instead of lying and stating the cancelation form was never recieved. That is not an ethical way to do business and makes the company look dishonest. They leave messages about the representatives needing to make their commisions. They also e-mail a confirmation that the cancelation was received.

I came here on a Saturday morning at 11am and I really enjoyed it. I paid $20 for one class and got another class free. I like that there are 3 huge projectors while you ride so you can go along with the music and also feel bad about yourself that you dont look like Beyonce in the music videos- I guess that's kind of the point. However, the staff is really sweet and they provide you with towels and shoes with no extra charge. You have a personal locker that you can use as well. If I lived in Tampa I would definently come to this studio. Super fun environment and great workout.

My best friend and I attended our first ever cycling class yesterday at 5. The studio is very chic, modern, and most importantly clean. The two girls working at the front desk were very helpful and kind to us as we filled out paperwork. They provided us with shoes and towels, too. We placed our belongings into a secure locker and entered the bike room. Our trainer, Ali, was SO nice as she helped us set up our bikes. Between the music, the workout and the atmosphere, it goes without saying that I will be returning to SOHO.

I have to update my review. I've been a member of about 8 months now. It is hands down the best gym in philly. Which is why I guess I continue to go. However being the best compared to terrible gyms doesn't make it amazing. At first I was obsessed. But lately it has been so crowded it's hard to deal with. I used to love working out in the mornings getting ready at the gym then going to work. That's the reason I joined such an expensive gym, was to have a nice locker room. However, if I do that there's no where to get ready. I wait to find a spot to put on makeup and try to blow dry my hair. It's way too crowded for only about 10 stations to get ready at. Also the classes are super crowded. If you don't book it right away you can't get into any of the good ones. It's been so frustrating. 

And on top of it they change their perks without explaining. When I joined a perk was free PSN sports teams. It's one of the reasons I was ok with the price. I join and email about how it works and I'm told "they no longer do that" without any explanation. I emailed back to ask why and when this occurred because it's one of the reasons I joined and no one has responded to me ever. It's been over a month. 

It's the best of what's around but I don't think it's worth the cost. To top off all of my issues I just received a letter they're raising the monthly fee. It's only by a few dollars but it's the principal. So frustrated but unfortunately in philly there's no where else to go. So that's why it's so popular. The best of what's around by far as far as facilities, etc. but they make it hard to enjoy sometimes.

It's true, there's pretty much nothing I can think of that's bad about the spin classes here. I've only been to 3 classes, three different instructors, both great, but Jessica Sullivan's class was the best cardio class (not just spin class) I've ever tried. From the beginning, she was helpful and friendly, but I really appreciated her adamance about form throughout the class. She didn't just say "no bouncing," but explained how to not bounce so that we don't injure ourselves. (I'm a newbie to spinning.)

The studio is clean, not overcrowded, towels and water available, well ventilated, the equipments are new. 

The only drawback is the schedule of classes. There are hardly weekend classes (no afternoons), and the times are not consistent during the week, so for many of us who have a set work schedule, there's only 1 class I can attend the whole week.

...and if Jessica teaches more evening classes, that would be ideal!

Shapes Brandon, and Riverview, are wonderful. The staff is always helpful and encouraging. Anne, the owner, is lovely and supportive and gives a great Thai Chi class. The hours are great they just renovated the entire gym it's beautiful. To work out with other women is inspiring! Thank you shapes, thank you Anne.

First it was really hard to find a place you have to turn down the alley which wasn't reflected well on Google maps. The instructor was warm and bubbly but this video is kind of tiny. It's a good thing they were only three of us taking the class today. It was kind of awkward for me. Least favorite class I've taken so far from class pass and I didn't feel it matched the class description well. It was branded as a high energy Bey/Nikki/RiRi HIIT class but it seemed more like barre class with hit song's playing softly in the background. I did break a good sweat though, so...Mission Accomplished! I got in a good workout but it wasn't fun or engaging so I'll try somewhere else

This LA Fitness just opened Jan 2, 2012. It is the first full service gym in this area. The staff seem very friendly. Lots of equipment so you never have to wait. Even when the parking lot is full it never seems overly crowded inside. Enjoying my first month.

After cancelling my account multiples times with fitness 19 and their 3rd party biller ABC, I still got charged.  I put a stop payment with my bank last month, disputed the charges and got my money back.  I thought I was finished with them.  It turns out they also had my credit card and keep charging it now.  I call to cancel and get tossed back and forth between the gym and 3rd party biller.  I've spent 10 months trying to cancel with them.  Ridiculous!

Simpatico is the best!  I have been working with an instructor both in private and group apparatus classes for a few years now.  The studio has a great energy, and the owner is very accommodating and friendly.  I've had a wonderful experience with the people, as well as a more toned pilates body!  Highly recommend!

I love infrared Sauna's AND working out so this combo is PERFECT!    The owner is amazing and takes the time to answer all your questions AND backs her answers up with factual DATA from accredited and licensed professionals.    Her staff is well trained and there is NO HARD SALE tactics!  (They honestly don't need them anyway! But it's nice to have an actual free class with NO pressure to come back.)     You will though!  Over and over again!   Every class has a modifier and you go at your own pace.   If you're reading this review GIVE THIS PLACE a try.    Fishers is SO BLESSED to have it.

My son and I visited a few weeks ago for a birthday party (we'd been here before, but not in several years, and it has changed quite a bit), and it is a great little place that offers an arcade, laser tag, a very small "crazy" car area (bumper cars), and one or two small party rooms. it's similar to Chuck E. Cheese, only less Vegas-slot-machine-like, and slightly more expensive. There were only two crazy cars that were operational during the party, so the kids stood in line and took turns basically spinning around in circles. They all enjoyed the laser tag. My son and the other kids seemed to be having a wonderful time at the birthday party, and the service provided to the party was great...I wish I could give this review 2.5 stars for that.

he biggest drawback however, and for me it was *BIG*, was the music. It was very loud (for any time, much less a Saturday morning), and entirely inappropriate for a place catering to children. It felt like I was in a nightclub in Ybor, and was annoyed and a little shocked by it.

Terrible experience trying for free Trial!

I got an email below once i signed up for free trial. It clearly says "no obligation" basically hassle free but once i called and spoke to someone it sounds the opposite (see email quote below). 

1. First email: 
"
Thank you for signing up for a free, no obligation, 7-day trial at Any time Fitness. To arrange a visit during staffed hours, please contact the gym at the phone number or email address below. Then show this email when you visit the gym. See you soon!
" 
2. Email asks for much more than no obligation experience: Deposit $$ and proof of residency. 

"
We would be happy to get you set up with a 7 day trial pass, which you would be able to use the gym any time of the day 24x7 throughout the seven day period. This is a free pass which does require a $49.00 deposit on a credit card for your security key which would be refunded in full at the end of the seven days when you return the key. We accept Visa, MasterCard and AMEX. You must be at least 18 years of age. We do not accept cash or check. We will make a copy of your AZ driver's license.

If you have just moved here and your license does not show Tucson, we will need proof that you are a local resident to honor this offer, i.e. a local driver's license, utility bill, etc. Free trials are not available for students, but we do offer a Student Summer Special and Winter Special with a student ID and key purchase.
"

Locker rooms were always clean and the staff was relatively friendly. Overall it's a decent gym if you're looking for judgment free. If you're looking to really push yourself, this isn't the place to do so.

Love this gym, all the hammer strength machines are a huge plus, plenty of benches. Lots of high quality cardio machines and classes every day. I also dig the fitness machine up front that tells you your body fat percentage. Very clean locker rooms and they have a nice sauna. Staff is friendly and 30 bucks a month is very inexpensive. No pool or courts but they are looking for a new location. Would recommend working out here :-)

With all the hype building up to the grand opening, it just didn't live up to the expectations and unfortunately I'm going to have to give this place just three stars.

Like another reviewer mentioned I've also been having trouble with billing. It seems like I was not signed up properly originally by one of the reps and every time I come in there is a problem with my account, stating that I have not signed all the agreements although I've signed all the paperwork and billing information well before this place even opened and on top of that l actually found out they had signed me up for the wrong membership. This doesn't actually make a difference as there's not really any regulation between memberships, so even with a regular base membership you're able to use the HIIT zone, weights and take group classes for the most part. 

One of the reasons why I signed up for the Peak Results membership was the ability to use the tanning and hydromassage, however it doesn't seem like they have even set this up. The facility is clean and the equipment is very nice however with them unable to resolve my account problems and incorrectly signing me up, even though they claimed to have fixed it when I originally signed up, I'm not sure if I'll continue coming here.

I do love the RZ workout. 45 minutes of cardio and floor workouts the class goes by very quickly and you're always in for a good sweat! 

The studio definitely isn't luxurious though. There's no locker room which is inconvenient because I come right from work and need to get changed before I leave. I also get peeved when workout studios charge for towels - and RowZone is one of those studios. 

I come via ClassPass and will continue to do so. I recommend integrating this workout into your workout routine - but I don't think I could ever see myself solely coming here or getting a monthly membership.

Eric is the best instructor! He pays attention to the whole class and helps with form while also motivating us...def recommend his class!

I hate writing negative reviews but my experience with this gym definitely warrants one. 
First of all, the staff is extremely unfriendly, something I noticed right out of the gate. 
The sign up process took over an hour, which is pretty outrageous. At signup, the staff member who helped me informed me that there was a $100 early cancellation fee. 
I ended up cancelling within the first two months. I received a call from a different staff member who informed me that I would receive a bill for the cancellation fee. I never received a bill but my debit card was charged $100. 
If that wasn't bad enough, I received a second charge for $300 about two weeks later, which was drawn off of my debit card. 
I called to question the charges and the staff member I spoke with was extremely rude and informed me that the $300 charge was discounted from an early termination fee of $500. 
So all totaled up, I was charged over $500 for one month of a mediocre health club...
Aside from that, for over $130 per month, the facilities are not what you would think would warrant a monthly fee of that size.

i do not like giving 1 star review to any business but this place really deserves it for their rude and not trained staff. do not recommend them. if you don't  care about service the facility is ok .be careful when you sign up the take advantage of you.

I love French Riviera Fitness!!! They have great hours, friendly and helpful staff, and a great selection of fitness machines and exercise resources! The cost is well worth it and the gym is well maintained. Everything is clean and tidy and I find the people that go there are respectful and careful (during pandemic there are extra safety precautions and cleanliness requirements that are well maintained and enforced. There is a Women's Only section which I like bc it's generally less crowded than the main floor. I also love the big exercise room with wood floor for yoga and meditation. The machines are well kept. I really like this gym!!
I've been going here for years and have had nothing but great experiences.  The owner Jason is awesome and his staff is always nice. They also keep their place clean.

One of the main advantages of a "chain" operation is consistency across locations.  Unless you live under a rock you know that this is not always the case.  This location is the perfect example of not living up to corporate standards.

I've been to three other nearby locations (Springfield, Bala Cynwyd and Andorra).   Compare this location to any of them and the difference is startling. 

* Overall maintenance and upkeep is deplorable.  You never know what's going to be broken, out of service, empty.

* Cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired especially in the locker rooms and bathrooms.

* Customer service needs some work.  It's clear that many employees skipped the training videos!

What's most disturbing is that these conditions have existed for years.  LA Fitness has been around for 30 years and has hundreds of locations.  I'll bet you a week's pay that somewhere on a HQ computer there is a national inspection schedule.  It's almost like there has been a glitch and they are not on the list.  

LA Fitness has some solid locations that could easily meet your health club needs.  Unfortunately this isn't one of them.

Overall, I have had nothing but positive experiences here.  

Pros - The staff are mostly friendly and welcoming.  I have had one staff member out of maybe 6 that I really was not fond of the way he interacted with me, but maybe it was a bad day?  Equipment is constantly being wiped down by users and people put their weights back!! :) Makes me so happy and calms my ODD.. seriously.  The cleaner is always cleaning.  Membership cost for location is great IMO but my office is around the corner so it works for me.  If you need food ASAP it's conveniently located near lots of places where you can get your healthy food.

The layout works for me, however, the locker room is very small.  There is little they can do about that, but it would have been great if there is a little bit more space.

While I was staying in Tampa I joined the Gold's gym.  I really enjoyed working out here.  The gym is open 24 hours and has lots of different equipment.  The only downside is that it is like all gyms and it gets crowded between 6 and 7 PM.

I've worked out at the Spring Garden location for a couple years now. This was an awesome gym and the price was right. The trainers were/are still great. But slowly the entire atmosphere started to change. They lost a couple of there best trainers to start. No big deal since they still had solid ones remaining. Then the green turf was laid out to promote a new type of training. This is where City Fitness started to go wrong. If you didn't pay for personal training, you started to get corralled in one section of the gym. Then they put in an awesome 7 rack pullup station similar to what you'd have at a cross fit gym. Even if no training session is going on, regular members can't use the rack. I can see if it is crowded or a class is taking place but an empty station really?
