Increasingly it is becoming the few "paid trainer" folks sprawled out in one area and the many "non paid trainer" folks crowded in the rest of the gym. Not cool no matter how many pool parties you throw. The regulars are the reason this gym is even popular. Don't forget that. Getting told I could not use the pull up bars (in the middle of a set no less) was my final straw. Today was my last day. The 3 stars are a remnant of its glory days. Felt like a 2 start gym today but that wouldn't be fair.
Great customer service! They have a nice little kids room and they have all the stuff you would need at a gym. The atmosphere is great with a great staff along with multiple trainers and classes.

I just moved here and joined Lifetime the moment I walked in and looked around.  My gym back home was similar (actually not as nice!) and $40/mo more with very limited usage (outside with masks) during COVID.  I see some negative reviews here about the fees but the amenities, size of the facility, cleanliness, etc. are worth the membership to me.  My only frustration is the classes fill up FAST...it seems I may have to set an alarm the day registration opens for the early morning spin classes.  That being said, my solo workouts have been seamless and I've never had to wait for a machine...maybe a bench on occasion.

Looking for a gym where you can feel YOURSELF? Where you are welcomed like an old friend? Where you are pushed in a safe and supportive way to become the very BEST version of YOU? Strength Camp is the place. Knowledgeable coaches with experience and education, a fun and challenging structure to each day's workouts. The system here WORKS. I love coming in and feeling the high energy vibes in the gym, knowing that I will leave in a clearer, more confident mood when I'm done. Not only have I become stronger physically but mentally I feel sharper and more balanced. Can't say enough good about Strength Camp. This is not your average gym. Gotta check it out to see what I mean!

I did not have a good experience at this location and will not be back. After signing up for a membership online I came into the Charlotte Pike location to work out for the first time. When I walked in there were several people already standing around so I waited until a guy at the counter called out to me. I told him that I was new and that I had just signed up online. I assumed I needed to get a membership card for my key chain so I asked for one. Not that I expected the red carpet rolled out or anything, but the guy barely acknowledged me, gave me my card and sent me on my way...No welcome, No tour...Just gave me my card and moved on to whatever he was doing. I explored the gym by myself which wasn't that big of a deal and did my workout. I laughed to myself because they have a sign on the wall that talks about what they do for new members...none of which they offered when I walked in. Anyway....

When I was done walking around I noticed they had the hydro beds and I wanted to try one out. So I go up to the same guy at the counter. He was standing alone with no other customers around. I kindly asked him if I could use a hydro bed and he said they were all taken. He offered me the hydro chair. I said I didn't know the difference (because I have never been there before) and he appeared annoyed that I didn't have a preference. He hands me two coins and I go, "What are these for??" He sternly goes, "For the hydro chair." I go, "Oh...okay." He must have been able to tell I had no idea where to go or what to do with these two coins so he walked me over to the area where the chairs and beds were. He noticed one of the beds in fact was available and asked me if I wanted to use the hydro bed after all. I said, "yes." He told me to go ahead and lay down and that it would take "a few moments" for him to reset the computer and have it ready for me. So, I get comfortable and lay down. I waited for what I thought was "a few moments" and nothing was happening. I thought maybe I was supposed to put the coins in a slot somewhere?! No idea. I finally get up and go back over to him to which he came off annoyed that I was bothering him again. I told him the bed wasn't working. He reset it again and I went to go lay down again. I waited and waited and nothing happened. I finally gave up and took my things and attempted to leave. He saw me walking by and didn't understand why I was leaving. I told him the bed wasn't working yet. You can imagine how irritated he was with me now. He rudely told me that it's set on a timer and it gives me 5 minutes and that it hasn't been 5 minutes yet so go back and wait. UGH!! So I go back and lay down and wait and wait and wait. I was irritated but figured I had waited this long I might as well enjoy it. Finally I hear the machine next to me go off. It didn't dawn on me until after the fact he set up the wrong machine. I was supposed to see a small box on my screen that indicated my 5 minutes, but since he had set up the wrong bed, I never had that on mine. Since I didn't know this at the time, I'm still laying in the bed he told me to lay down in. All of a sudden another employee walks up to me and goes, "Excuse me ma'am...you need to get off the bed because I have another person who is signed up to use it." ((Like I'm just laying on a non-functioning hydrobed for fun.)) At this point I had it. I go, "Excuse me?? I've been waiting for the other guy to get this bed to work for almost 10 minutes and now you are telling me I have to move???" I gladly got up and walked straight out of that club and will never return.

SORRY Guys! But your employees need an attitude check and some customer service training. Based on my experience, your club does not stand by what you advertise either. I have since worked out at the Franklin location and will be transferring my membership there as soon as I am able. The energy in their club is more positive and their employees have been absolutely great to work with.

If I could give (-) * I would. The place is falling apart, mold, mildew and broken equipment. The pool is dilapidated as the entire finish is crumbling, the volleyball court is full of weeds unkept and unusable. The hottub is broken and like the pool the bottom is gravel so you couldn't even sit in it anyway. The tanning bed at Trinity floor is rusted out and covered with an old dirty bath mat. I would not even use it for fear of malfunction plus when was it last service if it looks like that. After 2 weeks we wanted to cancel our membership and that's when we found out the staff was just as dysfunctional  as the buildings. I ended up having to file fraud charges with my bank and cancel my credit card to keep them from continuing to charge us. I wanted to love this place but it's impossible as it is very clear those responsible for it do not care for their business or their customers.
Dropped in while in town for a conference back in December.  Coaches and members were welcoming.  Was accessible via car from French Quarter.  Will definitely drop in again when back in the area.

Just like the rating system says "Yay! I'm a fan."  I have been a member for SRAC for about 3 years now and am very pleased with the gym.  They offer lots of classes throughout the day. There are also a few bootcamps to choose from that usually have an additional fee. I have participated in: spin, yoga, zumba, and one of the bootcamps and been very pleased with the equipment, facility, and instructors.  Great people work here, it is always clean and bright, there are lots of options for cardio and weights, and it never feels overly crowded.  

The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is the locker rooms, while clean, they leave something to be desired as far as showers/space/amenities.  What they do offer suits me just fine, but I have been to gyms with better locker rooms.  

Overall, I have been a member of many gyms over the years and would easily recommend SRAC.

Had a great time learning how to surf with my 9 year old twins. Signing up on their site was nice.  The staff met us at Coastal Access near UCSB with wet suits and boards.  They gave us a short demonstration on the boards before we got in the water and then we were off to give it a shot. After just a couple tries we were successfully riding the waves. Their team were extremely patient and friendly.  I'd highly recommend them to anyone.

I've been working out at Orangetheory since January and I love it. There is no other workout like it. Morgan does an incredible job motivating you through the workout and coaching on form. The place is awesome.

Exercise!  New equipment and new facade!  The Ambler YMCA is better then ever!  The best fitness center in the area.

Three pools for those who like to swim laps and watch the kids whisk down a 2 story water slide.  A state of the art hot jacuzzi and dry sauna will relax your muscles.

My two concerns are the locker room size and the absence of racquet ball courts.  There are plans of an outdoor pool and more!  I am looking forward to getting back to shape at the YMCA.

After years of visiting what feels like every Club Fitness in the St. Louis region, I can confidently say that the Affton gym is the best of the lot. It's well-lit, has new machines, clean locker rooms, and great group classes. Everyone that I have interacted with has been friendly and helpful, from the front dest staff to the janitorial team. 

This gym is 24 hours, and the parking outside is well-lit, so you can feel safe walking in at all hours. I have not worked with any of their personal trainers, but the zumba and spinning instructors are helpful and encouraging. 

A few tips to get the most of your experience:
I don't recommend going on Mondays and Tuesdays between 5-8pm because that is when it seems to be the most crowded. I've never had trouble getting an elliptical/cardio equipment, but parking and waiting for free weights during this time can be frustrating. 

My only qualm is that many users do not wipe down the machines after use. This does not seem to be an issue with cardio equipment where there are sanitary stations at the ends of rows. However, this is not the fault of Club Fitness and I couldn't knock off a star. Just be sure to wipe down your machines before and after use to be safe!

I just joined a few weeks ago but so far really like it. The equipment is in good shape and there is plenty of it. One downside is the dumbbell area and benches are always crowded so I don't get to use that area. The TV situation is not the best either,but I just listen to podcasts instead. All in all a good experience. Friendly staff.

I've been very happy with this Planet Fitness location! It is hard to beat $10 a month for such a big and well maintained gym! I've come at all times of the day and I've never had a problem getting a machine to work out on. There really is a focus on cardio here so there are rows and rows of treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, etc. My only issue is that the free weights section is very small so you really have to make sure to go at off times to get access to the weights! If you go at peak times you also may have a problem finding parking, but if I drive around for a few minutes a spot usually opens up. The staff is also very friendly!

Cardio equipment -- 5 stars
Weights -- 3 stars
Staff -- 4 stars
Parking -- 3 stars

Crunch is a good value for the price (only $10 a month) if you don't mind the huge crowds. 
This gym is great for those on a budget and is really popular with the local university crowd. 

Pros - cheap price, wide variety of equipment

Cons - Too crowded late afternoons and evenings. Expect to wait to use benches and equipment and park far from the gym. Annoying power-lifters/cross fitters that monopolize the squat racks and slam the weights. Some equipment is really old.

I love working out here. It is convenient, clean & has what I need to work out. Yes I would love a track or a pool but you get what u pay 4 & this place is cheap!! Don't forget your headphones or they charge. It's worth the extra $10/mth for the black membership with free massages & tanning.

Decent retro.

Pretty up to date. Although it looks like the walls and dcor could use a little sprucing up. Otherwise they have good variety of equipment for lifting and plenty of cardio machines. Not a big fan of the parking lot, it seems a bit cluttered coming in. Bathrooms are clean and the staff are nice. Definitely a go if I am in the area.

I recently went to this gym 3 times, thanks to generous friends who had guest passes.  It's a beautiful facility.  An historic warehouse-type building has been renovated to become a gym, and the renovation used good materials and good design.  Here's what else I like about the place:  first, the pool and the hot tub are very good.  And second, the gym is located in the heart of Mt. Airy's business district, so you can go to a restaurant or bar or bookstore while you are arriving or leaving from the gym.  Third, they provide towels at this gym.  Fourth, the room used for physical therapy and classes is beautiful, with huge windows looking out across the street, but I would not use that room for my normal exercising.  This fitness center is classy and deluxe in its appearance.  Here's what I don't like:  the gym is very expensive, costing more than $700/ year per person when Planet Fitness gyms cost less than $200 (but of course there is no pool or hot tub at Planet Fitness).  The men's locker room at Fitlife is extremely small, and usually you are jammed right next to somebody else when you try to access your locker.  That's annoying.  At Planet fitness, for comparison, the locker room is spacious.  At Fitlife the room containing exercise machines and free weights is small and cramped, and the number of treadmill and elliptical machines is very small.  For comparison, Planet Fitness is spacious and spread out, with tons of natural light and tons of machines.  I am a member of Planet Fitness in Flourtown PA, so I can compare, but I have criticized Planet Fitness for having so many machines where, when you watch TV, the sound comes into one ear only through your headphones.  This is a common problem everywhere:  gyms don't repair their machines when the electronics get messed up.  Getting back to Fitlife, the reason I give it only 2 stars is because it's not a good value for the money, especially for me because I don't routinely use a swimming pool for my exercise.  The tiny locker room is a big problem.

Really cool gym! Relatively good hours. I wish they were open earlier, like 5 am instead. But they are open until lateish in the evening. Plenty of space to work out, decent amount of cardio equipment, spacious well laid out locker/shower/bathroom.  Definitely recommend.

Peaceful and clean environment. Very pleasant staff. Great place to work out! I've had the experience of working with a personal trainer,  so have my 12 year old son and we have both seen impressive results. They even have a child care center so bring your toddlers in and they will cared for!!!

I love working out but I hated this gym. I have worked out for years. This gym made me uncomfortable and the staff is one of the worst I've experienced. I got suckered into signing up for a personal trainer thinking I would get new ideas for work outs. I had ONE evaluation session then kraig cancelled on me twice and never cared to contact me to make up sessions and I got a sitter to watch my son which isn't easy. My son was born needing surgery and stayed in children's hospital for a long time. I thought getting into working out would help me cope with my son's condition. Instead La fitness took advantage of me. What makes this more frustrating is that I paid several hundred dollars maybe even $1,000 I can't remember and got NOTHING. The manager Andrew called me a liar because the personal trainer manager said I could cancel anytime. Conveniently he left when I was going through the process of canceling and trying to get my money back. These "men" are ignorant, rude and selfish. Kellen and Andrew knew my son was sick and continued to charge me knowing I had to be a stay at home mom. I hope people read this and turn away from this gym. The picture attached was the personal training manager, John. This confirms what kind of people work there which is no surprise.
I love this gym. It's clean, no one tries to sell you on anything additional. Everyone is super friendly and it's open 24/7 - who can ask for me!?

I like this gym. Location, atmosphere is great. It's not too big and that's important for me. 
My trainer  Adam C is fun to work with. He is punctual, knowledgeable and works hard to help you reach your goals. Rest of the team is friendly and always ready to help. 
Try it out!

I love this place! For ten dollars you can climb for an hour and that's usually longer than I can continue to climb! I have gone here a couple different times with friends and my girls. One is six and the other is three and they have a great time! The auto belay is perfect for them (and me too). 
I love the challenge that accompanies the climbs and they let you know how difficult the climb is with ratings on the wall. 
They also have a free climb section where you don't need a harness. This, I think, is a little more challenging but still fun! 
My arms are always sore here when I leave and I feel like I had a really good workout. 
The staff is friendly and helpful. It's a big indoor space and usually there isn't a wait to use the auto belays if you go during the day. I've never been at night so I can't attest to how it is during the evening hours. I recommend this place to all my friends!

This LA Fitness Signature Club is fabulous! I was immediately impressed by how airy and well lit the place is with windows that bring in plenty of natural light. Also great about this place is the sheer number of cardio machines available. I've never had to wait while I'm there. 

This location has a pool and class space. I didn't check out the locker rooms, but I'm guess they're nice as well. There's also an attached parking garage with free parking.

Easy access clean facility and easy access to equipment without having to wait forever. 

I belong to LA and to Anytime Fitness. Majority of the time I find myself at Anytime Fitness on Swan because it's down the road from my office.

I highly recommend this facility I don't think I've had an issue with anyone here. You're also not intimidated by other people working out.

Give it a shot!

It was not a sport facility, but I think in order for it to be considered a sport gym, a pool must be developed. Anyways  they had plenty of machines, the same ones where you find anywhere on the 2nd floor.  

The weights were okay as well, but the service is excellent though. =)  The girl that works out in front was super nice and maybe she liked my smile so who knows.  But she asked what I was doing and how was everything so that was a good thing.
Not much to say but, I will be coming back to train again soon. The environment is nice and spacious, so you will not feel cramped doing what you want to do.
great gym at a great price. equipment is new, locker room is clean, lap pool, basketball court, spin, banana bags. awesome!

Let me list off some of the things I love about Dragonfly Fitness & Training.
1) All ages and fitness levels are welcome (and encouraged by your peers)
2) When a move doesn't work for you, the trainers have good modifications
3) More fun than I have ever had working out - we laugh a lot
4) Some of the nicest women you will ever meet are your trainers and classmates
5) Giving back to the community is a core value here
6) Once a week I do something requiring strength or agility and think "this right here is why I go to Dragonfly. "

Make the call or send the email!!  You will not regret it!

This is one of the worst gyms I have seen. First, the gym is very hard up find. Second, when walked in I was given a locker key only to find the locker might as well not be locked as didn't even close all the way. Next to see the old, un maintained equipment, I was by then disgusted beyond belief.

i hate the staff, rude and unprofessional people. specially the Mexican name Rigo  the management should fired his ass. never again going back to that place,  i just gonna work out in the park for free, not recommended to people to come here they just gonna drain your bank account, my co- worker told me after  he cancel his membership they still charge his ATM card, never and not recommended to come to this place,,,

I've been going here for a couple of weeks now with a great trial offer and while my experience working out here has been positive, I will never ever join LA Fitness for one reason alone. In my first week, they had one day brought in Hungry Howies pizza and another day Dunkin Donuts... For their customers.... At a fitness center. It's clear to me LA Fitness is not fully invested in the overall health and wellness of their customers or else they'd never consider bringing that crap into the facility. And it's too bad because it's not a bad gym. It's crowded after work but not unbearably so. There's a mixture of types of customers and it's fun to watch and learn new moves from others. I have no idea what their prices are so I can't speak for value, but again, I'm not gonna give them my money to have junk food thrown in my face after pushing myself toward a healthier me.

Just signed up at this gym, very friendly and knowledgeable staff, the gym has a nice and open floor plan. I do think that the kickbox and yoga studio are on the smaller side, but the rest will make up for it.

I have only been a member of The NAC since March although I have visited various times before . This is my 4th gym in the area that I belonged to and the 1st one that I enjoy going to. I find it easy to navigate the equipment and large enough to never wait for anything! It is extremely clean and there is plenty to offer. I haven't even begun to explore the many classes they have to offer. The best part has been the pool! It is my paradise! I have met so many people this summer and feel like I am part of a country club ! Even though I have a pool at home, this one is a social setting! Where else can you be served food and drinks without leaving your chair! After only a few days the staff already knew my name and greeted me when I came in . I recommend it to anyone with or without a family. I donot have young children but those who do, really enjoy the children's pool , slides and play area!  The adult pool is for adults over age 21 which makes it really enjoyable. It is totally relaxing!  The membership is reasonable for what you get. Most classes are included and of course the pool is included and is open until mid October ! The restaurant and bar are open to the public and they have nice Sat evening events for anyone over age 21 to attend. My husband is in his 60's and he even enjoys the DJ's and music. It has made our summer enjoyable. Get a tour and see for yourself...

Yes, I did this. Yes, I survived. Yes, my bro status grew by five points (from 0 to 5, that is). Located along the Canal Walk in Downtown Indy, CrossFit Infiltrate has been one of those businesses that I slowly walk past and think "mayyyybeee one day when I'm feeling exxtraa crazy, I'll give that place a whirl." Well, that "maybe" and "that one day" came much sooner than I expected thanks to my pal, Jake. The free intro class is the perfect opportunity to get your toes wet in the world of cross fit (ya know, that super intimidating, tractor tire throwing world). I would say the crowd was what I expected but not overly intimidating. As embaressed as I thought I would be about working out in such a public location (row machines facing the Canal), I actually enjoyed being able to have the open air and water surrounding us. Our instructor was very informative and approachable. My push ups were ridiculous but the intro class allowed me to not feel alone in my .... weakness. The workout clearly worked muscles that I've been missing in spin and barre. I was sore for a solid 5 days. I would consider that a win.
Excellent spinning studio! SUPER challenging classes! Fabulous instructors! Great bikes. My favorites: Shoshana, Erin, Carly, Jess, Russell. Love it here. :)
These people are scammers. So sad to watch someone in a position to help someone else prey on their emotions instead. Sickening.

This is hands down Reno's best gym. I've shopped other locations and NOBODY can compare. It's clean, the staff greets me by name, even when it's packed it doesn't feel like it, and the range of equipment is phenomenal. Love this place!

I'm loving Barry's bootcamp so far I taken about 6 classes there since 9/14 and get a really good workout in every time burning at least 400 calories.! My favorite trainers so far are Chase and Antonio they have great energy but Devin and Josh will give it to you straight your workout will be intense! Chase and Antonio are intense as well just better energy. Either way I would recommend this gym!

Dirty - The bathrooms are disgusting. The staff tries but can't keep up. I'm pretty sure This location is going out of business there's never anyone there there's no way they can keep the doors open - Very sad they just did a huge promotion one dollar down and $10 a month they probably ripped a lot of people off of the process

With my corporate membership, it's a good deal for the best gym in the city. The classes, which are included in the membership, are challenging and there are a wide variety offered at pretty flexible times. I love the openness of the fitness floor and the range of equipment- there are machines I've never seen at other gyms.

I do feel like some of the facilities could be upgraded. The locker rooms are small, and I would go as far as to describe some pockets of the space (ie bathrooms and showers) as a little disgusting. Happy with my membership overall though and sure can't beat the convenience.
I have been reaching to to contact ed gallo in regards to the myhealthways network to see if they are a partner. He is not returning my calls about the gym services.

Started up my gym membership the day after thanksgiving. My co-workers work out here, and I figured I'd head in to see what it was all about.

The day that I went in they were running a special, where they waved the enrollment fee and only were going to charge me 20 bucks a month. I signed up on the spot. They give you a tour of the facility, and set you up and appointment with a personal trainer, which comes with the enrollment.

I was very interested in this gym because of the pool. 

When I started working out here, I tried out the pool, and it was very slimmy on the bottom, and i didn't feel like it was very clean. I wont use it again.

Something that is nice is they have a wide variety of machines to use to choose from. 

They have classes available as well, and give you a schedule when you sign up. 

Overall, this is a nice gym, I enjoy the sauna after working out, the locker rooms are nice and I would recommend it to a friend or family member.

This gym is awesome. Not spanking new like the downtown YMCA at Cityway, but they have every piece of equipment you could ever dream of. The group fitness classes and schedule are great. I especially love the cycle class on Tuesday with Amanda, and the Wednesday night yoga. Boot camp is also great and doesn't charge an extra fee like some other gyms. Same with TRX. 

NIFS has a decent amount of weights spread in multiple areas around the gym, in addition to the actual weight room, so there's always plenty of room. 

Only downside is that IUPUI's pool isn't included with the membership, although I think the fee isn't too much extra if you want access to the pool as well. The gym has a dry sauna and a hot tub in the locker rooms though.
They ordered another set of weights because of my review! You have a client for as long as I'm in New Orleans. Thanks Gary and PF!

Continues to be a scam. As others have pointed out, they'll take your $500 deposit, injure you with nonsensical movements while cold and then keep 100% of your hard-earned money. Just read the reviews so you can avoid this trap.

I'm back yelp friends! Short story: I've moved to Florida. Sunny, gorgeous Florida. With alligators and Zika. Not stopping me from reaching my fitness goals. You know what is stopping me?!?! Steak N' Shake, but that's for another review. Anyways, I was content at working out in the tiny apartment gym. It has some basic equipment. I gave myself DOM's (no, 50 shades fans, not that DOM. Delayed onset muscle soreness. Like when you squat so much you can't walk, those are DOMS.) I digress. I needed a squat rack. This gym wasn't cutting it. 

It was my intention to check out ALL of the gyms in the area. This was first on my list. Abe is a good sales person. I have somewhat of a loyalty to ATF. It's where I began, as a mega obese girl in Oregon three years ago. Now I'm a fittish chubby girl who is like hey y'all! Coming to work out! Watch out! Anyways. I never made it to the other gyms. My nostalgia mixed with Abe's excellent salesmanship won me over, and I did what I promised I wouldn't do on the same day and signed up. 

I've been four times. Boot Camp on Saturday. Don't ever ever ever do Boot Camp after Friday leg day. I'm moving leg day to Thursday. I did Body Blast today and I was going to do Yoga Flow, but I changed my mind at the last minute because I was starving. :D anyways. These are the first classes I've ever done. I would like to do more. Maybe someday. Also I need more reasons to get more workout clothes. Because workout clothes are the only reasons I go to the gym 5-6 times a week. 

Tech specs:
Squat racks- yes
Plenty of benches- yes
Olympic bars-yes
Cardio stuff-I hate cardio, but yes. (Also take note that lack of cardio is why I'm still chubby. Cardio-ing it up, and no more steak N' shake. If anyone local knows of any place with healthy choices, hit me up!)
Lots of dumbells-yes
Clean-yep
Free classes-yesssss

I'll revisit this with progress when I make some.

**edit: one month later,  down 13lbs and seeing some massive progress. Everyone is still amazing. I was in a vehicle accident and Abe even gave me bath salts and recruited me to come to yoga in the middle of leg day. Usually I would carry on, but I was sore. Abe, Mary, Karen, you are the best! None of the other trainers have taken time to visit with me. Kind of wonder if it's because I have RBF. Maybe, maybe not. :)

**edit: 10 months later: still rocking it out and looking and feeling fantastic. Might hire a coach soon for these aesthetics. ;)

***Edit: 13 months later. How come you can't out train a bad diet? I really think you should be able to. I mean? Come on! Still love the gym.

I wasn't a fan of this place at all. The pictures imo don't describe the real look of it at all.

It's very messy. unnecessary tape lines all over the ground, bulletins, flyers, and papers on the walls that looks very chaotic, the decorations aren't attractive or symmetrical at all, and it was the hottest studio I've ever been too...... and I've been to a lot... it was way uncomfortably (even for a yogi that has done a LOT of hot yoga). 

I wouldn't go back here... it needs cleaned up, a lot...

Took my daughter here and the instructor Regina was incredible. We can't wait to go back and have a great time again. I would suggest making a reservation as this place is popular. Worth stopping in when local. Clean, fair prices, great teachers and lots of different walls.

As with all Borden owned Anytime's around town this one is awesome too !  I recently moved from the north valleys to sparks and this one is less than a mile from me now. I come here when I can and it's always clean and the equipment hassle free. The staff when there are very nice and helpful. I like the different machines available  at this location especially!

The staff is great.  Always an available workout station or treadmill when I wan it.  I also like that it's climate controlled, so it's comfortable working out no matter the time of year.  I see a wide range of other customers, from teenagers to seniors, so it's definitely a place where everyone fits in.
The interior is clean and inviting which creates a great workout environment.  One of the best parts about RH&FC is that it's locally-owned, which is hard to find in this day and age.  All in all, I would recommend them to friends and family.

I been having a membership for long time when I had my baby today I went for the first time in a long time I'm thinking bout canceling my stuff it was so dirty all of the workout equipment in I have ocd planet fitness is cleaner this this gym smh

Great gym but their billing is all messed up. They constantly double and triple bill me. Make sure you check your bill each month and use a credit card not debit card--they will drain your bank account and getting the money back takes loads of calls.
Oh, and the front reception folks are soooo mean! Downright mean and condescending. My 19 year old teenager asked for a bandaid and they literally started asking if she had a "boo boo" and making fun of her. 
That's just one example. 
No one ever says hi to you. No one knows my name after 3 years. No one smiles. There's one woman who is nice during the week in the morning. The afternoon and weekend crew seems well, annoyed that you are there.

Will not come back to this location. Who does the hiring and training? Some of the staff are like "duh".. also the layout of the gym is jacked up.." hey lets put the swimming pool on the other side of the gym and the only way in is by walking through the middle of the gym". Also totally NOT kid-friendly pool. Just 3 swimming lanes and that's it!

This was my next stop on my Tour de Gyms of Tucson and it was my favorite by far. From what I saw everything was very clean and the equipment was new. The front desk staff I interacted with was very friendly. Tons of parking available in the lot. 

I liked that the cardio equipment was upstairs and there seemed to be a good variety. It terms of quantity, I can see how this may be a problems during peak after work times. TONS of weights--both free and machines. Everything was spread out well so you weren't catching the sweat of your neighbor. There is also a pool, 4 racquetball ball courts, basketball court and 2 different group fitness rooms. 

Overall, this gym seemed to attract a much younger crowd than I am used to seeing in North Tucson. I went on a Sunday morning, so it wasn't too busy. I have no doubt that this gym, like all gyms, fills up after work. So plan your workout accordingly!

I'm adding two stars because the staff are friendly and helpful, the child care room is amazing, and the swim teachers ROCK (my 4yo nearly has his front and back stroke down pat thanks to private lessons with Miss Angela--money well spent)...Admittedly, I realized how good we had it after visiting the Hatboro Y...which, in turn, reminded me of the one we used a few years ago back in Queens. Not much to complain about when you compare it to other YMCAs.

And even just the lobby...a super useful space, and everybody uses it to settle their kids, wait for people, have a snack, work, study...I've actually put my kid in child care; invited a private language instructor to teach me at the table; and had dinner afterwards that I brought in and  warmed up in the microwave for me and my little dude (who's already had his fun time and shower for the evening). Oh, and they have COFFEE now. (Not recommending the pumpkin spice.)

And the sheer number of classes, most of which are free with membership...I've posted all the schedules on the side of my pantry so we know what we can do a few hours before we decide to go. Yogalates...on my list of things to try. As well as cross train boot camp because my husband says I won't last the hour...I'll die trying. 

Tip: Don't try to lap swim on Thursdays, especially if kids annoy you. And don't take your kids to swim on Thursdays. It's a big lesson day.

Poor review solely due to the terrible maintenance. 
One of the front doors has been missing its handle for at least a month.  I think the same for the door to the bball court.  Sure, these seem petty, but it goes toward an overall issue.
Repairs on fitness equipment takes months some times.
The place just plain smells.  And it's not something that can be fixed by wiping down the equipment.  The whole gym needs a deep clean...and maybe new carpet.
Locker room floor is generally dirty.

None of this stuff would ever happen at the Y, but I also paid 2x at the Y so maybe that's the issue.

Somehow this gym has garnered a reputation as the best in Philly and they ask for membership dues and sign-up fees that correspond with that reputation.  But beyond the prime location and the size of the place, it really is not in any way a nice or fancy gym.  The machines are old, the towels cheap, the TV systems crappy, the locker rooms are dank and crowded and the staff unhelpful and unremarkable.

I have heard great things about their classes, but I didn't take any so can't speak with authority on them.  But on the basis of the gym alone; the owners clearly have demonstrated no commitment to investing in top of the line new equipment which should be the hallmark of any top rate establishment.  The treadmills appear to be at the very least 10 years old with ancient red dot LED displays, the stair masters are fine but also old and faded; there are three newer ellipticals and the rest are all old with cracked rubber handles and over-worn steps.  The basketball court is very, very nice and there appear to be regular pickup games (although the balls on the ball rack were mostly deflated, which to me is another sign of lack of attention by the staff).  

You can tell a lot about a gym by their towels.  What you get here is a thin, rough, scratchy piece of cloth that reminds me exactly of what we got to use after P.E. class in high school.  It's a small and insignificant thing in one sense (no one chooses a gym because of a towel), but to me its indicative of a larger problem in that the Sporting Club has chosen the cheapest and easiest option in a lot of areas.  They wash all their towels onsite and to upgrade to something nicer would be a relatively insignificant cost based on their size...but they chose not too as like with the old machines and the faded carpet of the "fitness floor" they adhere to an ethos of getting away with spending as little as possible.

My feeling is that the Sporting Club at the Bellevue has an excellent revenue stream and whoever sits on the top of that food chain has chosen to take their member's money happily and spend it on themselves rather than reinvest in the gym.  I can see how it might have been a great place at one point in time, but now its just another gym with a nice name and a good address.

I spent a total of $126 dollars for a 15 day, short term membership there ($75 sign-up fee and prorated monthly fee for my 15 days).  When I signed up I specifically stated that I would like to work out until Saturday, February 4th.  I showed up on the 4th for what I expected to be my last workout. I took the elevator to the 8th floor, walked over to the desk, scanned my card and an alert popped up saying my membership was "cancelled".  The friendly lady at the front desk called the manager who checked into my info and said, that my short term membership had indeed expired.  Perhaps I'd counted the days wrong when I signed up (I could have and would have gladly paid for an extra day), perhaps the membership guy counted them wrong; the bottom line was that my card wasn't working and the manager had no interest in helping me out.  You'd expect any normal business to perhaps bend the rules to make a customer happy and let me in for free, or at the very least let me pay something to get in.  But no, he said unless I had a friend in the gym at that very time who could vouch for me and pay $20 for me to come in, then I wasn't welcomed.  And so I traipsed back out; somewhat incredulous but ultimately unsurprised.  The manager's effort mirrored the gym itself: just doing enough to get by but in no way trying to achieve anything above and beyond.

It should have been obvious. The signs were all there. How could I have missed it? 

What the heck am I talking about? Well I'm upset that I've never been able to successfully keep myself engaged in physical fitness. Yep. Despite multiple attempts, I've always fallen out of the routine just as soon as it began, and I never quite knew why. 

But I do now! Workout partners! They've never stuck with me! I've had so many over the years but NONE of em would stay true to the mission, so Id just drop off the face of the earth.

That was the case UNTIL... GRIT! 

This team is badass! Laura, Taryn, James, and Zach are always there and always down to kick your ass in gear with an intense workout that has your body firing on all cylinders all day long. Add to that the team dynamic and no person left behind dynamic of this group exercise program and the convenient schedule, and you've got an absolutely powerhouse combo of factors that will get any couch potato up and out, and on their way to great shape. 

Yes. You'll hate the first few classes, but they're only 30 minutes long, so you can totally do it! Then, when you get to class number 3, you'll still be hating life for those 30 minutes but loving it for hours, days, years and decades after. 

Apparently I needed the structure, routine, and assurance that Group Exercise offers to keep me on track, and I'm so grateful I found it.

If you're lazy like me aka incapable of staying committed to your own personal health, you owe it to yourself to check this program out. You can absolutely count on this crew to keep it fun, keep it tough, and keep you on track toward success. Heck, I'll be there and would love to sweat it out with you too! 

Here's to health! Many thanks to the whole GRIT team for all you do to motivate bums like me!

I was visiting Tampa over the weekend & this facility was the neareat outlet to my hotel next to the convention center.  It was a new & very clean facility.  I guess, technically, I'm not entitltled to use this type of club, but the desk agents didn't say anything when I scanned-in.  

The club is very large with a lot of equipment.  What stood out more than anything else from where I go at home is that I did not see a single "Sorry for the Inconvenience" signs on anything - not a single apparatus was awaiting repair & as I noted, this gym has much more there, and thus, a greater chance of something being broken.

So this club had everything that I use back home, so I was able to feel right at home after finding where in their set-up, each piece was located.
There's plenty of parking with an attached parking garage & no time limit.
I saw a lap pool that I didn't use & the men's locker room had a sauna inside.  The shower stalls contained liquid soap, shampoo & conditioner, none of which was empty, or even low, in the stalls I used the two days I was there.  

If I lived in that downtown Tampa area, I'd up-grade my membership to make this my "home club."
Totally impressed with this gym in the hotel!  So clean and a ton of equipment!  Pretty impressive! The people that work in the gym are friendly and helpful also!

The Brewerytown/Fairmount areas are known for great food and brew options but finally there is a kick-ass place to sweat out and burn the calories each and every day. 

Tiffany and her crew at Cycle Brewerytown are truly a step above the big-business cycling studios like Flywheel, Cyclebar, etc. Believe me, I've tried those. This baller Girard Avenue studio is composed of about 20 bikes which makes for an intimate and motivating setting. Once the door is closed, fluorescent lights go out, black lights on, music turned up, it's all about work for the next 45 minutes. Tiffany has a background as a personal trainer and brings a friendly, personable attitude but is ready to put you to work. 

First of all, the FIRST RIDE IS FREE and every ride the trainers continue to make sure you're set up comfortably on your bike and ready to work. Every ride Tiffany makes sure your form is the best possible despite how heavy and hard the workout may be. 

What's more to love about this studio? Their social media presence is awesome and drops promotional codes from time to time like 20% off rides or unlimited packages. They also rock great apparel and gear, as well. Just recently, they've added "Spin and Conditioning" classes that consist of 30 minutes on the bike and 30 minutes off in their other studio if you're looking to add some variety to your cycling workout. 

Lastly, the fourth Sunday of each month, they sport a charity ride. You can ride for free with a $20 donation that goes 100% to places such as CHOP. Tiffany and her crew work hard and you will too. If you're looking for a place to go to work, push yourself, hit your goals, and be your strongest, then Cycle Brewerytown is the studio for you.

ok so i was a member of city Fitness in no libs.  when i moved to the graduate hospital neighborhood i went to try this place out. first  off the music was way way way too loud.  it was painful for me.  the wefit class was going on and i couldn't even hear myself think.  

i told the membership rep that i paid 19.99 a month at the city in no libs and he basically shooed me out the door.  they tried to charge me $65 a month.  

i am a big proponent of "get what you pay for" and city Fitness is not worth that much - plus their weird billing stuff where they magically charge you big bucks to lock in your rate - i still dont understand that process. 

the place is always super crowded.  the weight area is meathead central and every time i have gone on a guest pass it's been a struggle to get a seat at a spin class or secure a treadmill that works. 

(pro tip - sometimes when i have a guest pass and walk in the people at the front desk legitimately ignore me so i just walk in and save the pass for another day.  great staff there guys!) 

also whats the deal with the towels- do they charge for them?  ive never seen a gym so cheap with the towels.  

either way i joined sweat in fitler square - its wayyyyy less $$, no weird rate lock fees, and not cheap with the towels, plus unlike city Fitness - sweat will let you go to any location

This place is AMAZING. The cardio equipment is fantastic. The pool is really great considering we are in Philadelphia .



In terms of swimming coaches- Roger is fantastic. He is patient, brilliant at swimming technique and he  breaks down all of the swimming strokes to really ensure proper form.

A+!!

customer service is very bad on this place and they are very unprofessional ,arrogant and rude .They behave as if they do not need customers and keep manipulating these yelp bad  reviews left ,erasing it for a fee ..
stay away, it is a complete nightmare !

This gym is the best around. I love the location. Right by westside beach. Plus you can go anytime you want. They have unique equipment that is available for all. My favorite is the prowler which is a full body sled workout. I suggest you take a tour if your looking for a gym.
Super crowded, staff are pretty good at being salesman. Don't believe that prices change daily and they will try to sell you a membership if you use a guest pass.

I've been here a couple times for a $10 drop in fee for swimming laps.  The facility is clean and updated.  The free weights area is fine, but a little cramped.  The facility is associated with the high school so there are always kids around, which kinda bothers me.  I looked in to getting a membership but discovered that the exercise group classes are an additional fee, I believe it ranges from $1 to $8 per class. WTH?!?!  I am still debating, but the pool is amazing. 

So I caved and got a membership.  It's fine for what I am looking for, basically I am paying for the pool, which I love! oh and finally found a place to play badminton, time to dust off the racket :)

They are building the new one right now in the same area ! It's going to be awesome ! It will be done February 10, 2016! On the other side of Winn Dixie  brand new anytime fitness! Lots of good looking guys go here too!

I was very disappointed to find out "after" I was canceling my $59.00 per month membership that they had lowered the fee.  I was a charter member so one would think we will have received the notification in our bill every month....

I'm really happy with Planet Fitness, and its mostly for the $10 a month membership. It's nothing special or fancy, but I'm always able to find a treadmill. I'm able to get in and out, and I don't have to wait in line to workout like I did many times at PSC Radnor.

I don't get why the rating is not higher here. This gym is big, clean and inexpensive. They also have a kids club. What more could you possibly want? The value is amazing. Yes, there are other gyms in town that hand out warm towels, have a ton of space and are super nice but you also pay the price. 

Fitness connection has two locations that you can use with your membership. One in Reno and one in Sparks. I've only been to the Reno one. It has a pool, sauna and hot tub as well as a nice locker room. It's pretty clean and the people are friendly there. I generally go in the evenings and don't ever have any trouble getting the equipment I want to use. They have a ladies area which is nice simply because it's got nice open functional space and they have several classes throughout the week. I didn't realize I'd like this gym so much. I had been with 24 hour fitness forever before I joined here. I only left because they shut down their kids club. 

So far I've been very impressed with Fitness Connection.

I'm not new to rowing and so when I saw this class on classpass I decided that I would give it a try. It was advertised as a mix of rowing and circuit training which is very well was. 

I felt like I wanted something more from the class but didn't quite get it.  I think I was secretly hoping that we would do a longer series of rowing/cardio intervals and then switch to exercises so your heart rate really got up there. Mind you I hit the target pretty quickly so it wasn't as if I wasn't working hard and I used heavy weights for the exercises just to push myself. 

I thought the instructor was super friendly throughout the workout and it's good variety to your regime. The space is void of frills, lockers are in the back, and be sure to bring a dollar for a towel. Make the workout your own.

 I'll probably try it again just to see if I feel the same way about it.

Happy rowing.

filthy dirty gym.   locker rooms filthy,  filthy on monday, filthy on tuesday, no hot water on wednesday, no water  pressure 24/7.
save yourself a boatload of money.  go to planet fitness !  they keep their gym spotless at all times.

Shred is one of my favorite places to work out. Every single time is different, and everything single time is challenging. Every instructor who leads class is different in their own way, and It makes me look forward to the way I feel after a shred class. For the class only being an hour of the day, it is one of the hardest workouts in an hour that you could ever get yourself to do! The lights being dim, the music loud, and the instructors motivating you on the microphone..you push your limits in this class. And anyone can start at whatever level pushes them..this is something for everyone. Try it!!!!!!!! your first class is free :)

This is an update to a review I wrote February of 2011. Today  I was contacted via a Yelp message by the manager of this location. She mentioned that  since my review we have changes "adding new Body Pump equipment for our classes and replacing belts & decks for our treadmills and ellipticals." I feel that the Improvements she mentions were much needed and probably if done the almost 2 years ago that I wrote my original review I would have given 4 stars at that time.  The reason for this and it not being 5 Is mostly that at the time I was going there the sauna needed repairs that we had mentioned to employees who were like of ya we know but for a long time they made no changes.  I left the 3 star rating I gave them at the time of the original review.

Haven't used the gym yet, looks amazing!  Just got a membership.  I just wanna say that the process of walking in, being greated by the owner and talking about what I was looking for in a gym was comfortable and refreshing.  Mike, the owner, was greeting everybody by name and had a super-fun and friendly atmosphere!  As I walked the premise with Mike, I was in awe of the cleanliness and quality/newness of the equipment. Glad I made the move to get in there and thanks for you help Anytime!

This place is amazing! The owner Soleil is so nice and all of the classes are great!  You get so much done in one hour - 30 minutes of cardio and 30 minutes of strength and/or body weight. It's a great full-body workout! It is much more motivating doing it in a group with an instructor encouraging you. The time flies by. They have other classes too like TRX, HIIT, and Yoga. Overall, it's a great place, everyone is friendly, there's no pressure, and you get a great workout everytime. The workouts are always changing too, so you never get bored. I definitely recommend trying Let's Sweat!

I just signed up and met with Max who was wonderful and gave me a great overview of what I should be doing. It is a clean and nicely laid out Jim, and I was given a lot of great information for a good start!
Best gym in the city. Multiple machines and always empty. Plus they just redid the facilities.
Friendly,  clean and super fun atmosphere! I will come back everytime I'm in town. The instructor was patient and fun.

I love orange theory & I love the staff. 
You must try it- better than any workout I've ever done & I've tried them all.
Want to change your body? This is the place. Any age..... You work at your own pace.
Love it!!!! Cone to Tampa Palms- they get to know you- it's worth every penny.

I had the pleasure of attending the Summer Bash IV put on by CrossFit Unbreakable and it ran very smooth. This place definitely knows how to put on an event and stick to a schedule. They were very welcoming as were all their staff and members. I had a great time at what was my first CrossFit Competition. Can't wait for their next event!

The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable and made the day a great experience I can only imagine their regular daily classes run the same!
This place is dirty and just awful.  In the past year I've seen it go downhill and am heavily considering canceling my membership.

This studio is amazing! I love that you reserve a bike in advance or if there is a seat open, you can come & sign in. I hate getting to the gym and having to fight to get in the cycle room years in advance to ensure I have a seat!

SoHo has a fabulous website for scheduling, info, etc. It's great that I can plan my week and schedule classes with favorite instructors/times.

The facility itself is immaculate. Super clean, awesome vibe, encouraging instructors, blowy fans and a booming sound system....winner! And classy. Oh yes.

You know you have taken a great class when leftover makeup is running down your face & 600 plus calories are gone and the hour flew by.... (Thx Eric! I heart your music choices!). Gentlemen, I hope your makeup stays intact :)

Go at least once! Your first ride is free!

This new gym is awesome! It is kind of a drive for me so I don't go too often, but I try to go as often as I can.  First off, this place is huge! Very open and bright.  They have a bouldering section, a huge belay section, and a pit where you can lead climb really really high.  If I do go here I go on Saturday when they have a 2 for 1 special so it is more affordable.  The parking is kinda cool because it is right under the freeway, but it is limited.  There was one night when we had to circle a couple times waiting for a spot to open up.  I would suggest carpooling if you are going with friends.  I would highly recommend coming here!

This rock gym is the best! I've been going since December 2015, and I'm by no means an "athletic" person. They have climbing routes for all abilities and the staff will help teach you how to do everything. The bouldering area can get a little crowded sometimes on weeknights so try to get there before 7pm if you want to have a climb without dealing with all the ropes and harnesses. It's a great way to get a total body workout while also the feeling you get when you put a puzzle together correctly. Their exercise classes will also kick your butt, so if you are feeling like you need a challenge, do the HIIT class on a Tuesday night and get ready to be sore for the next five days.

The dumbbells only go up to 75 lbs which is pathetic since my small apartment gym has 100 lbs dumbbells. The hand sanitizers are empty 50% of the time which isn't great during COVID times. At least it's only $10 a month.
Yoga with Catherine on Saturday morning is the best thing ever!
Best gym ever. I've gone to several OTF gyms, but this place is special. If you haven't tried OTF, start here!

I joined before the holidays and I gotta tell you, best decision I ever made.

For the price, you can't beat it. $10 a month for white card status? That's all I need. 

The staff is very friendly. Always pleasant. 

The gym itself? I love the atmosphere and overall experience. Barely any juice heads. I mean, yeah, that lunk alarm is annoying, but it keeps the clinks, clanks and grunts to a minimum. 

With the tiny exception that SOMETIMES way too many machines are down, I hardly ever have to wait for a machine. 

I'd say if you're looking to shed some pounds, this is worth it,

The best place to spin in Tampa Bay, hands down. Three giant screens playing videos, beats you can actually spin to and the friendliest instructors. I am a regular in Jaime's morning class and need a tough workout, and it hits what I need. But all levels are in class with me, and it seems to work for everyone.

Bonus: Their smoothies are the best! Try the Soho Detox or Kale Yeah. Perfect post-workout!

This review is simply for my initial impression of the facility and the staff as I've only been given a tour and haven't worked out at the facility yet. 

The gym is small. Don't expect a Fitness Connection-sized gym. For me, this is perfect. It has two cages, a full set of free weights, nice Precor machines and Life Fitness treadmills, and a virtual workout studio with a ton of workout videos that project. Everything is very clean and organized: all weights were neatly stacked and placed, the equipment was in very good repair, and everything looked great. They have private bathrooms and showers instead of locker rooms (umm, yes. Every gym should do this). If you want tanning, it's an optional extra. They have one tanning bed. Safety and security appear to be of upmost importance at this facility, and the EMT in me thanks them for that. 

Insofar as service goes, it was exceptional. I was immediately and warmly greeted by Lizzy who made me feel not only welcome but appreciated. She was constantly and genuinely smiling, and I could tell she likes dealing with people. She provided me with a great tour of the facilities, going over all the ins-and-outs specific to this facility. It was compelling to sign up without being pushy; after seeing the faculty and the staff, you simply want to workout here. It's a totally different atmosphere. At the end of the tour, Lizzy gave me the pricing options and even told me about a sale they're having tomorrow. She didn't have to do this and, to be honest, I never would have known about it if she didn't tell me. This shows a level of respect for customers that is simply lacking these days. This kind of honesty is what brings me back and will keep me a customer. 

As I've said, this (rather verbose) review is rather premature, but I don't see it changing in the future. If something does become amiss, I will update this review. Until then, I strongly recommend you come check out this Anytime Fitness location.

I love the Sporting Club. It is an incredible facility; it feels wrong to even just call it a "gym." I've been enjoying it for a little over a month now, I was able to join because of a LivingSocial deal which reduced the normal monthly fee of $102 to $60 (and no initiation charge and a massage or personal training session, to boot!). This now stands as the best LivingSocial deal ever in the history of the universe and it shall never be surpassed. Fin. 

I find most gyms utilitarian. Some are nicer than others, some have more equipment or shorter wait times for machines or cleaner facilities, but generally the vibe is people are there to work out and you go in and get it done and go home. The atmosphere here is totally different. The whole place just seems designed to make you feel taken care of. On the first floor, there is a small cafe with very friendly staff, I like to stop there for a quick snack and some coffee after an early-morning workout. There are some armchairs in front of a flat-screen TV that's usually tuned to CNN, some longer tables where you could eat lunch, and a few smaller tables by the windows overlooking Broad Street that have a great view. I've been to other gyms that have juice bars/cafes, but this one just has a very pleasant, friendly vibe to it. 

The locker rooms are great. They're never crowded, the lockers are big enough to fit whatever you've brought with you. They have absolutely every amenity you could want - for the showers, there are shower caps, razors, body wash, shampoo/conditioner, and shaving cream. The towels are fluffy and always plentiful. There are individual vanities stocked with deodorant, hairspray, body lotion, hairdryers (with diffusers!) and curling irons. Whatever you need, they have it here. I don't think I've showered at home since becoming a member. 

Since it's been approximately 1 million degrees throughout my membership, I've been using the pool rather than the other fitness facilities. It is absolutely lovely. It is occasionally crowded enough that I've had to share a lane, but everyone is very friendly about it. Only once have I ever had to actually wait for a lane, and that was literally for five minutes. After my swims, I like to indulge in a soak in the giant hot tub, which is the size of my living room at home. I am not kidding. There is also a sauna. The hot tubs and saunas are single-sex, while the pool is co-ed. I'm a fan of the setup. 

As others have mentioned, if the Sporting Club has an achilles heel, it is the price. I believe the normal initiation fee is $450, on top of the $102 monthly membership fee. They were recently running a promotion for a $99 initiation fee, but you're still looking at a considerable amount of outlay for a gym membership. If you can find a way to fit it into your budget, it would absolutely be worth it. After my promotion ends, I'll be wistfully looking forward to the day my life allows me to return!

For as cheap as it is, it's good enough. The locker rooms are surprisingly clean, and I've never had to wait for a machine, even at peak hours. But I absolutely agree with all of the comments about the staff. They could at least pretend to not hate their lives. Also, kudos for being open during all of the snowstorms this year.

After going to the Hampton Village location, I had almost given up on Club Fitness (read my Hampton Village review for details).

My neighbor recommended this Club Fitness, saying that it was new and much much nicer than the one in Hampton Village. No more free weights dungeon, this place is well lit and everything is located on the ground floor.

I really don't know where to start, there are so many great things about this place.
- All the equipment is new
- Great variety of exercise machines
- Plenty of cardio equipment
- Gym does not smell like sweaty towels
- There are massage chairs and tanning beds
- Plenty of plates so you don't have to hunt around for them all over the gym
- Dumbbells go up to 100 lb, and I believe there are two sets of all the dumbbells
- Gym is very clean, probably because it's new
- Lots of parking
- Locker rooms are very clean
- Really nice fitness room
- Cardio cinema room
- Childcare provided (check website for hours)
- 24 hour gym
- Best bang for the buck

The list goes on.

There are still people that don't rack their weights and drop them, but hopefully that doesn't become a trend at this gym.

Even though it's about 10 mins further, this will definitely be my home Club Fitness.

*Note: All Club Fitnesses are not created equal.

Can't believe I'm the first one to review vandy's Rec center, especially given how phenomenal it is. I'm an avid gym goer and have seen a ton of different gyms over the years and nothing has measured up to this.

Indoor track, indoor pool, indoor field, countless group fitness classes, Racquetball courts, squash, a rock climbing wall, different cardio & weight rooms... need I go on?! I'm an especially huge fan of their group fitness classes, especially spinning and Zumba. I haven't been to a single class that has disappointed me. 

It gets particularly busy during the beginning of the semester but levels out as the year goes on. If you google the Rec center, it has a live feed of how busy it is too, just in case you're not looking to throw some elbows trying to get your workout in.

I also learned this past weekend that if you're a vandy student, your family can work out with you for free. Definitely a resource you should take advantage of if possible.

I haven't had a chance to experience all the classes that Flava Fitness has to offer- but I can definitely say that Jeni J's zumba class is by far the best in the area.

I've been dancing my whole life, so I was hesitant to try Zumba, assuming I'd be bored.   But that's never the case in Jeni's classes.  She moves at such a good pace- keeps your heart rate and mind going the entire class!  And her energy and confidence is super motivating...she never lets you give up!  The classes have a very wide demographic as well- young adults to seniors- all shapes and sizes. 

The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because this is currently the only class I can vouch for at the studio. I do know that they are constantly adding classes and trying out new group exercise ideas on a very regular basis- so boredom can never set in.

You can't beat their drop in class rates- $7 for regular classes, and I think $10 for specialty classes.  This is awesome for people like me who have irregular schedules and don't want to commit to a $60/month gym membership when some months I can't get to any classes.   I pay only for the time I work out! Additionally, they have classes at all different times throughout the day and night (not just 6am and 6pm, which are awful times for me when I work 3pm-midnight).  

The flexibility of the classes and energy of the studio makes Flava Fitness a great choice for keeping your workout regiment fun and fresh :)

I am a regular at this studio. My pick is the C2 class and some of my favorite teachers are Vera, Jane and Tricia. I like the vinyasa classes and I think there is a good amount of hard work balanced with stretching. I avoid the HPF classes since they are more like Bikram and I am not a big fan of that type of yoga. It really depends on what you like and how hot you want the class to be. 

For awhile, I was a black tag member and went almost every day. That was a reasonable price considering how frequently I attended. Now that I do not work locally, I get the packages and they break down to $15-20 per class. It's just so pricey that that is the only reason I sometimes reconsider committing to this studio. I know they give student discounts, but I'd rather see some discounts for locals than students that just try it for a week or so.

While my daughter loved this place I generally considered it to be pretty dirty and expensive. You could tell the amount of time they spent cleaning the gym was minimal to none. 

The staff was always very helpful and polite, but unfortunately some of the classes got crowded and were a little overwhelming for the staff. 

The good news is the classes helped our daughter advance fairly rapidly which is why I gave it 4 stars versus 3 stars.

This place is SO much fun! Whether you're into bouldering, sport climbing, or lead climbing they have it all. First timer or long time climber, you will feel right at home. They also do lead certification if you're interested. Staff is fantastic and you can tell they really know their stuff. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good climbing gym or want to try something new!

How have I not reviewed OT in Reno yet?!  This place is amazing.  It is an incredible workout via organized classes with awesome music.  You stay with the same "number" throughout the workout, so it is smooth and you are never fighting anyone for equipment.  You wear a heartrate monitor and the goal is to get a certain number of minutes in the orange zone, which is challenging and definitely possible.  The workout room is a "phone free" zone and I find it SO nice to unplug for an hour out of my day.  The trainers and the ladies at the front desk are THE BEST.  Definitely check it out!!

I've lived in Philly for about a year and yesterday was the first time I tried the class. The first class is free so def check it out! Each class is about 45 min. 

I like that they play upbeat EDM music- it was easier for me to get through the class. Our instructor was Tiffany and she was super nice and patient with helping us adjust our bikes and teaching the class. I think this is a great place for beginners! 

They have showers but only like 2-3 so I recommend just going home to shower. The studio is located on the 2nd floor. If I was still living in the city I'd be interested in coming back.

Love this location. This is the old Ballys location. This location is really big. I haven't been to any other location so I am not sure it they are all this big. On the lower level they have plenty of machines. Nothing worse than going to workout and you have to wait for a machine. I really like have everything is organized. Cardio machines one area, weight machines another area, free weights in another area. On the top level they have the running track, crossfit areas, theres another area with a few machines. Then they have classes as well which are held upstairs. If you have the highest package the classes are included which is awesome. I haven't tried any of the classes, but there are a few that are very intriguing to me. Then they have an aqua massager which I have used aftet everyone of my workout. It is a perfect way to end your session. They also have a stand up tanning booth, that's my next adventure. And finally they have a sauna in the restrooms. Oh speaking of the restrooms, the womens (cause I haven't been in the mens LOL) it great. They have a sitting area with tv's, it's open, plenty of lockers and nice showers. The only thing I wish they had was for the shower area big enough to have a changing area with the showers. That way you can have all your stuff right there ans dont have to go to three different areas to get ready.

Drove past this one all the time on Oracle until I randomly found it while pulling into the shopping center, and being a member using the other Planet Fitness locations, this one is so much more convenient for me and tucked away in a shopping center with tons of parking. Mostly everything is contained in one room including all weights and crunch stuff, but they have a space for the Aqua Jets and massage chairs (which I pay an extra $10 to use because it's an AMAZING deal for those!). They are very handicap friendly with lockers designated for such in the locker rooms. Good gym and friendly staff!

I've been a member for three years and I'm sold on the egym virtual trainer.  I go when I want 24/7 and I get great feedback from the app.  The gym is clean and soothing.  Great design.  I go 3 to 4 times a week.  Love the flexibility of working out with a "trainer" on my time.  I can't imagine a better gym in New Orleans. Really.

I think this gym is perfect. It does get very packed but it's the only gym in northwest and the employees are very friendly. The classes and instructors is a good change if u get bored of he same thing at the gym. The Showers are a little scary and can be alot cleaner but it's a public shower.. Think about It....Shower at home!  Other 24 hours are larger but this is an active gym.

I've met a lot of good, skilled guys who went or go to Paragon.  There's no doubt they have some of the best instruction in a 40 mile radius.  That being said, when I went to test out a class, the atmosphere left something to be desired.  

First some fat guy was making backwards comments because I don't buy their wrist wraps and wrap my hands to punch bags.  He was saying something to the effect of, "Yeah he doesn't need wraps because he can't punch hard."  Or some nonsense which i found a bit absurd from someone who has never even met me before.  I find the whole wrist wrap thing a gimmick for schools to make more money.  You need impact on your wrists when you're practicing to build strength and bone density.  Sparring is a different story, but I don't need some fat dude insulting me to other students just to make a buck or make himself look better because he was chumped into paying to keep his wrists dainty.  

Second, I was waiting on the couch with the owner's dog, and when I made a friendly joke about the dog owning the place, the owner snapped at me with, "Yeah you're in his F*CKING SEAT."  Wow, dude is sensitive about his dog or his skanky torn-up couch.  In any case, I wasn't convinced this was the school for me.  Plus I don't think yelling "F*CK" in the lobby where kids can hear is appropriate either.

Third, the "gym" section was a dirty cluttered mess with equipment in chaos in disarray.  I come from traditional martial arts background so in my Kung Fu and Brazilian Jiu Jitsu classes, and even in some of the kickboxing classes I've taken, the students don't leave the place a mess as it would be considered disrespectful to the school. 

So yeah, I'm cool with a bit of hazing when you are actually part of the school and you know the people.  But when you're a potential customer, you should be treated with respect.  No doubt if you want elite instruction you can suffer through the douchebags and learn a lot here, but as the stars point out, I've experienced better.  Paragon has no shortage of customers so it's not surprising they can afford to be less than civil with new clientele. 

Lastly, they didn't offer any packaged deal to take both kickboxing and BJJ.  You just have to pay full price for each.  So if you got over $300 a month to blow, go for it, but that's out of my range.

Oh, I almost forgot, I had funky colored hair at the time and I remember the fat Mexican guy I mentioned previously whispering comments about that to other students too.   So if insecure instructors try to act like high school bullies, I can't imagine I'd want to send my children here. 

I will say the guy who actually did instruct me in the kickboxing class was very nice, very knowledgeable, and from what I can tell, a true martial artist.  But the owner needs to do some house cleaning in more ways than one.

I've been a member twice:  04/2004-2010, then re-joined a month ago after considering and/or being a member of YMCA, Chuze and Undisputed. Nationwide locations, ADA compliance and cost were ultimately the most important reasons I re-joined LAF. 

This particular club has, so far, the best equipment for my purposes out of the 3 LAFs I've been to around Tucson since rejoining, although the other clubs are fine also, just without the Pool or whatever. 

Javier signed me up with no bs, making a recommendation that was right for me, a returning member, even after such a long absence. LAF, I gotta say, was REALLY persistent via emails. Javier was professional, a really good listener, so naturally, I left the meeting feeling I'd made the right decision. 

The facility is extremely clean, considering it IS a WORKOUT FACILITY. 

Cardio equipment is plentiful and in working order, even at peak times. I like it that there are machines available for disabled folks on the bottom level. There are lots more cardio machines on the second level. I use the tread for 20 minutes 4-5x/week. 

Weight machines are on the ground level and plentiful, but busy at peak times. I work lower body for 20 minutes 3x/week. Upper body 2x/week. 

Free weights:  Don't know, but there are lots of them. 

Classes:  Don't know. I can barely feel my feet, so I'm intimidated. 

DayCare:  Don't know. Didn't see any small children, but I wouldn't be surprised if it's available. 

Basketball Court and Racquetball:  Don't know, but they look fantastic. Wish I could still play well. 

The Indoor Pool looks sparkling, although I haven't used it, but other folks do. It's plainly visible from the first floor weight machines area. 

Men's Locker Rooms and Sauna:  extremely clean, but kinda close quarters at peak time. Sauna always at 165-180. Think Phoenix in June. 

Parking is free and plentiful, although can be a bit of a walk at peak times. 

Non-peak times:  8:30 am-3:00 pm. After 6:00 pm. Hours are shorter, but workable, on weekends and holidays. 

$35/month. No contract. Good deal for me and my health. Something to make my Doctor happy

Upon permanently moving to Nashville I needed a gym that was clean, affordable, convenient, and spacious. These qualities have been unmet except at the YMCA. I love this gym and the sliding pay scale. It is so well maintained and there are tons of options to choose from. I've thoroughly enjoyed group exercise and there seems to be something for everyone.

Travelers!! Calling anyone from out of town or in town. This gym is the best gym I have been to on the road. I travel a lot every month and to get my workout in visit a bunch of new gyms. Never have a felt so welcomed at a gym. The owners are fantastic, the front desk staff is amazing and accommodating (I had some flight delays and they let me go to a different class than the one I was scheduled for which they didn't have to do) and the teachers are some of the best trainers I have worked with throughout the country. I wish this gym was in LA. Such a good gym community with fantastic culture. Do yourself a favor don't walk, run to this gym. You won't regret it and I can't wait to come back to Indy to try more classes. Just FYI Lacy's Kettlebell class will kick your a** and Marks sports class seems amazing...wish I was in town longer!

I'm a pretty big fan of the Sporting Club. While it's not the cheapest gym in the city, it offers the widest selection of services/classes/resources for its members. I enjoy:

*It's one of the few gyms that has a decent-sized pool.
*high ceilings and lots of ventilation--none of that stale sweat smell
*wide variety of classes for all fitness levels: yoga (I've tried and enjoyed classes taught by Jung, Phil, and Penelope), Pilates (not the most intensive workout, I find I need to go for a run afterwards), and circuit training (have tried Brandon and Ramon--these classes are amazing)
