*When you sign up for membership, there are a ton of freebies that come along with it: a free massage, facial, personal fitness consultation, and discount to the sporting club store (they carry lululemon), etc.

 My one complaint is that the sound/volume control for the TVs vary for each machine, and I've inadvertently blasted music/sound into my ear on more than one occasion by accident. 

net-net, it's clean, and you get a lot of extra services, etc.

This place is amazing and you will leave feeling exhausted but amazing about yourself! I would definitely go back to this place if it only it was closer to downtown! Definitely recommend anyone who wants a fun yet hard work out, to give this place a try. I've already passed on the recommendation to some of my co-workers.

Terrible, terrible, terrible. The gym is kept up with for the most part, though some things lately have been in disrepair. Staff seems to try to enforce rules only with certain people, and only for a short period of time. (Like walking past three people with gym bags in the middle of the gym floor up to me, to tell me the small bag I have tucked under the bench I'm on can not be on the floor, despite the fact that I've had one with me every gym session since they opened.) But by far the biggest issue I have is that the gym is already far too busy, yet they insist on constantly having flea markets in the gym during peak hours. Had there been a few tables offering meal prep or fitness related stuff, I'd have no choice but to accept it, but they have tables selling candles, baked goods, jewelry, and at least once clothing for toddlers. This brings in far too many people, crowding the gym even more. I'm sure this isn't acceptable to corporate, yet I've not received any response from the emails I've sent on their site. Just keep in mind that this is what you should expect when joining this gym. Guess you can't have your expectations too high when it comes to a $10 a month membership.

This is hands-down the worst gym I've ever been to. It falls short on equipment, cleanliness, communication, and pricing. I used to belong to a Planet Fitness because I like clean, cheap, no-nonsense gyms that offer the basics. After moving to Old City, I was in search of something similar, so I bought a Groupon for 15 visits (includes regular gym visits or group fitness classes) for roughly $45. Oh man, I felt bad wasting the money, but I could only force myself to come here about 9 times over the course of 3 months. The gym itself is in an old row-house, and has a distinctly dirty feel to it. Much of the cardio equipment is broken, with no signs of ever getting fixed, meaning I'd often find myself waiting in line for a dated, wonky treadmill for upwards of 30 minutes. As far as free weights, there was only one set of 8 pound weights in the entire place. On three separate occasions, I showed up for scheduled group fitness classes, and upon arrival, was told they'd been cancelled. Are you serious? Send out an email, or ask members who care about group fitness to opt into text alerts. Continuously cancelling classes without telling your members is just abysmal customer service. And finally, the icing on the cake, is that Sweat makes its employees hound Groupon customers about joining the gym full-time. I got several calls and voicemail every week, offering me a "special limited-time deal" to convert my Groupon membership to a full-time membership. After answering two calls and declining the offer twice, I still kept getting the calls. Look, I know no one wants to join your gym and this might seem like a way to drum up business, but it isn't. It's awful and annoying, and just another reason I'd never set foot in a Sweat Fitness again. I did get an email last week that this location is now under new management that hopes to address some of the concerns I listed above, and I wish them the best of the luck, but they have a long way to go before this becomes anything close to a decent gym.

I was a member of this gym years ago, and cancelled because I ended up moving out of the area. I'm now back in the area and am a member at Lifetime Fitness. I've received literally 4 or 5 phone calls, all of which I've answered from representatives at the Radnor branch asking me if I'd like to rejoin the club. I've made it quite clear every single time, that I am not interested in rejoining but the calls keep coming. I'd highly recommend that they consider putting a system in place to make sure they do not continually reach out. It really comes off as desperate but also disrespectful of peoples time. I'm sure I'm not the only former member with this problem. Once again...NOT INTERESTED. Thank you!

If there was a way to give no stars I would have. I made a membership and after 5 days they are closing. I wanted to get a refund but they told me it's after 3 days so they can't give me a refund. Rules are one thing but we are living in a different time now. I didn't come after 3 years asking a refund I came after 2 extra days. On top of that they are closing the gyms again. I asked to speak to a manager and she started to yell at me. The manager was probably the rudest person in that whole place. I want to cancel my membership and that lady was probably another reason to cancel it. To have someone like her in the managerial place shows me how much LA fitness doesn't care about customer satisfaction.

Don't judge a book by it's cover! I had a traveling pass from out of town and had intentions of going all week until I got inside. MOSES wants his cardio machines back!!! The cardio machines are extremely outdated and need some TLC! I guess I am spoiled back home because they pretty much have all new equipment at our Gold's. The topping on the cake was the women's showers... Clumps of hair in ALL stalls! Just nasty. This would typically be a one star review but the lighting was great.

3.5 stars (Yelp, why can't we half star, yo?)

Good little gym with decent equipment. Some new some old. I had everything I needed for my workout so no complaints. 

Parking seems a little tricky. I got lucky and saw someone backing out while I was at a red light, otherwise I'm certain I would have had to drive in circles as I was visiting and am unfamiliar with the area. 

$15 for a day pass which is on the higher end of what I've paid but no big deal. 

Didn't seem like there was much more to choose from in the area in terms of an actual lifters gym. Plenty of Anytime Fitness locations but Platinum seemed the best option for anyone looking to lift weights and not just go to the #gym #so #they #could #update #their #status.

I haven't been on Yelp to review in about six months, but I felt inclined after visiting this pile of trash gym. After reading multiple articles of the multi million dollar investment in this gym I literally burst out laughing my entire workout. It is literally a construction site with a handful of machines. Every wipe dispenser and paper towel dispenser was empty, exposed drywall and studs on every wall, subflooring being built in half the square footage, dirty mop water sitting out, and the employees told me I would have to pay to transfer to this junkyard.

My girlfriends and I took a private class for a bachelorette party. It was just ok. I expected it to be more involved and the instructor to be more upbeat and exciting. We were taught some good moves and we made the best of it. The instructor was very talented but very soft spoken and mellow. The class was a good experience overall, I just expected more excitement and hype.  They do give you time for photos before and after which is cool and they even provide props. If I could do it all over again I would have had the girls wear matching cute outfits or something.  They tell you that you can't drink before the class, which I understand however, i wish we would have taken at least a few shots before just enough to loosen up. I will say though, I have a new found respect for strippers!! They make it look so easy and graceful. There is nothing easy about it! Cheers!

OMG I'm dying lol. This class will kick your butt! Orange theory just opened in center city Philadelphia and is located within the Liberty Place Shops. Orange theory is a HIIT circuit type of class and you will experience rowing, different floor with weights workout, and treadmills. Your goal is to get in the orange and red heart rate zones. Everything is brand new and super friendly staff. Every exercise is do-able it's just pushing yourself is the hard part. I brought the elite membership which is 8 classes. Four stars due to high prices, 8 classes per month will run you $139 a month. But first class is free, hoping to keep my membership til the end of summer then switch it up. Overall, a great challenge and brand new facility makes me feel like the classes are working.

Avoid avoid avoid.  Look for another gym.  Been coming here for 3 years when at airport.  Today they charged me $10 to use the gym and said I would have to pay $172 and $15 more per month to keep coming. Never been treated like this.  Especially since I've been coming here for 3 years.  I'm done with LA Fitness in this area.

Wonderful staff! So warm and welcoming! Angel is an excellent instructor: Clear, encouraging and helpful with corrections. Sarah is god too. Daniel is both desk and instructor: awesomely kind and helpful. Jordan, Karlan, Patricia, Laura/Lauren: all such great staff members! My daughter was getting married and they welcomed all of us traveling in so warmly! Such fun for MOB, Bride to Be, and Bridal Party to work out together! Thank you, OTF!

This is my least favorite planet fitness. If I'm not mistaken it was the first one we had in the greater New Orleans area. It just seems really not up to date compared to the gyms in Kenner, River Ridge and New Orleans East. The machines are older, the water system isn't automated, and the smell is so pungent. It's always the most packed and the parking lot is tiny. Often times, you have to park across the street and dodge traffic trying to make it back to the gym.

We brought our son to Combat Fitness so he could learn some striking and ju-jitsu. We were also hoping it will build his confidence in uncomfortable situations. Jesse and his crew have done a great job introducing my son to this great sport. I like forward to some amazing results 

Thanks for your time and efforts.

Orange Theory is crazy! I got my ass kicked in that hour doing this workout, but it was awesome. The place is super clean, and the instructors and other staff are really nice. 

During this workout, the class is split into two halves. One half is doing cardio while the other is doing strength training. While the actual workout itself changes, the premise is the same. 

When I went, I did 26 minutes on the treadmill. It was all intervals, and what I was doing changed according to the instructor's directions. Walkers increase/decrease the incline while runners increase/decrease the speed. The toning was 26 minutes as well and has a set of three or four workouts that people repeat until time is up. 

All the while, I had a heart monitor strapped to my chest, and my classmates' and my progress was posted on the TV. This way, I knew my heart rate at all times and strived to get it into certain zones. There were time goals for which zones I wanted to be in and for how long. 

My only complaint is not all the instructors are as good as the others. And not all the desk clerks are as efficient as the others. 

It was super hard and super fun, but I will definitely be back.

What's not to like??!! I've been a member since about 2006. I've lived in various places and have never found a place even close to TRFC with such a wide offering of water or other kinds of classes with such great instructors, esp at the price. Deborah S. gives a good run down of the amenities. I'm a water aerobics fanatic and they have an incredible offering of not only water classes but many other fitness classes and they keep up on latest trends. Instructors are terrific! Very dedicated and well trained! Staff is great, mostly very friendly. (Whenever my mom visits from out of town they're very nice to her.) I also like the body conditioning and postural fitness classes and just recently tried some of the machines, which were great. The two hotbus (one outside one in) are both wonderful as is the steam room. The women's locker room isn't luxurious but certainly nice enough and always clean. They provide a cheap towel service but I bring my own. 

I do like that it has country club amenities but at middle class prices and attitude. I wouldn't feel comfortable at a country club in the foothills and wouldn't trade my TRFC for a place like that. Facilities at TRFC are good enough, great, even. The facilities workers are fabulous, keeping the pools and hot tubs always clean and sparkling, all the workout rooms are great, and the grounds are beautifully groomed. Remodeling has been underway in different parts for some time. Right now the upstairs bar/restaurant which, according to the pictures, looks like it's going to be really nice. There's a restaurant downstairs, too. TRFC has one of the best breakfast and dinner menues in town. (Coffee could be improved and no espresso coffees is a slight negative.) Otherwise, food is great and prices are very reasonable. Service is uneven but worth the wait if you have the time. The only thing that approaches a downside for me is that singles (like myself) pay a higher price on a per person basis than, say, families or couples. I don't think that's fair, but I think it's still a great deal! And they also give a slight discount if you pay a year ahead. Parking can be a bear around 10am, but I'm lucky to live within walking distance and don't have to deal with that unless I'm short on time or it's just too darn cold out to walk! Oh, and the place has a fabulous view of the Catalinas which I enjoy immensely as I work out in the pool in a water aerobics class, sometimes with hawks flying overhead :-))

My first visit to the gym was not a good experience. I showed up explaining I am a new member but didn't get the welcoming customer service that I expected as a paying customer. The young lady at the front desk do not (or referred me to another staff) give me tour of the facility. She pointed from the front area of the gym where everything is. Thanks a lot. Really I was annoyed but I wanted to do my workout. The gym is so small. The treadmills are stacked so close that runners would have to run consecutively to not invade ones privacy. The area where the fitness class are held is small and have no privacy. No showers. The elliptical I used had dust so there's no telling when was the last cleaning. I did not enjoy my visit. Also the owner harassed me via text message at night. If he truly cared about good customer service he would have dealt with such matters in appropriate manner and in a more professional  way.
I used to love it, but they cancelled the Zumba classes

Sooooo thrilled this new fitness center opened up-- was dreading at the thought of having to go to the run down place next to my house off of Gunn hwy.
This place is super clean, staff is extremely friendly and willing to show you around without feeling like thier trying to sell you something or training sessions.
So happy with this place so far!

Front desk staff does not smile or make you feel welcome. Brooke Curley does not return calls even after calling Corporate about her to complain. Very immature and unprofessional to hold such a prestigious position as District Manager and not return your phone call. I even asked to speak to her Boss,  The Regional Manager, and they won't give out that persons name which is comical.  So In other words if you have a problem with the District Manager you're pretty much screwed and cannot speak to someone higher up! I guess I need to contact the owner of LA fitness himself Louis Welch in order to get any resolution or contact their Legal Department to report her for Age Discrimination!
Had the best time on my Bach part! Gillian is a gem, if you're in NOLA you have to take a class! She made us all feel so comfortable. Total must for a gal group!

Ok, it's been a while so time to update.  It seemed like the A/C issue in the men's locker room got fixed for a bit but now it's back to sweltering in there again. And I noticed it's cooler on the main exercise floor, so what I think may be happening is that they are simply redirecting the air from the men's locker room to the exercise floor. Not good. 

The locker room floor situation has not improved. In fact, one could write their name in the caked 
grime if they desired.   Disgusting. 

Keep in mind though, LA Fitness is owned by venture capitalists. They could care less about operations and are not in it for the long run. They will cut everything to the bone for their short term profits only to sell later. Think house flippers.

This is the original spot I signed up to train Mma!! I go to both facilities. Santa Barbara and Goleta! Just mattering on where my day ends!! Both places have high level teachers and students!! You really can't go wrong at either spot. I love the fact I have the option!! Paragon gettting me in amazing shape and ready to compete!! Thanks guys!! I look forward to many more years to come!! Shout out to Danielle for getting me an awesome deal it's hard to put a price on the applicable fight knowledge I've learned! Also Sean the owner truly is a class act!! Tyson has an awesome kickboxing class that's super fun and I see so many new students growing there kickboxing game very quick under him! Can't wait to go in tomorrow and learn some new combinations!

Here is the deal with STLFC: 

This gym is not fancy, it's not brand new, it's not full of a bunch of beautiful people trying to out look each other. 

What it is, is a gym where you can be yourself and workout with people who know what they are doing.  You come in, work out and get out.  People who work out at this gym are serious about getting in shape and it shows.  

When you enter, you are greeted by a the same staff members every time.  They have had little turnover since I started here a couple years ago.  They also have a great selection of shakes, both pre exercise or a recovery.  I love the whole menu.  

I've recently been taking the yoga classes and they are very well taught.  The instructor Ashley talks you through the posses and lends a little extra attention beginners and includes variations for the more advanced participants.  

There are a lot of classes to choose from including boot camps and cross fit in addition to the typical spinning and zumba.  

This gym also has a good deal of equipment that other gyms don't. 
Boxes to jump on, ropes, medicine balls, stretching straps, a massive ab tower, rubber weights for dead lifts, and so on.  

Before I forget, I have to include the fact that people here actually clean their equipment after they use it.  A rare thing in today's gyms.  

In the end the only complaint that I have is that turning back onto Hampton can be a challenge in rush hour.  

Get in here and get fit.

Expensive club but the location is convenient.  Equipment is old and not cleaned very often, often broken.

I was a member for 5 years, because it was so convenient - they kept putting the prices up.  Finally I resigned my membership - that was my first mistake, they keep charging you and then finally call a collection agency after you for not paying (despite resigning and not going there).

If you resign, document it carefully, cancel you credit card, notify your bank you cancelled their authroization to charge you !!!  that might work - I did all of those things and they still had a collection agency go after me.
Danielle was very thorough. Perfect haircut,included a wash. There is also a drink service to put you in the right mood.

The classes for this gym have been hit and miss in the four times I've gone. 
Two of the times the instructors were attentive to the 20-something of us, and the other two the instructors were more concerned about what was on their phone. No correction was given to students who were clearly new, or lacking proper form and were risking injury especially during punching classes. 

The class that "Sweat" takes place in really smells during the summer, and has too many students- they make it work, but it's hard to concentrate on punching correctly when your partnered up and your partner has no clue what they are doing. 

The parking around the building is okay, street parking usually isn't much of an issue if you get there with time to find a spot.

Not a lot of equipment but enough for what is needed for basic training and drills.

I'm going to preface this review by saying I hate to exercise and I'm cheap. I don't like running. I don't like cycling, or swimming. But, I've always felt guilty about not wanting to stay fit so I've always belonged to a gym. And I've belonged to many over the years (Gold's Gym in Naples, FL, Bally's Gym in Boston, Healthworks for Women in Brookline, Philadelphia Sports Club, Newtown Athletic Club). 

The problem with my joining a gym is that while most have offered a lot of classes (Kickboxing for Mommies! Zumba for Couch Potatoes!), and amenities (eucalyptus steam room anyone?), I rarely used any of them. I went in, did my workout and left. Didn't really even need a locker room because I could just put my jacket by a window. 

And I never went to the gym. Maybe I'd go for spurts, like three times a week for a month, then I'd peter out and go once a month, then once a quarter, then once a year. 

When I moved to Wynnewood a little over two years ago, I up and joined Philadelphia Sports Club because it was a stone's throw from my driveway (I knew if a gym was too far, or out of my regular driving routine of dropping off and picking up the kids, I'd certainly never go). I went regularly at first, then the visits petered out until I realized it was October 2012 and I hadn't set foot in the gym for 8 months. That's right. I don't exaggerate when I say I rarely go to the gym. At $60 a month, I had wasted $480. That was enough to get me to quit my membership. I was still not exercising, but at least I wasn't wasting money anymore doing nothing.

So when a Planet Fitness postcard arrived in the mail in early January, with the offer of a $10 initiation fee and $10 or $20 per month membership, I figured it was time to go back to the gym because it was relatively cheap. I knew all about their "no judgement zone" philosophy, lunk alarm and no frills approach toward getting and staying fit. I opted for the $20 monthly membership, which was 1/3 of what I was paying at PSC, but which most importantly lets me use the massage chairs for free (and bring a guest every visit in addition to a few other perks).

Planet Fitness is exactly what I was looking for in a gym but didn't realize it. Tons of equipment, friendly staff, clean, convenient to my house, and inexpensive. I love that I'm not paying for features I don't use, and I love the Tootsie rolls that they keep at the counter that I eat while sitting in the massage chair after my workout.

What would make PF perfect? If their "no judgement zone" mantra--which is plastered all over the gym--were actually spelled correctly.

I have been a member at the Parks for 8 months now, and have been very happy with this club.  I worked with a personal trainer, Blake, for the first 3 months of my membership and saw big results.  I toned up, and at the end of that three months I finally had some muscle definition in my arms! Excellent trainer - super sweet and so good at what he does. 

They offer lots of group classes at different times throughout the day to accommodate their members different schedules. I've taken the spin classes here and love them!  Great music and energy. I'm not self motivated AT ALL, so the fact that I show up speaks to the dedication and talent of their instructors. 

They have plenty enough cardio equipment, and lots of machines. There are free weights as well.

It's always very clean - from the equipment to the locker rooms.  Also there's a Smoothie King conveniently located right next door. I've walked next door many a day for a post workout smoothie.

Great place, affordable, friendly staff, and busy trainers.

There is only one shower, but I have never had to wait to use it.

Go check out this branch of Planet Fitness.  The first thing you will encounter is the amazingly friendly staff.  They are always willing to help and guide you along hour path to fitness.   Extremely clean facility with new equipment, bright roomy dressing rooms and hot showers. It's difficult at the best of times to keep motivated to exercise, but with being able to go to this facility it makes it a little easier.   Shout out to Jessica and Eddie. They always give a sincere hello and have a great day.

GBSB is safe and fun to be a part of. I've stuck around for the kids classes and the instructors are fun and stern and teach discipline well. The pretty girl, Marcella at the front desk is very nice and helpful and so are all of the instructors. The curriculum is solid. The classes are always useful and the instructors are happy to assist with any questions you might have. And might I add there are TWO black belt professors teaching the advanced classes (a rarity).  I've learned a lot at GBSB and it really has boosted my confidence. I am a woman, and I do bJJ at GBSB.

I's a beautiful gym, definitely love just being there. You never want to leave which is a lot to say for a work out place. My main reason for joining was a variety of classes and I have been a bit disappointed there, dance classes I've tried were Dance Jam and Hip Hip and both were a joke. Both were a watered down version of Zumba, there is absolutely NO hip hop in hip hop class and instructors were kind of bad... not staying true to count, and putting on a performance more than teaching a class. I'm an ex dance instructor myself. Also, there's a lot more paid classes than I anticipated. 

As far as machines they're all awesome and a lot I've never seen before, gym is never crowded even though the parking lot is huge. The cafe is of course super expensive. Steam and sauna rooms are always clean as well as the spa. Pools look great, but way to many lifeguards watching you.. it's almost uncomfortable. I put my feet (just feet) in the pool the other day and was immediately told by a lifeguard that I'm not allowed to do that... Apparently it was an area close to the slides even though they were not working and no one was using them. Hard to relax with like 5 of them staring at you at all times. 

But overall, I do like it... feels good going there and being there. This gym is definitely in a league of its own.

After climbing here for about 6 months, I'm still really satisfied with the gym. And in LOVE with climbing. As I said before, it's not the largest or most state-of-the-art in the area, but for pure climbing it's great. 

The staff changes up the routes pretty frequently, so it keeps things fresh. Every couple of weeks or so there are new routes to try, ranging up to 5.12+. It's frustrating when a route you're working on gets taken down, but equally exciting when a new one is put up. The bouldering walls get changed up pretty frequently too, though they could use some labeling to get around "white is really easy"... "oh try neon green, it's like impossible". Bob, the friendly and accommodating owner, is working on putting up V ratings but hasn't gotten too far yet. 

I also love the community aspect of climbing. It's great seeing some of the same faces from week to week and always meeting new people. Climbers and the staff are almost always willing to help you out wherever they can. 

Interesting fact: Victory brewing company is right next door and in the summer the beer brewing scent wafts in. Have you ever smelled beer being brewed? It alternates between appetizing and nauseating (for me at least) and smells like a combination of bread baking and something funky yet indescribable. You really have to experience it for yourself. 

Also of note, the floor is made up of little pieces of tire-like rubber. This provides a nice, soft landing. However, it inevitably follows you home and shows up in your car, your bed, your great aunt's sock drawer... not to mention all the black dirt you breathe in that comes out in your boogers the next day. Sorry to be gross, but I got the black nose Pa... *cough cough sniffle*. 

Anywho, the $240 for the six month pass was well worth it. When it expires I'm sure I'll renew it. Judging from what I've heard about other rock gyms in the area in terms of size, variety, atmosphere, location, and price, I'm fairly confident that Vertical Extremes is the place for me. Not that other places aren't great too I'm sure, but all things considered I'm perfectly happy here.

I'd all but given up on gym memberships after an awful experience trying to get out of a contract at a not-so-local place in town. Plus running is free...

But after a serious workout rut, I decided to give Let's Sweat a try. Man am I glad I did.

Because here's the thing, working out is way more fun in a group. When you're all sweating together, it's easier to get through when you want to quit. 

Plus it's nice to have someone telling you what to do in this instance.

And those people telling you what to do, the instructors at Let's Sweat, are great. Each is different, which means there's something for everyone. The classes are all challenging, but each instructor puts their own 'spin' on things -- from Julie's themed playlists to Nicole's early-morning jokes, Lauren's motivational intros to Brittany singing along to the tracks.

And Let's Sweat feels like a real community. The staff knows just about every one by name, and everyone is so welcoming. There are fun challenges and tons of ways to keep you motivated.

If you want a place to pay a monthly fee without results, Let's Sweat is not for you. But if you want an encouraging and challenging place to see really change and get a killer workout, it definitely is!

Love this Place! From the second I walked through the door not only did the staff treat me like family so did the members! My key gets me into over 4,000 locations worldwide, 24hrs a Day. Jorge was extremely helpful with All my needs and questions. They offer Classes all day/week long to fit my schedule. It's great to know they'll care and coach me to a Healthier Place.
Great clean place with a ton of equipment. Friendly front desk and Charles in the membership group will get you hooked up with a great deal in a snap.

I'm so into this workout and the vibe at the studio. Approachable and upscale all at once with positive energy and a hard freaking workout. 

My one star off is because of the smell from Penn & Beech. It can be pretty strong during class and depending on what they are mixing there it is has triggered my allergies which obviously puts a damper on a good workout.

Worst gym I have been a member of. Heck even Planet Fitness is better.

Shady tactics in locking you into contract. The manager is a jerk. The large dumbells are frequently broken. The water fountain is frequently broken forcing you to ask the staff to fill a water bottle. I have nothing positive to say about this gym.

The Monon Center has a fantastic Adaptive program that ranges from yoga, crafts, to swim lessons. I have been taking my son to adaptive swim lessons (private) for over 5years now. All the swim instructors have been fantastic and patient with him. The private lessons are very affordable too, ~$150 for 10 lessons.

I like LA fitness but wish is there was a Lifetime Fitness here in AZ....any i been going to 1st & limberlost location for some times...but when i tried another location i found out this place is so trashy, garbage, unhealthy, and lots of freeks member looking for love....in tio of messed up managment....my advice try different location to see what im talking about

Ever feel like you're about to pass out or vomit during a workout? Me neither..until I tried Solidcore.
This is NOT for the faint of heart. You spend 55 minutes working muscles that you've only heard of, and believe me, it's a game changer. 
Ever had your abs shake so hard you feel you're about to collapse on yourself? Well you're about to. But don't think this is a bad thing. You look around and see everyone on Sweatlana (what the Solidcore team calls the torture machines that whip your abs into shaky, sweaty submission) and you feel a sense of community that comes from knowing exactly how much pain every single person in that room is in. 
Perhaps the biggest incentive to come to one of these classes is how you feel about your body afterwards. Almost everyone suffers from thinking they're not 'fit enough' (whatever that means), but after one of these classes, you want to pat yourself in the back for making it through something that's insanely difficult, and feel that you're basically doing everything you can to honor the body that you have. 
Try it. You will not regret it.

I really enjoy going to this LA Fitness location. Clean, well lit, plenty of machines/weights/equipment, there is not much more that you can ask for. The staff is friendly and not overbearing or pushy. There are promotional deals at any given time of the year so be sure to ask before you join. When I first day with a gym rep to talk about pricing he advised me of the best possible deal and made me aware of the specials going on. With ample availability in both of the parking garages in Hyde Park Village, you will not get frustrated attempting to park. There are very spacious and clean restrooms with lockers as well with a scale and sauna (and hairdryer for the ladies).

The gym offers group fitness schedule with new schedules printed every week. I don't usually or take of the group fitness classes but I have been to a spin class and it was awesome. The instructor name was Patty and it was a great workout. I imagine that the other group fitness classes are great as well, as they are taught by qualified instructors. 

I usually come to the gym very early in the morning or later at night around 8pm to avoid the after work rush that the gym gets crowded with. Many of the cardio machines have TV monitors so bring your headphones or you can make use of closed captioning. There are also machines which have iPod/iPhone hookups/chargers. I feel that this gym has something for everyone :)

This 24 hour fitness is a bit special, because this is the only 24hr fitness that still use all those older looking weights, you know how new weights are all covered by plastic and rubber, and the weights this gym use are all iron.... so your hands smell after using them, and the weight plates slips easily off the bar if you don't use the clipper due to the hole in the weight plates aren't covered in plastic/rubber.   I love the lightning in the gym at night, it's like a club or something, super dark mixed with blue light and pink light and red light and it feels very private, i feel like girls can go there at night with no makeup lol.  
I don't use the pool or the steam room in this location so i can't comment on that. But the locker room is huge and clean.  Cardio machines were a bit sticky a few time i visited, so remember to wipe down before and after you use it. 
Oh also no one is ever at the frontdesk after midnight. 
This location opens 24/7 unlike the one in the South.

I was a member here 8 years ago and rejoined within the last year. Most of the equipment hasn't been updated in that long. Free weight section is fine and they offer some decent classes (even though group x room is small). I have since transferred my membership to a different retro that is further away.

I've been going here for about a month now.  The staff is the staff.  Not friendly but not rude.  Most are college aged students.  The 5:30 spin classes are pretty good.  The gym is very clean, new and never "packed."  I've never had to wait for a cardio machine and rarely ever wait for any weight training station.  Also the basketball and racquetball courts never seem too crowded either.

I don't know why we keep coming back and giving it another try. Every time we come here, I regret it. Of course my 4 and 6 year old boys love it but from a parents standpoint, it's awful. The rudest bunch of incompetent teenagers running the place. I always get the worst attitudes from the staff plus the massage chairs for adults haven't worked in over a year. Out of order signs all over the vending machines. Dirty bathrooms. I could go on and on. Again, we've come back 3 or 4 times just because there's nothing else like it close and my kids love it but honestly if there was any other option, I'd never come back.

Not sure why I didn't join this gym when I first moved to New Orleans. By paying a bit more than a usual gym membership, I get access to excellent classes (with some diverse options, like Olympic lifting, "strongman", gymnastics, etc.) in addition to getting regular access to the gym. While it doesn't have all the machines a typical gym would have, those are less useful anyways. This is also more than compensated by the fact that the gym is huge and has lots of space for lifting. If you do any weightlifting, especially with barbells, stop going to a regular gym and fighting for scarce space. The coaches are very good and the gym-goers are a good and diverse bunch in terms of experience. This is very much worth the investment. You'll get a much better and more holistic workout, you don't have to spend time planning workouts, and you'll feel like a part of the community. Only downside is (at least during this pandemic), the weekend hours suck. But if you're diligent about hitting the gym on all other days then Sunday can be an off day without it impacting anything.

Great gym. It has everything. Pricey. But if I hear  the song that goes "let me disarm you" anymore which is played several times an hour, I'm going to throw up during a set of burpees. 

Two more things:

I'm pretty sure the A/C is not on today and it's 80 degrees in the gym and, worse, the locker room. 

Staff allow members to leave dirty gym clothes, socks, swimsuits, and shoes on benches and the floor of the locker room

Nice looking gym. 
Skews on the meat head, frat boy side.
A gym where "no cell phone "use is not enforced. 
Muscle boys on cell phones. YEAH!  
Overpriced.  $900 a year????? 
A good place to show off your extraordinary
muscle bound body.
Not for the underdeveloped masses, humble or shy. 
On the plus side. Urban. Mixed. Crowd  
Rappers delight!!!!
You welcome.
Love this place!    High energy, a challenge, modifications if needed, lights are dim, cardio, and strength!

I think this must be the flagship location for the area. Everything is new and many advanced options at this location. 
They have a massive pool area, both indoors and out. It includes different zones for different levels of swimmers, including a wading pool area. They have slides indoors and outdoors for more experienced swimmers. 
They put a ton of money into this location, it is clear that they have a lot of money in a rich area to put this phenomenal location together.

Best gym ever.  I've lived in Reno/Sparks for the past 20 years and have belonged to many different gyms. It is by far the best ever. The owners are so kind, sweet, professional, knowledgeable, fun, helpful and GORGEOUS.  The members are like a little family old, young all walks of life! Cleanest, friendliest, best smelling, happiest and best gym ever.

Need free weights? Need exercise machines? Need cardio equipment? Well this gym has all that, which I consider are the basic necessities, plus some. If your goal is to build muscle, maintain, or lose fat, you can definitely get the job done here for $19.99/month. If you want to mindlessly work out and be instructed on what to do, then take a group class. This Retro offers a variety of classes. So you want a pool, basketball courts, sauna, a steam room, and an expensive gym membership? Then you should take your boujee self on over to LifeTime Fitness. 


Reason for the 3 stars... well I've run into situations where the leg extension machine was down or out of commission for a week to MONTHS (happened last year). Instead of the typical temporary fix of having a service tech repair the piece of equipment this past time, the machine was finally replaced in its entirety. IMO there should be 2 leg extension machines. And the instructor running the kickboxing class has to deal with some run down freestanding heavy bags that leaks water from the base for the duration of the class. He shouldn't have to be frequently wiping the puddles on the floor during class to ensure none of his class participants slip and fall. Those bags should be replaced. Or fill the base with sand perhaps?

This box takes you out of your "normal" fitness and into the health lifestyle and programming that your lazy butt needs. Family is the name of the game and if you're only about yourself then go find some LA fitness or whatever because that's not what Crossfit is about. Are you ready to transform yours & your kids life to the next level of Rebel health? We shall see.

Great atmosphere. Easy place to work out. Lots of motivated people. Clean. Good lighting. Friendly staff. Great variety in equipment. Hours are so-so. My only problem is it takes them a while to fix broken machines. I wished there was an expanded free weight area because it gets a little crowded.

10 to 15 years ago when I first started coming here, I thought the gym was one of the best ever.  Nowadays, with the passing of time and technology, this gym is rather average to slightly below average.  You can still get a great workout here however.  And, I'll concede per prior reviews that it's still a meat market.  Always has been.  But what red-blooded American guy is gonna complain about working out with a bunch of strippers & hot chicks?  I usually train here on my mini vacations and day trips into Reno.  There's also the location out on Neil Rd., but I usually find myself closer to this location on Sky Mt. Dr.  Also, the Neil Rd. location isn't open 'round the clock like this one is.  Most of the late-night desk agents are mindless robots.  The dimly lit parking lot can get a 'lil creepy at night, so single females should be alert to this.  At minimal, the bathrooms are probably gonna have to be remodeled soon as they have "earth cracks" running through the floor.

Lets see , it's a little on the dirty side with a slight hint of mildew and sweat in the air in certain areas. We all know those  kind of smells that come out of a gym, do you expect anything different? If a gym smells like a flower shop then by all means get up in it with the begonias!  

Again it is a gym, you come in hit up some weights, get  your "swell on" , do a little cardio  while sweating like a champ. Come in , run, walk, lift ,  check yourself out in a mirror, give a wink and call it a day. 

La Fitness I expect  a few things from you, not asking for the world and you provide it for me.

Cardio Machines~  Check
Weight lifting stations~ Check 
TVs with sports and news~ Check
Juice /Smoothie Bar~ Check
Trainers ~ Check
Women in yoga/stretchie pants~ Check

Yea we are good, a solid 2.5 stars, so I'll be kind and round it up to a 3.
Gennie was so wonderful!  She answered the phone immediately and was able to accommodate us within 3 hours. She treated my 2 girls and was so patient and chatty with them. I highly recommend her!

I have enjoyed HotWorx for the last 4 months now! It's so relaxing, and you get a killer workout all at the same time. The place is super clean! I can't wait until the mass ave location opens since it will be closer to my home. Try the free trial!

I successfully completed the 20 pound challenge down in Orange County and became a member over a year ago. I love the Camp!  I am so stoked there's finally a Camp in Santa Barbara so that I can get my workouts in when I'm visiting home.

I am OBSESSED with solidcore. I am a long distance runner/major exercise junkie so I thought that the workout would be a breeze but after my first class I realized that I could not have been more wrong. I literally hobble out of the studio every time that I take a class. This workout taps into muscle groups that I didn't know existed. The first class I took was a bit intimidating because the workout is so unique and unlike anything that I had done before but I am so glad that I stuck with it! I have seen a huge improvement in my running since I started at solidcore, especially on hills. It is a total game changer.

The studio itself is super cute and has free water and towels. All of the instructors are fun and knowledgeable, especially when it comes to modifications. While it is a group fitness class, it has a very personal feel. The instructors give great feedback, talk you through the entire workout, and encourage you to push outside of your comfort zone. 

I highly recommend giving it a try!

I think I was too harsh on City Fitness. I have a one month pass I got in the mail to try it out, and it's growing on me. the biggest downside to me is that it doesn't have the equipment I've come to know and love at the Penn Pottruck gym. if you're really into crossfit style workouts, this isn't really the place for you (unless you join Thrive and work out in their area which looks to have amazing equipment!). there are no bumper plates, and i really wish they would leave an extra barbell permanently in the area next to the leg press machine for deadlifting (there is a trap bar.. but meh). it's a small space, so they can only fit so much in. there's only one set of 12.5 lb dumbbells downstairs for example- which is a popular size with women, so if other women are lifting i usually have to wait. i also noticed today when i was leaving spin class that they do group personal training downstairs in the astroturf area and take it over which is a bit of a bummer because i love using that equipment (trx ropes/kettlebells). i'm not sure how often that happens though.

on the plus side, it's open almost all the time (5 am to 1 am) - this is HUGE for me. i am a mom and being open that early means i can work out and get home in time to have breakfast with my kiddo before work. same goes for being able to book a spot in a class online ahead of time. it's incredibly convenient. the amount of classes offered is also excellent and i like that there are classes offered on the weekends. i've only gone to spinning so far but every time the instructors have been great. the location is fantastic too if you live or work in G-Ho.

Both the trainers and the gym are great, especially for the price.  The facility is clean, there's lots of space for all types of workout.  I work with both Felix and Tiffany, and can highly recommend both.  They're both very keen on teaching good form and they do a great job of explaining how the workout will benefit.

I used to pay 3x the price in London and the trainers were "meh" compared to City Fitness!

Nice gym, however the customer service does suck bunch of immature teens, I went in there as a first timer no idea where the bathroom was and I simply seen a girl hopping around talking to guys so I tried stopping her, she totally walked passed me as well as  ignored my question as if I wasn't there. I mean why work there if you don't want to help out the public...!? I'll remember her face that's fersure.. biiiiiittttccccchh
Just came here around 9 o'clock at night to work out. The rooftop unit caught fire and they had to evacuate the building. This place sucks.

Wow has Planet Fitness fallen off or what?!

I was a member years ago here but recently came back and it's awful. I still don't like the fact they have zero heavy weights. 

This gym just isn't for anyone trying to get big. 
It's too feminine. 
And the mops they clean the floors with smell awful

First off, this is not my day-to-day fitness center, but I've been here on several occasions to take a Zumba fitness class that is offered here from time to time. Front staff is always pleasant and even though I'm only here to take the Zumba class, they tell me I have full access to the fitness center, including the showers, etc. They seem to have a nice selection of cardio and weight equipment and the place never seems very busy when I've been there. Plenty of lockers in the mens room and showers are private in that there is a shower curtain that can be used. Soap, shampoo and conditioner are provided, or you can bring your own. Hair dryers are also available along with mens spray deodorant  in case you forget your own I guess. There is also a sauna room in there as well. Overall, seems like a nice local gym, but again, I don't really live near here and only come for the Zumba classes.

First week @ La Fitness. 

First impression of La Fitness when I open the door to La Fitness the front desk receptionist has a smile and welcomes me in. It was a pleasure meeting Jesse very knowledgeable and well versed in training specifics muscle groups. Very personal and friendly which says a lot due to my stressful work load and schedule.

No issues with the workout here at all. I've done workouts on the megaformer plenty of times and I thought it would be similar. It is, but this 10x harder, in a good way. My only issue is with some of the coaches. I have a bad back so sometimes I have to make concessions. I guess I have to make sure to tell the coaches beforehand if I need to do something different because of my back. Some coaches are ok with it, and some give me dirty looks. Or sometimes you are completely ignored if you dare to use the white resistance band instead of the grey with their "10 class" rule. Today one of the coaches refused to add weight to the upper body section of the class when she moved everyone else's. Really? So I had to stop and add them myself, which annoyed me since I lost workout time during the VERY QUICK transitions. Speaking of those, I sometimes can't transition that fast, again because of my back, and the reps are halfway over by the time I get settled. All in all, a great workout, but I'm not sure if it just a matter of sticking to only going to classes that have certain coaches or accepting that Solidcore might just be too advanced for me.

I was there for the Yelp event last night and I was thoroughly impressed by the facilities and the staff. I used to work out pretty hard in college, but since then I have mainly ran, light lifting, and yoga. This class was a refreshing break from that routine. I also haven't been worked hard enough to were I feel as if I was going to puke in a long time. The quick, changing movements are not something I am used to/

The staff was energetic and encouraging. The equipment is well maintained and clean. It was overall a great experience that I will have to look into trying again. It would be nice if there was one downtown though, that is my only slight drawback.
The only gym I have ever belonged to that is not so packed during peak hours that I can actually work out during peak hours.

this gym is a horror. dirty. filthy. in disrepair. look at photos of sauna. 

photos say it all.

This place is spacious and well ventilated, the equipment has every other machine taped off, the staff is wearing masks, and customer masks are requested whenever not working out. Why not 5 stars? About half of the customers are not wearing masks even while traversing the main corridor. They're clearly not actively working out. I wish the staff would ask them to comply. They appear to only wear their masks through the front door then pull them off and disregard that everyone else is complying.

Pros: they have a steam room and sauna, they are rarely crowded.  It's an mature, friendly clientele, no gym rats, no loud club music in the work out area nor in the locker room.  I like that.  No kids running in and out of the place like at Lifetime Fitness.  While there was a hard sales pitch at the Mt Laurel location, there was not in Cherry Hill.  I will be joining at this location. 
Cons: the locker rooms are never cleaned! Seriously, the trash wasn't emptied all weekend.  The same wet paper towels were on the floor for two days.  It's a little gross. The steam room and sauna should be wiped down at least every night. However, because I like the clientele, and  quiet locker room, I bring my own disinfectant wipes into the sauna and steam room to make up for the lack of cleanliness.
Also... there are NO water fountains anywhere! So bring lots of water or you'll have to buy it there.
For the price, it's a decent gym.  If I had to pay any more than $40/mo, I'd be joining virtua, not Future Fitness.

I have been going to this gym for a few months now and I have to say the facility itself is nice and appears to be well maintained, although I can only speak to the pool facility on an everyday basis because due to an injury, that is the only area that I am able to enjoy on a daily basis. The locker rooms are pretty clean and the front desk staff is friendly. The executive assistant Ashley is also very helpful and responsive. 

So why only the three stars? 

I had referred a co-worker to this gym and she had forgotten to inform them of the referral within 30 days of her signing up so they refused to honor the free month that was owed to me (even though the referred person has to stay a member for 90 days). I am very disappointed that they would not honor their referral program on such a technicality.

Updated Review: 

While the facilities are nice and the staff friendly, the management is pretty greedy. I was looking forward to taking the boxing classes offered by Clif but I come to find out the 10 week program is $250 for Members?! Ummm WHAT?! (Non-members are $299). Not to mention I received the email notification 3 days AFTER the program had already started. Also, tanning is additional $. For the price of a monthly membership, the tanning should be free. Lastly, it's lovely that they offer soap, shampoo and lotion for the patrons but it's so low quality that they are pretty much unusable so what is the point? The clientele vary and you will find a lot of self-important showy people walking around but luckily the size allows you not to have to have direct interaction with most of them. Overall this is one of the best gyms in the area but I wouldn't call this a top notch sporting club compared to ones in other cities. Did I mention quite a few of their group classes are at strange times such as 7:00am vs. 7:30am and they while they offer quite a few during the day (not many of us have that flexibility), they have no classes after 7:30pm. It is not fun for us night owls who prefer avoiding crowded classes in the am.

Of course as a gym ages you watch two things: 1) equipment breakdown and overall facility diminishment 2) bait and switch tactics.

1) The chest press machine has been broken forever and generally things are taking a bit longer to get repaired. Some of the boards of the treadmills are sounding like they're ready to give.

2) When you can get a chair massage with a full membership and then suddenly you can't because you need to increase your monthly membership by 50%, that is a bait-and-switch. I get having new membership tiers (who doesnt want to make more money - right?) but it should be for totally new services.

So I have had to downgrade my rating but as you will note it is still quite high as gyms go.

I would suggest that they *encourage* members to report machine issues like shaky boards rather than act like youre being a "fly in the ointment" (or business model). Perhaps a repair suggestion box. This would be especially useful for those of us who have 24-hour memberships.

If I could give them a zero I would. This company charges a lot of fees. First I was charged an annual fee and they would not refund it after telling them l was cancelling membership. I was told I have to give a 30 day notice and they bill months after you have reached a year. I had my account frozen for months because I had not been going which I could go online and do. After cancelling told them to remove my card from acct. They charged $10 for paper billing. They also charged for an additional month because they said it's in the contract   This company is terrible. I would never sign up with them again and do not recommend them.

Love orangetheory!  Great coaches and really great workouts.  It's good for a wide range of fitness levels.  You decide how heavy your weights are and how fast you run on the treadmills.  I'm not sure how comfortable it would be for someone who is completely out of shape but I'm sure the coaches would figure out a good fit.  

Parking is much better at this location now. They have their own lot next door and there is some street parking. 

I'd say my favorite part about being a member of OTF is all the events and challenges they have!

I'd give a 0 stars if I could. They are all about the money an nothing else 100%. My daughter ended up with COVID so my entire household was quarantined for 2 weeks. I contacted them to let them know the situation and that me and my daughter will not be able to make it for 2 weeks so can a hold or something be done since we are affected by COVID. They said they would if I can provide proof so I sent a picture of the positive Covid test am they said that was not enough. They wanted medical records notes an so many other things that number 1 is a hippa violation to ask for that stuff and number 2 I just showed you the test. No sympathy, no cared given for what we were dealing with just every excuse to get money. I have all the texts and emails am not in collections. I've contacted KOLO 8 about how this company treats their members during Covid an when affected by Covid and hopefully they will do a story on how horrible this place is. So now I'm fighting with collections and besides all that it's a 30 minute work out you can look up online an find out what to do. There is no real training behind anything like they will tell you if you sign up it's so this this an this then yell good job an 30 seconds to go. You can pay a gym 10 a month an get more help then you can with this place. STAY AWAY

Recently came back and the place has only gotten better with more specialty equipment and custom tools for unique work outs. Our favorite place to do a good powerlifting workout and be surrounded by a great and enthusiastic community of people. There is alot of rare equipment that is fun and makes work outs interesting. The atmosphere and space have a great vibe!

Visiting town to escape hurricane Mathew and came across this gym. The staff was extremly friendly and it has one of those vibes that you dont have to worry about people watching you. Only worked out here once but had a few quick conversations with some reguals and I really enjoyed my workout.
They have all the essentials to get a great workout in and appear to offer classes. There werent any going on at the time but the large room with the wood floor was great to stretch in.

The equipment is in great shape, the place is always unbelievably clean.  It's smaller than most gyms, but never crowded.  And the price is fair, considering weekend hours are short.  Doesn't have all the bells and whistles of a larger gym - but has what I need (cardio and weights).  Glad to have it in the neighborhood.

I'm so glad to be back!!! The coaches here are AWESOME! They are nice, make sure to remember your name and fill of energy! Classes are so fun and they keep me coming back. Definitely worth trying a class if you've never been. Worth the money!

I did a session with Kyle and he was amazing! A trainer like him is rare to find. He is not only knowledgeable in Food Sciences and Physiology, but also highly experienced with how foods and workout can impact one's lifestyle, posture, and emotions. He is enthusiastic and infused with a burning passion to help others achieve their goals. If you are looking for a trainer who won't be giving up on you, Kyle is the right man to go to.

In terms of my rating for this LA Fitness, my explanation can be derived from the fact that there aren't much a variety of equipment here, and you can't rent anything. The place looks a bit old and dirty. Also, the initiation fees are too high -- I wished it could have been lowered for me; it would have been more than three-star rating.

The female trainer, S., gossips about her training clients to other clients.  Turns out, some of us know each other so you find out through the grapevine what's been said about you.  Both owners are generally unprofessional, making it a less than comfortable environment.

I've been at La Fitnesses, Planet Fitnesses, 24 Hour Fitnesses, YMCA's, college gyms, you name it, across the country. 

This LA Fitness location on Oracle is by far the worst gym I've ever been to. Total trash. Why? Employees. Employees and employees only. 

Facility is fine, great pool. Great amenities. Trouble is, the entire staff is rude, entitled, lazy and immature. I guarantee you that manager Alex wouldn't last a week in corporate B2B environments. She shrugs you off, avoids doing anything in her job requirements of watching over the staff and making sure routine work is done, all while holding an attitude that things are great we all love it here. 

No. Most everyone hates the environment in there. A mixture of senior citizens and high schoolers with many dedicated lifters of all ages peppered in there. A very non sociable, unfriendly gym. This is by far the least social and least happy gym environment I've ever been in.

So glad I cancelled and went to Planet Fitness down Oracle. Who cares about the brand image - their machines work and their employees are friendly and responsible!

If I could give this a zero star I would. In March 2020 I decided to joint Crunch Fitness on Bloomingdale. Of everyone knows COVID happened shortly after. During the state wide shutdown I attempted to find a number to call crunch in order to cancel my membership because my wife is high risk. Of course there are no general contact number because the gym is franchised.  I tried contacting the gym during the closer and was unsuccessful. So, on Monday May 18, 2020 Gym's opened as well did crunch fitness. I called them at 0800 to cancel my account. They said in order to cancel I would have to go in person or send a certified letter.  So after work at 3pm I stopped by. I learned that as of that day everyone in crunch was charged $27 which was ok if I was going to use the gym. I talked to the AM and explained that I won't be using the gym at all because of my wife's status and asked if I could be refunded my money because of COVID. Their response was "no, we are not giving any refunds. If we gave you a refund we would have to give everyone a refund."  So I spoke to the GM. At this point I just wanted my account canceled. She wouldn't cancel my account because when you initially sign up there is a 90 day mandatory period. Fine my $27 takes me to my 90th day but I still wouldn't be using the gym. The GM said oh btw in ten days you're going to be charged approximately $45 for your annual fee.  Wait what? I explained that it's not that I don't want to use the gym it's that I can't again due to my wife's condition. GM then mentioned she may need to contact her manager and get a doctors not about my wife's condition. I've called everyday since to get an update from the GM and have been unsuccessful because the GM is always busy but won't return my calls even though I leave my information. Finally someone talked to me and relayed messages between the GM and I on the phone because the GM Kirstey won't take the call. I was told " Kirstey has already passed your information to her manager and he will get back with you. We no longer have access to your account and can't change the active status."  There was no guarantee that the annual charge wouldn't be charge to my account nor that I would get my $27 back and my account was still active. I will never join a gym again nor will I ever recommend crunch to anyone.  

July 11,2020
Still waiting for their supervisor or someone above the general manager to call me.  I've made multiple attempts to contact Kirstey but she's still not responding to me. Don't know what else to do. Now I can't cancel even if I wanted to because they kept charging my account the monthly fees and you can't cancel unless your account is up to date on payments.

First, there has been a huge improvement since my last rating a few months ago. A lot of the machines are grouped by commonality instead of scattered throughout the gym. The majority of machines are in service and run smoothly.

Second, they have a nice supply of supplements that are well priced and below the competition. Their vending machine is well stocked and is no longer rejecting dollar bills for the smallest wrinkle(been there). Definitely worth a visit!

Incompetent front desk children w zero common sense. They truly just don't understand how to treat ppl. Very confrontational and nasty. There was no manager on duty so we were forced to deal w a dumb girl at the front desk who made us go all the way back home to grab some id to show her that a 37 year old friend of mine wasn't 13 yrs old.... and so they know who u say you are... as if it matters for a 20 minute workout.. clown show central. They should pay me 10 bucks a month to deal w their BS..
I love this gym.. Easy parking, great staff and owners, nice friendly members, lockers, Peaceful workout, sauna and fab shopping.. Best gym deal in town..

Let's Sweat offers fun, energizing classes in a well kept, aesthetically pleasing space. The whole team is great, however, I want to highlight Nicole for being an amazing personal trainer. I met with Nicole multiple times per month at Let's Sweat for 8 months leading up to my wedding. I've struggled to get into a consistent exercise routine since high school, and Nicole coached me to get to the healthy place I am today. She focuses on overall health and wellness, including food and exercise, that is sustainable instead of a crash course that doesn't allow you to build healthy habits. I now actually look forward to working out and enjoy eating food that's good for my body. Thank you, Nicole and Let's Sweat for getting me here!

The gym is okay - I thoroughly enjoyed my time there visiting my family for the holidays.  My wife and I live out of state. 

This 2-star rating is solely for the lack of communication and misleading information I was given when I signed up and checked in for my trial period.  I signed up online for a trial period with whole intentions of canceling before the trial was done.  I know this is not ethically sound, but I was 100% honest with the gym when I signed up and told them what my intentions were; I again mentioned this upon checking in for the first time.  I was told at check-in by one of the employees working the front desk that they would set up my trial and make a note in the system to automatically cancel after the period was done since we talked about it beforehand.  I was actually very surprised/impressed that they would do this; so I repeated exactly what they just told me back to them as 100% confirmation, and they absolutely confirmed that there was NOTHING needed from my end to cancel the membership before leaving the gym for the last time during my trial.  

One month later - billed $40 monthly membership, phone call that went absolutely nowhere, and now having to pay certified mail to confirm my cancellation with them.

I am not a lazy person, and I would have happily stopped by the front desk after my last workout to cancel my membership.  I could have spared 5 minutes of my 7-day vacation to do just that.  The ONLY reason I DIDN'T, was because I was TOLD by the gym that I DIDN'T HAVE TO.  I even repeated it back to them and they CONFIRMED.  

I'm not pissed about being duped $40 for the membership when I live 7 hours south of West Chester.  I'm not pissed about the money I'm going to have to spend this afternoon to drop a certified letter in the mail to officially cancel my membership.  I'm pissed because I was straight up LIED to by the gym - and they acknowledged nothing after the fact.

I was interested in personal training and found PPT through Yelp and Google, their reviews really impressed me. After doing my research, they really seemed like the best option. I got started back in May and the reviews are great for a reason. It completely lives up to the reviews.  This place is amazing. Brian, who owns the gym is really personable and it seems like he genuinely cares about helping people become the best version of themselves. 

Rachel's name is mentioned a few times on here, and I'm fortunate enough to have her as my trainer as well. Rachel has a great sense of humor, she's approachable, helpful and she's a fantastic motivator. She's available whenever I text her and has really personalized all my workouts. I feel like she really hears me and is rooting for me. Can you ask for anything else in a personal trainer? She's incredibly knowledgable and helps me understand anything that I have questions about. I look forward to all my sessions with her, but I also look forward to my at-home workouts- she picks exercises that challenge me, but also I'm never bored, and that was important to me. I feel like I came in with a small list of things that were really important to me and all my needs and expectations have not only been met but also exceeded. Cannot recommend PPT enough!
Great reformer class with new owner Chris Cantrell! I'm so happy to find a STOTT instructor  who is really willing to challenge you safely!

Sometimes it's crowded, now that I've been going a while, the trainers finally leave me alone...  when I first went they were like vultures.

It's convienient, staff is ok, they do their thing yakking on the phone and are not very attentive, but I don't need 'em for anything anyway.

Kid's club is convienient.  Manager (skip?) is ok, he does his thing

For some reason my husband LOVES Applebee's. While we were out running errands last weekend I agreed to go with him. It was pretty much what I expected I guess, nothing to write home about. I got the pick 2 with a chicken quesadilla and Cesar salad. Lesson learned - dressing on the side, it was just too much for me. The quesadilla was ok, nothing special. I LOVE cheese and I thought it was a little heavy on the cheese. 

We sat at the bar so that we could be in & out quickly... it really was quick!

This place is not a gym, more like a cardio house with some gym equipment. Majority of the gym is dedicated to cardio with small areas for weights. The free weight room is pretty tight and the machine area is even tighter. All the equipment is brand new. The machines have buttons on it, presumably to count reps and sets but it doesn't work. The cable weights don't have a pin but a lever system. The bad thing is there is only one so folks doing flys using both sides will pretty much take the whole cable machine. The squat rack is way in the back with a mirror behind it. The locker rooms are small, I mean really small. Talk about awkward when changing.

The location went through a remodel so there is some newer equipment and the lighting of the whole facility is brighter. This location is the most convenient for me so it's  why I made this my home location. Sadly there still are personal trainers even though you aren't supposed to have them and no one ever regulates people on their phone talking
 or folks not cleaning machinery after use.

New owners bring true pride of ownership.  The place is small but had pretty much all you need.  If you are looking for a small, less busy, no screaming muscle monsters, check out this place.  Open 24 hrs.  Price is about $30/ month.  I will never go back to LA Fitness.

This YMCA rules!!!! It's as nice as a country club and has any amenity you could possibly want. The regular gym area is always clean, has tons of machines and a nice lay out. What I use this gym for mostly is the classes, however, because I do most of my cardio outside. The classes are great, the equipment is clean, the gym is nice and they are usually not too crowded. All the bathrooms and locker rooms are clean and big and the building in general is just very nice. I love love love love this Y!

I've been going to this gym for many years primarily due to price and location. However, I've noticed over the past 2 years that the staff has been constantly changing. Initially when I would check in they would know my name and say hello, now nothing. A majority of the machines need to be repaired, yet it takes weeks and months. Many times there are 3-5 staff members behind the desk on their iphones, eating or just talking instead of working. Perhaps the staff could use their time to clean/check machines, clean the bathrooms, etc - do their jobs. Think it might be time to check out Lifetime Fitness.

Went here today with my 8 year old daughter for Sat. morning childrens hours. She was allowed to use the pool with me. I think this is wonderful policy. I do not know any other fitness club in philly that allows children to come with parents unless they are in a childcare area. I found the club members to be very friendly, not like other gyms. I did not have much interaction with the staff. Loved all the amenities in the club and locker room. Impressed with everything about the atmosphere of the club with the exception of the cleanliness. They could deffinately work on that! Ate at the cafe which had made to order breakfast starting at $4. Nice after a great work out.

I climbed here several times before finally joining a few months ago.  I used to belong to Vertical Extremes in Downingtown, but switched to Oaks mainly b/c it's much closer to work and home.  I've been to most of the rock gyms in the area (PRG Valley, Vertical Extremes, Doylestown, North Summit in Windgap), and PRG Oaks is smaller than most and also quite popular, which makes it more crowded.  Nonetheless, it's a fine place to climb, and clearly I wouldn't have joined if I didn't like it there.

You can get stats on number of routes, height, etc. from their site (I don't want to misquote), but the top rope area does feel smaller than most gyms (also a lead-only wall).  The bouldering wall is pretty substantial, mostly overhung to varying degrees, plus a slab bouldering wall.  There's a good variety of top rope routes, and routes along the fake crack are some of my favs.  However, they do seem to lack a certain creativity in setting routes.  I like when a route requires creative technical moves or interesting body positions.  Most of the routes here are more straight up hand-foot-repeat, and difficulty is achieved by tougher and fewer holds, rather than technical maneuvering.  Not to say they're not fun and different - but uniqueness and interestingness could be increased.

The staff has always been friendly, as has everyone I've talked to in general.  Patrons range from life long climbers, to first timers, to kids' groups.  I'm constantly getting schooled by tweens and old men (but so it goes in climbing).  As I mentioned it gets crowded on week nights, but the large groups tend to clear out by 8pm or so, and the last hour 9-10 is usually pretty empty.  They also have women's climb on Tuesdays and Saturday mornings which I've never gone to but it's a cool idea - any female can come and climb with other women to swap belays, tips, beta, etc.

I disagree with some of the points from another yelper.  I don't find the gym dirty (sure it's chalky and I wouldn't eat off the floor, but it's a gym).  And I don't feel like it's a meat market.  Sure there are some muscle boy boulderings trying to show each other up, but the crowd is diverse and includes plenty of women.

So a solid 3.5 stars.  More creative routes (that also change more often) would bump it up to 4 stars.

Music is played way too loud, students don't respect the silence in yoga room before practice and instructors/ managers do nothing to enforce, instructors show you how to do none of the moves during class, poses overall are crap.. the Locker rooms were nice so the stars are for them.

do not use pool or jacuzzi...tainted with soooo many chemicals your skin will scream at you...yes..using all caps cause my $50.00 suit top is ruined after 20 minutes..
i complained to the mgr.. los of shrugging of shoulders and mumbled bring in the receipt. .

Have been a member for 3 or 4 yrs now, trying to get back in the habit of working out. Have never been a member of the large chain gyms, so I don't have another experience to compare it to.
With that said it is a nice gym, generally not crowded, but when it is crowded it can be a hassle to work out because the equipment you want may be in use by someone that doesn't understand the concept of sharing. Earlier this year they rearrange a lot of the equipment to make room for a large barbell setup. The new layout put equipment that I used all the time in odd locations, and now some things are squeezed for space.
The one thing that drives me crazy is the music they play...the base clientele here are mostly older 50+..we don't listen to Pop, Hip Hop, Rap Crap, Disco, Dance Club, Top 40 14 yr old mind numbing music! But maybe that is what the big chain gyms play also..I don't know, but when I am there just some good old rock n roll, blues, or Motown would do.

I had a great time testing out this gym for a week. They have great classes, and tons of machines.

The membership contact, Jill, was really friendly and showed me around, told me how to use the facilities, showed me all the rooms and made me feel welcome to come in anytime during the week and try out the classes, equipment and empty rooms for workouts. 

Another nice thing is they do have spare rooms, and members are welcome to go into open rooms, hook up their music and use a private space to practice yoga or do a private workout. 

I also went to the Ring In The New Year Expo, which was so much fun. They had chiropractors, I was able to use the Pilates reformer and receive a free demo, and they had a day full of a variety of class, all open to the public. I tried  a Pilates class, which was great, not too challenging, but certainly not easy. You could see how the instructor was tailoring it to different experience levels, which is something I always look for. 

Unfortunately, even with a corporate discount, it's still 80/month for 1 person. But, if you're that's a price point you're comfortable with, this seems like a great gym.

SST is the place to be!!! If your looking for a facility that is caring and capable this is your spot. The staff is amazing!! Kind, knowledgeable, and genuinely want to help you achieve your goals. I have been here for a couple months now and I enjoy each session more than the last. I can see myself getting stronger and having more confidence in my lifting.

Crux: It's a decent gym, BUT sort of makes me vary to deal with then because of AT&T like CONTRACTS! 

So, I got on to the three month membership plan with this GYM and used it from Nov-15 to Jan-16 and let me start the review by saying that the GYM is fine. I have seen other GYMs which are bigger or better than this one; however, for all my needs and requirements this one sufficed.
