Do keep in mind though that I was an infrequent visitor and did not use any of the several classes they offer, so take my review about the GYM quality with a grain of salt if you are a frequent user.

Now the reason behind my poor rating. I cancelled my membership here in January '16 and have not been a member since but City Fitness still tried to charge my debit card for February without authorization. I reached out to them and they said that I was on a CONTRACT! Upon resisting the logic I was told that it was a mistake and was assured that this will not be repeated and that they cancelled my membership. 

NOW, fast forward 6 months, I receive a letter from a COLLECTION agency for a GYM bill from January to July, and it is ~$500. GYM that hired them- City Fitness! I was surprised to say the least. While I am willing to give the benefit of the doubt that this could be an honest mistake, I am afraid that this might be a repeat behavior since there are several other reviews here that lament similar troubles with City fitness. We expect highest form of professionalism from any business in our neighborhood and I hope City Fitness is quick to resolve this. 

To my fellow Yelpers, I promise to leave an update to this review to keep you posted about how this pans out so you know what to trust and what to best avoid!

I have been coming here since 2010 when I lived in Fishtown then I moved to South Philadelphia so I figured that I might as well join a gym closer to home plus I got a new puppy. After a few months at Bally's I was so disappointed that I decided to return to City Fitness. Now, I couldn't be happier and I go to the gym more often. The equipments are in great shape, the facility is air conditioned and clean. The locker is a little small but that's not a deal breaker for me. The staffs are very nice and helpful. Parking can be a little tricky but if you live or work in the area just walk there. I'm just so glad that I came back and I was surprised by all the improvements when I came back.

Beyond frustrated. I've been a member of LA Fitness for about a year and a half. I signed up for personal training sessions about 8 months ago. 

For 6 months I was charged $260/month (for 4 25-minute sessions)... on top of the $43 a month I was paying just to go to this gym. 

My trainer was lazy. Never pushed me. Wouldn't pay attention to set counts. Never set goals with me. Talked the whole time. And never worked on a diet plan with me. He cancelled several sessions on me the morning of and would show up high and reeking of marijuana. Twice now he didn't even call or cancel a session that I showed up for. 

After my 6months of training was up I was still being charged 260/month for the sessions I still had on my account (that I paid for). 

It's been a stressful last couple months. I finally cancelled my membership and training. Came in at 7am today to use the last training session on my account... which my trainer confirmed last night. And he no call/no showed. I asked the front desk if he called and they didn't seem surprised at his behavior. 

For a "professional" Fitness corporation I'm very disappointed. Taking my money to Life Time Fitness even tho it's farther for me to drive.  Will never come back to La

I've been a member of this location since it opened last January. Overall, I've had a good experience here. The facilities and bathrooms are clean, the class schedule is varied, and the gym is not overly crowded if you go off peak hours. Every gym is nuts if you go during peak hours, so this isnt a fault of city fitness. However, my main complaint is the exclusivity of class sizes and how hard it is to get into a class. It has become extremely difficult to enroll in a class (ie barre, bodypump, etc). You have to set your alarm for exactly 25 hours prior to the class time, and if you do not click enroll during the first MINUTE the class fills up. So frustrating. What's even MORE frustrating, though, is that people have been sneaking into classes without being on the list and making the classes even more cramped and crowded. The instructors take attendance and have even called people out for not signing up, but the sneaky people dont leave and it causes the people that actually signed up properly to not have equipment. I primarily use the classes, and its been very frustrating that people have not been signing up and keep sneaking in. For that reason, I cancelled my membership and next month will be my last month.

My husband and I love this gym! We are here at least 3x a week, he goes more than I do. We have tried different gyms and we actually switched from anytime fitness to here. Yes it's not 24 hours but who really wants to work out at 3am? I don't mind them closing at 11 because that means it's time for my butt to go to bed! 
My only complaint is the hot tub has wayyy too much chlorine that it burns my eyes and makes it hard to breathe so I can't stay more than 5 minutes. But I've been around and it seems like that's the case with most gyms. Nice pool, nice equipment, never had a problem with the staff. If something breaks it is usually fixed in a timely manner. 
I personally don't take the classes but I do enjoy the fact that all the classes are included in the membership for free, most gyms charge extra for that sort of thing. Although anytime fitness is closer we don't mind making the drive here! 
Plus this location is in the same plaza as a Publix, Chipotle and First Watch! Bonus points!

So this is just my personal option and preference when it comes to academies. Let me start off with, the guys who trained there were solid. All mat monsters. Really friendly and good training partners. The reason for 3 stars is just a way they (all gracie barra's) run their programs. Just not a fan of the fact that you have to buy there gi's or you can't train there. Also, the whole attendance card thing was really weird for me. 
I had just moved to town and was searching for a new school to train at. They allowed me to come try the place out for a day or two. First day was great. Second day...well yeah. The instructor seemed pretty irritated that I didn't have a card (even though i was testing the place out) and that i was wearing one of my old gi's. 
BUT let me be clear, the instructors were exceptional. Just very traditional. Great bunch of guys, just not the right fit for me.

I don't want to speak to highly of this place, because I don't want to have to start waiting for equipment and parking.  But this is the best gym in the City.  They offer everything you want in a gym..brand new machines (cardio/weight), fitness classes, towel service, parking, a nutrition/protein shake bar, hot trainers, reasonable prices a place to stretch, and personal TV's on all the equipment.   The knock, is they don't have anybody clean the equipment, and some of the staff are a bunch of arrogant douche bags.  

That being said, I lost like 12 pounds.

Of all of the places to get your ass kicked... This is the best. I've had a great workout every time I've been here. It's definitely a change in pace coming from the gym. Great way to workout your entire body and learn how to lock box. 

Their 7 day trial is also pressure-free. I've brought multiple co workers to try the workout with me and haven't seen the sales pitches like they do at certain gyms. So come give it a shot and you'll walk out sweating.

This place is awesome! A friend dragged me here after spotting an event on facebook called B cubed (B^3) = Bikes.Bootcamp.Brunch. 

For $25 you got a 30 minute spin session (courtesy of Russell who is also the owner and is fantastic!), a run to the art museum (which I skipped and drove to the art museum cause I parked on the street, oh, and I also hate running!). Then a 30 minute boot camp session on the steps of the art museum which was a collabration with Fit Academy owner/trainer Osayi Osunde (which was brutal). Followed by a free bloody Mary or mimosa at Urban Spoon.

Best $25 bucks I have ever spent. Russell is great, personable and encouraging. He helped get me set up on my bike. His staff (Erin) was great too. 

The space is clean and organized. This business should definitely be supported.
Shitty gym ever!! Rude  customer service. Dirty !! Leaving joining a new gym cleaner nicer and child friendly!!

Horrendous Customer Service - I received a flyer in the mail that advertised $0 enrollment fee with a promo code. I figured I would try this gym, but when I entered the promo code, it was invalid. I contacted Retro Fitness TWICE about this issue, and received no response whatsoever. So I figure that if the customer service is this horrible just trying to JOIN the gym as a new customer, the service inside the club must be even worse! This experience shows that they don't care about membership or their facility - they're just outright lying by sending out invalid promo codes!
Wish I could rate it ZERO STARS!

I go to multiple locations for LA fitness, but this one is convenient when I'm in Oro Valley. It's one of the newer locations, and it's always clean and in kept condition. When I do go, usually on Wednesdays around 5pm it's not very busy and there aren't your typical gym rats. I've worked with trainer Jimmy as well. He has great energy and will keep you motivated to stay on track. He's great! There's a smoothie place on the gym too. I haven't been yet, but I feel it's a nice touch for all gyms.

My first time ever attending Barry's, not once did anyone welcome me or offer any assistance during the class. I told the front desk that I had some concerns about a previous injury, and she told me that she would tell the instructor. The instructor, Devin, was rude, unhelpful, dismissive, and condescending. I am not sure whether or not he got the message about my injury, but even when I explained it to him myself, he failed to suggest any reasonable modification to accommodate my concerns. 
Thankfully, a "class"mate was kind enough to explain the various moves and answer any questions I had about the class-- again, this person was NOT a Barry's employee but someone PAYING to attend the class. I would not recommend unless you happen to be part of the *elite* super-fit Barry's crew. Very disappointed in my experience, as I had expected a much friendlier, welcoming, and encouraging environment.

Beautiful studio in Fishtown with really unique and awesome class offerings. So far I've been to Zumba and Buti Yoga (first time trying this and it was SO FUN) and I'm excited to try DDP live. I don't think anybody else in the area offers it.

Somehow they've managed to cultivate a really welcoming energy that I haven't found in other group exercise setting in the city. I always feel like I'm part of a community, there's no competition, and the instructors and staff are super supportive. Truly a judgment free zone.
This is definitely one of the nicer Club fitnesses (that doesn't tell you much tho ). But, it was very difficult to cancel my membership when I moved. Look out for extra charges.

I have been to Barry's bootcamp in a variety of different cities and each time I venture out it just gets better and better. You're greeted by the people at the front desk and I don't know if it's the Tennessee hospitality or it's this location but everyone was SO NICE and helpful. I wish I got everyone's names but they were all so sweet. 
The coach leading class was amazing. The workout was exactly what I needed after a weekend of being a tourist to the full extent. Overall highly recommend this location and I can't wait to visit again on my next trip back to Nashville!

Well, I ve been at la fitness off and on over ten years.   The one on first is my 
Home gym but I can go to any location..
Classes are included in the membership   
It s a clean gym, very well set up for free weights..  
There is a 3 lane pool that looks very clear.
They gave me a very good rate for returning, so good , I added my wife as family. That's a first..

I did a lot of comparing here in town, and for the equipment avail and being 
Relatively uncrowded, I chose this one..

I began going to Fitness 1440 about 6 months ago when they opened near Kroger on E Thompson. I usually go before the staff arrives since the gym is conveniently open 24/7, however, when I do see staff members, they are always friendly.  The gym is jam packed with equipment which is a little overwhelming and difficult to maneuver around during workouts, but if you are looking for special equipment they probably have it.  I do wish the old treadmills would disappear and the gym was a little less crowded (equipment). I've never worked out with more than 4-5 people in the gym which is nice as well. Over all I'd recommend but suggest removing some of the equipment that may not be necessary to create a little less of an overwhelming, claustrophobic atmosphere.

I really love this gym. The staff is friendly and I always see them cleaning something. In the bathroom, upstairs, downstairs, wherever. I work across the street at the new American bistro and walk across everyday to get a little exercise. I like to wipe the machines before and after I use them bc I know people forget or don't care. Best ten bucks I spent this year.

Most of the time I am happy going to 24 Hr Fitness.  They seriously need a maintenance crew though.  In the summer, the air conditioner breaks and it can get stiffling hot in the exercise room.  In the winter, the roof leaks and there are buckets all over, A couple of times a year, the speakers break and classes sometimes are cancelled.  
I go for the Zumba.  The Zumba classes at both North and South are loads of fun - I really like the instructors.  Aida is full of energy and enthusiasm.  Keeps you going and burning lots of calories.  Emma works you and you know you've gotten a good workout after having a class with her.  Elvia gives you a real "feel good" feeling after taking Zumba with her.
Staff are always friendly at North and South and greet you and always tell you to have a nice day when leaving.  The gyms are always pretty full with people using the weights.  Bathrooms and showers are clean.  24 hour South has a pool and both places have jacuzzis.  Machines are well maintained and up to date.
I've been with 24 hour fitness since the early 2000's.  Rates are reasonable.  You get the most out of what you pay if you go.
5/13/17  I'm upgrading my review to reflect the great workout I got today at both 24 hour fitness North and South with Emma and Aida.  What a team!  I believe the instructors really make the classes and are responsible for members to keep coming back to the classes.  Zumba is my favorite class.  Today the music was lively, easy to keep a beat and definitely sweat producing.  24 hour fitness, focus on your good instructors and I guarantee you'll have members breaking down the doors to come and experience the classes you have to offer!  Great workout - I feel great!

This is probably my favorite place in town to workout. If you haven't tried it, DO IT. Besides the fact that the staff is incredible, Emma (the dog) is the cutest, and they are always playing good music, Getfit615 is more than a place to sweat. I feel good when I leave. This is not necessarily because I worked my butt off (which you will if you come) but because there is something about this place that helps your mental health as well. Everyone is friendly. You are bound to meet someone interesting in the class or an instructor who will introduce you to something really great. Kate, the owner, is one of the most genuine people I know. Sign up for her newsletters too. They are always doing fun fieldtrips or dropping some serious knowledge about life :)

About a month ago I visited this business to ask some questions, but the employees refused - literally - to even speak to me unless I provided personal information for their system.  This is not an exaggeration.  I left a review of my experience on Google and the manager, Jim Dill, left a response telling me to contact him via email.

As Mr. Dill directed I contacted him by email to ask some questions about the facility and their participation in the Silver Sneakers fitness program for those of us on Medicare.  This is not a "free" program - it is something we pay for through our Medicare insurance premiums. Instead of answering some simple questions not answered on their website, Mr. Dill determined my request was unimportant and that any issues or concerns I had were all about his wants and preferences and told me I had to return to the facility to receive answers to my questions.

Thinking I might have failed to effectively communicate my needs with him I decided to try it his way again and responded to his insults by letting him know when I'd be by to discuss my issues with him.  Mr. Dill made it clear that he was too important to meet with rifraf like me, but he did provide the name of one of his employees he claimed would assist me.

I arrived at the appointed time, introduced myself to the employee at the front counter, and said I was there to see _____ (name withheld because I was not permitted to see him so have nothing to say about him), the person designated by Mr. Dill to assist me. Although the employee who greeted me was personable and friendly, her only mission was to pump personal information about me into their system.  She refused to contact the person I was there to see until/unless I acquiesced to their invasion of my privacy.

I don't know if it is a failure to communicate within their organization or just the example set by management, but trying to deal with them is about as distasteful as anything I've done in a long time. This is not faulting the employees - they are doing their jobs as the boss tells them to.

This place is the best! My teenager had been fighting lice for a while. I tried the store bought solutions and they never worked! I found this place on the Internet and took my chances. Thank God I did! Even though I called on a Friday, and I live 1.5 hrs away, and I couldn't get there until 7pm, Gennie without hesitation said that was fine! She was super nice and welcoming and explained the whole process, which was so simple! No chemicals or lengthy processes. She gets rid of everything and then shows you how to prevent new infestations. You leave with directions and the comb to keep your scalp healthy! She checked me as well to make sure I didn't have any and did not charge me extra (like the first business I called was going to do)! I highly recommend them!

I noticed all these reviews were pretty old, and thought I should let you know that RH&F has NEW OWNERS who have replaced most of the equipment, spiffied the place up, made the bathrooms inviting and are open to any suggestion for improvement.  They take a personal interest in the gym.  As always, the staff is awesome and there are a new calendar of optional classes such as Zumba.

I see a repeating theme of unfriendly and unhelpful staff, especially the daytime manager, and I totally agree. Any suggestions/complaints are met with a "no can do" attitude. Because issues aren't addressed, people give up trying. Please don't confuse a lack of complaints with improvement of the situation. 

For example, for years we have asked for more cooling in the spin room and have been told an additional fan was about to be installed. Never happened. Same with the room used for yoga. We were actually told the room would be cooled for "actual exercise" classes. We were also told that each instructor was asked and said the temperature was perfect. Odd that each instructor has asked us to complain to management about the heat- it's very stuffy always and uncomfortably hot most of the year. Members have requested better cooling all the way up to corporate. 

Also, we have asked repeatedly if while yoga is in session, racquetball players could be asked to use a court other than the one that shares a common wall with the yoga room- assuming one is available. We have been told that is not a fair request to make to those members. None have ever objected the move when we ask so how hard could it be to post a sign on the door during yoga classes or assign a different court? 

There are lots of classes offered and the yoga and spin classes I take are great. Especially Liz and Sunday morning yoga. She puts a lot into her classes including use of blocks, straps and essential oils. 

LA Fitness is a value for the monthly rate for sure. The Marana management and front desk staff needs an adjustment.

Usually love this gym but this morning when I was coming in the maintenance lady was windexing the door and it took me a minute to realize to go to the other set of doors and she said," 4 fukkin doors and you try to go through this one. Shiitt." In the most rudest way.

Not exactly the way I want to be greeted in the morning. Thank you for totally ruining my good mood and day now.

Ok.. this place is honestly my second home.  I joined a little over 2 months ago and have gone from 4 days a week to everyday.  When I walk in I am made to feel like a celebrity by the staff (although I kinda am)... they greet me by name, they know my family (we all go).  The members are all really nice, they speak or nod and smile.  

The classes are AMAZING!!!   From yoga with Sati and Juanita, to Zumba with Gail G, to asskicking---- I mean kickboxing--- with Mark.  It's great!  All levels are made to feel comfortable but pushed.  I've gone to several different gyms and have never felt the level of comfort I feel when I'm here.  

Clean facility, warm pool and hot hot tub with clouds on the ceiling and peaceful music.  Good exercise equipment, nice tvs. I can't say anything bad.  Well, parking is sometimes a challenge as other businesses use the same lot, but if you are patient you will find something.  

Love it!!

I'm not sure I can express how much I enjoy CycleBar by just 5 stars. If you enjoy fitness, getting our butt kicked and rocking out to awesome tunes - this is the studio for you. 

My absolute favorite classes are the Friday happy hours with Chris S. He's the perfect combination of entertaining and energy that one needs when they're getting their pre-weekend work out. 

The studio offers shoes to allow for a better ride when you're clipped in. Be sure to take advantage of the water bottle and snacks pre or post ride to energize your bod! As a note: check the weight of your bar at your bike - could come in hand for the arm part of the 50 min ride. 

All in all the technology and cycle stats that comes post ride really allow you to monitor your own success. It's always your ride - but the instructors encourage you to push yourself! 

Big fan. I'll be back many times!

I'm so obsessed with and addicted to all things Barry's Bootcamp. I don't live in Nashville but am here for work regularly. The banana nut milkshake is great after a workout. I usually go to Eve's classes and she seriously kicks my butt. The next city I move to has to have a Barry's.

I always love coming here. Staff is great and the equipment is new. Michael does a wonderful job of helping people with classes. 

I'm a black card member so I can go to any Planet Fitness in US. No  gymtimidation!
Signature my ass. There is no difference from this club in any other LA Fitness and The management sucks

Came here on a trial day pass because I live in Los Angeles.  This gym has the necessities.  Really nice staff. Some equipment is dated, but hey... it's still just as heavy so Shut up!  Sorry. 

Had a great workout here while waiting for my sister who was at a wedding I wasn't invited to.

I recently signed up for this gym and hopefully Yelping about it will be another step to hold myself accountable. Daniel and I have been talking about joining a gym and getting fit for awhile now, but it wasn't until his coworkers all started coming to this location that we got motivated to check it out.

French Riviera is on the entire second floor of a retail building. There isn't a sign for it in the parking lot, so you kind of have to be paying attention for the lit up upper floor and big red signage. The space is very large and has lots of different machines, as well as quite a few multiples of popular ones (treadmills, bikes, etc). They have a lot of televisions set to different channels, any of which you can listen to by plugging your earphones into the machines. The women's and men's locker rooms apparently are both connected to a sauna and spa, although I have not checked that out because I don't really know what that is. It makes me think of the scene in Gilmore Girls where everyone's wearing towels and Luke has to convince the town elders to sell him a house. 

One of the biggest draws for me is that French Riviera has a ladies only workout section! There is a smaller enclosed room that it for women only, with weights, machines, bikes, treadmills, etcetera, which is nice when you don't want to be ogled and/or feel intimidated by male Jersey Shore emulators grunting and sweating (tragically, no Snooki look-a-likes have yet been spotted).

They also offer a variety of classes throughout the week, from yoga and pilates, to cycling (which looks super intense), and Zumba, which looks like, to me, aerobics dancing mixed with hip hop and cumbia/salsa? Attending classes is included in the cost of membership, and they offer them from morning until evening. 

The customer service is excellent. We were welcomed, taken on a tour, then allowed to work out before going to into any details about joining etcetera. Brandon C. is awesome; since I have never worked out before, he actually gave me an orientation (before we even signed up or paid or anything), on how to use various machines, explaining what weights did what to which muscles (clearly I don't really get this yet), and advising me on how many repetitions to do, paying attention to what hurt, etcetera. 

Because we brought in an online free trial membership, we were able to sign up on our first visit for $50 registration. Other gyms I've looked at in the past such as Anytime cost at least $100! And our monthly rate is $32, again, less than my friends pay at Anytime, or what my sister pays in Atlanta for LA Fitness. 

For those who are afraid to make the drive to Metairie, never fear! There is a location on Carrollton and Earhart, and also they are supposedly opening one in Gentilly soon. They also have 2 locations on the West Bank (including one on Behrman right by Hong Kong Market). However, Metairie's is definitely open 24 hours, while I'm not sure about the other. 

*Another note on customer service: Last night, I lost a necklace given to me by my sister for my birthday. I was really upset and went to look in my car and in the parking lot. The girl working the front desk saw and asked me what I was looking for, then went around the whole gym with me to check for it, even though I had only just started working out. She checked under machines, in the couch... sadly we did not find it but it made me happy that she tried so hard and told me that if anyone turned it in, they would definitely let me know. 

**Yelp Tip For Non iPhone Users!: Sign up for a Free Trial here, http://rivierafitnesscenters.com/member_free.asp, print your ticket, then bring it on your FIRST visit. It'll allow you to register for $50 instead of $165. Again, ask for Brandon C.; I think he's only there Monday, Wednesday, and Friday but I know he will get you the best deal he can. 

Also, mention my name as a reference because you like me!

Great place! Chill, relaxed. Friendly clientele, helpful staff that remember you after a single visit, great student price... We got the punch pass so we can fit climbing into our complicated schedule, all because we had such a great couple of visits here!

Reverse Aging is great.  They are what the say they are. They have several saunas available, usually 3 of them.  I haven't had to share yet.  Plus lots of things I haven't  tried yet.  I go weekly.  I really like the foot massage and exercize machine that you stand on and it vibrates. It's been helping my back.

The jury is still out...

I reluctantly joined in January- the Yelp reviews for the gym are pretty terrible but I needed to join a gym that I can access when I travel out of state. 

I have enjoyed some of the fitness classes. The gym does waiver between clean and gross on a daily basis. I've gone to the gym right when it opens in the morning, to find bottles of water and tissues on the floor, and equipment where it doesn't belong (e.g., weight room equipment in the training area, equipment attachments strewn everywhere). It is clear that the gym does not always get cleaned in the evening after closing or before opening in the morning. There also appears to be high attrition with the personal trainers, which would lead me to believe that it is not the greatest place to work. 

I do hope I see an improvement or I will have to take my business elsewhere.
What a mess. The single most disorganized facility I have ever visited.

I go to Sweat in Old City pretty much because I have to. It's a few blocks away so the location is very convenient. This is the best thing I can say about this gym. 

From the 10-year-old, half broken equipment, to the ridiculous heat (no matter what the weather), to the few tvs that work and have seven ESPN channels, 2 HG TV channels and no football, to the slanted floors that bounce up and down if too many people are working out at once, I only go here when it's not nice enough out to work out outside. Not to mention the "annual membership contract" which they'll charge you an arm and a leg for if you try to quit before the annual period is up (though I only remember singing something four years ago when I joined and was unaware it renewed annually at the same rate--that is until they feel like increasing it, which has happened once or twice with no new equipment or classes to justify the fee--and the $25 a year maintenance fee which Lord does doesn't pay for maintenance there at all. 

Literally if they were any better options I would take them. And I might just buy a workout tape and start working out at home rather than have to go there anymore.

The locker room is tiny and there's almost always a male staff member in there after work. So, yeah, I don't recommend it.

I absolutely love Dragonfly! The trainers and members are so encouraging and supportive. When I joined in January 2015, I was completely out of shape and overweight, but I never felt out of place or like I didn't belong. Since joining, my life has completely changed. I've lost nearly 50 lbs and I feel the best I have since high school. Not only have I gained a lot of knowledge about fitness but I've also gained a ton of knowledge about nutrition through the Living Lean program at Dragonfly. If you're thinking about joining Dragonfly, do it! It will be one of the best decisions you've ever made.
You can pay me $40 dollars a month and I will make you run on a treadmill for 20 minutes. Haha!

I'm an amped fitness goer and I like that you can go to all locations with your membership. I have the VIP which includes guest for $20/month. My original location (east bay in largo) is much bigger and includes tanning. I gave this location 4 instead of 5 stars because it's much smaller and does not have tanning beds. Still a good gym for $20/month for basic membership.

It's a nice looking gym, but it should have more. 

Once you factor in the signature club premium fee, the additional towel service fee, and the fact that they close an hour earlier than the major competition in the area, this place charges Downtown Powerhouse Gym prices without the service or the equipment. Yes, you get a gym and a pool, but the weight room is not sufficient for power lifters and it's deceptively small. So, good luck training at any time except during off hours. Also, many machines have weight stacks that I swear are designed for only children and the elderly. 

It is very hard for an experienced lifter to get a decent workout in at this gym with any exercise variety.

Very nice gym. I like that it's women only, I feel more comfortable working out in a female-only gym. And they have a child care area, where you can drop your kid off for up to 2 hours while you're working out. There's also a pool, hot tub, steam room, and sauna.
Kind of a smaller gym and equipment is not maintained very well but it's hard to beat the price. Be careful of extra charges and plan on additional charges after canceling membership

It all started with a text from my sister asking me if I wanted to accompany her to a spin class. "It's free for first timers.."= SOLD. But hours after the Tabata Spin Class with Carly, I realize I would've paid the regular full price for my experience in a heartbeat.
When I tell you that this was one of the most positive experiences I have had in any sort of fitness class, I am not exaggerating. Carly was happy to help my new-to-cycling sister and I in adjusting our bikes, and explaining all of the terminology she would be using during her class. She was particularly mindful of my injuries (lumbar back spasm and degeneration of left knee cartilage) as she adjusted me into my bike, and reminded me to not forget that this was "my ride" and to listen to my body, above all. The next 30 minutes was a blur of sweat, music, encouragement, challenge, and accomplishment. It was HARD, and I certainly burned some fat (that was the whole point for me!!), but I was UNINJURED, thanks to Carly's sensitivity. She repeatedly dismounted from her bike to make sure I was okay without making me feel like a leper or an invalid. I got the workout I wanted and needed so desperately, without the injury I feared.
Post class, I was delighted that Carly and the owner (I can't remember his name, but he was so sweet!) stayed and chatted with my sister and I. Carly gave me some tips on strengthening my core to help buffer the pain I experience in my back. The owner was happy to answer the million and one questions my sister and I had for him regarding spinning and the studio, and seemed genuinely delighted that we had such a wonderful experience.
There is not a single doubt in my mind: I WILL be back!!!!

I was a member of City Fitness for two years, and paid them a good deal of money for semi-private personal training (think hundreds of dollars a month).

One note: my trainers (Ryan, who has left, and Dan, who still works there) were both great. I loved working out with them, and saw fantastic results in a short time. Twice a week was enough for me gain strength, tone and stamina.

The facilities themselves are okay. Not fantastic, but not bad. The locker rooms stink, and the showers are gross. They offer no towels, terrible mirror area and other amenities. The machines are new and I could usually find one to use, which was good.

Class options are few and far between, but Body Pump and the 20/20/20 one were fun. Spinning was also decent.

Why one star then? This place is run unethically beyond belief. I'm a patient and forgiving person, but cannot believe how I was treated when I left. Keep in mind my office MOVED so I no longer am anywhere near the gym. I didn't leave out of unhappiness or for a negative reason, but was forced to do so and choose a gym closer to my new office.

When it came time to cancel, I gave them 30 days notice on my training. I have my signed contract which requires NO notice, but was then told I had a pending payment in 21 days that could not be canceled. Essentially I'd have 8 more sessions than I could use, nothing around that. While I was annoyed, I figured I could use them up at some point in the future.

Fast forward to 12 weeks later. I've been charged TWO extra times, $199 each, and have called them now 11 times. That is not an exaggeration. I've spoken to several employees, all who agree these are incorrect charges and I should be refunded. I was even told that the refund was processed, but it's been nearly two weeks since and I see nothing on my credit card statement.

Let me make this clear: BEWARE of City Fitness. They are worse about treating past clients with respect than any gym I've ever been a member of, including large and infamously negative chains. They WILL keep charging you and if you aren't diligent about it they won't stop. 

At this point I've been forced to contact my credit card company and file chargeback requests, as well as the BBB. Not something I wanted to do but how else was I supposed to get my money back?

Super, super disappointing, especially considering what a great member I was for so long. Oh well...you win some you lose some.

Best gym ever. The help is great. The equipment and facility is extremely well-maintained. The protein smoothie bar is clutch. I'm a sucker for my protein shake after my workout. It honestly brightens my workout and my day. I honestly cannot even begin to say about how wonderful the employees there are. I love going to this gym. For $20 a month, it's all you'll need.

One of the few Retro Fitness in the area with Life Fitness treadmills. I won't run on any of the StarTrac ones at the newer gyms -- I don't care how much they cost but they suck and shake like crazy. There is no longer a cardio theater here unfortunately but I will make the trek out to New Jersey any day just so I can run on these LifeFitness treadmills.

I met Lilly a while back when I went to her Ballet Bootcamp class. Since that time, she's opened her own studio. My review is solely based on her Aerial Yoga studio, as that's all I've checked out since she's opened her new digs.

I wouldn't say that I'm super into yoga, but I enjoy taking a class from time to time and have spurts of really trying to 'practice'. I love Lilly's Aerial Yoga classes because it's a totally different way of doing yoga.  You are doing similar poses, but are using the silks (which are the aerial fabrics) to provide support and resistance. Classes are hard but Lilly is a great instructor and makes sure everyone is practicing safely.

The best part is learning 'tricks'. Some poses have you hanging upside-down. A few weeks ago we learn how to wrap ourselves up at the top of the silk and then flip down landing upside-down with only our legs still in the silk. I love that it's a workout and an adventure!

This place is amazing! If you like circuit type classes like Unite, you'll love this workout. For starters the facility is brand spanking new and clean. Small locker rooms of you want to lock up your stuff (blow dryers, deodorant hair ties too) or cubbies inside the work out space. 2 bathrooms and 3 large shower rooms equipped with fancy toiletries.

Staff super friendly and walked me through a short tutorial of what to expect. They advertise special treadmills which means nothing to me but after using them they really do feel different than the usual treadmills (in a good way!) There is a tv screen in front of the treadmill that gives you options for easy medium hard (easy proved to be quite challenging for me!) and also simulates a running course somewhere in the US that makes it more interesting than looking at the wall. Each interval feels hard but doable and before you know it 15 min is over and time to hit the weights for 15min before repeating treadmill and weights again and bam 60 minutes is already finished!

I hate the treadmill. I don't love running. But I didn't mind this treadmill workout at all...They switch up the focus of the weights daily so you don't exhaust any one bit of your body if you go frequently which I love. I'm looking forward to my next class!

These people are the REAL DEAL. I had the privilege of working with them for an entire summer and I couldn't be more grateful.

If you haven't met these two driven people yet (Charbel and Katie), you need to take the time to do so, because you WILL NOT regret it. Their business model and values are those of which that need to be replicated everywhere.

Their class style is a butt whooping you won't forget. They have 1 hour classes which consists of alternating between 15 minutes of weight training/body weight exercises and 15 minutes of cardio, and repeat! They have really fun energetic classes with great workout music and knowledgeable trainers. Try to go to Katie or Charbel's classes if you can as they are the geniuses behind this place and you are likely to get the full experience.

There are locker rooms to store your stuff, bathrooms and showers available as well. They have class times all day from 6am to 8pm so you're likely to find something that fits your schedule. They even do express workouts during lunch which are 45 mins.

You can try your first class free which is worth at least stopping in for. You most likely have not worked out like this before and will be in for a treat.
Love this gym,,lots of hot girls there and plenty to do. I like to listen to music and make the most of my visits but my friends just go to look at all the stretch pants. Win/Win

My tour de fit continues and my latest stop was Barry's Bootcamp in the Gulch. This class is hard, but it doesn't necessarily have to be. You can push yourself as hard as you want. The class is divided into two groups. Some start on the treadmill and some start on the floor. You spend half the class jogging, running, and sprinting and the other half doing floors exercises. If you want to run on a 10 with an 8 incline, do it. If you want to run on a 5 with no incline, it's your workout! The instructor was super motivating and kept the class moving along seamlessly. It's impressive because you have large groups of people crisscrossing from the treadmill to the floor, back to the treadmill, and back to the floor or the reverse. It was also Britney versus day and Toxic will really get you moving on the treadmill.

The facilities are super clean and the showers were spacious. They also provide towels which is a HUGE plus in my book. I hate lugging around a wet towel. You also sweat a ton and there is a real chance here to lose a lot of calories. This place will kick your butt. I could not walk the following day, but it was worth it!
Has everything you need. Just a little outdated equipment. At least all the dumbbells are in their designated areas.

From the outside it doesn't look that special, but on the inside this is an awesome gym. 
I've never had a bad experience here, the staff are always very friendly and willing to show you new things.  Well kept and extremely clean.  
They have cardio machines, fitness group rooms and free-weights

The facility is nice and clean; and the physical trainers and nutritionist are skilled (and in shape -- I prefer a person who practice what he/she preaches).  Sorry guys, this is a Women's Only facility. 

There's not much this facility doesn't have... Let me list a few things that peaked my interest. 
1) There are structured classes such as Zumba, Yoga, Lo Impact Aerobics, Tai Chi, Cardio Boxing,Water fitness, Cycle, etc. 
2) There are free weights, treadmills, elliptical, exercise bikes, ladder, weight systems, TRX suspension, and other fitness equipment. 
3) There is a sauna and pool inside the facility. The pool's water is generally 80-86 degrees. 
4) There are daily lockers for use, showers, changing rooms, etc. 
5) For parents, there's an onsite childcare room. 
6) Offers 1-year and 2-year memberships -- I thought it was very economical for full-facility use including classes, pool, and sauna.

They offer personal training packages, TRX and boot camps sessions, smaller/customized classes, and nutritionist support for a nominal fee.
All I can say. It's clean, friendly & great environment. Everyone does a great job wiping the equipment off after each use.
Great venue and new equipment.  Can't beat it when in Reno.

Finally went for a work-out as a guest of a friend.   I still haven't gone through the sales pitch, so I can't speak for the attitude/etc. of management.

My friend who took me as a guest really loves it.  They still have a $10 down and $10/month special going on, but I don't know how long the special will last, or how long the $10/month is good for.

Based on my past experience with Cardinal Fitness, here's my view of the financial aspect.  A gym business cannot stay in business charging only $10 a month or even $20/month.    They will be forced to eventually (within a year of opening) raise rates at least to $25/month, assuming they still have a bunch of people who join but don't go.

If they can't make a profit on a large percentage of members who are "people-who-join-but-don't-go", then they will have to charge in the range of $30/month and up. 

Right now, everything is brand new. Plenty of TV screens (choose the audio on the dashboard of your exercise machine).   Lots of treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, recumbent bikes, weight machines, and free weights.

There is a stretching and situp area.   And a special timed cardio area, that i forget the name of, and don't remember the name of the stations. You switch stations every 60 seconds or something like that. 

At the present time, there is a good mix of regular average people, overweight people, fit people, and "muscle heads".   There were some *serious* bodybuilders when I went.  

There are some water-massage tables, and a couple massage chairs that you pay extra for (coin operated things).

See the hours I mentioned in previous review.

There are three places in the neighborhood that are closer to me (Peak Performance, Anytime Fitness, and Liv Rite Fitness).   But this place (Planet) is not enough to get me to go further out of my way.   

Actually, i'm just using my apartment fitness center because it's free.   But if I were to pay, I'd go to Liv Rite as first choice, or to Anytime Fitness if I needed 24-hour access.

One reason to join Planet Fitness, and the same applies to Anytime Fitness, is that they are national chains, and for an extra monthly fee, you can buy an option that gets you access to all nation-wide locations.   So if you travel regularly, and those places have franchises at your destinations, check them out.
Gym is nice. New equipment and very clean. Disappointed with the class schedule (which was my main reason for joining this gym.) They make you sign a yearly contract to join.

I have now become a member and climb at least once a week, sometimes when I have time I will climb twice. I normally come Saturday's or sundays and sometimes monday's, and its always crowded, but its not that bad, you just wait your turn. Sometimes its annoying when you are already climbing and someone starts on the route right next you and climbs much faster and kinda gets in your way, so when that happens I just sit back and relax. 
There are 3 autobelays in the gym, and the routes change often. I really really recommend this place its so much fun and totally worth the $

I have always struggled with my weight and thought I had tried it all but I hadn't. Psychosomatic fitness changed my life!!! The trainers are amazing, friendly and supportive!!! The workouts are fun but kick your butt!!! I am so glad I decided to go to this Psychosomatic Fitness! #fitfam

Beware of fitness 19. I had cancel my membership since the summer of 2016 I had submitted a letter since I had moved out of state. They told me they never received it and they still kept charging me even though they won't let me cancel over the phone. I had submitted another cancellation letter to Diane and yet this issue hasn't been resolved. People make sure they cancel your membership in person or send them a letter by certified mail.

Always fun at the pool and with classes. I appreciate all these folks at the Y.

Bloodmobile here today, crafts, cards. Always something to do and people to meet

If you have an active child I highly recommend signing them up for a few sessions here. It was 4 weeks for $40. We signed him up for Kinder Climb (ages 2.5-5). They have youth programs for ages 2.5 to 13. They also have Family Climb and host birthday parties. 
 
My son is a huge fan of American Ninja Warrior so this place was right up his alley. He learned how to walk a balance beam, ran a few obstacles and did some basic rock climbing. Your child starts off on a smaller wall and gradually makes his or her way up to the larger ones as the weeks progress(they're in a harness while a guide watches over them). 

Not only is it fun for your child but it teaches them discipline,structure, and gets rid of a lot of energy! 

We plan on signing him up again in the near future. 

Definitely check this place out for yourself or your child.

I took my first OTF class this past Wednesday night! Maria is amazing and really took special care of me as a newbie! There is a lot going on, but I did not feel lost at all!! I loved the orange lights - they add an extra element of excitement to get you in the zone!!...Along with the energizing music!!

The workout itself was awesome!!! I am definitely feeling the soreness, but it is reinforcing a great workout! The row machine is sneaky! I definitely feel like my regular cardio helped me do well with the OTF class, but I think the row machine targeted muscles I must never use!! Ha!

I got a very gently used burn heart rate monitor off Marketplace the next day and am super excited to go back and use it!!

yep. I quite enjoyed going to the Holiay location when they were remodoling. I have a condition were I get hot really easy. I've been complaining about how warm it is in here for about 5 years. I stopped going or going a few times a month and staying 15 minutes or just to tan. I'm disapointed reading this as they said they were fixing the AC and it's definitely not 72. More like 78.

I honestly have no idea why anyone would give this place five stars. There's nothing five star about it! My story is one of deceit, poor customer service, and crappy workout classes. Be warned!

First I will tell you how they wrongfully took my money then I will tell you about their bad classes.

I got a groupon for some classes. When I called on the phone to book them, they offered me another promotion for $30. I told them I already had the Groupon but they said it was fine and I could do both. After using the second, lower valued, promotion the manager told me I couldn't use the first one I got and to ask for a refund online. I went on Groupon and there was no way to get a refund.

Surprise surprise. 

They followed that conversation with a sales pitch that I couldn't get away from that was about 30 minutes.

I went back to the gym to follow up and the staff told me they had no idea who I spoke to and they can't help me. They were really rude about it too. I described the guy I spoke to and they still said they didn't know him. Then I opened up Yelp to show them the picture and they said something to the tune of "oh yeah, he is the owner. We still can't help you". Many months and emails later, still no refund. Blatantly scamming me out of a meager $30.

Now the classes:
The first one was okay besides some microphone problems. I was the only guy in the class but that was quite alright with me. The trainer showed us the moves and I had a good workout. It was crowded though. At one point some lady stepped on me and was kind of rude about it.

My second class was an evening class. It was just me and one other guy. The trainer didn't push us too hard. I had a good workout but not as good.

The third class was garbage. I brought my girlfriend who had never done any kind of fighting. There was a one minute introduction to show her the moves and that's it. After that the trainer used a broken microphone to verbalize drills and never show us. I couldn't really hear him and my girlfriend was totally lost. Plenty of people there didn't know how to do the moves correctly and they were all hopelessly copying each other. Bad experience.

I highly recommend that anybody who likes this gym goes over to Everybody Fights instead. The customer service is way better and so are the facilities and training. It's like night and day and it is about the same price. CKO doesn't even have a locker room. Never going back!

The staff is great at this location....smiles &  friendly hellos. It is kept clean and there is ample parking. The tanning beds could be updated to newer models, but they are efficient. I do wish this location was bigger with more of the equipment (stair climber, pf360, etc) that other locations have.

I seriously can't believe this place receives so much hate! I love it here!

The environment is super welcoming and really fun. I leave with a smile every time. It's like we are all part of a little workout family. 

The best thing about this gym is that you pay one monthly fee for unlimited classes, which are as effective (and as fun!) as personal training sessions. They offer their weekly class schedule both in hard copy at the gym or online. 

I work out for free at PSC Highpoint because I'm an employee there, so the fact that I'm willing to pay for another gym just goes to show you how much I love UFC Gym. 

They welcome guests, so you can try a few classes for free before committing. As far as kickboxing gyms go, this one is not outrageously priced. You pay a $130 activation and start-up fee and then $79 a month. Places like Highpoint offer $20 a month memberships (without certain privileges--like towels) but you pay an annual fee plus a $250 start-up fee on top of that. Plus the management staff at UFC is WAY more approachable and friendly. 

Yes, sometimes they seem pushy when trying to sign you up. Hello? That's what they're supposed to do! They are trying to sell their product. As far as my experiences go, they are not nearly as pushy as other gyms, who will also solicit you via phone calls and emails.

Shred415's tagline of More Than A Workout is truly brought to life everyday in the studio. There are many opportunities to give back to the community through donation based classes, fundraisers and more. No matter what kind of day you're having, you will always walk out class feeling better than when you came in.

I've been attending classes for almost two years and have enjoyed many different instructors. As well as the TOP NOTCH front desk staff.  Cortney's energy, Kaelyn's passion, Sara's playlists, Lyndsey's dedication and Dana's overall badassery (just to make a few) always make for a fantastic class.

The classes are based on strength training and treadmills, but you also improve on things like endurance, balance, form, breathwork, flexibility and overall athleticism. No matter what stage you are at in your fitness journey, I would highly recommend trying out a class.

Psychosomatic Fitness left me injured within days of signing a huge contract and then simply kept my payment in full. It's been over a year, I no longer live in Tucson, and the owners have made no effort to settle up with me. Sprint repeats at 100% effort in the gym's back parking lot left me with a torn quad and a heel injury. I lost months while I recovered in addition to $500 in prepaid class credits.

I like this place and I like the energy. I love the workout and the science behind the methodology. I've taken about 30 classes and I only had one experience that made me not want to return. 

As a professional dancer with a degree in kinesiology and having lupus, i listen to my body and modify based on what my needs are and how I'm feeling. As a movement teacher I can understand calling someone out if they risk injury but this was not that. I made a slight modification to a movement to direct attention to my core instead of my hip flexor (because I was recovering from a recurs femoris avulsion fracture - or simply put a broken hip) seemed like common sense to not force the injury "to failure". On the loud speaker Josh continues to shout "i like what you are doing, great form but that's not what we are doing" until I realized he was shouting at me. I just stopped working out at that point and looked at him with confusion. I'm not going to risk my livelihood to be bullied by some bro. While this is going on there are literally people in the class who have no body awareness and are using weights way too heavy for them with their back so arched I'm hurting looking at them. I struggle to focus on my workout when there are people injuring themselves right before my eyes. It was like this in every class. Lots of egos and bad postures. He was condescending in his delivery and my opinion is he should have been more concerned with those new to exercise destroying their knees and QLs. He spent the beginning of the class looking in the mirror and flirting with clients when I would recommend he ask the class if anyone has any injuries or conditions that may need modifications. I would take anyone else's class but his. He's a total bro. I continued to go and changed my schedule to avoid needing to take his class. I share this to say, personally I don't think the structure at Barry's provides attention to detail for those new to exercise and would recommend a few personal training sessions before attending a class to learn basic form. The female instructors were great about providing modifications and would even show moves after class if you had questions. I do love the work out but it's not safe for people who have no body awareness. Maybe an introduction class could be the answer.

Our daughter has been attending gymnastics Nevada for 6 years since she was in the mommy and me program. Her core body strength has really helped her with everything from horseback riding to skiing and she's been able to stay in shape and get plenty of exercise on a regular basis. Gymnastics Nevada is an amazing place to bring your kids

I've been coming here since April 2011, and I am new to Crossfit. The trainers here have been very accommodating and wiling to help a newbie like me. This gym has a nice mix of normal people, buffed out ripped people, and all the in-betweens. 

The trainers are not super assertive/aggressive (like Centurian Crossfit in Sac), but they are always present to lend a helping hand, explain a move, or just coach you on. 

The best thing about this gym is the easy going start times. You are not locked into a specific time; just set an appointment with your trainer/coach, and you can move through the workouts individually, or coordinate with other clients. This is great flexibility, and real plus to use this gym vs. others. 

Give this gym a try, and go for the bootcamp series if you're new to CrossFit. I did it, and I found it a good way to ease into the series. Honestly, after the first two weeks, I thought I'd been hit by a car. Now though, I find the workouts challenging, but not devastating like before.

Good gym, and an excellent location for anyone in the northwest Reno area.

The Jump Time in Meridian (both the old one and new one) are great.  We decided to try out the Boise one and my daughter literally wanted to leave after 5 minutes. She said the trampolines were so stretched out that you could barely jump on them. And there weren't many choices. I would stick to the Meridian one unless they upgrade their trampolines.

An amazing community of people and instructors. Tons of convenient class times offered and easily the most knowledgeable coaches i have ever had the pleasure of training with. If you are looking to change up your workout, to get stronger both mentally and physically and to re-train your body to new skills this is your place.

I feel like I've been here long enough to write a review. I will probably update later in the year as my training goes, but I've had a good time so far. All of the management is super friendly and nothing like those gyms where it's really obvious they're just after your money. They really care about your health, schedule, and your situation. I've had 2 trainers so far because one left to school. They were/are both friendly, motivating and knowledgeable. Lots of fine equipment, space, and clean.

Update: I moved out of St. Louis and sadly had to leave The Lab. I gained almost 5 lbs of muscle during my time there and lost a similar amount of fat (they do assessments which measure). I learned a ton and now have the skills to take with me to lift in my new city. I love The Lab, go here if you want to get stronger!

This has been a good gym.  There is a good selection of cable equipment, free weights, and cardio machines.  They offer a military sign-up discount to wave the sign-up fee.  With your membership, you get one free session with a personal trainer.  It's always been clean, and all the weights and equipment are in good shape.  When something does break, it gets fixed quick.

Friendly service every time we go.  Girls locker rooms and bathroom are together.  They are always clean.  I think the price is good for what I get.

Just the best Studio around! They provide you with towels and shoes. You can sign up online  to reserve your bike and the first ride is buy one get one free. They offer quarterly 20% off discounts so that everyone can afford to ride.

 They just redid the studio expanding and adding in locker rooms, a smoothie bar, coffee bar, and an area for merchandise. Order your smoothie before class and it will be ready after! 

Let's talk about the owner Michelle who is one of the most amazing people ever! She often holds fundraisers at the studio. They are always holding community events to raise money for various charities through rides. They also hold a lot of fun theme rides and events!

The instructors are the best! So fun and motivating.. the new studio still has the 3 large projector screens to display music videos during your ride, and now they have fun lights they can use along with the music and videos to make it even more of a dance party!

I have been going to the studio for 7 maybe 8 years... But I am never bored and I always go back for more! It's like the "Cheers" of spin studios but better!

Insanely expensive. 100% NOT worth the $50 a month especially now that most of the facilities have been rendered useless because of covid. The membership agreement is really difficult to get out of and the hidden fees are ridiculous. Not to mention you will get yelled at for having your mask down regardless of your physical activity level. I regret joining this gym.
Great gym- solid yoga schedule indoor pool, childcare.  Love it!

They did a great job remodeling this gym, the new equipment and setup are incredible and the staff is very friendly. The only complaint I have is that they're only open until 7pm on Saturdays. I try not to go to the gym quite that late but I like knowing that I can put off the gym until later on the weekends if I need to, even 8 would be good.

I recently joined Planet Fitness after ditching my Gold's Gym membership. I was immediately impressed with the staff and the fact that the motto of the gym is "judgement free zone" and "no critics". The gym is clean and there are plenty of machines to use, which is great during the rush hour. They have a couple of circuits and a 12-minute ab area (which is pretty great if you don't want to build a workout). So far, we're very happy with it! They also have pizza and bagels once a month (crazy, right?!) and tootsie rolls at the check-in desk.

Well, I've been to a ton of jump parks, but this is by far the worst I've experienced. The staff was extremely rude and not helpful.  For my first time being here, they treated me as if I should have just known prices and what they have to offer.  On top of that, charging $15 per 5 year old just so they can use all the areas other than the "toddler areas" which is a joke, is just high way robbery.  On top of that, they wanna charge me $15 to jump with my kids, which is more like paying $15 to be near my kids rather than jump.  After tax, we were at $60 dollars.   I would suggest if you are coming here to either be okay with your 5 year olds to be cool with one little jump area to keep cost down, or have deep pockets for an hour of entertainment.

This gym could be so much better if it were run by people who care, they expect people to come to them without lifting a finger to get business in their doors.  The owners or management are barely ever present, they give different rates and deals to different people depending on their mood.  There's no "ambiance" for a gym, no music playing in the facility, a very sterile and uninviting environment for a gym.  They don't utilize their group fitness room nor seem to care to offer classes that people want either.  Children are not welcome in this facility either as there is no child care.

I have to say that Rob and Carol really care about their members. If you want a great workout with no judgement what so ever. I highly suggest going to their boot camp sessions. High intensity, great workout, and make new friends along the way. They treat you like family. The staff is awesome. There are so many that i do not want to miss anyone. We are Unstoppable.  Btw, they opened up a new boot camp on East Side. Rincon Fit Body Boot Camp on Harrison and Old Spanish near Game Stop and Starbucks.

My retired father is a member here.  For about 2 months now, I am hearing how the management still has not fixed the whirlpool area.  Every time he inquires, the manager tells him "soon".  What kind of manager thinks this is good customer service?   Get it done already.

First off, not sure why there are so many negative reviews on here. I was a member of one of the chain gyms prior to joining City Fitness, and let me tell you, no comparison! The staff here is very friendly, and the place is immaculate when it comes to cleanliness. The trainers here are top notch. They are constantly updating the space, and equipment always in working condition, contrary to other reviews. Been a member here now for little over two years, and do not see myself going anywhere anytime soon. People complain about the crowd, but that's ANY gym from 5pm-8pm! Highly recommend this place! Just remember, know what you're signing when you sign up though (in reference to other reviews saying they were "conned" into group classes/personal training).

I only came to the outdoor water park. On a Monday during the summer. The line started forming before it even opened which was annoying. But I quickly realized once I got in that it was because everyone was scrambling to get a shady spot to set their things. They had quite a few chairs but not a ton of shade. I kind of wish they had a few more umbrellas or something so people with little kids had a place to go if their kiddos got too hot or needed a rest in the shade. Guess you just have to stand in line 30 min early for that.

The park itself was nice. There was something for all ages and abilities. I was worried my 3 year old wouldn't be able to do much since he isn't great at swimming yet but there was a ton for his age level and size. He loved the kiddie slide/kiddie pool area. My older kid enjoyed the water slides and water surfing.

We didn't try the food because the line was too long. But overall it's a nice clean park and I'd come back for sure. Lots of lifeguards on duty as well!
Brand new gym!! AWESOME equipment, clean facilities, and incredibly friendly and helpful staff/trainers.

I'm in Philly (actually, the Philly burbs, to be more precise) for the summer and wanted to find a Crossfit box out here to work out at and -- though I haven't liked much else about the Philly burbs -- the folks (both the trainers and the members) at Crossfit Delaware Valley make me wish I could work out here forever. Whenever I travel, I try to workout in a local CF box and, though I've definitely drunk the Crossfit koolaid, I'm not equally impressed by every box I visit.

The trainers here are top notch and take all of their athletes seriously -- even new folks who aren't in great shape and have crazy injuries. The daily WODs are programmed in-house (not from mainsite) and tend to include a strength part and a metcon part. 

I can't even imagine the kind of shape I would be in if I were able to train with Rob and his crew long term. If this Crossfit is close enough for you to make it a part of your regular routine and you've been thinking about joining a gym but don't even know where to start, you owe it to yourself to check it out... it won't feel good at first, and you will get your butt kicked, but if you go regularly and try hard, you'll probably be in the best shape of your life within a couple months.

This place is awesome. The instructors and the front desk staff are all so welcoming and friendly, and the classes are always challenging with great music! 

Before purchasing a Gilt City deal for this place, I had never tried spinning at a studio before- I was just used to taking them as regular gym classes. My first class I felt kind of anxious: were they going to be snobby? Were they going to smell the Gilt City coupon and non-Lululemon on me? Was I going to be totally out of my element?

No! Totally unpretentious, sweaty fun. It's so addictive, and I'll definitely be returning for classes even after my deal runs out. The class prices and packages are really reasonable, especially for the quality of instruction you get. It definitely feels like a very community-oriented spinning studio, which is also great. 5 stars all the way!

I've been to many gyms over the years and this one I always stick with.

Membership costs about $1 a day and the amount of equipment and facilities you have access to is astounding for the price!

Whenever a piece of machine breaks, it is promptly fixed.  They also have one of the biggest free weights area I've seen.

It's funny how a visit to a place you've liked in the past can change your opinion. Unfortunately that's what happened today.

I brought the kids I care for there today. The parking lot wasn't busy, so I thought that would be good. What I didn't realize is that they have a camp there with various kids I'd guess between 8-13. At first we saw a half dozen kids on the court playing basketball with a camp counselor. 

Where the problem came in was that the "flotation" area was swarmed with about 15-20 additional kids just running all over that area, acting poorly, and being chaotic. Yes there were two camp counselors "overseeing" these kids, meaning they were either sitting on the sofas or standing around. Not telling the kids they weren't behaving appropriately or stop running up the slides and jumping on the outside area of the safari one.

It just wasn't fair that they were behaving so terrible and there was no one acknowledging that. The counselors shirts said Incredi-plex, but there wasn't other employees keeping an eye out for the other people not with the camp. It was a free for all.

After that they bombarded the obstacle course and finally it was time for them to have lunch and they picked up their shoes that had been thrown about. It gave my kids a chance to play, but shortly after that we had to go.

It was all so frustrating, and after seeing the lack of supervision and the chaos, I don't have any desire to return there.
Friendly Staff. Great Location. Decent Hours. Weight room is kinda small but if you beat the rush hour crowd it's perfect. Glad it's still here!
I love this facility! Always clean and staff is willing to help/answer with any questions! Spacious, but the weight lifting area is a tad small.

Fitness Connection--Disc Drive is criminals. I was pressured to get a personal trainer. They had me on an $80. monthly contract for a year. After the year when I went to cancel that contract the managers avoided my phone calls and sent me in circles to keep me on the month-by-month. I finally kept to it and Glenn and Brandon cancelled my contract as I paid all debts. Today I received a letter in the mail by their corporate office saying that I owe Fitness Connection $344.00. I contacted both Glenn and Brandon who no longer work there and they seem frustrated because they legitimately did their job but the upper management didn't acknowledge my cancellation. I contacted my former personal trainer and he can't believe it. I called the Corporate Office and they are avoiding me. I called Fitness Connection on Disc Drive and they avoided me. Finally I drove over there and they still tried to avoid me. Cowards. I then drove over there and marched into the manager's office unannounced and talked to the Manager with the Marine Corps emblem attached to his desk. I think his name was Brad. He even implied I was in the right but basically said, "too bad, so sad, we didn't finalize your cancelation so you owe us $344." Basically, they didn't push the papers and think I owe them money and seem proud they tricked me because I legitimately never received a letter of cancelation in the mail. Additionally, the desk clerk was sarcastic and rude to me and I told him this matter isn't funny and if he values his job maybe he should just mind his business. He shut up real fast. Too bad for them I still have a collage of evidence and paperwork. They won't get a dime out of me. I thought United States Marines practice integrity and honor? He actually looked proud that Fitness Connection did this to me. So this is how you treat your consumers? The funny thing is, I have the witnesses, paperwork, handwritten and signed notes, text messages, facebook messages to protect me from that illegal $344. debt they think I owe them. Perhaps the Marine Corps emblems posted in their office is to sway people into believing they are trustworthy? This kind of greed by trying to steal from consumers is the reason why our economy went down in the first place. If anybody wants to pickett in front of this branch in protest to their illegal business practices on Disc Drive, my name is Robert Mead--feel free to contact me and we'll get on it. Hey Fitness Connection (scum bags), you have so much competition in this region that you are screwed. Hey Fitness Connection, look at your Yelp scores, I'm not the only one making Yelp posts like this. Get with the times, consumers look at Yelp these days before making financial commitments. Please remove your Marine Corps emblems from your offices because this is insulting and disgraceful to run a business like this with a sacred emblem like that. Disgraceful.

Before giving a place 5 stars, I usually try to thoroughly scrutinize myself.  Is it really 5 stars?  Are you sure it's not just a 4 star place?  What's wrong with this business that other people could dislike?  I'm racked my brain trying to come up with plausible reasons how The Center of Clayton couldn't be considered a 5 star destination, and I can't find any.

For those not in the know, The Center of Clayton is more or less a fitness center.  But it's not just a fitness center, it's like a multi-plex that houses almost every exercise activity that you'd want to do.  It's huge, clean, inexpensive, and friendly, pretty much everything you want out of a gym.  Here's how it breaks out:

The facilities are pretty much everything you'd expect in an area of town known for yuppieness.  Mounds of treadmills, ellipticals, exercise bikes, rowing machines, stair climbing machines, a 25-foot rock climbing wall, a running track, basketball courts, lap lanes for swimming, yoga/workout rooms, free weights, resistance machines, and a huge leisure pool, complete with slides!  

Now I know what you're thinking.  "But I've been to [insert your municipality's workout center here] and it has cool stuff too!".  And I'll say hey I understand.  I've been to The Heights in Richmond Heights.  I've been to Centennial Commons in U City.  They're nice, but nothing like this.  There's a busyness at the CoC, a sense that things are happening.  And others can sense it too.  There's almost always lots of activity going on.  People who work out there take exercise seriously.

So as with just about every place in Clayton, the CoC is a place to see and be seen.  People dress up to work out.  Guys show off their latest Under Armour purchase and women show off...well they show off what they got.  I wouldn't say it's snobbish, just it's obvious that a lot of people who go there have a few bucks to spare.

For a facility as large and complete as the CoC, I expected a much higher fee.  As it stands, it's only $35/month for residents, and $50/month for non-residents.  There's a small rate increase if you go month-to-month instead of paying for a full year, but there are no high pressure sales tactics, just set it up, pay, and go.  Heck, I used to pay $50/month to jog at the smelly sweat-box of Bally's, dodging meatheads and soccer moms.  CoC has them beat, hands down.

So as you can imagine with the setup they have, things can sometimes get a little hectic.  During the heavy hours (5 to 7PM), they're so busy there's sometimes a (short) wait for workout equipment.  They have signup sheets to keep things orderly, and you can only use the equipment for a half hour before you have to re-signup.  It's a little annoying, and sometimes people "cheat" by signing up for equipment they won't use, but in the end it usually works out and people are generally respectful of the time.  Personally, I've never had to wait more than about 10 minutes for a machine, which is more than enough time to stretch or warm up on your own.

The CoC also seems to get the little things right.  The layout is easy to follow and is seamless.  The locker rooms are huge.  They have a daycare area where employees can watch your kids while you work out.  There's a Subway restaurant in the building.  Flat panel TV's line the walls.  There's a good mix of artificial and natural lighting.  Employees are kind and respectful.  There's plenty of parking.  No matter how crowded it is, there's always a nook or cranny you can find if you need to step away from the madness for a few.  The machines are continually replaced and upgraded.

People may have personal favorites, but it seems like the CoC gets everything right.  Exercising shouldn't feel like going to work.  This place has a buzz, an energy about it that will make even the laziest couch potato contemplate lacing up and hitting the floor.  If every workout facility was like this, Hostess would go out of business.

Just went to check this place out yesterday after noticing it for the first time this week. Andy gave us our  tour and we were very impressed with how it was completely informational and NOT a sales pitch. They sit you down at the very end and explain the two plans very thoroughly and leave you to decide.. that's it! This is EXACTLY what we were looking for in a gym and signed up as soon as we got home. We had to call back a couple times due to a system glitch they were having at the time and they were very friendly and helpful and called back when they said they would. Super impressed and excited to start working out after going so long without a gym due to the usual BS you have to go through. =D

The Brandywine YMCA is so awesome, I am thankful for all the wonderful people who kindly help out when you are working out. My wife, and our four sons love the YMCA too! This is the best YMCA and the staff are amazing also.

I just went for the gym part of the Y. It was horrible. A lot of cardio equipment but they didn't have a pull up bar and no kettle bells. This gym could be a lot better if they put some more money in to the gym rather than the pool.
Don't trust these weasels with your cc info--full scathing review to follow--

I used to go to the LA Fit on First Avenue - for almost ten years I have done this - and I'm so glad I don't have to go there anymore since I moved to Oro Valley! This location is awesome compared to the other locations. The equipment is new, the gym is very clean, and it is rarely crowded.
