The other locations I have been to have not offered free Wi-Fi - but this location does, and it works, so I can listen to music and watch movies on the treadmill without eating up data. One complaint I do have - MOST of the treadmills shake distractingly when I run at a good pace. I am a thin person so it has nothing to do with weight - the damn things get unstable if I run at any speed greater than 7.0-7.5 mph. It causes me to step off the treadmill during my run and go find another one, only to find that most of them have the same problem. I brought this up to the management and they just shrugged it off, saying that's just how that model of the treadmill is. Well, like I said, I've been going to LA Fitness for many years and never had this problem with the treadmills at the other locations. Definitely an annoyance! Other than that - good gym.

Psychosomatic fitness has been my gym for three years.  They have met and exceeded every expectation I hold for a fitness center.  Each workout was fresh and creative - never boring or repetitive.  The instructors are enthusiastic and encouraging from 5 AM till 7 PM (particularly Eric, Arnold, and Brad).   The instructors give excellent form critiques - which is quite the task considering the diversity of athletic experience among their clientele.  The workouts are designed to challenge anyone who walks through the door, and they certainly challenged me!  I was never disappointed or left wanting more.  There is emphasis on core, scapular stabilizers, and glutes - which as a physical therapist, I appreciate SO much.  I cannot recommend this gym enough.  It has helped keep me strong, healthy, and happy for the last three years.  It's something special...a real gem!

Visited on 5/18 on a day pass and paid $20, little more pricey than what I was use to for a day pass, but enjoyed my training session.  They have a wide variety of weight equipment, I was like a kid in a candy store, trying out equipment that I had never seen before.  If I lived in the area, this would definitely be my home gym.  I normally do not shower at the gym, but since I was visiting the area, I decided to bring a change of clothes with me.  The bathrooms and shower stalls were clean the only issue I had which I did not notice until after I had already disrobed was that the body wash dispenser was very low, so much so that I had to push on it several times to try to pump soap out of the dispenser.  That was disappointing because the shower gel smelled really good.  After I dressed, I went to the ONSITE restaurant.  I ordered a protein smoothie, they have more than enough flavors to chose from and my smoothie was plant based which made me very happy.  They also meal prep and serve food.

This Ft. Washington location is very much like any other Life Time Athletic location.  The layout, locker rooms and amenities are all basically the same.  I've been to many location, Las Vegas, Scottsdale and Broomfield CO.  The only difference now is due to COVID, steam room, sauna and indoor hot tub are all temporarily closed.  The staff is friendly and professional.  No surprises, a well run facility no matter the city!  You can't go wrong with choosing Life Time!  Highly recommend!

When signing up you have a contract for one year, and after that you become a month-to-month member. There is probably some cancellation fee if you cancel within that first year, but when you cancel as a month-to-month you have to pay for the next 60 days (2 months). I have read numerous stories about horrible experiences while cancelling your membership and suggest keeping track of any and all paperwork you receive from this establishment. I was a member August 2014 - August 2015 and then I cancelled; I still have to pay for September and October because of the 60-Day-cancellation bullpoop scam that most gyms have in place. Hopefully I don't run into any issues with continuous charges after October (I've cancelled my credit card that they were charging for the year as a precaution). 

Be careful if you sign up for EFT/Resolution Training.. I really suggest you don't make the same mistake I made and get talked into it by one of the sales people. They will try to offer you a free session/consultation, but it really will be a great 20 minute workout, then they'll drag you into the office and ask which package you would like to purchase. You will be so winded and amazed you might agree to start paying the extra $200/month for $50 thirty minute training appointments. You may pay $50, but the trainer only gets about $7-$10 for the session. So you will expect a $50 session, but receive a $7 training session (I'm talking quality). I signed up for training in the Lawrenceville location.. I had one young woman trainer say at the start of our first appointment "Let me tell you a little about why I'm qualified to be your trainer.." (OK..?) ...then she began to talk to me about her stalker ex-boyfriend who broke her jaw in college while I sat there waiting for my workout. My next trainer (also in Lawrenceville) was anywhere from 10-30 minutes late to 3 out of our 5 appointments (yes 30 minutes late.. meaning he missed the entire appointment without warning). Most of the times he was late was because he was hanging around completely aloof that he even had a client waiting on him. If you want good personal training you should find a real personal trainer not commissioned by this terrible service. Their website gympayment . com is quite faulty and will drop appointments without warning and incorrectly keep track of what sessions you have left. Also, they have an automatic renewal  aspect to the contract.. so if you just HAVE to sign up.. be careful when cancelling.

The membership allows you to go to multiple locations, which is nice if you have a crazy schedule and find yourself in different towns at any day of the week; there are different aspects to each gym.. some locations offer classes, tanning, daycare, etc.. included in the membership... other's don't. Some have showers.. some don't.. The equipment varies from place to place. And many of the gyms are way too hot (the air systems are terrible). These opinions have been formed from the Kenilworth, Lawrenceville, Mercerville, Moorestown, Whippany, and Clark locations.

You get what you pay for.. so it's up to you.. written above are my personal disappointments.. make what you want of them..

This review is only intended for the water park.  That said, it was great.  I went on the 7/4 holiday weekend with a team of 6 adults and I must say it was still enjoyable.  

The lazy river was a bit more crowded than you usually see (from what I remember as a child at water parks) but not suffocatingly so.  There were slide options with diving boards a small child area.  This would be a great place to take your family.  Admission was $8 for adults and I want to say $6 for kids but there is a yearly pass option as well.  I don't believe you can bring in outside food and drink but the concession stand is not overly expensive (1-6 dollar range per item).  The line for concessions was terribly long but I have a sneaky suspicion the park was crowded due to the holiday and not generally that populated.  A friend described the place as a "child's summertime mecca".  That explains it really well.  For adults, good for a group activity probably not great for a relaxing time alone soaking up sun.

Really good option for an Indy (all ages/group) summer activity since beaches are scarce (if any).

I always like checking out the local LA Fitness whenever I travel and I can say this is one of the nicest facilities I've visited. It is huge with tons of equipment, you walk in and right off the bat you're greeted by rows and rows of cardio equipment.

There is an indoor pool, they have child center for your kids to ensure there is no excuse not to get your workout in. There is a cafe that serves coffee, smoothies and energy drinks. A pretty large spin class and a personal training workout area and this is just on the first floor.

Upstairs you will find all the free weights and nautilus equipment you will ever need to get a full body workout in. They have a full court basketball court and a yoga room. 

There is ample parking with a three story attached garage.

If we could give zero starts we would! After cancelling our membership through the old management we continue to get harassed via email for our payment. No one wants to answer their phones here and when you try to leave a message the voicemail is full, this has been for the last month. We finally get in contact and think the issue is resolved but yet again they email and want "their money" Please find new management bc who ever it is here sucks.

This is a solid gym. There are so many cardio machines that even when it's packed, you don't have to wrestle someone for a machine. 

They have a good amount of weights and strengthening machines. The stretching area could have been bigger. It's hard to have more than 3-4 mats laid out in the back without feeling cramped. 

I love seeing people of all shapes in this gym. Also...plus points for cleanliness and being well designed! The staff is very helpful as well. 

If they could figure out a way to lose calories quicker...I'd give them 10 stars.

I really wanted to love this place. I know alot of members at this gym and was really excited to join. I called and set up an appointment for that day after work to check out the facility. They girls were great on the phone call. l even received a text message confirming my appt for 5:15. Admittedly I was running late. I called at exactly 5:15 and said I was on my way and I asked if it was still ok that I come. The girl who answered the phone put me on hold. When she returned she informed me that the person I was scheduled to meet with left for the day about 15 mins ago. She then asked me if I would like her to call me tomorrow to reschedule. I said no and hung up.

Here is my issue with this. I could have got past the fact the girl left for the day. But the receptionist shouldn't have told me that. She also should have still asked that I come in and found someone else to give me the tour. I was motivated at that moment. Tomorrow it may be gone. It just turned me off from the service at the gym.

Its really intense and I feel a full body response from it; cardio, muscle strength, endurance. The interval design helps me push through the pain and watching my heart rate solidified I'm doing my best. It's not boring it all! Jumping between treadmill, row machine and free weights is a great design. Thank you!

This is a horrible gym! I do not recommend this to anyone. Do not spend any money or time coming to this gym. I only came to give it a trial run for a week and what I've noticed a lot of the staff are not knowledgeable with their gym let alone fitness. The customer service is horrible, there is only 1 person watching the kids at the daycare and they are not certified. The owner/ manager is never there, one of the staff members told me he doesn't even live in town. 

In all honesty, I'd rather spend a little extra money on a gym membership at fitness connection or even SouthRAC than this place! This place only deserves 1 star because of Ceasar and Kayla, they were very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable about helping me with my fitness journey. Other than that, this gym is really nothing special.

Just like all the other reviews here, Future Fitness gives you the hard sell.  It is an antiquated sales pitch that at times can be insulting.  They use bait and switch tactics to get you in the door, i.e $1.00 down $10/month.  However, these cheap rates change in two months to a much higher price.  During the sales pitch they use terms like, "do you really need your wife here to make a decision about your fitness."  When they are asking you to spend thousands of dollars up front, yes, I'm going to consult my spouse.  They make you take a tour to show you all the equipment they have and I was told repeatedly, "can't you feel the excitement in this place?"  There were not many people in the gym during my tour so I had no idea what he was talking about.  Be prepared to spend over an hour if you want to sign up.

I did end up joining because I use it for the pool and other cardio equipment.  I negotiated a significant reduction in monthly fees and used the AAA discount.  Don't be intimadated by the used car salesman tactics and push for a $30-$40/month commitment.

Pros - not very many people in the gym so you have access to lots of equipment.  I go to the Cherry Hill Rte 70 location. They have lots of cardio equipment both upstairs and downstairs.  Secondly, they have a large workout space to do various high intensity exercises.  Finally, they have a pool which i use to train in.  It is a small pool but it works

Cons - I have many.....so I'll list
1. The trainers that roam around with clients are constantly yelling at each other and joking around.  It can be very annoying when working out
2. Jump ropes, kettle balls, TRX machine can only be used if you are working with a trainer.  This costs extra $$$.  They explained that this stuff gets stolen??
3. Much of the cardio machines have TV's on them but not all of them work at times.  Some of the cardio equipment is old and does not work right.  When asked to fix these machines it takes forever to be addressed.
4. They have 3 universal machines downstairs but only enough attachments for for about 1.5 machines.  People are constantly moving the bars and ropes around during your sets
5. Tons of nautilus machines that no one uses.  This is a big selling point when signing up from the staff but only older people use these machines.
6. Only one rack of dumbbells.  Need more in the other areas of the gym.
7. Lots of foreigners working out in jeans, khakis, etc despite a published dress code
8.  5-10% of the members wipe down machines.  This is really disgusting.  They need to place disinfecting wipes around the gym.  Instead they have brown paper towels with spray bottles that no one uses and aren't good at wiping down machines anyway.
9. No hand sanitizer dispensers
Cleanest gym I've ever seen. They do need a second squat rack, and it does get very crowded at peak hours.

I'll happily update this review should things change, but right now I'm pretty pissed at City Fitness.  

I should have been wary in Dec 07, when first walking in to sign up for an account, there was a customer yelling about his account at the front desk.  I should have walked right away!

So the deal at the time was $99 to sign up and $59.99 a month thereafter.  I am an avid reader of contracts, and I pointed out the many loopholes to them before signing it.  I was assured it was a very casual contract, they were a neighborhood business, and they weren't going to screw anyone over.  What a convincing little song and dance.  Well, I believe in giving people (especially neighbors, and so called "neighborhood businesses") the benefit of the doubt, so I signed up because they were conveniently located and had yoga classes.  And for 6 months, I happily went to my yoga classes and paid my bills.  

...Until one day I come in and find out it's going to cost an additional $10 a month (in the middle of my contract!!) to continue to attend those yoga classes.  Pretty shady, right?  Whatev.  Since they bailed on their own contract, all I want is a refund of the initiation fee, and a refund of the last 39 days I'd prepaid upon signing up back in December.  They've decided to ignore that request.  The excuses they've given me on the phone are piss-poor, and one member of their staff even got verbally abusive on the phone.  

I highly recommend you check out the neighborhood message board, northernliberties.org, before considering a membership here.  I'm not the only one to complain (just the first one on Yelp, for some reason).  Here's one recent thread in particular: http://pub50.bravenet.com/forum/4226496069/show/637106

If City Fitness does the right thing and refunds my money (and reconsiders cheating its members in this manner) I would update my rating to 3 stars.  There are a lot of excellent things about this gym, and there are a lot of things that leave a foul taste in your mouth.  Here's the short list: 

The good: 
- Many of the yoga teachers, including Lisa, Kelly and Mark, are fabulous and I miss them.  
- The TVs & vents atop each aerobic machine are nice 
- The overall gym vibe is nice, full of neighbors, not meatheady

The bad: 
- The gym has some cleanliness issues.  Yes it is new so it looks new, but get close up to a yoga mat: they don't get scrubbed down and you can smell an interesting, unique sweat bouquet on each one.  Dust bunnies float about like tumbleweed, too.  The bathrooms are often out of toilet paper and I used a shower once and told myself never again, ew.  A professional cleaning company really needs to be hired here.  
- When machines break, they should be fixed promptly.  Some of the treadmills were very shaky.  Some of the TVs and air vents don't work. 
- The nickel-and-diming across the board is very annoying.  How about providing towels for the prices we are paying?  Or the full shampoo/soap/conditioner range in the showers?  And the website still says a juice bar is "coming soon."  I was told it was "coming soon" in December and it's still not been worked on.  Oh, and the tanning bed costs extra?  They should clearly state what is covered in a membership before people sign up.  Because all things (that you don't know up front) considered, it's not that great a deal. 

Sigh.  Now to find another yoga place.

It is getting even worse if that is possible. I have visited a few gyms over the past couple of months and comparing them with this gym, this gym is just so out of date. The lighting in the cardio room esp. near the treadmills is awful. The tvs on the treadmills are very old and some are very fuzzy due to the cable being split among them (Doubtful they are bluetooth compatible for headphones). The towels barely cover you so good luck walking from the shower half naked (I'm on the smaller side too so I can only imagine how it is for taller or larger people). The rowing machines are outdated (even compared to a much cheaper gym I recently tried). As another poster mentioned the weekend hours are limited and the last time I was in there on a weekend night, both the trash near the water cooler on the cardio floor and the trash under the machine wipes were overflowing. The whole outdated equipment (that occasionally breaks) along with the abysmal lighting, cheap shower products and towels and overflowing trash just depresses me. I'm hoping another gym comes in soon and gives them some real competition or that someone shakes management out of their detrimental complacency. For the price we members pay, we truly deserve better.
Great customer service! I loved the environment, the personal training experience, and they even physically supported me throughout my pregnancy. A great place to get fit with great services!

The worst accounting department I have ever come across. No one there has a clue about what they are billing. Statements do not match the balance on the day it's due. Over charging every month. It can't be that difficult to charge someone a monthly fee.

This place is great! I've been a member of at least 10 gyms in my lifetime so I know a great gym when I see one. (T. Jimenez) The sales person I dealt with was very professional, well knowledged, outgoing and friendly. He gave me a quick tour of the gym, introduced me to the GM (Stuart I believe) who was also very nice and outgoing. I got a full explanation of the charges including the annual fee that someone in another yelp review mentioned they weren't told about. The sales team had great energy and I knew this was a place I wanted to workout at. The machines are all new and up to date. They have a good sized floor plan. Dumbbells up to 100lbs, Locker rooms have saunas, I saw a dance/studio class room. There was a cross fit section, a trx section, punching bag section, and also a cycling classroom. They offer daycare for not much more. I pay $32/month after taxes which isn't bad for the area and what they have to offer. They also have a towel policy. You must workout with a small towel to wipe up your sweat off of the equipment. Came here around 5p-7p weekday and the place wasn't that packed like you think it would be which is great.

Don't go here! It's dirty and always overcrowded. The classes are packed and the staff is rude. Also, cancelling your membership is a nightmare. I followed all the steps on the website and they still wouldn't cancel it and charged me for an extra two months. I had friends warn me but I went because it is the closest gym. Learn from me and DON'T DO IT!

I can't believe this place packs so many hidden fees into a gym membership for what is essentially a no-frills facility.  $199 signup fee AND a $40 annual "maintenance" fee per person on top of the monthly membership, which is only $10 a month if you want limited access and essentially don't want to use half of the facilities, otherwise you're coughing up $20 a month for a real connection.  The signup process simply baffles me.  When I showed up with my husband to check the place out--fully intending to get a membership--we were left waiting for over 20 minutes while the sales guy jaw jacked with a girl he obviously knew who was not signing up for a membership.  Then he sits us down and basically lays it out like "it is what it is, take it or leave it".  He said it was month to month; they advertise month-to-month; but I'm reading a lot of reviews about major problems with cancellation and managers ignoring complaints.  
Oh, and the pool is closed.
Considering the HUGE number of equally frightening broken equipment and other nightmare experience reviews that are huge red flags I think I'll pass, and recommend others do the same.

Has everything I need, plenty of things I don't, and can't beat it for the price! Parking is a bit of an issue but it's manageable. 

I was surprised to come on a Monday after work to find plenty of machines available, while the place still felt full.

I thought that it was hilarious that this location shared a building with a Dunkin Donuts.  You could undo all your hard work in a session with a trip over there!  For some reason when I looked at this place using Google Street View it appeared small to me.  I was quite surprised to see how large it was once I arrived.  The members door is actually behind the building.  The guest door on the side of the building indicates that, which I have a new appreciation for after recently visiting another location where I couldn't initially find the member's door.  Once you enter the member's door there are lockers where you can store your things.  There's a medium-sized room for classes.  To be honest it seemed a little small for a facility this large, but it was nice to see that they had at least eight spinning cycles that could be put into the room for spinning classes.  There was literally a wall of treadmills available.  I counted at least ten of them.  There was another wall of cycling machines with digital displays.  There were three smith machines and two power racks.  All of the equipment appeared to be StarTrac.  My favorite machines are the plate-loaded ones and this one had so many of them to choose from: chest press, shoulder press, incline press, lat pulldown, and one for seated rows.  When I left I was able to buy some Muscle Milk with my credit card, something else I am acquiring an appreciation for since the existence of credit card readers seem to be hit or miss at Anytime Fitness locations.  There is a banner on the wall stating that this is one of the fastest growing Anytime Fitness locations in the world.  With the size and selection available here I can believe it.

If you want to join a gym that lures you in with their 'cheap costs' and nice facilities; only to then be lied to and pay for months you canceled, then this is the gym for you. I tried to cancel my membership for one month, no managers returned my phone calls in a timely period.  Then when I finally spoke to a manager they ensured me all was canceled and clear with my account, only to find out it's not canceled and have $100 in dues. Terrbile business practices.
Outstanding facility and for old f*+rts like me...(some call us senior citizens) it is only $20 a month!
For what it is, a nice clean friendly neighborhood gym with lots of attractive young people and lots of older committed people to staying healthy, it seems like a little slice of heaven.

Very clean gym, big and spacious, tons of lockers. Theres a spa area for if you need a sauna after working out. Theres plenty if classes and employees to help out. Theres also a nice seating area. Plenty of machines to work out on as well.

OK so I transferred from va to Florida and this location is the closest one to my house here in Florida. When I first walked in I was greeted by Preston who was very helpful . First impressions : it was small compared to the planet fitness I went. Equipment was older. One stand up tanning bed and one lay down tanning bed (not enough). No filtered water to refill your water bottles ( which my planet fitness had) The music was super low. the TVs were old and some were not working at all.  The locker room sinks definitely need replacing, they look dirty even though they are clean.  Everything in general just needs replacing... Old and dated. Overall  still a good place to work out... I'll go there for now bc it is close to my house. But I was told this location is getting an over haul in The summer ( of 2016)! So I'm super excited for that. I'm a black card member (20 bucks a month) for over a year now! And I've been more then thrilled with the facilities in Virginia. So  I'll be even happier to see new equipment, filtered water and new locker rooms... At this location...it should be the standard !But Preston your awesome keep up the good work!

I am a spin instructor here.... but I was a member before that and I still am!!!! I choose to work out here on the days I don't teach! The place is huge! They have an indoor track (10x around is a mile) which I love because right now it's freezing outside!!!! They just got new spin bikes, the have racquetball courts, basketball courts- I don't play but my husband does often and loves it- and tons of weights/machines/cardio machines/ and a variety of classes to take. But my FAVORITE part is the kids klub!!!! I feel so comfortable leaving my two small children in the club every week to teach. The teachers are so sweet, dedicated, and I can tell they truly love kids. Looking at you Tuesday night crew!!!! That's really a huge plus in my book when I can be sure my kids are safe, happy, taken care of, and not going home with some perv off the street!!! Thank you for hiring Jill, Zach, and Anna! Don't let them get away!! Love SouthRAC.

Beautiful building right off of Frankford Ave! Just walking in makes me want to work out harder. Right now they are still putting some stuff together, the lobby area is a little empty. Once you get into the gym, you'll see very high ceilings and brand new equipment. The other important detail is there is no parking lot. There is street parking in the area though.

I mostly have used the spin room. The spin classes are the same quality as the Northern Liberties location. I like these bikes a lot more than NL though. These bikes have a screen that shows you how long you were working, rpms, and calories burned. It's a feature that I really miss at NL. 

For $50 and a $30 yearly fee I get access to all the gym locations within the city and all classes offered are included. For me, this is perfect cause I can always find a class between the Northern Liberties and Fishtown location. I'd definitely recommend this gym if you like classes.

So glad that Planet Fitness has finally come to Tucson! I had been a member since I was in high school living in New Hampshire and as a Black Card member ($19.99/month) I was able to keep my Planet Fitness membership when I went to college in Orlando, FL. When I moved to Tucson, I checked out other gyms but nothing compared to Planet Fitness. At other gyms in town I found the equipment to be old, staff was unfriendly, and they did not offer 24/7 hours like all PF's do. 

The Oro Valley Planet Fitness is gorgeous with brand new equipment, a comfortable atmosphere, friendly, well-tranined staff who can answer questions about equipement, ect, clean locker rooms, free personal training sessions and additional amenities offered with the black card such as tanning, hydromassage and Red Light therapy. It is also very maintaned - you will always see a staff member walking around cleaning machines and there are cleaning stations throughout the gym encouraging members to clean their machines after using them. 

If you are a "no frills" type of gym goer and just want access to the fitness equipment they also offer a $10/month membership. 

I prefer the black card since I can also use the 2nd location that just opened up by the Tucson Mall (big purple and yellow building you can't miss). Living in Marana, the Oro Valley location is convenient on weekends, especially since it's right next to Starbucks, Target and Frys which I frequent every Saturday but Tucson Mall is closer to where I work so it's great being able to access both and being able to use the clubs in NH when I go home to visit. I think they have clubs in almost all 50 states now so you will likely find one wherever you travel. 

Excited to be a member of PF again! And, as Micah P. said - they have a Big Ass Fan - which definitely makes it worth checking out!

I had a free 30 trial membership. It went well and I'd consider joining full time.  Here are some things to note:

- its crowded as hell from 5-8 on mon-thurs
- the equipment is really close together. You can catch a whif of someone's personal aroma too easily
- It's a bit of a singles scene
- guys only work upper body
- girls only do cardio and abs
- big sloppy broads fill up the aerobics classes
- the staff are like used car salesmen when it comes to a membership

This place is GloboGym from the movie Dodgeball!

This is a great gym. I've belonged to several gyms before, and generally don't love them because I prefer dance and yoga to gym exercise, but this gym was just so cheap, convenient, friendly, and beautiful, I couldn't resist adding it to my fitness routine. Tons of cardio machines, weights, spinning, classes, a sauna, etc. And I absolutely love the mural of Philadelphia that stretches along the back wall! It helps keep an artist/dancer like me from getting too bored while lifting weights. Give this gym a try-- it's a great deal.

I hesitated at first to join this gym. However, there is NO contract and only $10/mo (you still have to pay one time fees). The gym is wonderful and clean. There are staffs constantly cleaning machines, windows, floor mats, etc. every time I'm there. I go to this gym about 5 to 6 times per week. I am loosing some weights and gaining muscle. It has been 9 months of wonderful experience of being healthy. I still walk outside @park when weather permit on top of the gym. The best time for me is in the morning when less people are there. It gets too crowded in the evening, There are personal trainers, aerobic classes and children care services at the gym.
New crunch location, under construction so I'm only giving 3 stars until it's complete. Different equipment for more gains! I am excited to see what is to come. Staff is very friendly :)

This gym is amazing! From the second the new owners took over they started making improvements. From painting, to new equipment. Pricing is fantastic and the staff is unbelievable! They really want to be a part of the community and help and build relationships. They have already participated in numerous fundraisers including the 5k Prostate Walk/Run. Started a run club for members so even when you aren't at the gym they want to work with you. Check them out you will not be disappointed! Wish there were more locations so everyone could get a chance to join a gym that actually cares about their members and not just dollar signs!! I wish I was in Florida more often as this is my gym of choice when traveling!
This place is a scam.  Once they have your credit card information they refuse to stop charging despite repeated attempts to cancel my membership.  Avoid this place at all costs.

I have been a member on and off at LA Fitness since 2011. I started using the personal training August 2015. I was very satisfied with it up until last July. My trainer was very consistent up until he quit without notice and I ended up with a new trainer. At first I felt uncomfortable because I'd been working out with someone else for almost a year. Things started to pick up and I was feeling confident with our sessions. Now he has quit also to work at another gym. Not to mention several sessions that were dropped to due "scheduling" errors. I think that I had a good foundation now and so I said good riddance to the personal training portion of my bill.
Nice gym with friendly staff, but some equipment and lockers def showed signs of wear.

Ouch- so far bad reviews. 

I don't hate it. After months of waiting for this place to open, I was slightly disappointed that it still wasn't completely finished. I recognize they probably pushed the opening so that they could get the New Year's rush to join. I can't blame them for that- that's business. 

I think once all of the equipment is in, and they sort out their growing pains, this place could be top notch. Only time will tell.

I signed up in January of 2014 and also purchased a training package. I like going to this gym, and I like my training. However, the sales person that signed me up was not upfront with me about hidden fees. Also, I wanted to put my training on hold at one point and was given incorrect information over the phone that upset me greatly until I got it cleared up with someone else. 
 
I found out 3 months after signing up (through my bank statement) that I have a $29.99 annual fee that was not made clear to me at the beginning. I think the people who sign you up should be obligated to make that clear...not have you read through fine print after receiving a seemingly random charge to your credit card.

The gym is nice and I enjoy working out here (it is clean, the staff is pretty friendly and it's not too crazy busy when I work out) - but I could do without the issues above. Just some plain honesty and better communication could have made this 3 star review a 5.

Let's do it!  Great workout. Tough...  I burned 900 calories in 1 hour.  Great staff and instructor was really helpful.  Both cardio and muscle workout but not unbearable.   Any pace is welcome.  You can walk if you can't run. No worries!   Sign up and get fit!!

Very rude and inconsiderate staff. They avoid taking ownership for their mistakes. I love gymming for an affordable price but I will go out of my way to avoid the lack of service from the personnel assigned to this location. This place is horribly staffed and managed and offer little to no customer service or recovery for mistakes that are their own. They do not listen to customers and offer weirdly off-balance math. Beware of hidden fees and little to no accountability for clerical errors on their side. Any place that intends to keep such imbeciles on staff deserves no customer base. Do yourself a favor and find a gym that inspires rather than one that blindly robs and refuses to refund collected dues that were charged in error.
Snap employees need to start showing up during the hours they advertise. It's getting really old.

I have been a member of this gym since September 2010 - back when it was Gold's gym. Things have slid downhill since then. The gym is overcrowded, dirty, and has aging equipment. 

It is almost impossible to workout in the evening on a weekday. The locker rooms and showers are gross, the shower curtains are moldy and paper towels are in short supply. The equipment is getting old. The stretching mats are the same from 4 years ago, and quite nasty. They have continued to remove equipment from the general area and store it in the personal training area, making customized workouts difficult. 

The few upsides are real racks - squat racks, incline/decline/flat benches, and everything else for Olympic lifts - and being open 24 hours.

This location is a standard Planet Fitness facility...They have all your standard equipment: treadmill, elliptical, arc trainer, weights, 30 min circuit, abs, etc. You get the idea. 

I usually go on the weekdays after 8PM and it's never been super crowded though my favorite times to go are probably Friday and Sunday nights because the place is pretty much deserted. The location itself is expansive and clean for the most part. The bathroom area leaves a bit to be desired but other than that, all good. 

The staff here are OK as well, I haven't had much interaction with them beyond the general check-in and approaching them for the massage chair coins and whatnot. Speaking of massage chairs, you gotta give those things a try...just wipe it down before you sit. I personally enjoy the chairs over the hydro massage beds. 

Lastly,  I did notice the staff always makes sure to say bye & have a nice day/night to you when you walk out the door, which is a pretty nice gesture in my book!

This is not my home gym but I stopped here for a month and the staff is amazing! The place is always kept clean and there is always equipment available due to large location. Parking might be packed sometimes but you can always find extra parking across the street at the fresh market. Will miss this place as we head back to GA .

I tried this place a few times. It is pretty simple, plain ... and utilitarian.  For either the $10 or $20 per month plan, you do not get white-glove, valet-parking treatment. You get a simple, utilitarian gym.

I have to comment on the above post "...Hello, where are the bathrooms?  The lockers?  Can you explain where the equipment is?". You'd have to be completely blind to not see where the equipment is from the front desk, there are no walls, doors or partitions between you and the enormous rows of equipment, you can't possibly miss it.

This place will kick your butt before you realize it! You will be sore forevaaa. 

I used to think rowing was all about those sexy backs *Que the JT* Nope, it'll work out your abs like no other and if you have proper form (which takes 5+ seshes to develop) an amazing leg workout. 

All the instructors do variations of on the erg, off the erg doing an ab/leg/arm workout. I love that we alternate so that the 45min zooms by like everyone said. You're never on the erg for more than 7min I'd say. 

My favorite part: Not pretentious. The other studios in CC have this feel to them. That $200 Lululemon yoga pant, judging you so hard for not being on a all juice cleanse, feel. These instructors helped you with your form and pushed you in a great way. Everyone was just trying to get a workout in and figure it out! 

My least favorite part: The music suckss. It's kinda random like whatever happens to be playing on an old radio station? Nothing Top 40. Nothing hype. While I did get a great quick workout in, I never felt hype like LET'S DO THISSS when I walked into the studio or even during the workout. Def my biggest recommendation here,
Saturday A.M. 90 minute ride was a great way to start the day! They have cubbies, no locks, one shower, you can refill your water bottle during class.

Visiting from Atlanta and decided to drop in for a class. The guy at the front desk was super friendly and helpful. I got right in for the 3pm class with Matt. He was an excellent instructor! Very high energy and encouraging. The class was really tough but I felt like I got a great workout. I would definitely recommend it if you're in town!

I love this gym. I have too many classes to choose from; the pool is clean and I can always find a spot; the hot tub and sauna are great; the actual fitness machines are great (like spinning bikes that are on the regular fitness floor). I love coming here.

This is by far the best training facility in Indy! The classes and the equipment are top notch. I LOVE being a NIFS member! It's definitely worth checking out if you like an awesome facility to work out at!

First let me say that I was thrilled to join Crunch Gym, something close, local and affordable. My first encounter with having a problem was when my credit card information was stolen and had to close my credit card and I explained this to abc financial and the Crunch gym, that I would give them my new card information as soon as I received a new card. Every day that I had to check in for a class, they informed me I was behind on my payment (25.00!!) at the front desk in front of customers. Mind you they already had me account flagged in their computer and they said they would refrain from asking me anything until I received my new card. This happened every single time I went. My next issue with them was when I had to stop attending the gym because my daughter was unexpectedly deployed and now I was the primary care giver for my 3 year old grandson. I could not attend the gym due to my commute to work in New Brunswick every day and now the added responsibility of providing care to my grandson by taking him to and from daycare. I called several times and explained this to Crunch and their main concern was just getting money and not the concern that I had to raise a 3 year old until my daughter returns from duty in November. Then I could not due anything over the phone I had to physically come into the gym, which I had no time to do, or send a certified letter. While I was deciding to do this I was being charged from January up until June. I finally was able to take a day off from work with no pay and go into the gym and cancel my membership. Before I went to the gym to cancel I paid close to 160.00 (for a membership I didn't get to use), to make good on my contract with the gym. When the manager was about to process my termination papers, she had the audacity to ask my why I was canceling... I explained to her my situation, then she had the nerve to say that I had to pay an additional $25.00 for the month of July because in another 10 days I would be billed again! I will never and I mean never obtain another Crunch membership again under any circumstances! The manager was very rude, lacked compassion and basically made it seem like somehow I had the problem. I  am very disappointed with this money hungry gym and their lack of compassion that they distribute to people and their family members that are affected by individuals who are serving our country. My daughter's deployment was not planned, me being an alternative full time parent until my daughter returns, was not planned.....Crunch Fitness needs to be ashamed of themselves and how they treat their customers and households who are affected by family members serving our country. I plan on joining another gym that treats their members with respect, dignity and compassion and just doesn't look at their customers to meet their financial quota.

Soho Cycling is hands down the best spin studio. The staff is welcoming, inviting and professional. The classes are upbeat and instructors motivating. I literally get lost in the music and the ride. Before I know it the class is over. I truly love it here and can't imagine ever leaving.  You may sign up for your classes in advance online and choose your bike. This is so nice.  What is even nicer is they provide towels at no cost, have water available for purchase, have two bathrooms which are kept immaculate, offer free ear-plugs and hair ties. They allow you to cancel a class up to an hour before start time. Other studios require 24 hours or more. My schedule can change in a blink of an eye so I like the fact that Soho Cycling realizes this about people and gives you the option to cancel at the last minute without being charged. It is a very upscale studio. They are active in the community. It is great to see a successful business give back to its city.  They also  give back to their customers by hosting social gatherings on a regular basis, after class, at near by establishments.  Once you experience what they have to offer you'll be hooked. Michelle has a first class spinning  studio.

Orange Theory is the best! It's a full body work out with strength training and cardio - a different work out every single day. The coaches are amazing and the front desk staff are so welcoming and enthusiastic! Come get your butt in shape! :)
Great barre class especially for $8 for a session. I usually pay $25 so this is a great deal and it's in a beautiful building with other activities to participate in.

The sauna is disgusting. I have repeatedly asked red shirted staff to look at the green fuzzy smelly stuff under the bench and please ask their manager to look to the cleaning staff. I was rudely and or abruptly dismissed by smug 20 something's. I was told it's not their job, it's not the cleaning crews job, the bench doesn't come up (lie I checked and gagged when I saw what was under there). Come on u piss poor excuse for a staff handle the obvious situation. And management I am sorry if u only pay these people peanuts but there is a huge difference in the personality of customer facing front of the house and back of the house guy. Figure it out or abstain from selecting new hires. You have a shining example tall black guy, he should be in charge of all future hires. And For Christ sake your maintenance guy is friendlier than the red shirts what's that about.

It seems like you can't go anywhere in Reno without being more than a stone's throw away from a gym.  Price-wise - this gym is not the cheapest, but I don't think it's the most expensive either...

Everyone has their own preferences when it comes to how they like to work out, including me.  I was a member of this gym several years ago after purchasing a Groupon for a Boot Camp class, then I purchased a membership for a few months.  Life circumstances caused me to cancel my membership, but when I was ready to join a gym again, I had no hesitation to re-join South RAC.  The facilities are always clean, and never too crowded.  I prefer group classes, and I am pleased that they have added new classes since the last time I was a member.  They have a nice variety of classes, with a variety of teachers.

My husband is definitely bummed that they just removed the driving range, but we've heard rumors that they may add a golf component back in, which would be nice for the golfers.  I know that's one of the main reason my husband has been a member for so many years.

So yes, I know there is a $10 a month facility down the street, but I like South RAC, and don't plan on going anywhere else.

MY FAV GYM EVER!!! I have used several workout places over the last few years due to moving around and tbi's by far is the best place to workout! So much room and space and everything has its place. My favorite part is the ramp (wow what a workout that ramp is) 

People are nice and friendly as well. I'm just sad I'm not there to use it anymore but if I'm ever back there this is absolutely where I would go hands down !

Ive been going to this gym since it opened! I love planet fitness as a company because it offers a huge variety of machines and cardio equipment. Classes are even an option as well! A nice plus is the price, 10 for the white card and 20 for the black card. The shadeland location is always clean and the staff is friendly! They also have bagel Tuesday's at the start of the month as well as a pizza night. If you are a black card member you can use the hydro bed or massage chairs as well. pLanet fitness also offers tanning to those with a black card. I'll probs always go to planet fitness for my gym needs

Was in yesterday 5 pieces of equipment had out of order signs. Went to use the leg press and it was broken. When I reported it to staff I was told.." yeah we know about it, but we are out of out of order signs."  The cardio theater is a wreck and hasn't worked right in a year and a half. The place is always a bit over crowded. The front desk staff is usually very nice. I have never been in that I wasn't at least greeted with a smile or told "good bye" when I left.  I've only encountered a few of the personal trainers... They don't seem friendly at all and one of them is actually kind of a jerk. If you like a good front desk staff... And that's all that matters for you it's a nice place. But if you actually want to work out I would not suggest it.

I go to this place whenever I'm in Tucson.  The staff has been terrific and there's a good variety in the Cardiovascular Equipment I like to use.  However, one reason I'm rating it so high is that it is "Clean" unlike my local 24 hour Fitness.  The mens rooms is carpeted and there are hair dryers for our personal use.  I am not rating it higher than four only because I can't figure out their ab-crunch machines and haven't had any interaction with the trainers outside of the ones at the desk.  It has a nice swimming pool and handball/raquetball courts as well as a separate rooms for spin classes and aerobics.  Pretty complete I must say.  24 hour fitness -- pay attention.

Love this gym. I have been to many gyms in my lifetime. Many of them turned into "meet markets". This gym is the real deal.  Not intimidating, friendly staff, with enough equipment to please everyone. Many squat racks, free weights, machines, treadmills, and ellipticals. Love this place

I do appreciate it when owners try to remedy problems with their business. I've been coming here a lot and lately, I've been seeing the staff constantly wiping down the equipment and emptying the trash instead of chit chatting. I still see members who do not wipe equipment, but I'm glad to see the staff at least clean the fitness machines. Management must have told them so! The San Francisco Planet Fitness should learn from the other PF locations!

I go regularly to the Graduate Hospital franchise.  It is close to my house.  I have participated in the Thrive program for over a year now and love it!  While it is not the least expensive options, it is one of the best!!  My trainers, Lauren and Steve, are two of their premier trainers.  I am so hapPy with their caring and challenging approach to our training. While I am an older client, the trainers are very cognizant of your limitations.  This is also true for the 20 something members of my group.  In over a year  training, I have never had to stop due to injury or over use.

I LOVE this gym!!! yes it is pricey but its true what they say you get what you paid for; and this is where your money is going:
- amazing location right downtown and super close to work for me
- TONS of group classes (this is what I mainly do at the gym) from TRX, boot camp, spinning, Arial yoga and MANY more
- excellent and clean bathroom / showers and towel service. They have hair dryers, hair curlers and straighteners and even hair spray
- awesome spinning instructors 
- indoor track (yes it is not very long, 12 laps = 1 miles, but heck if its raining outside its an awesome place  to run 
- equipment is pretty new 

I love it here, its definitely worth the money!

Fun variety of classes makes this not your average gym.

This is honestly the only no frills gym I will ever go to.  Classes are often late, AC breaks, check in line can be long, but all that adds to the character of this place.  This annoyed the type A person in me, but I also forgave it enough to go here for a year.  That shows you that the good definitely outweighed the bad.

The best part of this place is the classes.  You won't find them anywhere else.  I've taken booty jam, step class, pole dancing, zumba, pound, body pump, and I've enjoyed them all.  This is a great beginner gym for people.  There really isn't any real high intensity classes and people take things at their own speed.  You will never feel intimidated by the people who work out here.  Definitely no lululemon.  But that's ok, this gym doesn't try to be something it isn't.

I'm sad that body pump is gone, because it was seriously the best!  In the end the distance got to me, but I would definitely suggest booty jam to anyone looking to have a good time.

Limited weight equipment making it hard to weight train.  Limited Aerobic equipment with long wait times. Childish and unprofessional staff that rather play on their phones socializing than working.  Owners of this gym interested in getting people to sign up for this limited gym then under delivering service followed by raising gym fees.  Take your business to Crunch Countryside and let Matthew treat you with respect.

I've been quite disappointed with this gym recently, which seems to correlate to management changing.

The fan in the room with the exercise classes has been broken for over a month, and has yet to be replaced.  Several people have reported this to the manager on a weekly, and even daily, basis, and he has neglected to follow up on this.  It's a $20 fan, just replace it.

Classes have been cancelled last minute.  Last week, even the sub who was supposed to replace the original instructor cancelled the class.  Another thing that I think is poorly planned is the timing of the classes.  On Saturday, there are 3 classes in the morning, PiYo from 9-10 AM, Zumba from 10-11 AM, and Bootcamp that starts at 11:30 AM.  Then there are no classes for the rest of the day.  On Sunday there is only Zumba at 10 AM, and nothing for the rest of the day.  Also, there are literally no morning classes during the week, which is not typical of most gyms.

If you look at the new schedule, most of the classes are Zumba.  Don't get me wrong, Zumba is fun, but there are more classes they should seek out besides Zumba if they want to keep their members happy and well-rounded.

10 toes and 10 fingers up! Awesome studio! I honestly have never felt this strong and have so much energy now. I take 5-6 classes a week and did the black membership. Expensive but over the years, it will keep me healthier over time and be less expensive later. I am soooo out of shape, and a Christian, with pretty painful carpal tunnel and plantar fasciitis. I googled cure for CT and yoga was first and then the other two not proven to help was chiropractic care and surgery. I've been in classes for three months and outside of a much more feminine shape that happened, my arms are better and my feet feel pretty great. Not cured but way more manageable and only due to the stretching in class. It's not a studio that focuses on the spiritual side too much and when they do, I turn my gaze to my Creator instead of any yoga references for "inner strength." So christians can feel comfortable here as well as very out of shape peeps. The instructors are so sweet and yes, sometimes it's not completely aired out or perfectly spotlessly wiped down but the people that are working out here come in clean. It's sweaty. It's not ballet class. But there are tea tree and water squirt bottles in case the floor around you needs a little care. I don't mind helping out. I highly recommend this studio!

I signed up for this planet fitness 2 months ago and I really think the workers here are friendly and always cleaning the gym. I feel very comfortable coming to this location and the equipment is great!! I come here about 4-6 times a week to workout use the massage chairs and the tanning beds. I dont live close to this gym I am about 35 minutes from here but its worth the drive.

I did have 2 issues 1 is the bathroom floor was wet and I slipped on it I feel they should try the floor better especially when people are going to be walking on it. The other issue is I know the tanning beds were just repaired last week and I noticed the screws weren't put on properly I can see the screws underneath the glass of the tanning bed. I did bring this issue up to 1 of the workers early in the week but I still see the screws under the glass. I feel they should address these 2 issues . Other then that I enjoy going here to workout.

I've been coming to this gym now for about a year and I really love it!  Everything is clean and there's a huge variety of workout machines. There's also lots of TV's and good music playing. I've never had a bad experience and everything is up to par. This Youfit location is my favorite one on the Westbank.

After being a member at LA Fitness Signature for almost a year and a half I decided to cancel my membership. Initially, this gym was great, but this gym has multiple issues.

OVERCROWDED
As more members have joined this gym and the gym is reaching full capacity LA Fitness has become too crowded. Between peak hours 5 to 7pm Mondays thru Fridays it is nearly impossible to get a parking spot. Once you find parking there is usually a wait for cardio and weight equipment.

CLASS SCHEDULE
The class schedule doesn't change often so the class times either work for you or they don't. In my case, they did not. I wanted to take cycle classes, but they were always at 5:30pm or 7pm. I would have also liked to seen more of  a variety of classes offered.

CLEANLINESS 
There is always a film of dust and dirt on the cup holders and television screens of the ellipticals and treadmills as well as the fans on the treadmills. It doesn't help that the South Tampa members feel too entitled to wipe down the machines after using them. 

TOWELS (or lack of)
If you work out during peak hours it is not uncommon for the gym to run out of towels. For $50/month you would think LA Fitness could afford to buy more towels. If the members aren't returning the towels my suggestion is to have members trade their keys or ID for a towel. When members return their towel they get their keys or ID back. 

DESIGN
While the floor to ceiling glass windows look attractive from the outside these windows cause several issues in the club. The cardio floor is miserable during the day because the sun is shining on the treadmills and ellipticals. The glare of the sunlight also makes it difficult to see the television sets on the cardio equipment. The windows also provide no privacy so everyone on Dale Mabry can watch you work out and those walking by the pool/hot tub area can see everything.

While I still believe LA Fitness is one of the better gym options in Tampa this "Signature Club" did not meet my expectations.

I love City Fitness Grad Hospital! I first joined CF about three years ago at East Market as a founding member. Since then, I've been to multiple locations and tried an assortment of their programs. Overall, I have had a really positive experience with the CF facilities and their staff members and I have really appreciated their COVID response. 

While I have not done Thrive training at Grad Hospital, I was a thrive member at East Market. The program is great if you need more motivation or help with ideas for your workouts, but it isn't cheap. It's only semi-private training so it's likely there will be other people in your classes. A lot of people become friends through the program, so if you're new to the city it's a great way to meet people!

I primarily use my CF membership to attend classes. You sign up for them through their app, and each class registration opens 25 hours before the class start time. Some classes fill quickly, so I have alarms set to remind myself to sign up for BodyPump. The regularly weekday BodyPump trainer Michelle is a great trainer, but she's very tough so be ready to work! Carrie does a BodyPump express on Friday mornings and that's one of my favorites. Ted's Saturday morning class is another favorite of mine, he offers a lot of modifications and is very open to feedback and requests. Beyond BodyPump, there are so many awesome Yoga instructors at CF. The Yoga studio is downstairs and there are cubbies across the hall so you can leave your items. I'm also a fan of the Phit Body classes. They aren't easy, but they combine cardio and strength for a great full body workout. 

The facilities are always very clean and well maintained. The only time I've seen "out of order" signs on equipment has been for social distancing purposes. The women's locker room is downstairs and nice too! Quite a few showers and lots of lockers. It's not as big as the locker rooms at other CF facilities so I could imagine it would be tricky to get a locker when the gym is busier. 

There are always clean towels and plenty of wipes for cleaning equipment. This location also has a nice smoothie bar and the hydro massage chairs. The staff is SO friendly! I often pass employees in the neighborhood (outside of the gym) and they still say hello! It's nice to feel so welcome at the gym because I am easily discouraged from working out. 

If you're considering CF, I would absolutely recommend you check them out!

Worth every penny! 

I signed up for the 30 minute sessions, twice a week, with Matt, who kicked my butt in the best way possible! I initially wondered if 30 mins was too short, but it ended up being the perfect amount of time per session and i recommend it. You get worked very hard for those 30 minutes! 

I highly recommend working out with Matt! He's a calm storm! He has a tranquil vibe but also tough, always pushed me to get the best workouts in. He is super flexible with scheduling which was super helpful with my busy and sometimes unpredictable schedule. He was also always great about tailoring my workouts to my own individual needs and limitations. He also constantly sent me new workouts to do on my own via the special app that PTT uses to communicate with clients. 

Overall, two thumbs up for philly personal training and Matt! It was like getting a workout and therapy session all in one place!

12/22/18 Came here to work out while I was in town to find that it's no longer in business. The Planet Fitness logos have been taken off the building and the doors say "Blue Fire Fitness."

However you can see inside that they still have all the purple & yellow Planet Fitness equipment.

Ive been a member since September 09. It is a wonderful facility. So many great activities. Lots of free classes. Two indoor pools. Outside a great pool area, I think like 4 pools. Two gyms, great workout area. The Kidwatch amenity is awesome. I have 2 lil girls and they love it. Highly recommend it to all. Much better price monthly than any gym, especially since you can go to any ymca anywhere....

I've been a member now for six months it is absolutely the worst high-end gym I've ever been to they do not wipe down the machines or clean the locker rooms well or stay up on maintenance .. it's a bait-and-switch on joining I would not recommend this gym for the money at all

If you want to whip that booty into shape then bite the bullet and open your wallet and buy some reformer packages.  It's worth it because your body is an investment.  Pilates powerhouse is owned by Camille. There are two other instructors, Brittany and Chris. All provide private lessons but there are some group lessons available which is what I do. There are hardly ever more than two people in a reformer class which allows for maximum teacher attention. The instructors are very knowledgable, personable, and attentive. They remember your needs (bad wrists, bad knees) and will provide you with modifications when needed. 

Pro Tip: it's in a non-descript building. 
You MUST call ahead to sign up for classes. 
If you've never taken Pilates with reformer before you will have to take a couple privates.

Cons: limited class times - so build it into your schedule unless you do privates!

A great little gym, and when I went at 11:30 at night, there were several others there.  An easy place to chill out and work out without having to stress about the hours they keep!  Plus, they have little life-guard monitor lanyards that you pick up at the door; they call 911 and the Anytime Fitness staff when you press them, for extra safety!

I rated it two stars for a couple of reasons.  From a work out perspective it was absolutely fine.  

From a business perspective it leaves a lot of room for improvement.  I needed to cancel, so called.  I was told that you have to come in physicality to cancel.  That seemed pretty inconvenient.  They said that I needed to be present to sign a cancellation form.  

When I got there, they started questioning if I actually wanted to cancel.  Admittedly I was not in a good mood and said "I only want to cancel, not have a conversation about not cancelling".  Nevertheless I was subjected to being told that for my own good I ought to think about not canceling.  

Eventually I was able to fill out the forms and signed them. I was then explained that there was a 30 day notice requirement, so my cancellation would not take effect for one account next month, the other account the following month.

So they got me for an extra couple hundred dollars.

I feel that two stars is fair because the fitness is very good and accordingly expensive, but their business practices are not something I would in good conscience recommend anyone sign up for.  Learn from my mistake.

This Club has so many possibilities but clearly the owner just didn't know how to make it happen. First the free weights area is way too small. It's always crowded with  members ducking to get out of the way of others lifting. The weights are scattered all over the gym floor and some of the racks are not marked so people wouldn't even know where to put the weights back if they wanted to. And there aren't enough weights under 30 pounds. 

Secondly and most importantly this gym is dirty. The women's locker room is filthy. The staff tries but they are clearly embarrassed by the dirty showers, sinks, benches and floors. We've tried complaining and contacting Crunch corporate offices but still disgusting. The worst and dirtiest club I've ever been to. 

Back to Powerhouse Gym for me.

Awesome facility and their staff are all really kind! I went to a Breast Cancer Event they held and got an awesome workout! The trainers come to you during your workout to help with form which is great, especially for us who are a lot less experienced! You'll definitely get a good workout here and will wake up sore the next day!

After 6 months I feel compelled to give this location the glowing review they deserve. 

The coaches are ALL knowledgeable and very caring. Each one brings something special and unique to the classes they teach. In their own way they have all helped get back into shape and get through a series of painful and silly little injuries of my own making. Front desk personnel are ALL knowledgeable, friendly, professional and very helpful, always. 

No divas at all here. I've felt welcome from day 1 by everyone!  And I'm probably the oldest one here on a regular basis. Great group of members. Like a family. 

The facility itself is spotless. Always! The equipment from treadmills to rowers, striders weights and more is high quality and always working. 

As for the program itself, very well conceived and executed. Wearing a monitor displayed on several screens is both motivating and sensible. My results speak for themselves. 

As sort of a gym rat, I've belonged to many fitness facilities and programs. By far and away this is my favorite. I'll be coming for a long time.

I searched all over the Metro area to find a gym that was convenient to both my job in Chesterfield, and my home in Florissant. As it turns out, I needed to look no further than my own backyard. This gym was the cleanest, nicest place I tried out, and I joined on the spot. The cardio theater is awesome!

The only drawback is that they don;t have many channels on the TVs. Only about 8, and one of them is all infomercials. It would be nice if they had MTV or something, but I guess they have to promote their own Gold's Music Video channel.

I come here during the indoor volleyball season. The facility is great. There are always multiple sports being played here throughout the year. It can get pretty cluttered at the entrance especially during the start of a new season when everyone is trying to pay their fees for their teams. As with Midwest everyone has to pay $3 EVERY TIME you come which I still do not like.  Spectators, yes, but players, ugh. At least here they give you and option to pay for a pass up front so you don't have to hassle to find $3 or wait till they run your credit card every time. Parking can get pretty packed, but I've never had an issue with finding a spot in the lot.

My husband and I joined LifeTime shortly after it opened. At first it was great, SUPER clean, equipment always in working condition and overall great. I personally love the outdoor pool, and i appreciate that you can't bring guests in on the weekends. It makes it so it's never too crowded. Unfortunately, we've been pretty disappointed the last few weeks. The locker rooms are starting to be absolutely disgusting. Last time I used the steam room there was a hair ball with a clothing tag tangled in the middle of it, I went back TWO days later and it was still there. The shower cleanliness has also gone down hill. Last summer there was an attendant pretty much always in the locker rooms, wiping down showers, sweeping the excess water on the floors, now you are lucky if the towels are stocked. I would expect this from a LA fitness where you pay $30 a person but to be paying $100 for the first person and $60 for the second this is unacceptable.
Cleanliness aside, the price they charge for infants is outrageous. DO NOT join this gym if you have a child that isn't walking. The infant room, although the staff is great, is such a rip off. You have to arrange in advance (at least 24 hours!) which if you have babies, is next to impossible. They make you pay $40/kid/month yet they tell YOU when you can bring your baby. If this is the case, infants should be discounted. After the summer we'll be looking elsewhere, only good thing about this place is the outdoor pool.
Lastly-beware of using your membership card at the cafe. They always double charge. The cafe staff don't care, and just give you something free when you tell them. We've been double charged for coffee 4 times in the last month. I'm not sure if it's a human error or system error but regardless make sure to check your statement.

This used to be a great gym. However, it has really gone downhill. For the price ($75/month), it could be much, much better. Too crowded, closes at 9 pm or earlier, and it always smells like a Subway sandwich shop no matter where you go in the gym (gross). Half of the group classes are an additional charge, which is ridiculous. Rude staff at the front desk. Other gyms in the area offer much more amenities, aren't always packed, and are cheaper.

I do not use this gym every day, but it has been a great back up on weekends and the occasional early morning or evening. Facility is always clean and is never crazy crowded like the downtown YMCA. There is a good variety of weights and machines as well as cardio equipment. Like most Ys, they have several classes that members can attend at various hours throughout the day. I've been to several cycling classes as well as Les Mills Bodypump. The instructors for all have been great and I always feel like I get a good workout. The only negative I have is that some of the free weights/racks as well as the locker room is a little dated (everything is still in good shape though!).

As a passport member for Crunch, I have been to many locations in the Tampa area and nationally. When it comes to the Tampa Bay area, I'd say this location is my third favorite (behind Amberly and Downtown Tampa). 

The cardio deck is separated upstairs which is nice since it's separated from the weights and keeps that area less congested. I like how the gym has a wide layout. It doesn't have the amount of equipement that some of the other locations have but it works with the way it's laid out. 

The only con for me is that the dumbbell/free weight area is a little congested due to the small area it's in. Other than that it's hard to beat what the gym has for the price. 

Bonus: It has a sauna!

I remind myself every time I go that this is the cheapest gym membership around. I have to give myself that little pep talk because it's not clean. It's like they've never heard of vacuum attachments- there are huge dust bunnies and clumps of hair behind trash cans and under many pieces of equipment. Paper towel dispensers are routinely empty, so you can't wipe down equipment. You can ask the employees to refill the machines, but in my experience, they say "thanks!" and ignore the request. Don't look along the walls or in the bathrooms because it's bad there, too.  I imagine it's a steady cash cow for the owner so he/she doesn't care.

I love working out here. It's small but effective. I never have to wait on equipment. The front desk staff and trainers are personable. It never feels intimidating to ask a fitness question. The sauna is also a nice add in. They also have Les Mills fitness classes, I plan on trying one in the near future!

Ya know, I strolled in thinking "I'm not into arcades, this place isn't going to be for me, blah blah, blah." Clearly, I learned this past weekend that I am really down for skeeball action...

For starters, Incrediplex is huge, terribly named and a brilliant spot to let kids loose and run off energy. You'll find a basketball court, bungee jumping set up, arcade games, mini soccer field, etc. etc. For the adults you'll find a beer and wine bar and a junk food eats like pizza and chicken wings. I was able to check out the Incrediplex with my husband's company for their annual holiday party. This was an ideal location for adults to do their thing while the kids could hop from activity to activity with a buffet bar of food available for all. The location is a bit odd but features plenty of parking. 

My only complaint from the visit was the super grumpy bartender who visibly hated his job. Luckily, this can easily be improved.

The workout kicks your butt, I love that everything is slow movements and it never gets easier! each time is such a challenge, you definitely will feel sore for days!

Do not worry -- if its your first time, the instructor will make sure to go over the machine with you and usually place you near someone who isnt a first timer as well.

One of the little salesman spoke to me the entire time with an AirPod in his ear. I'm sorry if my signing up for a membership was so boring that you had to have a sound track to go along with it. I won't say his name because I don't want to embarrass him on here, but it was incredibly rude.

This place is great unless you need to cancel your membership if you are you know, pregnant, moving, or have an injury or just don't want to go anymore! BUYER BEWARE. They are complete and utter jerks if you are unable to pay for their classes anymore. 

Also, I brought a friend here with a friend in 2017 and she ended up signing up on Groupon as well to take another type of class to see if she liked it before signing up and some lady literally pulled her out of the class, MID-CLASS, to tell her she couldn't combine promotions!!! In front of everyone! SO INCREDIBLY EMBARRASSING, we both left that class. 

I should've taken note of this negativity and attitude then!!!

I had a membership with Bally Total Fitness and went to the location on Grant and Swan.  At the beginning of this year, LA Fitness took over this Bally's location.  I went in and switched my membership over... pretty easy.  Then, this location closed.  I was told I could choose one location in town as my home gym as it was not my fault the Grant and Swan location closed.  I chose this location and did like it, however, it was about 2 miles farther then the Grant and Swan one.  Everytime I would come here after work or on the weekend I would have to wait for a machine.  This location is a meat market and all you will see is college kids.  I chose to cancel my membership and go somewhere else.  This is where I became frustrated.  It is a pain in the ASS to cancel your membership.  I was given conflicting information from the general manager and several other employees on how to cancel my membership.  The general manager Ashley, I believe his name was, lied to me and told me I could cancel my account online.  I told him I had an account online and asked him to guide me through it.  All he did was take me in circles and waste my time.  He also stated I didn't have an online account, but I was online looking at everything he was.  I went online and read the policy which stated to send a cancel form by certified mail.  I am sure glad I did.  This is the only way you have proof that their Corporate office received your cancel form.  Otherwise, I think they just throw them in the trash.  After looking at several complaints online, I can see that I was not the only person to have this issue.  LA Fitness makes it as difficult as possible to cancel your membership, so once you are frustrated, you will just give up and think it's not worth the hassle.  Whatever you do, if you do wanna cancel, send your form certified.  I am SOOOO glad I am done with this place!

I love the YMCA and have been going with my family for as long as I can remember, even now we still go. We also have a membership that we use very often.

The YMCA is for all ages and though its mostly for family's there's still a lot of stuff to do. The YMCA is mostly known for its swimming pools, in total the YMCA has 3 pools, a slide, a spray park, a hot tub, and a little pool for younger children. However, that's not all the YMCA also provides a large gym, daycare, plenty of activities for all ages, and more. My brother plays basketball there, he has lots of fun and has made some friends. Personally, I like the e-gym, the e-gym is a portion of the gym that you just have to scan your wrist band then the weights and adjustments to the machine are set up for you. It's perfect for beginners! Also, I've had great experiences with people who work there, they are very nice and helpful.

-SP

I signed up for this gym over two years ago, it didn't work out so I stopped going. Paid all my fees and wanted the account canceled. Seemed as though everything was fine and I thought this was all done with but I guess I was wrong. when it comes to this gym they are terrible and will do anything for your money. Over two years later I start getting a call and an email saying I owe money on over due charges. What? That account is closed why do I owe money? So I  went down there. The kid "helping" me was no help and obviously was in no mood to help me deal with this issue. I told him I will not be paying the fee since I have not gone there in such a long time and the account should of been canceled a long time ago. "well fees carry over" yeah I get that, but over two years later? no I don't think so, its not my fault you guys didn't properly close my account when this all happened the first time. "well just pay the fee and it all goes away" obviously not cause this is the second time ive had to deal with this! he was so unhelpful with just saying the same thing over and over again. I get you're just doing your job. i work with people too but there has to be more that you can do when it comes to something like this.
