I will not be paying anymore money to these thieves. i canceled that account. paid my fines. and moved on. stop trying to get money out of people.

I don't know how really this happened or what to say about it 
I really interested long time to check out this place so   I just walk-in to take a tour and ask few questions like any outer future members 
But Ben don't won give me any information till I not file  up some form 
Whit all my personal information 
Address/phone/ name/ SSN ????
Excuse me?
I just interested and won see the place 
If I am like it I will go next step
Ben say he need it for start whit me the process
Whit ...what process? You remember I just here for check it  out right?
Ben " we need to know any one is step in"
So weird seals person 
I just walk out whit out to see or get any info 
Greet job
Likely I don't member there if this your welcome  for new member 
No thanks !
Negative 2 star

I'm a fairly new convert to American Iron, but, from what I've seen, it's one of the most unique and value-driven gyms in Reno. With accessible hours, abundant equipment and opportunities for personal training, American Iron has some great perks. 

For potential members, be aware that this gym is pretty no-frills, but it does offer all of the most basic and advanced weightlifting equipment you'll ever need--including squat racks, free weights, kettle bells and more--as well as cardio machines. Among the patrons you'll find professional bodybuilders, exercise newbies, seniors and young people alike. 

When I first joined, I paid extra to work with one of the on-staff licensed personal trainers, Kindra Cannon, and I can't recommend her enough. She taught me how to use machines I'd never worked with before, and she gave me plenty of encouragement throughout the process (and tough love, when I needed it). She also offers meals plans as an add-on to her services.

If you're just looking for a basic membership, this gym offers the most bang for your buck that I've seen in Reno, at around $30 per month (less if you buy several months or a year at a time).

Things to consider: 

-The music appears to be a looping playlist of the same 20 metal, alternative and heavy rock songs (I'm pretty sure I've heard Papa Roach's "Last Resort" at least four dozen times since I became a member). If that kind of music isn't your jam, be sure to download Spotify or Pandora and listen to your own music on your smartphone. The wi-fi is free for members!

-This gym can be intimidating, especially for women and/or beginners, who seem to be in the minority. Since the gym can get pretty busy during peak hours, other members will ask to work in with your equipment or swoop in on your machines while you're doing a circuit, so make sure you're willing to speak up if you need to. But many of the members are also experienced gym rats, so if you're willing to accommodate others and follow proper gym etiquette then you'll be treated well. The women who *do* go to American Iron are total badasses, by-and-large, so the atmosphere can be quite motivating if you give it a chance.

-The location, on Rock Blvd on the east side of the airport, is off the beaten path for many Renoites, so take this into consideration if a close proximity to the gym is important to you.

It's a small inexpensive gym. I upgraded to the black card membership have them show me how to use the tanning beds and the customer service was horrible it took me four times to get a tan because they kept forgetting to run it so I had to keep getting dressed going back to the counter they also had trouble signing up for the membership so between that and trying to get a 6 minute Minute tan they wasted over 2 hours of my time! And their excuse for their incompetence was that I should have went to a different employee!

I rarely post on here but felt today it was necessary. One of the check in girls overcharged my girl friend by $192.00 when taking my account off hold status. I met the manager today, Cati, and she corrected it within 5 minutes. I can you that your previous manager would not do it. Management here has been poor and feel Cati is a step in the right direction.

I love the small classes, the instructors are totally flexible and make you feel great about working out. 
Early schedule is perfect for my schedule.
great facility but their weekend and holiday hours are horrible, close at 7pm typically on weekend and holidays, your lucky if they are even open.
Don't join!  They lie.  Took my 2 year membership and refused a refund when they got evicted downtown.

I've been a member here for 35 years. I love this club. Jim Worthington is always improving the equipment and the facility. It's clean and the staff are very friendly. 
I had lunch today by the pool and I'm sorry to say it wasn't good. Also The selection for lunch is lacking. Hoping something changes soon. It would be nice

Love this gym. Great gym equipment and staff too. Amazing atmosphere. Great vibes. Best gym ive been to so far. They definitely made me change the way i look at working out and such positive energy. Unfortunately i moved outta state but evertime i come back ans visit. This is the spot to lift. Come check it out! Great pricing too. If youre in the area come check it out and see what its all about

It's usually extremely crowded especially during the high part of the pandemic there was no limiting of people which I didn't like. They have some good machines but none of the amenities  of the bigger gyms. I try to go later at night like after 9. When you first sign up they will call you ALL THE TIME. Trying to get you to get personal training. I understand that's how you make money but if I've told you no I don't want it why call my 20 times after I've declined? This is the closest gym to me that's why I go but I wouldn't if I didn't have to

Wow, what a great place to workout!  I really like the indoor track, the building is set up really good.  I like the open areas, it feels great not having wall to wall people, you have room to move around.  So at first I thought it not being 24 hours a day gym, that it might not have the value of the 24 hour gyms around town, however the hours have worked out perfectly.......  They have all the free weights, machines weights, racquetball courts, workout areas, the hill and the indoor track.  The Best GYM in Reno!

I really like this gym- it has every thing I need and is comfortable to work out in. The staff is super-friendly-- everyone is- but a special shout-out to Jay and Theresa. I was introduced to this gym via a 30 day Groupon. Afterwards I tried out a few other area gyms and 2 weeks later I was back at City Fitness- and they had even made a few improvements in that short time. The equipment always works and if something does goes off it is tended to in a timely fashion. The hours are very convenient. I usually just do my own thing and don't take classes, but I did take one (Zumba) and it was fun. People who do take classes there seem to like them very much. They have a wide variety of options at various times. The club is always very clean. If I did want to make a suggestion for improvement it would be to watch the volume of the music- often it's fine but sometimes is too loud and leaks  through my earphones -- what they do play is generally pretty cool stuff.

So the Website location for this place is messed up. But If you take the "Stump" blvd. you may be better off. I have since joined this gym and have to say I am happy the people are friendly and helpful. The person who was showing me around the machines did not know the specifics on what and how I should adjust them to my height. That was a waste of time. I took a couple of classes and worked that out.. But overall they try to do a good job. Where else can u go for 10 bucks a month...well with membership it's more but who is kidding who here so I give 4 stars.

Amazing full body workout! I always leave feeling exhausted in the best way. You spend half the time on a treadmill or elliptical and half the time using weights or completing body weight exercises. The environment is dark but loud with music so it is great for clearing your mind and focusing on yourself. The only drawback is the price.

My 4 year old daughter takes gymnastics here. They have a nice student:teacher ratio (usually around 5:1). The teachers are enthusiastic and seem to rally enjoy working with the kids. My daughter is learning to try new things and the teachers are very encouraging. The atmosphere is positive, not competitive at all. I'm very pleased with this gym and would highly recommend it!

This is one of the better and newer planet fitness locations in the city.  It's never really crowded and parking is never an issue.  Although I do wish they had more free weights and leg/lower body equipment.  Friendly staff and great value.  **Side note: if someone could please add CNBC (or another financial news channel ie. Bloomberg, Fox Business) to the television lineup, that would be great.. pretty please thanks
So far I have been happy with coming here. I love the fact that they have daycare and my boys love going as well. Their sales peeps are a little much that's why I can only give a 4 star.

Another indoor cycling studio brand has arrived! I was fortunate enough to be able to try the free classes during their opening week and overall, it was a decent class.  The structure is very similar to Flywheel, which I used to go to quite frequently.  You ride on the bike and do some arm work with some weights during your class as well.

Overall, I had a really good and challenging workout. I'm a distance runner and cycling was still pretty hard and challenging for me.  My only criticism is I know it's impossible to pay attention to everyone's form but it's SO important for instructors to walk around and look at everyone at some point.  You can get knee injuries if you aren't cycling correctly or are pushing too hard.  Classes are pretty pricey and since I run 4-5x a week for marathon training, I don't think I could afford a membership here at this time, but maybe in the future. I just wouldn't use it enough right now to justify the cost.

If you're into cycling though, check this place out!  It's new and clean, they offer free snacks and have water there as well.  They provide the cycling shoes included in the price of your class which is also great.  All the employees were very nice and excited to be there!

Definitely don't sign up here. The GM gave my husband and I false information upon signing up with regards to our contract resulting in money down the drain. Seems like he was more concerned with making a sale than honesty. Very bad experience and wouldn't recommend.

For many years I have loved Powerhouse.  That is until I found out they lied to their customers about paying their prior rent that our monthly fees were going toward.  They stated they were closing the location due to rent increases but that they were all caught up and it was a price increase.  The financial report the next day suggested they hadn't been paying for a year. So they have forced all of the customers to their new location where rent is cheaper and the service sucks. They no longer have sweat towels and don't even try taking a shower- even though you will need to with the rush over traffic you experience at this new location.  If you shower not only will they not provide you any type of towel but there is no soap and shampoo in the dispensers.  Additionally, when you go to wipe your machine down they are ALWAYS out of wipes, it's disgusting! Are they really trying to cut back this much or just lazy? I'd like to say this stemmed after one day but it has been EVERY visit here. It's frustrating, it's a simple convenience that you guarantee the supply of for sanitary purposes.  Lastly I showered with paper towels last week but was unable to this week because they were "out".  This gym has probably lost half of its customers due to being unethical and unsanitary and is becoming a royal pain in the butt.  I can't wait for someone to open a gym where they actually care and value their customers. The only reason I recommend going here is because the equipment is great.
It rocks.  Large gym, extremely clean, friendly staff. Only thing is I would love to take more classes but it comes with fees if it's not your home gym.

I've been a member for about 2 years. I like it very much. but I've noticed things that annoy me a little. one is that they don't put out signs for people to return the weights to their proper location. people walk away leaving their dumb bells and bar bells and plates and others are supposed to guess if those stations and dumb/bar bells are free to use. drives me nuts!
another is that the men's bathroom isn't as clean as it should be. toilets and toilet basins are yellow and filthy. could and should be much cleaner. I wonder sometimes how clean the hot jacuzzi is under all that foam.
Anytime Fitness is a very clean and supportive environment with all the equipment needed for a complete workout! I love the community feel and everyone on the staff is more than helpful!!

Let's see, where do I start? I've mixed feelings about PEAC. First off it's not worth $65 + tax per month ; although I love the track area. I live in an area where the average gym is 25 mins away, PEAC is only 10 mins away from my home. The staff are not friendly, never rude, but never engaging. The owner is very nice, always speaks with a smile. It's the only gym in my area that I can drive without all the crazy traffic in Mercer. The workout equipment is okay, but they could use more cardio equipment. RETRO please open near me.

I LOVE this facility! It's the cleanest gym I've ever been to and the staff are always friendly. My weekdays start with a great workout, followed by the sauna, steam room, and shower. Every day feels like a spa day and I come to work feeling fantastic.

I can't award them any stars but I do pay my $29.99 a month and suck it up. Here are some tips.

1) They are allowed to sell memberships for $29.99 a month with no initiation fee. Don't let them tell you otherwise.

2) Shower and change at home. The shower and changing rooms are unsanitary and people shave in the sink. Even wash their feet. Yuck.

3) Avoid peak times, the gym gets busy and especially in the free weight areas where people don't put equipment away. 6am and 3pm are good times during the week.

4) Classes are free and some e.g. Spinning, are really good. Jen, in particular, is awesome.

5) The gym was refurbished at the end of 2012 and is in decent shape.

6) Yes, there really is a big TV and couch in the stinky changing room.

A lot of the reviewers here have fair comments, but they forget it is the gym members that make it smell and don't put equipment away!

As for me, I follow the above and I'm kind of happy here. The only thing I don't get is why the management don't read these comments and do something about it?

For a field trip, I brought kids I was supervising at a summer camp to Playformance for an afternoon. I did not know what to expect as I only knew as much about Playformance as what I was told over the phone. My first impression was that the building itself is pretty old (there's a good reason why) and that I was worried for my kids. Thankfully, I stuck with the "you never judge a book by its cover" principle.

Once the kids and I entered, we were greeted right away by the staff. At that moment their kids were in "free time", where they were either playing Gaga, soccer, an obstacle course, or rock climbing. My kids immediately joined them for the fun. Next, the staff led all the kids in team-building games built around their philosophy (you can find it on their website). After a fun game of Box Ball, they ended the day with a compliment circle. 

I was very impressed and satisfied with this place. They have a mission of providing a fun and safe environment were kids of all ages are learning the values of teamwork and lifelong success. They are promoting strong physical education and healthy eating habits (the lunches they offer meet children's nutritional guidelines). The reason for the building being old is that the place they use to be located at was damaged due to arson. They were offered this place and turned it around to a great place for kids. The staff was very friendly to the kids and all seem committed to giving them a great time. Most importantly, they are  making these kids into leaders, whether it is on the field, in the classroom, or in their communities. 

If you are in the downtown area or near their location, I strongly recommend sending your kids here.

I like Planet Fitness in general, but I really don't like this location. The internet barely works, and the staff seems to view any kind of interaction as though I'm rude for interrupting their phone time. I think I'm going to start driving the extra distance to the Metairie location. As far as cleanliness and working equipment, though, I don't really have any complaints, but it isn't as clean as the out of state location where I originally joined.

The gym is amazing, me and my husband love it. But speaking about outdoor swimming area and the Escape bar, we are not so satisfied. How many times I found band-aids drifting in the swimming pool? A lot. How many times I noticed sand and plastic cup lids on the bottom? Too many. How many times I was filling in the form on their website to tell them about it? Three, to be honest. How many times anybody contacted me to say they're to fix the problem? None. The last straw here is the Escape bar. Stuff is great - they are quick, polite and helpful. The problem is in food. It's ridiculously expensive and absolutely wretched. I have tried salads, flatbreads, steaks and burgers there so I know what I'm talking about. They are really proud of their new chef but I'm not sure they have to be proud of their food, really. I had a flat steak a month ago and I ended up with terrible heartburn at the time. Some time later we were too lazy to cook dinner at home so we decided to try a couple of burgers here. I thought "nobody can ruin the burger" and I decided to give it a try (we both had their special "The Big NAC" burger). That evening I was suffering a heartburn again and I promised myself never ever in my life eat here. It's just not worth it! I can spend my $30 for a better dinner in a better place.

Going from a private workout club to a multiple location establishment, we knew was going to take some getting use to however first impressions are important and this location did not give off a great one.

This is the closest location that has spinning so on the day I wanted to try it, I showed up 15-20 min before the start, and was very rudely informed that we have to sign up a week in advance (in person) and I was put on the wait list and I had to come back to the desk at the start of the class to see if I could get in.  I was not informed of this when we originally signed up for the membership so as I tried to ask more for the future, another guest comes to the desk and the lady very rudely stops our conversation and decides to take care of the other guest.  I went about a workout, then came up to the desk to sign up for the next time I'd be able to come to spinning.

I showed up for the 2nd class with my husband who had also signed up, and the lady gives us a pass to go into the room.  Once in there, there was only 1 open bike, 3-4 broken bikes and the instructor asked to see passes and the lady who was checking people in was giving the wait list people the pass for the people who were "guaranteed" a spot so our spots were already taken.  I went back up to the check in lady, and while trying to figure out what happened this time with it all, she decides to stop our conversation rudely in the middle by answering the phone when there were 3 others around that could have answered.

That was my last straw and I asked to speak with the manager.  He did listen to our concerns and chalked it up to new employees and the month of January but with my job I deal with people on a daily basis and new or not, there should always be a common courtesy given to each and every person encountered.  I hope that this situation is used as a learning experience for the 2 girls above.

On our 3rd attempt we were able to finally participate in spinning and loved every minute of it.  I noticed a sign that said their earliest class at 530am was first come, first serve - I suggest that each class be like that to give everyone a fair advantage, especially people who can't get in to sign up in person, or at least allow sign ups over the telephone.

What a great place to workout! No pressure, no discomfort, no weirdos. Totally kind and genuine staff and trainers. Greg the trainer especially. He is professional, supportive and encouraging, courteous and truly knows his stuff. The PT specials are affordable and work for my budget! I'm enjoying the new, quality machines, with a new "booty blaster" machine and rowing machines just added in the last 2-months! Classes look packed all the time, boxing bags and ropes, up to 50lb kettle bells! Best investment in myself possible! Oh, and they have a sauna in the privacy of the clean and roomy locker room, showers, private changing rooms and overall just a great facility. Members are friendly and go about their business, totally comfortable environment. Quality pro-shop, protein shakes and other workout supplements available, they thought of everything! Highly recommended to all people- from beginners to elite. 

Thanks especially to Stuart, Joe, Greg and Nancy for making my experience incredible. #1 gym in Pinellas! I've even invited my friends and family to workout with me. So glad I made the switch! You should too!

I've been a member here for well over a year. I love it here because it's convenient, locally owned, and inexpensive.

From the outside you'd probably think, wow that place is tiny, no way it'd be worth it. But they've got a great layout and an abundance of machines. Signing up for a membership was easy and not filled with gimmicks like the large chains like to pull. $30 bucks a month, 24 hour access, free fitness classes, free towels, and 1 free session with a trainer. After a year, the price drops (seriously!) to $25 a month.

The clientele here is a mixing pot, young and old, ripped and not so much. I've always felt comfortable working out here. Also, I should mention, free yoga classes, so awesome. They could probably stand to update some of the equipment, but I'm glad they aren't jacking prices to pay for fancy machines.

With 91k square feet there isnt much you can complain about. This gym is the best in Reno, its pricey I guess for,locals but I'm from Socal and you get the most bang for your buck here! I was going to the old 24 by the mall but it was crap compared to this gym!

I came to take a Tuesday morning Fitness Cross Training class and was pleasantly greeted by Chris, who proceeded to thoroughly, cheerfully and expertly lead me through a solid, well-thought-out workout. I sweated, learned new skills, and had fun. Parking was a breeze, the gym is well-equipped and conveniently located. Long-story-short: I'll be back on Thursday for Alternative Circuit Training!

I just started coming here a couple of weeks ago, and it has been so easy to get to know people and feel like part of the community.  I have only taken Russell's class, and I think he is a fantastic instructor who really keeps the class energized.  One of the best spin studios I have been to.

I've been to pretty much every gym and Sweat is good.  Currently I'm a member there.  

Pros: huge gym with every piece of equipment you could need; very empty so that there is never a wait for a piece of equipment; VERY friendly staff; free towel service; locker room is always clean; easy on-street parking or a parking lot right across the street and right near the Market-Frankford El.

Cons: ladies' locker room is tiny and not climate controlled---so no A/C in the Summer and no heat in the Winter so it makes it pretty impossible to both be in there during rush hours and get showered or ready but okay if you go home and shower; they can't get the temps right in there like in the dressing room.  Right now the first floor is freezing and the second floor is 70-76 degrees...which is where all the cardio equipment.  This is terrible for someone like me with asthma.  After complaining a bunch of times, I found out the salon controls the heat and I can't blame the patrons for wanting it warm...it just sucks when you are there to work out; a lot of the machines aren't maintained--treadmills not balanced like the other review said and some of the machines will shut down when you're on them, etc. but for the most part the equipment is way better than other gyms.  

If they could fix the temperature control issues in the locker room and second floor and enlarge the ladies' locker room, it would be perfect.  

The price seems to be reasonable for the quality of equipment and professional of staff/operation/cleanliness, etc.

Never done crossfit regularly until now, been going for a few weeks and really impressed with No Shelter Crossfit so far.  Tom & TC are amazing and really care about each person and their success.  Great experience and great workout.

Been coming here for the past 8-9 months, love this location! Very convenient since it's near work. I usually go on my lunch break or right after work for a quick workout. The staff is always courteous and friendly. And since I've been going there for a while now, know me by name. 

This facility has a couple of racquetball courts, a basketball court, a fitness room-for fit classes, separate spinning class room, sauna in each men's & women's locker room, and a pool in addition to all the latest fitness equipment and weights you need to get your workout on!

I enjoy the Zumba classes when I can make it. Leta, the instructor, is fun and very lively like all Zumba instructors I know! As with anything, it takes a few classes to get used to the moves. But it's fun learning! It's probably even more fun watching us trying! Lol. Class schedules are available online or at the facility if you're interested. Other classes are offered as well. (Spin & cross-fit)  Once in a while they offer quick workshops on the equipment they have on hand and how to use them...pretty cool & informative!

Membership is fairly cheap as well. Check your health insurance at work. I have UnitedHealthcare, and LA Fitness is one of their health & wellness partners. I get a $10 fitness reimbursement for going to the gym at least 12 times every month! So going to the gym is even sweeter!  

All in all, I like coming here. The associates are friendly and helpful, & so are the patrons! There are a lot of machines available, so no waiting either! Come and give it a try! Your body will thank you... =)

I'm giving this gym 3 stars because I already have a 1 year contract and I am determined to make the most out of my experience here. Also, there's nothing that great around Hermitage either. I love how much equipment they have. Sure, it's no Lifetime, but the gym is pretty nice. You get a sauna, steam room, pool, open group/circuit room that's available for personal use quite often, cardio, weights, TRX. But, the gym gives off a pretty filthy vibe. Nothing is new. The equipment is very outdated and you just get the sense that the equipment is grimey. It's very important to wash down all the equipment with the cleaning materials before use. I think you would be happy if you can look past feeling unclean when you work out here. 
It's also not in the best of areas of Lebanon Pike. It has a pawn shop near it and sometimes you don't feel that safe walking to your car if it's at night. Take everything into consideration before you get membership.

This place really rocks.  Will Power and Grace, a barefoot cardio class,  is a hard class to find in Santa Barbara. It will challenge you and with safety, functionally and with integrity. Great location- parking is so easy and the atmosphere is so light and easy to get in there and out and feel great about what I did.  They also top it off with clean towels and water.  Honestly, there is just a very nice aura and energy here that is inviting, safe, and professional!

ToneZone is probably my favorite place for fitness classes, ever.   I've been coming here about once a week since I started working down the street in Conshy about a year ago, and absolutely love it.

All of the classes I've been to and all of the instructors have been top-notch.  High energy, great workout, awesome music, and best of all fun.  My favorites are Wednesday/Friday Warrior, Boot Camp, and Cardio Kickboxing.  I'd say I'm in pretty good shape (I also rock climb, run, go to a regular gym)... and the classes still all kick my a$$.  However they're really designed for you to push yourself personally whatever fitness level you're currently at -- and there have been plenty of beginners, moms-to-be, people trying to get back into shape, etc. that attend classes and do really well.

As I mentioned, all of the instructors I've had have been awesome (Scott, Frank, Erika, Regina, Anne, ...).  They all seem really into it, have a lot of energy, and make sure you're really pushing yourself as best you can.  And they mix up the classes and exercises so even the "same" class is totally different week to week, which keeps it fun.  The playlists they use are also basically the best workout music ever -- great upbeat mixes of both current and classic pop songs, that also always change every class.

ToneZone is also extremely clean, has great new equipment, and is always a comfortable workout temperature with AC at high 60s (which is very important when it's over 90 out).  The Elm St. location is a little smaller than the newer one on Ridge, but still a great space.  I generally go to whichever one has a class I want to take at the time I'm looking for, on any given day.

Woooo ToneZone!

No trial workout?!?! 

My husband and I showed up ready to sign up with Planet Fitness yesterday. I'd done my research and we were pretty sure this was the gym for us, but we wanted to give it a try first. 

When we arrived, I was shocked to learn that the "black card" (Premier) membership requires a 12 month contracts - UGH - and there's a fee equivalent to 3 months dues if you break contract. Double ugh. Oh well, we could get the cheaper, basic membership on a month to month basis. Except..... 

They refused to let us have a trial workout!! We were there ready to give this place a go, water bottles in hand, and she said it was "a liability". Well, apparently it's not a "liability" for every other gym you're competing with because they ALL offer a free trial - many give you a week or some even a month long pass. We just wanted ONE work out before signing up and they wouldn't do it. Our only option was to pay $20 for a drop in fee which would be credited towards our membership (if we signed up). So for more than the cost of an entire MONTH, we could work out ONCE - to *try* the gym. I don't think so. 

Thankfully there are other gyms in the area that offer no contracts, tanning, equipment AND will let you spend 30 minutes on their equipment before you sign up. *SHEESH*

Compared to nearby LA Fitness much better value, cleaner, friendlier, better run, better maintained, lack of basketball means far less crowded and since i don't play anymore this is perfect for me....i recommend this gym.

Been going 1-2x a week since the studio opened! Best workout I've done in a long time!! Beautiful studio space (only downside is the alley the entrance is in) and awesome instructors ! They truly want you to have a great experience and hit your goals ! HIGHLY recommend this awesome addition to Philly !

A great community center with frequent special cultural events. I'm not Jewish, but I've never felt out of place here.
The center features an auditorium/events center, a nice exercise area (not quite as large as a YMCA, but lots of equipment), a yoga studio, salt water indoor and outdoor (seasonal) pools, basketball racquetball, tennis, and pickleball courts, and nice locker rooms with steam rooms, jacuzzis, and saunas, and more.
If you live on the west side of Nashville, this is a great option for you and your family if you want to stay active. You might also gain some cultural understanding while you're there.
Very friendly staff as well.

Nothing has changed here.  The sauna is dark, dirty and smells bad.  The floors are always dirty with paper litter ignored by the staff.  They walked right by it.  The steam room is a joke.  The JCC fitness center could be so much better.  It's clear that they are mismanaged with leadership problems.  To have a janitor walk by trash strewn on the locker room floor without picking it up says volumes about the attitude of the staff.

I took the beginning class there, and I loved it. It was perfectly paced, and though the moves weren't difficult, they really stretched me in places I didn't know existed! I even broke a small sweat! But I felt great afterwards! The studio is clean, and I like that I can buy some Beyond Organic food items there too.

I had my first facial ever last weekend. I read an article about facial extractions, and wanted to give it a try. When I saw a deal on Groupon, I jumped on it. The whole experience was great. When I walked in, they greeted me immediately and directed me to change into my robe and slippers. I waited in the relaxation room for a few minutes before my facialist (?) took me back. She was great. She asked me what I hoped to get out of it and if there was anything I'd like her to focus on. She spent the whole 50 minutes doing different scrubs, masks, and rubs- even massaging my shoulders, arms, and hands. If you're curious about the extraction part, it was a bit unpleasant, but my skin looks clear and feels great now! The whole experience was so relaxing. Can I have another next week please?

I agree with previous reviews. The gym is okay however the customer service is horrible. I have tried to put my account on freeze and cancel it but they keep billing me. DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR FINANCIAL INFORMATION!!
Great place to be. Golds gym is hands down the best gym in the area. Love that they're updating all of their clubs!

Lots of weights, lots of group fitness classes, lots of cardio equipment, a pool, hot box but no sauna.  Pretty good gym overall but the locker room is always really dirty.  Ill still coming here but thats inly becuase im locked in already.

I had 15 lbs left to drop after my 3rd child and friends all raved to me about Barry's Bootcamp.  Flash to 6 weeks later and I am back to my goal weight and stronger than ever.  This workout may not be for everyone, but if you want to really sweat, be sore and see results- GO.  The music is loud, the lights down low, and the trainers funny and helpful.  I particularly like Josh (usually takes his shirt off), Devin (I have never been so all-over sore as I was from one of his classes), Megan (so full of energy while she kicks your butt), and Cella (positive energy throughout), Amzie (good all-around workouts).  Really, I have not had an instructor I disliked!  (The front desk can be a little un-friendly, but really just one girl and I am not sure she is there anymore).  I am adicted to this workout!

This was my very first time taking a spin class... whew! It is a workout, but I really enjoyed it. Adrianna was amazing! I can't wait to go back. Her playlist was really good, the music was really loud and motivating. 

They supply you with shoes, towels, water and a locker to put your things in. You can even order a smoothie type drink to be waiting on you when you're done with the class. 

The shoes are cool, they stick right into the bike so that your feet don't slip during all the pedaling. Again my first time ever taking a spin cycle and I WILL be back!

Definitely feel like I got a full body workout!

Always been my favorite since before it was LA fitness. Hyde Park has become a happening place again. Parking great and can grab lunch afterwards or a quick pre-workout dinner at the healthy places nearby.
Had a great drop-in at this gym. The coach and other crossfitters were very welcoming! I also got a tank top which I love!

Fairly certain I got food poisoning after eating the California Shrimp Salad.  I would not recommend eating here based on this experience alone. 

I will say that our server was very nice and attentive, as was the hostess.

This is a great gym with incredibly friendly and helpful staff and trainers! It's the only place near me that does DDP Yoga, which I had always wanted to try. It was a great experience taking Dave's class and learning all about dynamic resistance and just how many calories you can burn with such low impact on your joints! I'm very happy to have found RFF, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a place where you can get a great work out and trust that the staff and trainers really want to help you reach your full potential.

Ugh. This has been my go-to gym for the past few years, but only due to the convenience and relatively low price of $20 a month. The gym has recently gone through some significant changes in terms of management, and I can attest to some of the good changes and fixes they've employed, but the overall atmosphere and experience is seriously lacking.

Positives - As I stated above, the price is good. That's one of the few redeeming qualities of the place -- honestly! Depending on the time, it's not overly-crowded (unless you're going at 5 pm sharp on a weekday) and the clientele is OK. Most people are focused on getting a good, quick workout, and people are relatively friendly (except that giant, douchey, stereotypical "bro" guy that always wears revealing tank tops and inappropriately tight pants. Regulars will know who I'm talking about) Additionally, I like that they've put in a few "sanitary wipe" stations with trash cans around the gym. In terms of essentials, retro does have a few benches, a squat rack, power cage, kettlebells, etc.

Negatives - Since management has undergone changes, I've noticed several new faces behind the front desk, as well as new trainers and class instructors. Unfortunately, many of the front desk employees are too busy talking to friends or have their heads buried in their phones to even say 'Hello' or even acknowledge your presence. This even extends to the new manager who isn't very friendly, helpful or outgoing in the slightest; honestly, he seems very indifferent and appears like he couldn't care less.

The place is seriously dirty. I can't blame this all on the staff and management, though. Many of the clientele don't bother to wipe down the equipment and are too lazy to even put weights back where they belong. The clocks on the wall are ALWAYS incorrect, and no one seems to give a crap. The bathroom can also get very gross and smells awful.

This location is also in serious need of an equipment and free weight upgrade. The wear and tear on some of the machines is obvious, and it would be nice to have some different machines or other things to improve the experience. Speaking of experience, the "class area" is super small and about the size of my bedroom (not an exaggeration).

Lastly, the AC/Heating in this gym is all out of whack. This summer, the gym was consistently hot and pretty gross. I remember one particular week, the AC completely out of commission and the temperature inside the gym was 89 degrees!

This retro location is flawed in so many ways. If i had any better alternatives in the area, I would 100% pursue them and leave this place in the dust.

I joined this gym earlier last month and I am really enjoying it so far! 

Only minor downside is that it is pretty busy for such a small space. Even their bathrooms are tiny. However, I really do enjoy coming here. They keep the place clean and they seem to have figured out how to squeeze in a good variety of machines for such a limited space. It's close to my home, with a good amount of parking. I would recommend this place to others looking to get a good exercise in!

3 of 5 stars. For me, this means it is Solid, fair.
Not terrible.... yet not amazing either.

I previously wrote a long review regarding this gym. I did a free trial membership, ended up joining, and wrote a 5/5 review regarding the my initial experience. Praised some of the staff there. Ended up deleting it because all that hype just disappeared within the next month but I will still say it's a good gym. (Why delete it? well it was just a little disappointing cause of a little let-down in that sense but oh well)

As an update, I have put my 30 days notice for canceling my membership. And the reason why I am canceling my membership is because i'm moving out of the city and won't be close at all to this gym. I will say, they must be reading the reviews and really listening to the complaints because I thought it was going to be a pain from all the previous reviews/complaints but it wasn't at all. I signed on a digital pad at the front desk, a copy of the cancellation was emailed to me and a follow-up email asking for some feedback was given. Easy as that. I will keep checking my bank statements to see if something terrible happens but honestly, it was simple!

They must be listening..... and I say this because even with the issues of there only being 1 squat rack, surely enough they ended up adding another. And that was EXTREMELY helpful!

I have been coming to this gym since it was Lifestyles Family Fitness before L.A.Fitness bought it a few years ago. It is time for some new equipment though.  They have had the same equipment since the previous franchise. 
I have never had a problem with the staff being unfriendly.  I have seen some on their phones at the front desk. I love the size of the gym. Just wish it was updated.

Besides the Clarksville location this is by far the cleanest most comfortable PF I've been to. The staff are so kind and helpful, the atmosphere is safe and encouraging, and you can't beat what you get for the price. I love this place!

Stopped in while I had some time to kill downtown. Went at around 1 and it was pretty empty - which is nice esp during Covid times. Equipment looked clean and worked well. Smaller then other anytime gyms I've been to, but does the job.

Was this place recently renovated? 

Clean and the weights (machines and free weights) are definitely "newish." Spinning room is small but the bikes I saw were well-maintained.  I don't know how it compares to the next closest LA to them (Glenside) but it's definitely nicer than nearby Andorra and Norristown.

I used to go here for a while when I lived in Tampa. It's a huge gym. Great features. However, the worst part was that when I wanted to cancel my monthly subscription, I had to go intro THAT LA Fitness in order too cancel it. No over the phone. When I left it was bc I got a new job that wasnt in south Tampa so I warm my going anywhere near the area anymore. That was upsetting.

I've been a gym rat for 25 years.  SRAC is the best gym I've ever worked out in.  The manager, Gabe, is there and cares and it shows.  The most professional , courteous staff I've encountered .   I sing Sourh RAC's praises far and wide/ they improve and modernize continuously.  It's a gym that is a very well run business!!!

I Love Love Love this gym!!!  I have been coming here for just over a month and I feel more like I am part of a family than just a member of a gym.  Everyone here is so helpful and makes an effort to encourage me and get to know me.  They all remember my name and my schedule.  I am working with a personal trainer, Lauren, but all the trainers help me and encourage me.  The manager, David Luna, goes above and beyond to create this environment and make everyone feel welcome.

Have tried all the LA Fitness locations in Pinellas county and this one is the best....by far. Now it would be easy to say that because it's the newest but that's not the only reason. The location is super convenient to get to (right off 19). I really like the layout everything is right there not any multiple floors to climb to get to the free weights (like at the 4th st and Seminole locations). The locker room is kept clean which is important. The pool area is large with a big Jacuzzi. Most importantly there is more than one of the nautilus machines and plenty of free weight stations throughout so practically no waiting so ya gotta dig that. All in all, the best LA Fitness I've visited.

I'm Impressed. 

Movie theater with treadmills. 
Awesome Spinning Room
Sprint track (for you runners out there) 
clean and modern restrooms (even joked that it was like being in a 5 star hotel)
plenty of weight machines,racks,benches etc. 
ultra modern treadmills,ellipticals,steppers etc. (you can even log onto FB, Instagram & charge your phone during use - Amazing.)

It was pretty crowded during both visits but it was manageable - I've seen worse. 

Edge is a nice addition to Somerton. 
Somerton deserves a gym like this. 

Now we just need some better restaurants, coffee shops ... & maybe an orangetheory fitness.

I greatly enjoy working out at OTF Northern Liberties.

My family greatly encourages myself and my brother has joined also at another location.

I don't fully understand exercise science and see the value of the trained coaches to explain the workouts for me.

The members are very friendly and I have made good friends.

I feel very much a part of an exercise community.

I would like to see more social events.

I've been going here for 10+ years. 

Pros:

-All the staff members are friendly
-Convenient downtown location 
-Child care for those who have kids
-Basketball court. Noon ball daily.
-Lap pool with a good amount of free swimming hours 
-Lots of cardio equipment 
-Lots of stretching areas (in the back room by the Strive, one in the upper level in cardio room, one in the hallway to the weight room, and two in the weight room)

Cons:

-Weight room needs improvement. Need better equipment, such as Hammer Strength, Nautilus, or Matrix plate loaded machines. 
-Quite a few machines, barbells, etc, are older and not maintained properly
-Lots of cardio equipment that takes up precious space in the weight room
-Not enough free weight space, especially during peak hours

Wow. This rec center is amazing and definitely the best gym/rec center I have ever been to. It features a new multi-million dollar gym area, A huge swimming pool (heated) and lots of chairs for sun bathers. Approximately 8-10 racquetball courts, huge locker rooms for both genders, many dance rooms located upstairs and downstairs, and indoor track, sand volleyball, a pro shop, and 6 basketball courts (one of those can be converted into indoor soccer)! For some reason the tutoring center and a restaurant is here as well but I've never been to either of those places. 

The new gym is definitely the highlight of this rec-center. It is 2 stories with hundreds of machines. The atmosphere is very nice, it is extremely clean, there is music playing, and there are a lot of TVs around to keep your eyes busy. So many TVs that in fact each treadmill, elliptical, and bicycle has its own LCD TV that you control yourself. The free weights area is pretty large and is clearly defined and upstairs has a lot of mats for floor exercises. You can check out medicine balls and exercise balls from the staff. With water fountains located conveniently throughout the entire rec center to keep you hydrated this place has everything! I highly doubt you can find a workout that is missing from this gym.

Parking is rarely an easy thing to do because the parking lots can get extremely full sometimes but the worst case scenario is that you park in the back of the lot.  

At the beginning of each semester when everyone is in "workout" mode there tends to be waits for various machines in the gym. Most notably the treadmills, elliptical machines, and sometimes the free weights area gets ridiculously packed. Also on extremely busy nights the basketball wait can take an extremely long time, I remember waiting almost an hour once to play 1 game. The reason for this is because various clubs and groups (karate, badminton, volleyball, etc) will rent out 1 or 2 of these courts which narrows down the 5 basketball courts that are used down to 3 and some nights I've seen it come down to 2. 

Another downside is that the rec center is only available to students, alumni, faculty or guests of any of those people. So if you don't know a single University of Arizona person, it might be hard for you to get a membership here but if you do its definitely the best deal in town.  

In my opinion the best thing about the UA rec is the basketball scene there. It is definitely has the best pick up basketball in the State of Arizona. 5 courts are usually running full 5 on 5 games on weeknights and on weekends that number usually falls to about 3 or 4. Even then that is still a lot of chances for you to get a good game of basketball in. You don't have to bring your own basketballs either because you can check one out at the rec center. 

Overall, the UA rec is just plain amazing its hard to describe how large it actually is when you are inside of it and with so much to do you'll never get bored here. It has an awesome atmosphere with a great staff that is very helpful. I would highly recommend anyone get a membership here if possible, I promise you will never regret it!!

p.s. This place closes at midnight now, which compared to last year's 10pm close makes the rec center that much better.

I joined recently and staff was great. i was little confused before joining as there were mixed reviews but my experience was nice. Omar(manager) and Yahed(trainer), both were cooperative and friendly. I recommend others to go and talk to them before any mind set up.

I had the same horrible membership experience! They told me I could buy myself out of the contract for $75 if I wasn't happy. I wasn't. Now they are telling me that's ONLY if I move. What a joke! I never would have committed to a 24 month contract with them knowing I couldn't get out of it. Now I'm telling everyone I know about my experience and I told them I would. But all they cared about is enforcing their contract rather than providing good customer service. Good Luck Idaho Athletic Club.  I don't think you'll survive long in the new social age with business practices like this.

Very good gym with a personalized, high-tech training vibe to the experience.  There is a range of activities, fun stuff for the kids (kid's club is phenomenal), yoga classes, fairly up to date exercise equipment, weights, etc.  They have some in-depth training programs, and seem to focus on a lot of sport science.  The lockers are adequate and have been updated from time to time.  

The staff is very pleasant, especially Joel who is the general manager.  He stands out.

That said, it's not quite a 5-star experience.  The cafe is very amateur, with mostly kids working, and chefs equivalent in training to what you'd expect in a local pub.  They sell a ton of greasy pizzas, cheese burgers, and hot dogs along with a decent attempt at healthier options.  I think they need a few more registers to move people along and some higher-end ingredients than the pre-packedged stuff.

The pool can become a bit crowded and overly zealous, but what can you expect from a communal pool?

Overall the vibe is a good mix of fun with sport science, and they have a gigantic parking lot that still tends to fill up so it says something about the attractiveness of a membership there.

Great gym. The staff and owners are very nice and welcoming. They definitely deserve more than 3.5 stars.... I've been a member at many gyms in the past and Powerhouse has been the best one by far!! Love the environment and everything about it!!

They only play Classic Rock in the morning which sucks! I've requested several times that they play a variety of music because of their diverse population to no avail. I'm May change my membership for this alone.

I love planet fitness and the other locations in the New Orleans area have nicer staff. I was asking for help with a smith machine pad and the front desk help and manager were nothing but rude in responses. "Phil" or the manager who changed his name twice while we spoke, being unprofessional in conversation on Tuesday, Dec 28,2021 was a jerk enough for me leave mid work out. Go to a different location. Kenner or the east side. Not Metairie

The gym moved a few years ago to a former parking garage, making for a fun, funky environment.  

But there is still a very notable problem with housekeeping, as they have never replaced the two part time staffers whose sole occupation was to vacuum and clean up the place (which was a constant struggle, given the nature of young people who are members of the gym and have apparently only recently moved out of their parents' homes).  

Since my gym membership price has not gone down, I have to assume the McGowan brothers, who own several businesses in the area, are pocketing the difference, leaving me, as a paying member, to pick up after other paying members with lower housekeeping standards.  

The staff is very nice, but whenever there are two young people (or more) sitting at the front desk, my first thought is, "why isn't one of you vacuuming?"  The place rarely looks cleaned.

Of course, the young staff members are getting paid only minimum wage plus (one assumes) a free membership.  But if there are two of them behind the front desk at any time, other than during one of their furtive lunch breaks, I must insist that one of them be vacuuming.  There is no excuse for these fallen standards at Fitness Factory, since its franchise opened in St. Louis, and no reason why I should have to pick up after other members.

This is a great gym and a great location. Even during busy hours from 5pm to 8pm, there are plenty of machines and weights to use. Staff is friendly and always cleaning and fixing any issues. $20 for 24 hour access. Cheapest and cleanest gym in the area.

It is now FITNESS CONNECTION

This place has gone downhill.  The equipment is constantly broken for weeks before getting repaired.  The equipment that is at the gym is usually set aside for the personal trainers (lighter weights etc).  The staff are not welcoming and actually are downright rude.  I was there 4+days per week for 2 years and never was treated as someone that they recognize, no smile, no hi.  

The gym is frequently very dirty.  Look at the ladies locker room.  The carpet?  Yuck! The pool gets green on a regular basis.  The shower room is also dirty.  

When I cancelled (I was no longer in a contract) they charged me a $50 cancellation fee.  I was happy to pay it and no longer go to this dump.  

Beware of their new $9.99 per month promotion.  With all of the fees it works out to $25 per month.

The owners were so cheap that when they changed their name to Fitness Connection they had housekeeping staff take black stickers and place them on top of the Gold's Gym stickers.  Well, they did not match up very well and you can clearly tell that it is still the Gold's logo. Ridiculous.  

KIDS childcare area:  They have hungover looking college age girls working in the childcare.  They also have 1 staff person to 10 children.  This translates to 1 hungover looking college girl watching 10 babies/toddler in the morning since the older kids are in school.  Ummm no thanks. I elected to pay a professional to watch my baby rather than taking her to this gym childcare.  UNSAFE!

So, if you are looking for an unfriendly, dirty gym with TV's that are usually broken or hardly working this is the place for you.

My son just attended a nerf battle there and had so much fun. I'm a full-time student and I was able to study on the patio (bonus!) while he played. We'll definitely check out their other programs and be back for more nerf battles.

Everything is out dated, they are under new management monthly, locker rooms are disgusting, no one re racks weights, no Wi-Fi, no water fountain in the weights area, and the membership is way overpriced. Worst part is they are always busy mid day, and they close at 8 on the weekends.

They spent a lot of money to remodel the gym and it looks much better. This is a huge plus. The cardio area received a huge makeover and all the equipment is modern and functional. I love that you can plug in your smart phone directly to the equipment. 

My only downside is they could not remodel some of the clientele. For example, there are people that crank out a lot of weight, I mean an impressive amount of weight, but for some reason they must exert all their energy in lifting the heaving weight and just don't have the strength to re-rack the weights. This is a huge pet-peeve of mine for a couple of reasons. 

1) why should somebody have to clean up after you?
2) it is confusing to know if they're actually done with the equipment


Next, WIPE DOWN THE EQUIPMENT WHEN YOU ARE DONE! Seriously, it's a gym and you sweat. We all sweat in there. In fact, that seems to be the number one side effect of going to the gym. It's not like anyone will catch MRSA from sweat, but it's just plain nasty.

Seems a little petty to complain about these things, but when you are on a tight time schedule, i.e, your lunch break, time is of the utmost essence. In other words, most do not have time to workout and play housekeeper. 

The staff is very helpful and friendly, I just wish for once that they would hold members accountable for their clear violation of gym etiquette.  

Again, I will reiterate, I have been a member forever, but I only go because of its proximity to my employer. 

If any staff or management actually takes the time to read this, please have a little more pride in appearance and hold certain members accountable. It's not like you all are hurting for membership fees.

we came here during the heat wave and it was super clean and cool inside. google maps brought us to the parking lot but the main entrance is actually to the left of the building. there's an awning over the door for the main entrance which is a joint entrance for the racquet club as well.

it wasn't very crowded for a sunday afternoon and we were able to get a lot of time on the wall. we did the private staff belay session for a party of 4 for 1 hour ($95). this includes shoe and harness rental for the whole party, and chalk for your hands as needed. if you're new to rock climbing or haven't been in a while and feeling a little rusty, this is a really great option. we were all super pooped after the hour and got to climb about 4-5 routes each.

our instructor meg was very sweet and professional! we felt very safe up on the walls and had a great time!

Planet Fitness is the cheapest option I've seen in a gym, anywhere, ever, at around $15/month over a year.* Not only that, but the facilities are comparable to gyms I've seen that charge several times as much (and are more crowded).  The staff are pleasant, the equipment is in reasonable condition, and while maintenance was neglected for the first half of 2019, it's been good recently.  

One downside of this gym that I've run into is the undersized and often crowded free-weight area that's missing standard bench racks and the heavier weights of dumbbells.  It's rare for the gym to be too busy to find a bench, but it would be great if they expanded this area to match demand. The second downside is that this gym (needlessly) advertises falsely low rates. The prices are super good--around $15/month if you contract for a year, yet they advertise $10, then tack on a yearly fee. 

This gym isn't "perfect", but as far as value goes, it would be tough to beat.  My gripes about deceptive pricing and occasional crowding aren't unique to Planet Fitness, and just mentioned for completeness sake.  You'd be hard pressed to find a better choice for staying fit around the area.

The team member you had working at the desk on Tuesday May 28th at 9:30pm was extremely rude and ALWAYS is whenever I or anyone I bring with me interacts with her! I believe her name is Jess. 

She is always laying on the couch when we walk into the club to check in. When we walk past the check in desk and not check in because she isn't there to check us in, she asks us to return to the check in desk even though she was sitting on the couch watching tv. We don't have time to wait for her to come check us in at her convenience. It's her sole responsibility to be ready when members enter the club. It's extremely unprofessional. This the not the first time this has happened. 
 
In addition, when this feedback was given to her she stated "I'm leaving soon so I don't give a shit". Are you kidding me?! Who says that to a member. 

We ended up exiting the club at 12 at closing. Her and the closing manager demanded we leave as they were clearly upset were were using the iPad and the front desk to give feedback. This is ridiculous. 

I've been a member for quite some time and am there every day and never has issues during day time hours. But later at night, there is always issues. I assume it's because no one is there to manage what the employees do around that time of night. 

I will be cancelling my membership in the morning along with my 2 other friends and members who experienced this with me. Them or I can't stand to come to a place where the first people we interact with are extremely rude and unprofessional. As great as the physical gym is, it all means nothing when people have experiences like this.

Management, can you address the first issue noted below?  Too many of the treadmills have problems for a member to take it upon himself to "report" each one, and since the machines have no numbers, it would be nearly impossible to do so!  

I would give this gym a 5-star if they would address the fact that at least half of the treadmills have at least one thing wrong with them.  It's very counter-productive, during a workout, to get all set up on a machine, then discover that the tread is loose or the headphone feed to the TV is impaired.  (Often other users are on the okay-machines, so often there's a hunt for a passable one.) The fact that none of the treadmills seem to have numbers reinforces the impression that this Sweat branch has no interest in maintaining these machines to baseline level.  I.e., if members have no way to reference particular machines for repair, where is the mechanism for ensuring quality and fixing machines?  Please address this systemic problem!  You're better than this.

Another less pressing question: why do the tv's on all your machines get only about 7 channels: two 24-hour sports channels, CNN, Fox, and a couple other pretty bad ones?  Other gyms I've used before and during business travel typically have way more channels than this.  For the steep membership price, can't you do better for your members?

I promise I will return and sing your praises--these are the only down's I've encountered--if you address these problems.

Sweat is a great gym otherwise.  Please address these issues!

Up up! 
Vertical Venues hooks you up with all the gear to safely climb. 
A fear of falling? That will be conquered here as you learn how to let go (and let God - or the safety line take over). 

Who knew climbing can be such a good workout?
This place as walls for all levels of experience or inexperience. There's a gym on hand, a boulder wall and so much. 
Honestly, I've walked past this location and heard about it, but did not believe how much fun and how easy it is to get started. 
After finishing the easy wall I felt like a champion... But, when face to face with a more difficult climb I quickly realized I had a lot to learn.

I highly recommend giving a climb a try. You'll be hooked.

Great staff; Ryan Cook, the GM, did a great job explaining the various (confusing but not his fault) varieties of membership and getting me signed up.  Very personable, and not your typical "gym guy".   As a 58 year old who has no hope of getting in better shape, but just wants to stem the slide, I appreciate the help in getting into the whole gym thing.

Xiomi Steven and Cisco are my absolute favorite! Such a friendly staff and the bikes are so comfortable! I have gone to other cycle studios and this is by far the best one I have been too. The classes are so fun and everyone is always so engaged and there's always so much energy! Soho cycle made me love spin!!

It's fine. There are generally enough treadmills/ellipticals so that you don't have to wait. You will wait for gear in the weight training station. What bothers me is the temperature inside. The building is old and clearly used to be an office building. It was never designed for or intended to house hundreds of sweaty people working out at the same time. As such, every year around April the AC system can't keep up and it gets hot as balls inside this gym. To the point where cardio is uncomfortable and if the sun has gone down, its actually cooler outside than in the facility. Along the same vein, because it was an office building, there is not nearly enough parking. If you come between 5-7pm you will see people parked along the street, along the median, circling the lot, doing basically anything they can to find parking. Hopefully someday LA can find a parcel big enough to relocate into a prototype gym. Until then, I'm on a cheap as hell family plan, so i keep going.
Tried the two week pass and will soon be getting a membership. This place is great! All of the staff and instructors and really kind and the place is bright and clean which is inviting

I am so lucky to have a CorePower Yoga walking distance of my grandparents house! I love their flow and I've been to quite a few hot yoga studios, CorePower by far, is my all time favorite. I'm beginning to think I cannot go on without it and am contemplating getting the online access to classes so I can practice while in school. Yoga Sculpt is my favorite class, and the hardest class available, with fusion of cardio, weights, and yoga flow. This is the get in shape class! My second fav is C2, good flow and next in line in the get in shape regimen. The teachers here are new, but, very good. Dylan is super intense during Sculpt but, pushes you appropriately. Mia, her second time teaching was a couple of days ago, and she is a rock star and provided a very calming, but powerful, flow for Hot Power Fusion! Congrats Mia! For new students, the first week is HELL (you will feel like you are dying), but, once you get over this hump, you are indefinitely hooked. The yoga high is real! Locker rooms are clean, studio is clean, I have zero complaints! I will definitely keep coming back to this location! Cheers!

Clean facility, nice and helpful staff, kindly accommodating my daughter with autism when she wants to go and take an aide who is a non-member, excellent yoga classes. The value of the yoga classes is worth the cost alone. Happy I finally joined.

I have been getting day passes at this place for a couple months and I really love it here. It has very few mirrors, which gives it a more down to Earth vibe and prevents you from constantly analyzing your body. The front desk staff especially Kevan, are very helpful and friendly. This place feels like a community and I really dig it!

I like orange theory when I went there, but the lack of a good warm up at the beginning wasn't for this oft-injured body. I hurt my calf once and knee once generally early on. If they had a good stretching session at the beginning for those who have a bit more mileage I'd have rated it higher. The workouts will make you sweat and you'll feel good for a week.

Great classes! Wonderful if you want to spin in the morning, as you reserve your bike the day before guaranteeing you a bike in the morning without having to arrive egregiously early.

Audio visual problems occur once in a while, but generally the facility is great. Teachers are tremendous - favorites are Ian, Amanda, and Biatta.

I lived in New Orleans for a month and the first thing I did was try to find a box.  Crossfit NOLA (mid-city) was about a mile from my place and it was great.  They made me feel very welcome.  I miss the coaches and all the athletes!

My friend Reggie worked here as a personal trainer for a while and I stopped in here to visit him a few times. I was impressed with the design of the gym and he gave me a compelling pitch on all the details of the gym, so much that it convinced me to come here if I ever wanted to work out. I've also heard great things from a few friends that came here too. Unfortunately I do not have as much time as I want to get to the gym, but if I ever did this would be my first choice and one day I look forward to joining!

Both my parents signed up late last year. One of the salesman offered them a training package and it piqued my dads interest bc my mother needed rehab on her arm. He said it was month to month and that they can cancel at anytime. My father clarified with him to make sure he can cancel at anytime bc my mother would have surgery again in a few months. Fast forward 3 months and they try to cancel but they can't. The salesman signed them up for a yearly contract that cannot be broken. The problem here is that my father never saw the contract. Yes he should have asked to see it but they never even showed it to him. Just made him electronically sign without and paperwork being shown. And of course that salesman isn't there anymore. Anyways, I reported it to corporate. Let's see what happens.

With the medical system bing as mucked up as it is, finding a 'good' primary doctor who is NOT the typical 'pill-pusher' and is on the same page as those who wish to follow a mostly homeopathic approach, is almost impossible. When I contacted this clinic, my initial impression was that I had reached a used car lot by the way they answered the phone. I was placed on hold for a new patient 'specialist' who I had hoped would be able to answer all my question. However, after only a few minutes, it was clear that she only wanted to answer the questions that were favorable to their business. I asked 4 times what kind of doctor the main person is and never received a definite reply. I did, however, receive 4 evasive answers. When I asked what types of insurance they accept, I did receive an immediate answer of NO INSURANCE at all. That was the end of the conversation.

Got a trial for here... it was easy, no high pressure from the guy on duty. I liked that it was a huge place, plenty of room and not crowded at 4pm on a Friday when I went. Also a juice bar with all kinds of good protein concoctions etc. I didn't really experience the shaming that a couple of other reviewers did, but I did kind of feel smirked at by the local bro dudes... whether it was because I was in work clothes not workout wear, or just because I didn't look like them or drive souped up Chargers etc;

I was hesitant to reach out initially because CrossFit was new to me. I contacted several boxes and Evan from CrossFit Forte got back to me the same day. He definitely answered my questions and I felt welcome the day I walked in. Every coach genuinely cares about each member, both in terms of performance AND and personally. It has been just under a year now, and I feel like I have an extended family, and I have never been in better shape; I can't wait to see where I'll be in another year. If you are looking for a new gym, box, or want to begin CrossFit, check them out...you will be glad you did.
Absolutely love this studio. I've been to both locations and the instructors are wonderful!  Booty Jam is my favorite class!  Dance away the night while also burning calories.

Some of the most unhelpful people I have ever met! 
I don't understand how this planet fitness as gotten so unhelpful. Workout is someone we should all do every day however coming here is dreadful and it's takes a toll on a person working to be better. However it is the only place open at 4am so I am stuck here and to another gym opens up earlier or I moved to Philly! If you can go to a different gym please do! The one star is for the hours!

First of all, I have to say that the gym itself is nothing special-- for the monthly fee that they charge, it should be exceptional compared to other area fitness centers. That is not the case.

Initially, what first drew me to this gym were the classes, which (of course) you have to pay extra for. But I bit the bullet and signed up for that, because I really wanted a weekly class that I could go to. The zumba classes were great, but I went one night at a scheduled class time only to have somebody tell me (ten minutes after the class started) that the class was no longer at that time. By the way, if you went online to look at the schedule, it still said the class was held at the intended time.

But my real issue lies with the staff and the horrible way we were treated upon attempted cancellation. When we first joined, nobody reached out to us about taking a tour or how we were liking the gym or anything of that nature. Because we weren't in love and we were paying $30 a month, we decided to cancel. WELL, we were thrown back and forth between the gym and their payment company for almost a month. We ended up having to pay an additional two months membership despite constant arguing with the company because of "corporate policy." EVEN THOUGH we waited until our yearly contract was up (and, by the way, we only went a handful of times during that contract) to cancel.

I do not recommend this gym to anyone. Even despite the cancellation process being a nightmare, I promised myself (and them) that I would not let anyone else join them because of the way that we were treated.

We've been members of the Caughlin Athletic Club for several years and are quite happy with our experience. The club features several well run tennis programs, excellent tennis courts, and a nice cardio theater and free weight area. There is also a heated pool, hot tub, sauna, and an indoor basketball court. They also offer tennis lessons and various exercise classes and have nice little cafe. Weekly social events are also held, although we don't usually go to those. I knocked off one star because it seems to take them a long time to repair certain fitness equipment when someone breaks it, but other than that I really can't complain about the place.
I love this YMCA branch! I have my daughter takes swimming class here. The teachers are professional and graceful !!! And the faculty is so beautiful and clean!!!!

I've going to this gym for 16 yrs now because I have a life membership that only costs me under 50.00 a yr.  This is the only reason I still go!  The equipment needs updating badly.  Even if they don't update, they could at least keep the old equipment in good working order.
Also, When you walk up to the front door the first thing you see is the nasty old gum all of the sidewalk with pigeon feathers stuck all of them.  I have never the gum removed in all the yrs going.  It's really gross!  You don't have to be updated to the latest and greatest, just clean!

I went to Salon by Dominic to fix a haircut disaster, and the only reason I chose them was because they were the only salon I could find that was open on a Sunday. It was bonus because they had online appointment scheduling, so I knew I could get an appointment right away. I wasn't sure what I was getting into, but I was desperate, and even tried to go to Supercuts to try to get my hair fixed. (Luckily supercuts had closed early that day). When I pulled up, I wasn't sure what to expect because it was in a strip mall next to a grocery store. I was afraid that my mangled, page-boy haircut was going to be turned into something even worse, but I ended up having a great experience. I got my haircut by Kristen Baiocco, who got right to business without a lot of small talk, which I prefer. I don't like it when salon or spa workers are super chatty since I feel a lot of pressure to engage in conversation instead of enjoying the experience. Introvert problems...

With my original attempt to get my haircut fixed, I had showed the stylist a picture of a certain haircut, and she insisted that I was showing her the same haircut that I already had on my head, even though my hair looked more like Prince Valium's haircut...  When I showed the picture to Kristen, she took a quick glance at it before she got to work. I was nervous bc it seemed like she barely took a look, but it turns out the girl knows what she's doing. She managed to fix my previous haircut into the one resembling the picture I showed her, and answered some questions I had about styling tips. I walked out feeling good about my hair for the first time since I realized I had gotten a bad cut, and although I'm growing my hair out again and there are closer salons, I'll probably end up going back to Kristen.

(one day later) Holy hell. My booty hurts. 

My first BC class was all thanks to the gals at The Positivity Charge. They hosted a SipxCycle event, which started with a class taught by Jenna Stern and ended with fresh juices from The Juice Philly. Awesome way to spend a Sunday.

I've only tried SoulCycle in the past. While that was great, BC is an entirely different experience and I recommend trying both to compare. I prefer BC more because of the overall vibe/clientele. Jenna, the instructor, was unbelievably encouraging and had a rockin' personality. For me, the overall experience lies mostly in the hands of the instructor. Also, loved the fact that you DON'T need cycling shoes. 

Would 10/10 go again.
This is not a LA Fitness!!! It's a fitness 360. If you're visiting the area from out of town, you'll not be able to use your LA  Fitness membership. Looks lovely though & staff are friendly.
Great gym. Makes you feel at home, great equipment,  and awesome owner and staff. It is a great gym and I recommend it to any type of lifter.

I come to this gym strictly out of convenience. I usually don't have to wait for many things. Maybe a couple of dumbbells here and there but usually I can get through my workout pretty quickly. However, they don't have any freaking channels! They literally, no, literally, have FIVE channels and one is Nicktoons and it never plays any of the good cartoons (Hey Arnold, Ah! Real Monsters, etc). I mean sheesh.

You give me more TV channels, I'll give you more stars.

I haven't tried any other Planet Fitness locations (which I should, I have the black card), but I love the club in Ardmore. I feel like there are a ton of cardio machines available, and the staff is very friendly. The area is really nice as well. 

Down side, the parking situation is not so great. The parking right in front of the club is limited and meant for anyone making a quick trip into one of the other shops. You need to park across the street and basically try not to get hit by oncoming traffic.

Was visiting from out of town & dropped in on a 9:30 class. Everyone was super welcoming and the workout was challenging. Definitely not used to those workouts with the added humidity. Large space with lots of fans for some much needed airflow. Was able to purchase a cool shirt too! Thanks for the warm welcome Crossfit St. Louis!

John Price gave me outstanding service and signed me up with a great promotion.John can also help you with your personal training needs. Great facility has everything you need including child care, it has  lots of covered parking
