I attend mostly just classes like RPM and BodyPump. It's full of muscle heads in the weight area and I'd skip that area all together because of that, but, to each his own. The cardio equipment is quality and they have a whole row of new elliptical type machines with built in fans! Tanning is bad but if you need some vitamin D you can use the stand up beds for free.

I wish there was a gym, at this price, where I live...I'm lucky to be able to go to this gym free of charge while I stay at the Residence Inn on business in Tucson.

I love Orangetheory Fitness! This is the first workout that I have ever been able to do consistently for over a year now! There is a good mix of cardio and weights and I really like that I can mix it up on my own as well. Sometimes I will do the spin bike or elliptical to change it up too. Which is what I need! I am not the type of person that can do the same workout over and over. The classes are always different and changing which keeps it fun and challenging. 
I can also see changes especially in how fast I can run. When I first started a year ago, my "base pace" was 5.0, now it's over 6 MPH and my fastest mile I had ever run was 9:45. A few months ago, it was 8:30. And they always do "benchmark" workouts so you can see your progress! Which keeps it inspiring to see the improvements!
The staff is always so friendly, they remember me by name! (Which with how many members they have is really saying something!) The coaches are so good and motivating! They cheer you on throughout the class and really encourage you to push yourself! And there are always alternatives if anyone is unable to do any movement for any reason. 
Seriously, I love OTF. It was intimidating at first but now I go 4 days a week and absolutely love it.

This is such a great place for us.  I have enjoyed their youth sports for my kiddo since he was a little tot!  In fact, I loved it so much that I joined the team (no pun intended!) and got hired on part time in the Sports Department (which is now many years ago!).   Everyone who works there is so passionate about making this a  great experience for the kids to get moving and get started with sports.  There are the basics like basketball, T-ball, soccer, and flag football not to mention Tot Kwon Do, Judo and Gym & Swim.  The coaching is often done by our super fabulous parents and volunteers, but many times it is our wonderful staff who steps in to coach.  The director provides guidance and good structure.

I really don't know what I would do if my kiddo wasn't able to spend his summers at their summer camp.  They have regular camp, artsy-camps, sports-camps, camps with special focus and content.  The preparation that goes into doing a camp is enormous, and it pays off with great fun for the kids, and is a safe place that gives some measure of comfort for the parents as well. They have very strict pick-up rules, and make drop-off soooo easy, too. 

The rest of the facility is wonderful as well, and the staff is top-notch.

I haven't taken a class yet, so all I can speak to is their customer service, which is non existant. I had purchased a Living Social deal for 5 classes. Right afterward, I tore a ligament in my ankle, so I couldn't use them for a while. I wrote the company to find out what happens if I can't use all 5 by the expiration. Never heard back. 
Then I had trouble signing up for the class online. I emailed them and also called and left a message. Never heard back.
I really hope the classes are better than the initial communication shows. I was very disappointed as I've been really looking forward to going to the classes.

Per your request, I have sent an email to social@planetfitness.com, and maybe this time I'll get more of a response. You know, something that isn't a form letter and half-assed apology for taking my money and doing nothing productive with it.

Most efficient workout in Center City! Better cardio than spin. Great for days it's too cold (or hot) to run outside. The weight portion of class will help you strengthen. Instructors are great, though the intervals go by too quickly for them to correct form (unless the class is small). The interval training helps a lot with outdoor running, increasing your VO2 Max.

Excellent facilty. Well maintained. Great staff. A great variety of treadmills, elliptical and nautilus type machines. Nice pool and gym areas. We joined for the cardio. But lots of classes, yoga, Zumba, aquacise. Why go to a for-profit gym, when this non-profit,  community oriented facility is available?

I was a member for 2 years until I moved away. Their high pressure sales tactics are quite annoying, but the gym is pretty great. The price is worth it to get the hour of personal training once a month - the trainers will show you whatever you want to learn or work on, and the included group classes also add value (especially if you're into yoga - that can be expensive on its own). The variety of equipment is really nice and I never had a problem with it being crowded, except the first couple weeks of January. They also changed their cancellation polity to one month notice instead of three.

Its the best gym in the area which may not be saying all that much when the competition of a bunch of dirty LA Fitness.  The place is brand new with a pretty fantastic indoor pool and quality cardio and weight area.  They are in the process of building an outdoor pool which will be available to members for what I'm told will be a pretty hefty surcharge.  If you have kids the Y will be your best option to get them involved with sports lessons.  From swimming to basketball the directors here really take pride in putting on quality programs and I can attest that my daughter loves it.  2 hour daycare per day is also a nice perk for those of us who need a break from the litter once in a while.

I will say this...  The Ambler YMCA is only a year old.  Community centers often do not age well.  Equipment wears out or breaks and often does not get properly maintained.  Floors, locker rooms and heavily used areas show their wear quite rapidly and if they are not replaced make the place look run down and worn out.  The real test for this place will be when the time times to start making repairs.  Will they make the investment to keep the place spotless or will it go downhill?  Only time will tell.  In the meantime as soon as they build a Lifetime Fitness in the area we'll all jump ship because that place is the gold standard of gyms and since moving to Ambler from Scottsdale, AZ we're counting the days till they decide to expand to this area.

Today was my first visit to CycleBar Carmel. I have a friend who really loves CycleBar and I have been meaning to give this place a try. I am so happy I decided to take a class here! It was amazing and officially one of my new favorite workouts.

The entire place is just perfect. They gave me a free water bottle since it was my first visit (always a plus!). They offer a water station and a variety of fruits! It is a really inviting atmosphere.

My instructor, Tracy, was amazing. She was really helpful in explaining the bike to me and also helped me clip in the biking shoes. She motivated me a lot throughout the class and had a great music playlist.

Overall, I plan to return to CycleBar quite often. It was such a great workout and I felt really comfortable here.

The workouts are as challenging as you want to make them! Every workout is different, the instructors are extremely encouraging, and it's a perfect combination of cardio and strength. I feel so amazing about myself after completing these workouts and everyone who participates in the classes seems very friendly. I highly recommend the classes for those motivated to improve their level of fitness. It's highly addictive!

Cleanliness 3/5
Equipment 3/5
Staff/Service 1/5

I've been to Snap Fitness for more than 3 years. Snap has been there for more than 8 years and it continues to keep up great and clean. Bathrooms aren't dirty and are kept up nicely. The gym itself may have a few spots that seem dirty, but nothing too noticeable. The variety of machines are great and there is something for anything you want to do. They also recently brought in new equipment. Sadly, it isn't something that the gym need in priority. Although there are a variety of equipment to use, there's only one set. For instance, there's only one set of free weights, so if someone has the weights you want, you'd have to wait. Also, there's only one squat rack. There are 4 total barbell benches, so that's good. Some equipment such as the treadmills are a bit outdated, and sometimes some machines may be broken and left to "out of order" for almost a month. Other than that, snap is a very convenient gym because it is open 24/7. Snap has everything you need, you just need to probably come early if you don't want the equipment to be occupied by another individual. 

One important point to make, Snap is very understaffed. I would work out and many different times and there would only be one staff member at the front desk and not keep watch or just observing the gym every now and then. In case if someone were hurt or needed something, a staff member probably wouldn't be there. Other Gyms have 3 or more staff on duty always overlooking the gym.
Overall very nice and clean gym. I've been coming here for couple of years. Sometimes it takes a while to fix a machine when it breaks down.

Everything in here is brand new, which is nice!  The staff is super friendly and it's never been packed whenever I've gone. True this place is slightly higher priced than other places, but not by a lot. It's definitely worth it. And the lap pool is well taken care of! If recommend this gym, even for beginners. I'm just getting back into working out after a year off and everyone still is nice. There really aren't your typical meatheads here.

The Sporting Club at the Bellevue is considered by many to be the top fitness club in Philadelphia. I've gone there a few times and must say that the place is wonderful. It's immaculately kept, and has all of the facilities that one would dream of including saunas, pool, and pilates.

We moved from Collegeville area to Ambler in July 2011. Although not a member, I had visited the Spring Valley Y on a few occasions. It is almost identical to the Ambler location. We moved here and joined the Y after a tour and discussing the cost and the fact they were in the process of building a pool outside (like Spring Valley). Although the cost for Ambler is about $8-10 more a month than Spring Valley, we justified it with the difference in childcare cost. At Ambler, it's included in your membership, but at Spring Valley you pay $1/hour. Being pregnant with my second child, I figured Ambler worked out to be a better deal. 

These are the reasons I'm rating this beautiful facility with 2 stars:

I recently received an email stating pool memberships are now available for purchase. WHAT???? They are charging the members (who already pay top dollar for their membership) $400 to use the outdoor pool. $800 for non- members. This was not conveyed to us at the time we enrolled.

The children's classes are almost impossible to get into. I've been a member for almost a year and my daughter has gotten into swim lessons twice, but the first time, we had to go to Abington because Ambler was full. I try enrolling her first thing in the morning on the day enrollment starts, but most classes for 3 year olds are usually already full.

I enrolled my daughter online for camp this year. I paid $50 for a deposit and the remainder was supposed to come out at a later date. We had a change of plans, so I called to cancel camp and they said I had to come in to fill out a form. I went in and they said I would lose the $50 deposit. I asked if they could put it towards a class or swim lessons and they said "no." REALLY???

The place is gorgeous and new, but next to impossible to work out in the mornings when my daughter is in preschool. It's packed. I haven't tried going any other time because my schedule doesn't allow.

On a good note, the dance teacher, Dana, and the swim instructor, Caitlyn, are awesome with the kids. They seem to genuinely like what they do. Too bad it's so hard to get into classes with them.  Guessing we'll be canceling our membership in the near future. $97/month is a lot to pay to not have use of the entire facility.

Nope.  Called twice because I was interested in a membership and no one answered. The "sales team" doesn't get there until 9am.  Well--I can't do 9am because I work and go to law school until 10pm.  They wouldn't even let me tour the facility.  Won't be back and I'll let all my followers know that lifetime sucks.

Great workout great employees! Was here for work and dropped into a class they were extremely welcoming and explained the entire class to be prior as it was my first time participating in a Barry's class! Got a great sweat in and made sure to grab a delicious shake on my way out!

I've gone through my exercise phases. When I was a sophomore in college, at Tulane, I went to Reily just about every day. For this, it is really good. The weight room is spacious and, after the first week or so of the semester is over, the crowd usually thins out and you don't have very much trouble finding machines, weights, space, etc. Their are several racquetball courts, and you can check out the equipment to play. The same can be said about the basketball courts. 

Reily offers all kinds of classes, from ballroom dancing to Kendo and Martial arts. They also offer a variety of fitness courses. 

This place loses one star because, though the service is good, it's nothing more. It's staffed by students, and having been a student employee myself, I know that they are probably highly un-motivated and working for little to no money.  Their apathy is understandable.

Beyond that (which I totally sympathize with) Reily is a nice place to workout with all kinds of free amenities for members. If it were a bit better service and a bit less occupied during the school year, it would be worthy of five stars.

I started working out at crunch when they first opened, paying $10 a month. That's the cost of medium fries every week. You can't go wrong. The atmosphere is friendly and open, you have powerlifters working out side by side with newbies. So it's not planet fitness with their ridiculous rules and pizza distribution, but it's not LA fitness either with an employee breathing down your back if you deadlift a tad bit aggressively. Love it!
I strongly dislike this gym. As a girl this gym feels unsafe. The equipment is old and it is never staffed. Even when staff are supposed to be there, they often do not show up. Do not join this gym!
Bad practices, be careful to read through everything, especially if you want to quit... After several years and a job layoff, I needed to quit, but they still milked me for a few months of dues.

Wow what a workout. I had Maria but it was her last class, so I can't speak for the rest of the instructors, but she was great. It was my first free intro class, and it did not disappoint. I also loved the bikes since they show RPM and you can really push yourself versus the standard bikes. The place is a little hard to find and is on a second floor of a row home. It's quite pricey, so I don't think I would get a full membership since I like having variety of classes to pick from, but for any spinning enthusiasts this is a great gym!

I was looking for a place to workout where it wasn't as brutal as Crossfit but better than a regular gym. The trainers always have high energy so it keep me motivated to work harder. I've only been 3 times and I'm already starting to see results.

So, I will upfront admit that I am a bally's fitness, l.a. fitness brat.  I am accustomed to huge two story locations with day cares, tons of mirrors, full locker rooms, pools, saunas, packed schedule of classes.  Now the offset of that (back in the day) was that you were in some crazy contract for ever and paying 40-60 bucks a month.  Although pricing changes for each location and depending on the placement of the moon and the sky, most people at anytime fitness have a 1 year contract for between 20-30 bucks.  So, you know, you get what you pay for. 

At this location, as compared to my experience at Bullard location, you may get a little less than you pay for.  The space is extremely cramped. That being said the equipment is quality equipment, they do have the standard classes, and it is generally clean. There are no lockers just cubby holes by the member entrance/exit door.  The parking lot can get crowded when the dance studio and dojo are having classes.  The classes fill up and it gets dangerously crowded and hot in the studio.  There is one shower.  Fortunately, I haven't had to wait for cardio equipment.  Most of the people working out at the time I am there are in class or are on weights.

I think the most annoying thing about this location is the service. By the time I arrive at 6 or 7 in the evening, the staff has zoned completely out.  They are nice but not at all proactive.  The first time I went to this location, one of the members let me in the front door and I stood there for a good 2 minutes before I had to then go in to the office and say, hey I am here on a free pass.  No tour was given, no information about classes (until I asked), no policies, and no membership prices.  I loved that it wasn't a hard sell but I expect 1) for people to be aware of people coming in and out of the locations and 2) for you to care and follow up with me on whether I had a good experience or not. Also, with the classes, the teacher was late and her music skipped.  However, everybody has an off day so I am going to reserve my final opinion on that.  Especially since her zumba choreography was fire!

For me, working in CBD and living in New Orleans East, this location is more convenient because I can stop there on my way home.  But I think they should step up there game as more planet finesses arrive in the area and more smaller boutique fitness centers pop up they are not going to be able to just win on price.

Something is not right about this place. You must fill out a form and sign a legal statement to get a tour or to talk to sales personnel about membership fees. No brochures are available that describe the fees. I walked out.

Since I used to work for a gym, that was recently bought out by another company.. I feel like I would always have to compare. But not here. I went in and signed up immediately! Signed for a year and have been loving it. And my weight loss has been significant. My trainer as well, she been such a blessing. I've never had any problems. The girls up front are very personable and make it a joy to actually walk into a gym and...well workout. The gym is clean and has a great atmosphere. After joining Shapes Total Fitness I don't think ill go anywhere else unless I have to.

Club was good workouts good price but they subcontracted with 3rd party vendor to service accounts.  To cancel or suspend you must first call the club for acct, #, then the 800 #. Then lengthy hold times for calls to oversees call center then they force you to website to try to cancel after all that. In fact the acct number from the club is different from the one used to cancel. It's maddening.  I had odd random charges which turned out to be from Fitness19. After an hour plus I'm finally done.  Forget this club and go to locally operated one with real people.

Love it, it's just super packed . They have a turf, I just wish people would stop stretching there and laying around. It's suppose to be for moving functional workouts. 
They also got rid of mats.. they need to bring those back

I went in last night for my first (free) trial class to see how I liked it. I absolutely loved it! It definitely gave me a great workout and I'm feeling it today! The trainers are very hands on and motivating. My experience did have a few negatives though... First, it is very pricey. $70/ month plus $75 to start. You also have to pay 2 full months upfront. So I am not able to commit to the club. If they lowered their prices/offered specials of some kind, I would definitely become a member. Second, I felt very pressured to buy a membership at the end of my class, which I hate. I am not at a car dealership, I'm at a gym! Anyway, it was fun and intense. I'd recommend giving it a try.

REVIEW YOUR BANK STATEMENTS!  They overcharged me THOUSANDS of dollars.
 
Timeline:
* Personal training obligation was through 7/2/21
* Personal training charges continued through 10/21/2021 (overcharged me thousands of dollars).
* Disputed $440 in charges through my CC company (was refunded)
* I canceled my membership (last membership charge deducted on 8/28, I confirmed cancellation)
* 10/18/21 charged me twice in the amount of $220 (totaling $440).  My personal trainer charge was only $220.  Why did they charge me $440 in one day for a membership I canceled?

THIS PLACE IS A SCAM!

I'm a fan of LA Fitness gyms, since they have a good amount of equipment, pretty good facilities, and a bunch of classes included with membership. This one has a very convenient location, right off the Turnpike, and it has everything I look for. I haven't really done the classes here, but usually don't have to wait for what I'm looking to do (i.e., pull-ups). One main drawback is that they only have one of the dip/ab stations.

Doesn't look like much at all. It's in a strip mall. But inside it is really expansive and full service! To be clear, I am not a member but I used my ClassPass account to visit while I was in town for a trip. I really, really needed a hot tub so I looked for a gym to visit with this amenity. 

The place was great. I signed up for a couple of fitness classes - they have group classes- and they were each a circuit style and to be honest more challenging than I expected, but with circuit classes you can always push yourself to go harder so that might be it. 

There is a very large weight area inside with a running track indoor around it. But what I came for was the spa area! There is a hot tub, sauna, and steam room as well as a small pool. I was able to spend a nice 45 min or so alternating between the hot tub and steam/sauna rooms and I was really in heaven. If you are coming and want to do the same I recommend checking the water aerobics schedule- immediately after the spa area will be pretty full with people finishing the water aerobics class. 

Showers are present and lockers and changing rooms are ample. 

It's relatively no frills in certain ways but also has every amenity I would want so I was very pleased - if I lived near here I would join!
What a fabulous place to take overwhelmed mom and energetic boyz.Loved the entire experience.

Steer clear of their youth classes. They are nothing more than an after school activity with little to no instruction. Different teachers every class, no continuity. Look elsewhere. Owner is cool though.

George Phipps or "Coach" as he's known around here is an amazing trainer. In three months of training and better eatting via his Blood Type Diet instructions I dropped 15lbs. 

Everyone here is super friendly and helpful, and there's something for everyone. There's silks, for silk dancing, kick boxing, weight training, and of course cross fit. They moved from their previous location to the much larger, brighter warehouse building across the way, and they have really turned it into an awesome gym. 

Best in gym in Reno for sure.

Customer service is a struggle here. Employees are nice but I'm assuming OrangeTheory corp makes things hectic and confusing for employees.... please note: once you enroll into a program they will auto-renew - this was not a message delivered to me until after I was charged again. 

On my first class, they had me go through 3 heart monitor chest straps (WHILE in the class) and 0/3 functioned and finally they gave me a wrist heart rate monitor which worked. After the HR mishap they offered to allow me to borrow HR devices for my first several classes - I borrowed 3 times and 2/3 times their HR monitor died mid-class. Obviously this does not make me want to purchase one of their HR devices.... 

However, regardless of some miscommunication and Heart Rate Monitor malfunctions....I recommend the OT work out.
Great facility in Speedway. All business. Come in, work out, go home.

I was home for the holidays and staying with my parents in Merion.  LA Fitness is 1.5 miles away and conveniently close.  Their website claimed that if you provided your email address, they would email a 3 day pass immediately.   This pass did not appear in my email, though the website stated that it had been sent right away. I called LA Fitness and explained  that I was from out of town and just visiting for the weekend.  I was told this wasn't a  problem and could come over and get my pass.   Not so easy!  First, I was asked to show an ID.  Not sure what the point was when I clearly was not joining.  Second, the guy at the desk gives me a 3 day pass but then takes it back.  He hands my drivers license to a salesperson and makes me sit down with him.  He then makes me fill out the same paperwork they have people fill out for memberships. Even after explaining that I did not live here and had no intention of joining, he still continued to interrogate me on my fitness goals, my weight, height AND then made me take a test to see the percentage of my body fat.   Then, he goes over my BMI, fat percentage.........while snidely making rude remarks of "where I am" and "where I need to be".   Bottom line, after all this, he says that though the guy at the front desk gave me a 3 day pass, it won't work since I'm out of state.  The pass only works if you live in PA and are no more than 25 miles from the facility.  Though I clearly explained that in the beginning, he wasted 15 minutes of my time, insulted my fitness level and body weight and then told me I couldn't work out.  He said he would take me on a tour.  I was infuriated and insulted at this point and just walked out.  I restrained myself from making any rude comments.  I am sure REUBEN (got no problem stating his name, Chris R. is better than me) is not characteristic of all the salespeople there.  However, he was a pompous, rude, capital A--HOLE!  If you're visiting and out of town, go to Philadelphia Sports Club in Ardmore-right across the train station.  They gave me a 3 day pass-no tour or interrogation or fat analysis needed.

I've been a member here for about 8 months and I can honestly say this is an amazing crossfit gym. It captures everything great about crossfit, community, health, awesome coaching, challenging workouts, great programming, and a supportive network. 

Naptown is also in the process of expanding its offerings and locations. I strongly recommend Naptown if you want to try Crossfit for the first time, get fit, or meet people if you're new new to the city. 

The community is one of a kind :)

Shane is awesome and the REAL Westchase Fitness / Westchase Fitness Boot Camp. He's friendly, knowledgeable, and will help you achieve your goals. He's modest and won't admit he's as good as he is but he's as good as they come. Thank you Shane for serving our country and for all of your help!

Let's be honest. Compared to 24 Hour Fitness clubs, FFC's in Chicago, and even our local Elmwood Fitness Center Elmwood location Snap falls short. This location is a very small gym (700 sq ft maybe) with a few ellipticals and treadmills. It also has one Smith machine, some free weights, and a few other weight machines. That's it. 

I go here mainly because it is rarely ever crowded (only a handful of ppl before 6am) and everyone there just comes to work out. This is not a social gym like Elmwood.

All of the Snap's that I have been to have been immaculately clean! Love that. 

Each location charges different rates, though, so shop around to get the best deal and lowest enrollment fee (I have seen some locations charge $100+ to enroll). I joined the River Ridge location simply because it was $5 less per month ($34.95/month) than the other ones in Metairie/Kenner. Plus they only wanted $20 for enrollment. 

If you want to take spinning, cardio, or zumba classes you won't find it at any Snap gym. If you desire a pool, a basketball court, or racquetball courts you are out of luck. I only recommend any Snap gym if you are looking to do strength/cardio training ONLY.

Its pretty empty but the facility seems clean and its very new.  Everything was very simple to use and it was a convenient, quick experience.  The employee could have been friendlier, but there weren't any issues.

I signed up for the Sunday night spin class at 7pm with 2 other friends. 1 class was $12 for 45 mins. This was the best cycling class I have taken so far! It's a very different experience than most gym spin classes. You spin in the dark with cool lighting, the music is loud and upbeat, with a video projection to watch the music videos. The workout is timed very well to the music. The instructor will guide you through different workouts on the bike and focus on different muscles. They also add in ab and arm workouts with dumbbells. And at the end of the class, they hand out a refreshing cold towel. This class was so fun and I am really excited to try it again.

This is the best gym in Indy by far, the variety of equipment and hours of operation make it among the best. I've been going to nifs for about 5 years now and as far as the gym aspect goes I haven't had any problems. For many I know the parking can be a problem but they do have a parking garage across the street that does get very full during the week with Iupui student. Also if you want to use the pool you have access to the Iupui natatorium but there are many events going on so it is hard to get a time where it is open swim.

This LA Fitness was on my route this afternoon, so I thought I'd simply stop in here to workout rather than make my usual visit to the location in Hyde Park.

I inaccurately thought I had never been in this one previously. However, once I walked in the front door there was clearly a reason I deleted this from memory and never returned.

Why LA Fitness kept this club open when they took over Lifestyle Family Fitness, I have no idea.

It was freezing cold inside and the layout of this club just makes it feel even colder than the actual temperature.

While the bathroom areas of the men's locker room were exceptionally clean, everything else about being in here motivated me to get done and leave.

All the cardio equipment is pushed off into a dark corner, which is hard to imagine considering how dimly lit this entire place is in the first place.

Also, the variety of cardio machines is subpar. Two modern machines that I regularly use at Hyde Park were not even available here.

Looking over at the front desk and sales area, I never saw more than two employees at one time.

To say this location is not very inviting and welcoming would be an understatement.

I can only guess that LA Fitness maintains this location because the rent is so cheap in a dying plaza that only features a Walgreen's and the token JJ Smoothy near a health club, but working out here on a regular basis would make me ask for a significant discount off my current monthly dues.

Centrally located, in the heart of Clayton, it's easy to find. Beyond the location, the real attraction is the personalized training and personal feel. It's very cool to be surrounded by professionals- lawyers, doctors, boxers; yes, professional boxers- and regular folks, all just going about their business. Unlike other gyms, I don't feel out of place or uncomfortable.

One of the worst gyms when it comes to canceling your membership. Members be aware! You need to give them 60 days notice. You can't really do this by talking to any person on the phone or any of their staff who work at the gym! You need to send an email to two email addresses! They really don't have a customer service or customer care person for this basic function. You need to send an email to their money collecting company called ABC Financials. Make sure you email both sweat and ABC Financials. Apparently they don't really talk to one another--so the responsibility falls on you, that is this is all your job to do to cancel your membership. Email support@sweatfitness.com as well as customercare@abcfinancial.com and good luck if you don't use emails and online portals.

*** Don't forget to go online to your membership portal to ALSO CANCEL IT THERE!!!

I am filing a complaint with FTC's Bureau of Consumer Protection.

Matt was so patient and helpful. This was my first lesson and with his guidance, I was able to get up and actually sort of surf! A great experience all around. He did all of the work that a hesitant first-timer doesn't want to have to think about -- which waves to take, when to paddle, how to avoid crashing into people! I would highly recommend these lessons to anyone looking to learn to surf or further develop their skills.

Back for the second time since they opened. 

So first you make your reservation online at cyclebar.com and choose the wheels you want. Its basically a seating chart that shows the position of the bikes. When you walk in there are tablets for you to check in. They set you up with shoes that are already in a cubby with your bike number. Towels and water bottles are also provided. Oh and you get a locker to put all your crap in (shoes, keys etc) 

A very friendly staff will take you to get you set up on your bike (making the necessary adjusments so you're comfortable).

Let the cycling begin! Very unique, intense workout!  All you're doing is cycling but it feels like you're at a dance party.  Melanie or whoever the instructor is will get you all hyped up. They tell you what to do and you follow their lead.  Ride to the rythym of the music and you'll be good.  Every now and again you'll have individual as well as row races (you'll be in one of three rows). Awesome right!? Damn right it's awesome! 

Oh just a heads up, you'll have a sore butt after the first time but you'll be ok. No worries!

Check out the cycle bar if you're in the area, it's worth it!

This is pound-for-pound one of the very best gyms in the world. The equipment is extensive and well-maintained, the locker rooms are clean and spacious, the classes are challenging and rewarding and, above all, the staff are top class. The team is expertly led by Zach, who keeps the whole operation running like a new limo. Big credit to him and to Natalie Adams, who oversees the whole area. The gym has a more illustrious cousin on Dale Mabry, but the gym in Hyde Park is an authentic environment, where people interact cordially and genuinely enjoy their training. Even the surrounding area is fantastic: lots of stores, coffee shops and restaurants that you can just walk around with barely a sign of traffic.

Great family gym, everything you need plus area
For crossfit and circuit training, indoor track, basketball and racquet ball, classes and daycare! Plus it's clean and not crowded!

It's ok. 
It's next to a nice Chinese restaurant and an amazing Italian Restaurant (Marco Polo).
First time here today. I love the setup! It's wicked clean! Friendly and knowledgeable staff! Safe area! Didn't have to wait for equipment - best workout ever

I have always looked for a gym to be comfortable in as a female, but still get in a good solid work out. I found that at AMPED. 

On top of it not only being comfortable, it has a family feel. From the owners being such genuine, good people to becoming friends with everyone else in there. 

Where does that happen?? Not anywhere I've worked out and I've had memberships at just about every gym.

It truly is gym heaven. Go check it out for yourself ;)

Yup, this is a pretty amazing gym! Whether this is your first time rock climbing or you've got some boulders under your belt, this place has routes for you. If you've ever been to the Tampa gym you'll feel a little spoiled here: each route is color coordinated so its easy-er to figure out where to go next; the problems are a bit more spaced out so it doesn't feel supper cluttered; the belay routes are higher, not including "the pit;" their is a private section for members with a private rock wall and actually weights and gym equipment; there more seats to sit and watch or take a break, plus they doubles are storage spaces; the walls here are painted so it give the whole gym this cool and new feel. You can tell there was a lot of thought put into how this gym was made. 
I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good time. You don't have to know how to rock climb to have fun here, they make it real easy to start. Which leads me to my only gripe, the rating system is a series of 5 upside-down triangles. 1 triangle (vb-v0) being the easiest and 5 triangle (v8-up) being the hardest. It doesn't make it easy for beginners to tell which ones they can try and which routes to steer away from, but it also makes the jump for 3 to 4 triangles and 4 to 5 triangles really high and sometimes frustrating. 
All in all the tampa gym will still be my home, but dang St. Pete, 5 stars!

This City Fitness has a touch of Fishtown vibes with the paint, exposed brick, mixed material architecture, and open window to Frankford. I'm not sure about anyone else, but I used to belong to Sweat where I never visibly saw the gym being cleaned. I've also been to PSSC and another City Fitness location. I've even tried Planet Fitness! I've seen almost all of the gym options in the city, and I've gotta say this is probably my favorite. I wish they had a little bit more real estate and rooms for functional training, but I'm impressed with the amount of machines and the layout (multi level with great views) they have been able to achieve. 

If you're the gym rat who likes a younger gym rat crew to motivate you and a clean facility, this is your spot. You can generally find parking nearby, though you may have to circle a few times. And get ready to parallel park! 

Amendment: updating to 5 stars because the improvements over the last few months to the facilities have been fantastic! Great job everyone!

I signed up and took advantage of the 3 training session package! I was teamed up with Tate Gordon. He is an amazing instructor! He's very knowledgeable, supportive and motivating! He knew how to substitute and modify some of the exercises that were not a good fit for me. He's so personable, kind and fun too! Overall, I really like Gold's Gym, too! The facility is clean and I like the layout/set up of this location. They have a lot of great classes that are part of the membership. I love Bodypump and yoga! This gym is totally affordable, too! I recommend Gold's, as well as Tate as a trainer! If you get an opportunity to work with him, do it!

I wish I could give 0 stars.  While signing up for my membership I already had bad feelings but went ahead and signed away.  Obnoxious sales staff, rude front desk staff, bad parking situation.  Of course when I go to cancel my membership I have to personally come to the gym between 9 and 5 o' clock Monday through Friday then send a certified letter to the corporate office. I asked the manager to email me my agreement and of course they said they would, I called back several times and he then would not take my call and the people answering the phone said the manager was the only person that could send me the information I was asking for. DO. NOT. DO. IT.

By the time we finished our membership here, we had really appreciated the help from Julia. She was always ready to help with any challenges we had. The facility is adequate and clean. The desk staff changed over a lot in the couple of years as did the trainers. I think it is a good place to workout for the price.

I finally decided it was time to make a change. I had been paying for another gym membership that was no longer working out due to their hours and my new job location (over a year ago). I checked out SouthRACs website and requested information for a free 3 day pass. 

With sweatpants in hand, I headed to the facility for a tour. I was greeted and introduced to Ron who would tell me about the club. He asked me what I was looking for (weight loss, strength training, personal trainer, etc.) and showed me around. I was pleased with the variety and cleanliness of the club and, even though the parking lot was nearly full, there were plenty of machines available. 

I decided to sign up and then I remembered I had the 3 day pass. Since I signed up on the first day, he waived my first full month of membership. I was able to spend a little more than I would have for that first month and getting a personal training package (4 sessions) for just $99, a savings of $100 off the regular 4-session price of $199.

I'm looking forward to getting started with my trainer who will be able to teach me how to maximize workouts also provide nutrition advice. SouthRAC provides help in all aspects of health and fitness and so far the people I have met, both employees and patrons, have been friendly and supportive.

Fitness Connection offers many "free" things but they actually don't provide anything that you don't pay an exorbitant amount for (a).  Also, I called to cancel my membership in May, checked up on it in June because I got a charge, and found out that they will not honor the cancellation I made in May because they "have no proof of it" (b), even though I am a student with very little money and had to cancel the membership because my violent, drunk boyfriend and I broke up and I had to leave town as quickly as possible (c).  They try to push you to sign up for year-length commitments (it's cheaper, just do it!  You can send proof of an address if you move later!) and do not leave off when you say you don't want to.  For these reasons I think that Fitness Connection is full of people who are pushy, maniacally money-motivated, and disinterested in their customers' health, safety, and well-being.

(a) For example, the free session with a personal trainer is time for them to try to railroad you into signing up for either a personal trainer or small group fitness.  If you join the gym but you don't know how to use most of the equipment you are out of luck, unless you can spend hundreds more per month on someone to show you how to use it!!  
(b) Funny, I would have thought that if they needed proof of it, their employee would have given me some proof.
(c) They have no empathy or regard for other people.

This LA is nothing special. Staff is very meh.. not welcoming or too friendly. No sanitary wipes or spray to clean equipment EWW. 

Machines are abundant but free weight area is crowded and benches aren't versatile. There was an incline bench open, but I needed a flat bench. Sure would've been cool if I could've moved that bench to be flat.... 

Music is very very quiet. Can't really hear it. I forgot my headphones at home once and figured they'd have music I could listen to. Nope! 

Matrix bike seats are HORRIBLE! They do not allow you to sit up and bike, they force you to lean forward. If you do sit up, it puts the wrong angle on your knees.

Worst gym I've ever belonged to! I've only been here a month but will be changing soon! Kids club is even worse, staff is neglectful and verging on abusive, I'll never leave my son there again. I've been waiting for a call from the general manager for 3 weeks, you'd think that with something as serious as mildly abusive behavior of their kids club staff they'd respond promptly rather than never.

Edit. General manager finally called after giving them poor feedback in an email review. Acted apologetic but never followed up on his promises even after I called him to follow up. 
Taste left in my mouth now is even worse. 

Be forewarned. Awful, awful business. Support one of our great local gyms!

Great facility to hold all sorts of indoor sports.  They have basketball, volleyball, soccer, baseball, etc.

The front desk crew is very efficient and very helpful about answering questions in a timely fashion.  The one thing that surprised me was when we had an injury, they didn't have any ice packs around.  Kinda weird for a sports complex.  

I play volleyball there once a week in the colder months.  The courts are on the short side but once you know it your fine.  They will also adjust the net height to whatever we prefer when we get there.  

Very accommodating and grateful there is a place to play this winter.

I've been a member for awhile now, it meets every need imaginable. Compare it to Lifetime or LA fitness, it's better priced, more activities, Christian friendly. They've got locks free of use, towels, pools, spin classes, personal training, kid zones. I don't think I'd work out anywhere else, I'm proud to be a member. Thank you for everything and providing a safe place for our family.

I couldn't be happier with recently joining. I'm delighted with a faculty and the staff. They lease there equipment so it's always new and current, three different weight rooms and with just everything you can imagine and more. The classes they offer looking exciting and from what I've observed the instructors are very prospective. Highly recommend this club, money will spent.                   Just wanted to update my review as I've had time to get a familiar with everything. I had initially took advantage of there personal trading deal while signing up. After working with Ja Elam  this past month, I've recommitted to a long term personal training agreement. What a wonderful trainer and coach. Almost immediately saw a difference in my own workouts as a result of working with Ja, just had to let everyone know looking for a great personal trainer!!

The Monon Center has a walking track, basketball courts, indoor lap pool, workout equipment, and a outdoor water park. We've been members for 4 years and I enjoy going. I like the treadmills, bikes, and stair steppers. I also use the weights. There is usually equipment free even during busier periods. They even now have ones that as they are used power the lights at the gym! I like that my exercise keeps the lights on and burns calories. 
A few summers ago I started doing the outdoor aqua classes, deep water, walking track, and Zumba. I really enjoy the aqua program and love working out in the water. I hope they keep Saturday classes next summer. But for now I try to get to a class on the 2 weeknights they also offer them, it's not the same as being outside, but the indoor pool is rather large and classes can be help while other people swim laps. 
I also really enjoy the Monon Mixers that they have during the summer for adults only.

Ok, where to start.. 

So my husband and I decided to join this gym 2 weeks ago, we initially chose this one because the price is great and it has a daycare which is a must. We each have the $19.95/mo, with that we can go to both gyms and bring one friend anytime we go and all the other stuff which I don't remember. Not bad, right? No, price is great and I'll be honest, they offer a lot; cycle, yoga, water zumba, regular zumba, small group training, one on one training and much more. When you sign up, you're scheduled a one on one health assessment with some one that is supposed to last an hour. This is where all my frustration started. I will say, I do not see any issues with the gym or equipment itself except that I saw at least 3 of the cardio machines out of order. Stuff happens right? Anyhow, back to the health assessment. I had mine scheduled for 4pm, I showed up at approximately 3:55, that gave me about 5 minutes to go put my stuff away and very sure I was ready for my appointment. I told the front desk gal at about 3:58 that I had an appointment and told her with who. She told me to sit down and he will be right with me. She picked up the phone and overhead I heard her announce to the staff that so and so's client was there. So I waited, I looked at my watch, 4:03... ok, I understand some clients like to take their time and have questions afterwards...  then it's 4:08.. I started to get a little frustrated, I mean, I'm supposed to be on time, shouldn't he? So I decided that if it went as far as 4:15 I would leave and reschedule with someone esle. Well, at 4:13 the trainer went behind the counter, didn't even come up to me personally and introduce himself, and motioned to me to follow him. Mind you, the whole time I was waiting, not one of the 3 ladies at the desk came over to even apologize for the wait or inform me how long it would be. 

We sat down at the desk to go over goals and nutrition and other elements of a healthy life style and on the sheet it said that I would be shown 8 different machines or exercises for different parts of my body. My main goal is weight training since I do a lot of other training with a trainer other times per week; I informed him of this. He asked me if I was familiar with the TRX, I am very familiar so I asked if he could possible show me some more weights. Well... he had me warm up on the bike for 8 minutes while he went to get himself a protein shake and then he took me straight to the TRX and had me do squats, lunges, and jump squats, which I am already very familiar with on the TRX. Then, he took me to the squat rack and showed me 2 other variations of squats. These two are the only two exercises he showed me that I didn't know. Then he said I was done.. at 4:45! So he was 13 minutes late, and then talked for about 15 minutes, and the rest was what I explained above. It's like he didn't listen to a work I said or considered what I had asked him to show me. 
I understand this is a free service for joining the gym and that I'm not paying for a full-on personal training session, but come on, he didn't even do his job in my opinion. If I'm given a piece of paper telling me what to expect for the fitness assessment, I kind of expect at least some of it to happen and definitely get my full hour. I am very displeased.

Perfect gym! I am home on leave for less than 30 days and the manager at Gold's Gym was able to give me a pass for less than $40! I love that they are basically a 24/7 open gym, convenient location, and extremely clean.  My favorite part about this gym is the cardio movie theater.  By far, the best idea on the planet! Hope my new gym in Italy can come up with this same concept.

Russell's spinning classes are the best in the City and make my day.   Body Cycle has evolved into a happy united community and the space is clean, funky, affordable and accessible.  After twenty years of spinning, these are the class that I love best.

The Monon Center has a lot to offer. I particularly appreciate their effort to have adaptive classes to engage individuals with disabilities. They offer sensory days at the pool and many exercises classes created or adapted for all levels of abilities. 

I have only been to the fitness center a handful of times, but the staff has been friendly and helpful on each visit. 

The water park: 
A step above and beyond your neighborhood pool.  The layout of the pool is easy to navigate with restrooms on your right upon entering and all of the attractions beyond that. Lifeguards seem professional and everything is very clean. They offer something for everyone, even if you can't swim well (or at all). There's a toddler splash zone that is fenced in (hallelujah for the mom's of darting 2-year-olds), a bigger kid splash area equipped with a small slide and a bucket dump, a lap area, lazy river, 3 slides, wave rider and aqua rock climbing. If none of that tickles your fancy, maybe you can rent a cabana, or bring in a picnic. The concessions seemed very reasonable as well ($1.25 for popcorn). 

Tip- come after 4 for half priced tickets.

Contrary to the other reviewer both myself and my boyfriend were very happy with our time as members of CHFC. The equipment was always clean, with the exception of the peak time of 5-7pm there was never a wait for cardio equipment (and even then the line was much less than other gyms), I never felt like I was in a meat market, and the trainers were always extremely helpful and nice.

We spent many hours with one trainer, Bob, who we miss a LOT. He got us to the gym almost daily, we enjoyed our workouts, saw definite shaping and toning differences (he was great about working around a fairly recent and severe knee injury of mine). We find ourselves saying frequently at our new gym (in CT) "We miss Bob."

There are some things that we would have liked to have (mainly a pool and 24-hour access) but we were very happy with them.
When we had to move out of the area they gave us no difficulty in getting out of our membership either.

My wife and I have been going to this Fishers YMCA for the past few years and I love this place. The staff are super friendly and it is always clean. It has been a very difficult time for the folks there with Covid but they have soldiered through, and I really appreciate that.  I have gone to other fitness centers but there is something special about the YMCA.  Super family friendly, thank you to all that work at the Fishers YMCA!

Where do I begin? Let's start with the filth. There is not a male custodian. The showers look like something out of a bad prison movie. I have been there all hours of operation and granted, the people who frequent the gym are filthy. I have seen people spit on the sauna floor. I have seen people keep equipment, and then not put it back. I don't think there is anything that can be done about the nasty ones who think they are alone  at the gym. The racketball courts have been unusable for years now. YEARS!!! They finally put up a wall similar to Trumps wall. There is nothing behind it. So now no courts just a wall to cover up that part of the gym. Say Whaaa? I went to Tampa to the L.A. Fitness and it was a complete different situation. When I opened the doors to the facility I swear I heard an angel chorus. Clean, friendly staff, and most of all no spitters. Stay home and work out in your living room. If you go to this dump you may come home with filth on your shoes, and a disease from lack of cleanliness. WARNING!!!! STAY AWAY.

It's something of a "treat" for me to go to a salon in this price range. I have read mixed reviews on this place, but with the half off coupon for first time customers I figured I'd give it a shot. My stylist was Seiko, a tiny cute asian woman. She was friendly, and not only knew what I was going for when I told her I wanted some style while growing my hair out from a pixie cut, but had idea's on how to fix my bangs perfectly. She was talkative, complimentary (Flattery will get you everywhere), friendly, and most importantly, gave me exactly what I wanted. I left the salon feeling cute and confident.
I can't vouch for salon services other than shampoo, cut, and style, but from my first experience, it's 5 star worthy.

These guys are amazing! I have been training with a few other trainers in the Tampa area since I moved here 2 years ago- these 3 trainers are by far the best! From their facility, to the small class sizes, to the workouts to their amazing personalities- it is beyond evident that they love what they do! 

I started off with personal training and switched over to the group classes (with the occasional PT depending on my schedule) not only do you see and feel the difference with your body, but you see and feel the difference with your energy and mentality working out with them. Even at 5am I leave feeling like I can take on the world! They don't boast or brag about their clients they just let their work speak for itself and that's something rare in this industry here. 

No matter your age, size or fitness level you need to be at Apex! They will definitely bring out the inner lion in you!

They just renovated the space with new weight machines and removed some carpet on the lower floor- so clean! The upper floor cardio machines are still the same models from when I last wrote the review (and when they opened probably), but they are clean and kept in great condition. 
When this LA Fitness was being renovated, we had to go to some other gyms in the area, and this one was by far the cleanest and most well maintained.

Love this place and it is affordable if you want a personal trainer.  I've worked out on and off for years but at my age (50) I needed a gentler approach to exercise.  I am learning a lot about how I move my body and how to improve my longterm bad habits.  Steve is a pro and great at explaining the physiological reasons for pain, dysfunction, etc.  Wish I could go more than 2x per week and look forward to the sessions.

I like this gym a lot.  It is very clean, newer equipment, friendly staff and 24 hour access.  The only problem is a couple of things behind-the-scenes.....which have been promptly fixed.  See below.

1)  showers are what you would call lukewarm at best. There are many people from foreign countries here and they're probably not used to real hot American showers, So they don't care.

2) You get your butt up there to workout, It is a great incentive to have a sauna.  however, this sauna is frequently broken.  They claim it is because people pour water on the calls. But neither have I ever seen people do that nor have I ever seen a sauna where that was really a problem. It seems like an excuse not to keep the sauna in good repair


. Overall I would recommend this gym.  Highly!

When I decided on my 55th birthday to get fit - I went to Hermitage Fitness - I wanted group classes so I could set up appointment exercise ! You can get a 7 day trial online - also pay for classes at $6.00 a class. All classes are included in membership ! I was self conscious and nervous for my first class ! It was like a family reunion! Everyone from staff to members were so friendly and no judgement! The Zumba classes and instructor are amazing ! In my third week of three classes a week and I already feel at home . I changed to a membership right away ! I have not tried the pool, hot tub and sauna but they are on my list and are beautiful! What a happy , no pressure environment ! A very diverse group with one common theme - welcome encouragement ! My only regret is I waited so long to try. The gym has been in the same location and ownership over twenty years ! Most members I have met have been there for years - I will be as well!

The membership guy took forever to show me the place, stopped too long to chat w/ other members, wouldn't tell me the rates, and when we finally get back to his desk he says,
'Now let's do a body assessment!'.   This is how they treat women?!
They don't deserve your money, and the equipment is old and needs to be serviced.
There are many gyms in Tucson - don't waste your time.

When a friend of mine starting asking me to go to Planet Fitness with her I was skeptical. I've been a member at other gyms before and remember clearly the high-pressure environment they foster. Pressure from the sales staff to renew, upgrade, and add more to your monthly plan, pressure from the trainers to book expensive private sessions because you weren't "working out right," and pressure from the other members themselves as female members would saunter in with full makeup and curled hair and jacked men would gawk as their grunts grew louder. That environment is so not me. I would much rather run with my dogs or bike down to the beach for my daily exercise.
After a few months, I finally accepted my friend's invitation. Being a "Black Card" member, my friend could allow me join her whenever she went and I figured there is no harm in trying it out. I was blown away by the atmosphere at PF. I have currently gone as a guest 3 times and not once have I been pressured by staff to enroll. The staff is friendly and sociable. The gym members are mostly there in groups and the atmosphere among them is friendly. Lots of motivating words are passed from one to another.  High-fives are given after a friend achieves their goals. The equipment is clean and wonderfully maintained with plenty of cardio options including treadmills, stair machines, ellipticals, bikes, and spin bikes. The machines for weight training are in sections clearly marked for "abs, arms, legs," etc. There are areas for "express workouts" that are taught with a trainer who optimizes your workout to get maximum results in less time. The locker rooms are pristine and feature lockers, bathrooms, showers, a private scale (no more weighing yourself in front of the entire gym population! YAY!) a hair dryer, and a vanity. The best part, this gym is open 24/7 so late nights and early mornings are never a problem. 
Everything I've mentioned is included in a regular membership at $10 a month. If you choose to upgrade to a Black Card member you will also receive unlimited use of the tanning beds, hydro-massage beds, and unlimited guest privileges. This is, by far, the most perks for least amount of money I've seen at any gym. 
The only critique I have is that all of the machines connect to your phone using an i-pod cord. Being a staunch Samsung user, I find it irritating that I'm unable to utilize the charging/headphone feature of the machines because of this. The machines should be upgraded to include a usb jack. My complaint is a tiny one, as I can still plug my headphones into the machine and watch tv shows on one of the 18 screens or plug directly into my phone to listen to music. 
Overall, I would encourage everyone to visit Planet Fitness just to check it out. I guarantee you will return.

I thought I was in good shape, but this place helped me to get into the best shape of my life with a friendly yet semi-competitive environment (and I have always participated in sports/exercise/distance runs/swimming/group fitness classes/gyms/dance/spinning/etc.) so why only 4 stars? ... The Price!  It is so overpriced that I couldn't afford to continue my participation at this facility while in college for more than a month.  It's a shame because I really enjoyed my time at Sparta, but I refuse to pay over $100/month when I am using my own body weight for WOD exercises!!  The owners are decent people, though they wouldn't honor a discount listed on their own website!  (I'll just stick to swimming in the free outdoor pools at USF and running in the FL heat, and when I want to use weights I'll join USF's rec center, it is a fraction of the price of this place and you can get a workout in on actual equipment any time of the day!)

I love this gym. I mean seriously? What more do you want? Around $30 a month... has SO much equipment. And for how huge it is, they usually keep it very clean. Very happy with it! Love nutrition factory attached to it, their bowls are better than Fresh Kitchen's. No complaints... I mean seriously, what more do you want from a gym? If you're that snobby, go to Lifetime Fitness at the mall.

I've been a member at various gyms in a number of different states and countries.  This LA Fitness club is close to being the best.  Hasan gave me a great fitness assessment and then proceeded to wipe me out in my first private training session. Thomas, now my personal trainer, picked up the pain in today's session.  They are both great trainers.

This club is clean and surprising sparsely populated.

Join now for a clean, easy to access club.

This Gold's is a great gym. It's usually not too crowded, probably because it's so large. The locker room is very clean and spacious, the trainers are knowledgeable and helpful, and the equipment is high-quality and plentiful. It's a bit pricier than some gyms, but well worth it.

I've been going to golds gym for maybe a decade all over the US. This golds allow crossfitters to throw and slam weights above shoulder high. Annoying as fuck and distracting for the whole entire gym! 
Management didn't care when I brought it up. Golds gym, you need to cater to one crowd. Mixing up weight slammers and normal lifters doesn't go together. 
Annoying as fuck!  No one wants to hear that shit.

It being Jan 2, 2017, youd think they have more respect for the new wave of people trying to get in shape.

Pros:

Location perfect to my work
Friendly staff
Lots of cardio equipment

Cons:

Gets a little crowded around 4:00 pm.

Staff is friendly but sometimes aren't as helpful as they could be sometimes example: "I can't assist but that guy over there may be able to."

Not as many free weights and area that many would prefer. I have heard they have no place to squat or deadlift.. but I haven't tried to do either to verify yet

It's a bit smaller and less options than the franchise in Hendersonville.

All in all it's not bad at all

Do not ever go to this gym ....I was so sleep deprived due to work image my surprise when I worked out for 45 minutes and some asshole steals my purse wallet and cell phone . The acting manager was so rude to me . Also I was looked in to pay 70 dollars total to join then little missy Kylie as well as Jessie make my total to join 136.00 yes like a dam fool I paid that amount. I lost my membership key once again charged 5.00 the young kid goes how did you sign up by credit card ? I go no I paid cash he goes when will you be switching over banks so we can get your CC information. I told him to cancel everything and give me back my money.

His reply:::: Michelle what are you talking about  my KARMA called their main corprete office and should be getting a check for 136.00 in 3 to 5 days . These MF are worse then used car sales men !

I recently purchased a one month deal through Living Social for unlimited access and one hour personal training session.  I made an appointment to visit the gym and as I suspected would have to sit through a sales pitch even though I told the person I took advantage of the deal to use the swimming pool.  At the end of the tour I was informed the deal begins the day you go in for the initial appointment and tour.  Had I known this I would have waited until a later date to make an appointment which was more convenient for me to begin my month.  I was not pleased that 45 minutes of my time was wasted with the sales pitch when I was very up front with what I wanted to use my free month for.
Would I recommend this Living Social deal, NO unless you're planning on joining the gym.
I don't even know why I checked in here.  I must have been waiting for her to finish her shower.  Either way, it's a gym.  Get in, get out, and do your thing.
I love this location! Super clean and the staff are friendly. Parking is across the street. They clean the gym daily which is great!

Nice, clean newer Y facility, that is walking distance from my house.

The wife has attended a ton of classes here, Bodypump, Spinning, Boot Camp - and aside from some gripes on the times of classes (generally seem to be friendlier to people that don't work 9-5), she has been very happy.

I usually come here to take the kids.  They have a SWEET indoor pool that has water slides and a lap area, but more importantly it has a great area for kids that has a huge natural slope 60 or so feet that only gets to 3 feet - perfect for the kids to walk or crawl through.  We've enrolled our 3-year-old in swimming lessons and he seems to love not only the classes, but the great attitude and patience of the teachers.  

The thing that would take this center from 4 to 5 stars would be an outdoor pool,  more class time options for working folk and a bar that sells more than juice.With those, they'd be unstoppable!

YAY for NIFS!

NIFS is a well above average gym, with a ~200 meter track, plenty of cardio and weight equipment, large warm-up area, and tons of wide-open space for classes and other activity. I've never had to wait for equipment. They also usually rotate in some "trial" equipment that you can vote on; if it's popular enough, they'll try to work it onto the equipment floor.

NIFS will cost you ~$47/month, which seemed a little steep at first, but you can really get your value out of NIFS...if you want to. They offer TONS of classes -- cycling, Body Pump, yoga, Bosu, and more. You can also get an exercise prescription, meet 1:1 with a specialist, and more.

You can save about $30 total by paying for a year upfront; I think paying upfront should save you a little more.

My favorite thing about NIFS is that it's all sorts of people who are there because they care about fitness. Not girls wearing make-up, nor douchebag dudes staring at themselves in the mirror for hours.

I'm being a little generous with my rating because I *think* that I'll eventually like Barry's a lot.  But right now I hate it.  A lot.

First thing you should know is that this place is hard core.  Each class consists of time on a treadmill and time on the floor with weights.  You may be thinking:  why would I spend $20 to use a treadmill?  Ohhhh you just wait and see!  This is no regular run on the treadmill.  We're talking steep inclines, lots of sprinting, sideways running and more creative torture methods.  The weight portions are pretty standard except you're coupled over dying from the run you just did so of course it's harder!

Now, I am by no means a runner.  In fact, I absolutely 100% hate running.  But I'm no stranger to intense cardio.  That being said even their beginner's pace is killing me.  We're talkin' my face is still bright pink almost an hour after class!  I guess I must be a masochist because I bought 30 sessions just to ensure I'd keep going.  If there's one thing I hate more than running it's losing money.

The only thing that rubs me the wrong way is that their marketing is clearly effective.  They've done a great job acting like a bad ass place where only hot people want to go.  All the people in class are already fit, svelte, and good looking.  And it seems like the instructors are trying a little too hard to be "hard core."  But maybe I'm the only one who'd like an occasional encouragement with "YOU CAN DO IT!" instead of "WHATEVER YOU DO DON'T SLOW DOWN"?  They clearly do not believe in positive reinforcement at Barry's Boot Camp!

Free parking in the ramp next door.  

All that being said I'd encourage you to try out a class.  You'll get a killer workout and you'll be glad you did!  Now please don't make fun of me if you see me in class and I look like I'm about to keel over.

My review of Future Fitness is somewhat limited, as I joined this gym for one reason only:  Pool access. So I can't comment on the gym floor, classes, etc., but here's my review.  If possible, I'd give it 2.5 stars - somewhere between "Meh" and "A-OK."

When you first arrive at Future Fitness to tour the facility, be prepared for the HARD SELL.  Also be prepared to be talked to like an idiot.  I explained to the sales person that I was a triathlete, only looking for a place to swim.  Clearly, I'm not new to the gym atmosphere.  Yet, he still felt the need to continue on with his sales script, and explain to me a bunch of BS about how to get results, and making lifestyle changes, etc.  Annoying.  He then proceeded to show me the entire gym, even though I was only interested in the pool.  That is understandable, except that the pool was the very last thing he showed me, and the thing he spent the least amount of time on.  Then it was time to talk price.  I had to go through 3 rounds of "negotiations" before he reached their "current specials" which were a little more in my price range. 

You may ask why one would join after being degraded like this.  The answer is simple:  I really needed a pool, and this is the most convenient place for me.  All other options were either too expensive, or just totally out of the way.  

So, the pool:  The pool is actually pretty decent.  They don't have any water aerobics classes here, so the don't crank the water temperature up.  It's always kept at a nice temperature that is slightly on the cool side when you jump in, but perfect after just one lap.  I find the pool to be clean, and the fact that its salt water, not chlorine, is a huge plus.  My skin and hair are grateful!  The only down side to the pool is that it's an odd length - 21 meters.  I suppose that's just due to the amount of room they had to work with when building it.  There is also a hot tub, which I often relax in for 5 or 10 minutes following my swim.  

The only other part of the gym I use is, of course, the locker room.  The locker room itself is pretty decent, with various nooks where you can find slightly more privacy if desired.  They do need to do a better job at cleaning the bathrooms throughout the day.  There are always a couple of toilets filled with TP, and trash on the floor.  The showers are nice - I just use them to rinse the salt water off my body following my swim.  There are 3 or 4 vanity stations which would make it easy if you had to fully shower and get ready for work or something after your workout.  

Overall, the pool is decent, and that's why I come here.  But I'd have a hard time recommending the gym as a whole to someone.  If you don't need a pool, or can deal with the limited Wahoos schedule, go to my first gym, my home, my love, Cherry Hill Health & Racquet Club.

First timers get a "buy one get one" offer if you let them know it is your first class.  This is such a good idea because classes are expensive ($15) and I like to try a bunch of different specialty classes before I buy a package at the gym.  This is a great place to burn tons of calories and spin is such a great option for any fitness level, you differentiate your workout by how much weight to add to your bike so anyone can do it.  I loved the loud music and videos playing while we rode.  Our instructor was very energetic also and I wish wish wish I could remember her name but sadly cannot.  I went on a Wednesday night at 6:30 and class lasted about 45 minutes.  There was an Ab class after wards that I believe is included but I had to go so I didn't try that out.  There are towels provided though (get one) and you feel great after wards.  Highly recommended!

The 2 classes that I took here were cool, but not cool enough to get me to finish the 3 class trial I purchased.

I always felt extremely challenged during the classes and wonderfully exhausted afterwards, but I'm just not into rowing, I guess.

The coaches are really encouraging and friendly, so if you actually like rowing, it's probably worth visiting. Prices are reasonable, especially for class rates in center city.

This location is the smallest out of the 4-5 other planet fitness. It's right in the middle of a sketchy neighborhood, but there's always a cop after late hours so... I guess that's a little better .. right? 
From Monday-Thursday I believe they open from 5 til  11pm and Fri-Sun til 10 (not 24/7, but I can understand why) I usually only come to this location in the early noon ..it's way less pack ! Also, this location seems super cheap with their a/c for such a small gym! 
The employees here aren't as nice as the ones at the other locations, but , oh well! I shall get my workout out on regardless .! 
There's a Pizza Hut next door that should be opening soon.. (cheat days yay!!) .. and a smoothie king not too far away (yum) !!
All in all , this planet fitness gets the job remotely done.. Only for an early workout.. OR for a late workout around CLOSING time... Other then that I prefer the Slidell location .
Everything you could possibly need without the pretentious affliction t-shirts and bros.

Great local spot to get in a solid workout. The outdoor space is airy and tropical, very hard to find such a cool landscape to do anything from free weights to cardio, especially during this pandemic.

Membership fees are very competitive and with 24 hour access adds that convenience aspect.

I've tried to cancel membership at this place for the past 3 months and have not been able to do so.  Only way to cancel is to either snail mail in a form (which their corporate office pretends to never receive) or to go in person M-F 8-5 to meet the manager to cancel.  They forget that people have jobs!  Even during the weekdays when I have gone to cancel, this manager named Lea Aguelira has never been present!  They continue to scam/autocharge everyone!  Strongly advise to stay away from this company!  Unethical on so many levels!

In town for the weekend visiting family and came in for a day pass to workout. No sales pitch and no tour. It was a quick five minute sign up process. I appreciated that.  Gym was very big with tons of modern equipment. Clean facility, friendly staff, lots of free weights. Great place to workout. Thanks Nico for your help.
Seems like a cool place but I wouldn't know because they lock there doors an hour before closing time.

I was a member here for about a year and a half. I rarely used the machine/circuit part of it--I really just went for the Saturday zumba classes with Vaughnda and sometimes a step class. Vaughnda isn't there any more, and I know at one point they had tried to convert Zumba to to their own faux brand of Latin Heat, but I think they came to their senses. That said, I don't know what the classes are like now. I think this place thrives on its convenient location, but I actually prefer the ones in Springfield and Bala Cynwyd. Luckily, a membership gets you access at those places as well, or else my membership fees wouldn't have been worth it. In the end, it wasn't worth it to me, so bye bye, LA Fitness.

Seriously the best spin gym in Reno! A lot of times when you first go to a gym it is intimidating but that is not the case with Escape. When you walk in it just seems like you're family. Everyone greets you and offers to help. That goes for not only the people working there but the clients. Everyone is so welcoming. The classes are amazing! Spin is hands down my favorite but POUND fit is quickly becoming my second favorite. Combine an amazing workout with great music and blacklights and the result is just magic! I also love that when you want you can mix up your cardio/workout routine with their variety of classes. If you are looking for a place to get your sweat on this is it!

Moved away for a year to Chicago and just moved back and re-signed at Anytime in Westchase. Since I've been working out here for 3.5 years (minus one year away) I will give my pros/cons. I think somebody whining about old mats is a joke, I can't say I've ever used the mats, but if I was into something where I needed one (like Yoga) I would buy one and bring it to the gym anyway.

Pros:
-Nice, newer equipment
-Considering this is the heart of Westchase, this gym is rarely crowded
-Great selection of machines, free weights, and cardio equpment
-Friendly staff
-Tanning for $10 if that's your thing
-Cheap for all club access
-Location!
-Not a huge space, but they have done well making sure the layout isn't crowded like the YMCA Express down the road
-Always CLEAN

Cons:
-Stupid "upgrades", they replaced a decline bench with a smith machine because you can "do more" on a smith machine. Well, no serious weight lifter I know uses a smith machine for anything, they want free weights for bench/squat/deads. Glad to know my "club enhancement fee" went towards getting rid of equipment people actually use. 
-NO bench press? Is this real life? The aforementioned smith machine does not count. It's a tough pill to swallow to have to wheel a bench into the squat rack to do bench press every time.
